gravelmon.midnightconfig.title: Gravelmon Config
item.gravelmon.luster_ball.tooltip: 1× catch rate, makes the caught Pokemon Shiny
item.gravelmon.feather_ball.tooltip: 1× to 4×, decreased by the target's weight
item.gravelmon.typing_ball.tooltip: 1× to 4×, increased by the length of the target's name
item.gravelmon.shiny_ball.tooltip: Guaranteed to catch shiny Pokemon, 1× catch rate on normal Pokemon
item.gravelmon.nuzlocke_ball.tooltip2: RELEASES YOUR POKEMON WHEN THEY FAINT
item.gravelmon.snore_ball.tooltip: 5× catch rate if the Pokemon is asleep
item.gravelmon.gen2_lure_ball.tooltip: 2× on Water-types, until fishing is added
item.gravelmon.gay_ball.tooltip: 5× if the Pokemon is the same gender
item.gravelmon.lesbian_ball.tooltip: 5× if the Pokemon is the same gender
item.gravelmon.bi_ball.tooltip: 2.5× if the Pokemon is the same species
item.gravelmon.pan_ball.tooltip: 2× if the Pokemon isn't the same species
item.gravelmon.non_binary_ball.tooltip: 3× if the Pokemon has no gender
item.gravelmon.ace_ball.tooltip: 2.5× if the Pokemon cannot be bred
item.gravelmon.aro_ball.tooltip: 2.5× if the Pokemon cannot be bred
cobblemon.species.eppv11.name: EPP_v1.1
cobblemon.species.neocacnea.name: NeoCacnea
cobblemon.species.neocacnea.desc: They ram into cliff faces to toughen up their bodies, growing round bumps on their heads from the impact. A telltale rattling sound inside a Cacnea's arms warns that it's readying a painful spiked punch.
cobblemon.species.cactussle.name: Cactussle
cobblemon.species.cactussle.desc: It has a notable resilience—even under the intense desert sun, it never falters. If this Pokémon encounters Cacturne, the two will fight each other in a brutal standoff.
cobblemon.species.foliat.name: Foliat
cobblemon.species.foliat.desc: Although Foliat is unable to fly, it still has an extremely high metabolism. It's often found feeding on sugar-rich nectar and sap found in plants.
cobblemon.species.florabri.name: Florabri
cobblemon.species.florabri.desc: This energetic Pokemon zips around at speeds that make it nearly invisible to the naked eye. It is playful and competitive by nature.
cobblemon.species.floressum.name: Floressum
cobblemon.species.floressum.desc: Floressum can synthesize energy with its symbiotic flower. By rapidly flapping its wings, it can create gusts of wind comparable to a tropical storm.
cobblemon.species.kidling.name: Kidling
cobblemon.species.kidling.desc: Kidling headbutts humans and Pokemon as a sign of affection. When its head makes contact, even gently, the flame on its tail flares up briefly.
cobblemon.species.pyroat.name: Pyroat
cobblemon.species.pyroat.desc: Pyroat’s flaming hide can be seen streaking across mountainsides at night. When it collides with other Pyroat, the light and noise can be mistaken for an explosion.
cobblemon.species.flairees.name: Flairees
cobblemon.species.flairees.desc: The fire on Flairees' body propels it with enough force to break steel. It forms its territory by smashing apart and leveling mountaintops.
cobblemon.species.aguade.name: Aguade
cobblemon.species.aguade.desc: Aguade's face and hands are armored with rock-hard salt. It uses its fists like hammers to break open nuts and its head to block incoming attacks.
cobblemon.species.iguadium.name: Iguadium
cobblemon.species.iguadium.desc: The thick layer of salt on Iguadium’s head and hands protects it in combat. It trains by throwing punches underwater for more resistance to build more muscle.
cobblemon.species.aguanaut.name: Aguanaut
cobblemon.species.aguanaut.desc: Aguanaut devastates its foes with savage blows from its fists and tail, as well as crushing grapples. Its body is armored with dense, impenetrable layers of salt.
cobblemon.species.harpee.name: Harpee
cobblemon.species.harpee.desc: Harpee's perseverance is unmatched. It purposely builds its nest in places with harsh weather and tough opponents, challenging itself to become stronger.
cobblemon.species.aquilor.name: Aquilor
cobblemon.species.aquilor.desc: Aquilor lives in treetops and watches its prey before swooping on it. Its sharp eyes can spot the faintest of movements, even through dense foliage.
cobblemon.species.warquila.name: Warquila
cobblemon.species.warquila.desc: Warquila is a fierce predator that uses its speed and maneuverability to outwit prey. Its powerful talons can tear through even the toughest hides.
cobblemon.species.capig.name: Capig
cobblemon.species.capig.desc: The pattern on Capig's fur is popularly mimicked by the woven hats of locals. It will sometimes sit on its trainer's head to keep them warm.
cobblemon.species.capabara.name: Capabara
cobblemon.species.capabara.desc: The thick fur on its arms and head keeps it warm as it tunnels through cold snow. Capabara are often found in groups, huddling together for warmth.
cobblemon.species.cubzero.name: Cubzero
cobblemon.species.cubzero.desc: The saliva in Cubzero’s mouth freezes at an early age, forming sharp, icy fangs that will never melt. If shattered, new ones will freeze in mere hours.
cobblemon.species.avalynx.name: Avalynx
cobblemon.species.avalynx.desc: Avalynx excels at stalking its prey in heavy snowstorms. It can move through deep snow and ice effortlessly without making a sound.
cobblemon.species.fawning.name: Fawning
cobblemon.species.fawning.desc: When first born, Fawning is too weak to defend itself from predators, so it tends to stay near thorny bushes for protection until it joins the herd.
cobblemon.species.llamarsh.name: Llamarsh
cobblemon.species.llamarsh.desc: The wool around Llamarsh's neck keeps it warm, even in sub-zero temperatures. People in cold climates have used it as clothing for generations.
cobblemon.species.buckston.name: Buckston
cobblemon.species.buckston.desc: Proud of their power, Buckston constantly battle to test their strength. It is rumored that their migration herds can be seen from space.
cobblemon.species.pengliff.name: Pengliff
cobblemon.species.pengliff.desc: Pengliff's rock-hard head is solid enough to protect it from damage. Some Pengliff have been seen diving from ledges to crack open boulders for sport.
cobblemon.species.penglacier.name: Penglacier
cobblemon.species.penglacier.desc: Penglacier are adept tunnelers and make their nests by digging caves out of the mountain side. Some snowy mountains have vast cave networks as a result.
cobblemon.species.bluffin.name: Bluffin
cobblemon.species.bluffin.desc: Bluffin's wings aren't powerful enough for flight, so it wanders the snowy peaks on foot. Its long tail drags on the ground and frays at the end.
cobblemon.species.burrmudail.name: Burrmudail
cobblemon.species.burrmudail.desc: Burrmudail's beautiful, crystalline feathers are highly sought after by collectors. If a Burrmudail bestows one to you, it is a sign of good luck.
cobblemon.species.koblin.name: Koblin
cobblemon.species.koblin.desc: Koblin spends its entire life in tunnels deep underground. Because of this, it was long believed to be just a myth told by miners.
cobblemon.species.koberus.name: Koberus
cobblemon.species.koberus.desc: Often the cause of brush fires, Koberus will light its surroundings on fire, creating a thick cloud of smoke in order to disorient its opponents.
cobblemon.species.kobalt.name: Kobalt
cobblemon.species.kobalt.desc: By choosing to stay in the caves, Kobalt has lost its eyesight. This has enhanced its other senses, which it uses to excavate complex tunnel systems.
cobblemon.species.pebblosa.name: Pebblosa
cobblemon.species.pebblosa.desc: It loves to collect rocks from different mountains and caves by carrying them in its mouth. When threatened, Pebblosa will spit them at other Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.terratetra.name: Terratetra
cobblemon.species.terratetra.desc: Terratetra use their claws to harvest rocks from deep-within the earth. They use these rocks to make walls and to hurl them at potential threats.
cobblemon.species.gigaard.name: Gigaard
cobblemon.species.gigaard.desc: It uses its claws to carve slabs of granite and crystals from cliff faces to wear as armor. No two Gigaard have the same armor plating.
cobblemon.species.cowatti.name: Cowatti
cobblemon.species.cowatti.desc: Cowatti uses its tail to detect signals of varying frequencies. It can hone in on these signals to locate food, water, and even shelter.
cobblemon.species.snome.name: Snome
cobblemon.species.snome.desc: Snome is very shy and often hides under the snow. When it hides on slopes, it may accidentally roll downhill, picking up more and more snow on the way down.
cobblemon.species.snogre.name: Snogre
cobblemon.species.snogre.desc: Snogre is incredibly reclusive, living in remote valleys and cliff-sides. Villages pass down stories of them appearing to save travelers lost in blizzards.
cobblemon.species.taomarin.name: Taomarin
cobblemon.species.taomarin.desc: Taomarin constantly stands and moves with perfect balance, even in strong winds or uneven ground. Nothing seems to distract it from deep meditation.
cobblemon.species.orangutao.name: Orangutao
cobblemon.species.orangutao.desc: Orangutao are often found solemnly meditating in the wilderness. It is thought that they seek to obtain inner and outer balance in all things.
cobblemon.species.larvabidae.name: Larvabidae
cobblemon.species.larvabidae.desc: Larvabidae follows orders given to it by fully evolved members of the swarm. Its evolution is determined by which role it is most successful in.
cobblemon.species.caranox.name: Caranox
cobblemon.species.caranox.desc: Caranox defends its home aggressively, attacking anything it sees as a threat. It often assaults bigger Pokemon and sprays them with burning acids.
cobblemon.species.carajoule.name: Carajoule
cobblemon.species.carajoule.desc: Carajoule tend to serve as sentries for the hive. It can use its tail to flash signals or warnings and to attack foes with powerful jolts of electricity.
cobblemon.species.caracrust.name: Caracrust
cobblemon.species.caracrust.desc: Because of its heavy carapace, it is a very slow mover. It uses its tough and sturdy defensive capabilities to protect fragile Larvabidae from harm.
cobblemon.species.musburry.name: Musburry
cobblemon.species.musburry.desc: Because this Pokemon grows delicious berries, it is often preyed upon by Berratel. Some Musburry try to exist with Berratel symbiotically.
cobblemon.species.musbushel.name: Musbushel
cobblemon.species.musbushel.desc: Musbushel does not give up the berries it grows easily. When it does, however, it is not only a sign of trust, but also one of friendship and staunch loyalty.
cobblemon.species.berratel.name: Berratel
cobblemon.species.berratel.desc: Berratel eats so many berries that its fur is permanently stained. It waits for other Pokemon to gather berries, and then mugs them for an easy meal.
cobblemon.species.growmeo.name: Growmeo
cobblemon.species.growmeo.desc: Growmeo scurry through flowerbeds in search of a Tuliep. However, they are painfully shy and rarely work up the courage to actually approach one.
cobblemon.species.montegrew.name: Montegrew
cobblemon.species.montegrew.desc: When Montegrew falls out of love, it turns bitter and spiteful. It will begin shunning the Capulilly it once loved, whom it now sees as vain and pompous.
cobblemon.species.tuliep.name: Tuliep
cobblemon.species.tuliep.desc: Tuliep loves nothing more than the attention of a Growmeo. If a Tuliep is seen blushing, it invariably means one is nearby.
cobblemon.species.capulilly.name: Capulilly
cobblemon.species.capulilly.desc: When a Capulilly ceases loving its partner, it becomes haughty and cruel. It treats its former love Montegrew with disrespect, believing it to be callous and unfeeling.
cobblemon.species.dreamdery.name: Dreamdery
cobblemon.species.dreamdery.desc: Despite its adorable looks, Dreamdery is a voracious predator. It devours the dreams of people, leaving its victims disoriented and fatigued.
cobblemon.species.macabra.name: Macabra
cobblemon.species.macabra.desc: Macabra hunts Dreamdery for their wool. It has developed an immunity to their attacks, making it popular among people dealing with Dreamdery problems.
cobblemon.species.kertruffle.name: Kertruffle
cobblemon.species.kertruffle.desc: Needing little more than water and air to live, Kertruffle can adapt to hostile environments where few other Pokemon would survive.
cobblemon.species.mosshroom.name: Mosshroom
cobblemon.species.mosshroom.desc: Mosshroom is commonly mistaken for a grass hill. When something bumps into it, it releases spores before shuffling off to find a quiet place to sleep.
cobblemon.species.lumishroom.name: Lumishroom
cobblemon.species.lumishroom.desc: The light from a Lumishroom’s caps can illuminate even the darkest caverns. Lumishroom use these lights to talk with one another from far away.
cobblemon.species.perishroom.name: Perishroom
cobblemon.species.perishroom.desc: Perishroom never seems to need to eat or drink in order to survive, and rarely moves. The spores it releases when attacked are fatal in even small doses.
cobblemon.species.rocano.name: Rocano
cobblemon.species.rocano.desc: Rocano is able to store up pressure inside its body by eating ore. When it is startled, it will release it all at once in a jet of magma to scare away foes.
cobblemon.species.volcaroc.name: Volcaroc
cobblemon.species.volcaroc.desc: Volcaroc live very deep in the earth and are a rare sight close to the surface. While digging, they leave long tubes behind them as if formed by magma.
cobblemon.species.volcoalder.name: Volcoalder
cobblemon.species.volcoalder.desc: Volcoalder claim entire hotspots as their personal domains. The strongest Volcoalder use mighty eruptions to protect their lands.
cobblemon.species.pounther.name: Pounther
cobblemon.species.pounther.desc: Pounther plays with its siblings by sneaking up on them and then jumping them when they least expect it. This game serves as training for the hunt.
cobblemon.species.jaguile.name: Jaguile
cobblemon.species.jaguile.desc: Jaguile are incredibly patient hunters. They use specialized appendages to detect changes in the wind, and pounce on their prey with blinding speed.
cobblemon.species.neureka.name: Neureka
cobblemon.species.cerebrulb.name: Cerebrulb
cobblemon.species.cerebrulb.desc: Cerebrulb's light stimulates brain cell activity to an extraordinary degree. This trait makes it a common companion for scientists and academics.
cobblemon.species.peppit.name: Peppit
cobblemon.species.peppit.desc: Peppit seeks out the spiciest berries to make its Fire attacks burn hotter. Groups of Peppit love to play in dry leaves, often causing small fires.
cobblemon.species.hoppanero.name: Hoppanero
cobblemon.species.hoppanero.desc: Hoppanero has few natural predators due to its spicy fur. When Hoppanero gather in large groups, they have been known to cause heat waves.
cobblemon.species.scovalope.name: Scovalope
cobblemon.species.scovalope.desc: Scovalope is highly adept at evading detection. The fruits on its horns may fall off, and are considered both a lucky charm and a delicacy.
cobblemon.species.pawter.name: Pawter
cobblemon.species.pawter.desc: A loyal companion and a skilled swimmer, Pawter is a common partner for sailors and lifeguards. It can detect storms and warn others before they arrive.
cobblemon.species.hurricanine.name: Hurricanine
cobblemon.species.hurricanine.desc: Hurricanine becomes more and more energetic shortly before a storm hits. When angry, its growls are so loud and harsh, they evoke the rumble of thunder.
cobblemon.species.skullarva.name: Skullarva
cobblemon.species.skullarva.desc: Skullarva spends its early life hidden away in damp caves and crevasses. It tries to scare away predators and trainers by mimicking the cries of stronger Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.maskoon.name: Maskoon
cobblemon.species.maskoon.desc: It imitates the cries of other Pokemon, but warps them so they sound morbid and unnatural. The pattern on its back is used to scare off predators.
cobblemon.species.mortasque.name: Mortasque
cobblemon.species.mortasque.desc: It can make human-like sounds to scare away predators and unnerve those that enter its domain. Many 'haunted' houses are merely nests for Mortasque.
cobblemon.species.vectol.name: Vectol
cobblemon.species.vectol.desc: Vectol was a computer virus that had infected the PC storage system. The process that converts data into matter has given it a physical form.
cobblemon.species.vectol2.name: Vectol2
cobblemon.species.vectol2.desc: Exposed to an unknown code, Vectol has upgraded to Vectol.2. It feeds by using its stinger to download data, leaving computers a corrupt mess afterwards.
cobblemon.species.bouwee.name: Bouwee
cobblemon.species.bouwee.desc: Bouwee's tail lets it drift peacefully near the surface. However, the bright colors often attract predators, so it will release a jet of water to escape.
cobblemon.species.scubug.name: Scubug
cobblemon.species.totter.name: Totter
cobblemon.species.totter.desc: Totter’s skin requires constant moisture, so it makes its home near riverbanks. It likes to soak up water with its tail and splash other Pokemon with it.
cobblemon.species.cascotta.name: Cascotta
cobblemon.species.cascotta.desc: Wild Cascotta have been known to attract attention by leaping out of streams and performing displays of aerial acrobatics at high speeds.
cobblemon.species.lutrajet.name: Lutrajet
cobblemon.species.lutrajet.desc: Dwelling in the deepest reaches of the clearest pools, Lutrajet moves as if it were one with the water. There are few who have witnessed this elegant dance.
cobblemon.species.alpint.name: Alpint
cobblemon.species.alpint.desc: The sapling at the end of its trunk acts as a personal weathervane. By holding it up to the wind, Alpint can tell where the weather will be most favorable.
cobblemon.species.forusk.name: Forusk
cobblemon.species.forusk.desc: While normally peaceful when soaking up sunlight, Forusk is quick to anger if approached. It swings its hammer-like trunk with enough force to level houses.
cobblemon.species.platypow.name: Platypow
cobblemon.species.platypow.desc: Predators that don’t pay heed to Platypow because of its tiny size are quickly surprised by its fiery nature and its remarkably strong punches.
cobblemon.species.platikhao.name: Platikhao
cobblemon.species.platikhao.desc: Platikhao has venomous barbs hidden on its elbows and knees. It uses them to hurl furious strikes against its foes, and then lets the poison do its work.
cobblemon.species.cuppy.name: Cuppy
cobblemon.species.cuppy.desc: Schools of Cuppy gather in circles when sleeping, burying their noses in the sea bed. Many poems have been written about these strange underwater tea parties.
cobblemon.species.fettlekish.name: Fettlekish
cobblemon.species.fettlekish.desc: Fettlekish stores water in its body and controls its temperature to let it sink or float underwater. It can also release the water in a scalding hot blast.
cobblemon.species.shibalbat.name: Shibalbat
cobblemon.species.shibalbat.desc: Legend states that Shibalbat guards the entrance to the Underworld. It appears to be a statue until exposed to moonlight.
cobblemon.species.nobunata.name: Nobunata
cobblemon.species.nobunata.desc: Nobunata fights fearlessly and honorably, standing up for the weak and defenseless. When defeat seems inevitable, it will explode in a flurry of treats.
cobblemon.species.psybex.name: Psybex
cobblemon.species.psybex.desc: Psybex takes long journeys to mountain tops, searching for inner peace. Through meditation, it is able to see into the hearts of humans and Pokemon alike.
cobblemon.species.gnuru.name: Gnuru
cobblemon.species.gnuru.desc: Its horn amplifies its psychic powers, allowing Gnuru to communicate with parts unknown. It meditates daily to commune with these voices from afar.
cobblemon.species.flowger.name: Flowger
cobblemon.species.flowger.desc: When Flowger gather in great numbers, their songs form a joyous symphony. Many romantics believe that hearing a Flowger sing means one will find true love.
cobblemon.species.blue_flowger.name: Flowger
cobblemon.species.blue_flowger.desc1: When Flowger gather in great numbers, their songs form a joyous symphony. Many romantics believe that hearing a Flowger sing means one will find true love.
cobblemon.species.bullotus.name: Bullotus
cobblemon.species.bullotus.desc: Bullotus’s booming cry can be heard for miles around. When resting, it floats on the water and looks up, absorbing sunlight with the petals around its neck.
cobblemon.species.blue_bullotus.name: Bullotus
cobblemon.species.blue_bullotus.desc1: Bullotus’s booming cry can be heard for miles around. When resting, it floats on the water and looks up, absorbing sunlight with the petals around its neck.
cobblemon.species.burrowl.name: Burrowl
cobblemon.species.burrowl.desc: Burrowl’s heavy wings prevent it from flying, but it uses them as shovels to dig underground. It also uses its wings to protect small Pokemon from sandstorms.
cobblemon.species.magowl.name: Magowl
cobblemon.species.magowl.desc: Its wings are broad and powerful, yet it never flies. It is said that Magowl is weighed down by the arcane secrets hidden within its cloak of feathers.
cobblemon.species.craliber.name: Craliber
cobblemon.species.craliber.desc: Hatched near undersea mineral deposits, this Pokemon develops a sturdy shell. Its body rotates, helping it maintain course at high speeds.
cobblemon.species.crawglock.name: Crawglock
cobblemon.species.crawglock.desc: Crawglock hides underneath rocks to guard its offspring. A rapid click of its claws releases explosive blasts of heat and light with a loud bang.
cobblemon.species.leafish.name: Leafish
cobblemon.species.leafish.desc: When food is scarce, it floats sideways on the water's surface and absorbs sunlight for energy. Bug Pokemon often land on it, mistaking Leafish for a real leaf.
cobblemon.species.chlorofin.name: Chlorofin
cobblemon.species.chlorofin.desc: Chlorofin's natural camouflage makes it difficult to find in the wild, but once encountered, it'll display the playful, friendly attitude for which it's known.
cobblemon.species.quibble.name: Quibble
cobblemon.species.quibble.desc: Irascible and immature, Quibble squawks loudly when it doesn't get its way. It picks on smaller Pokemon but it's quick to flee when its targets fight back.
cobblemon.species.fowattle.name: Fowattle
cobblemon.species.fowattle.desc: As Fowattle grows bigger and bolder, it becomes somewhat of a bully. Rather than foraging on its own, it prefers to steal food from weaker Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.turkistador.name: Turkistador
cobblemon.species.turkistador.desc: Turkistador often moves into other Pokemon's nests, stubbornly refusing to leave until the old inhabitant gives up and flees.
cobblemon.species.sedirrot.name: Sedirrot
cobblemon.species.sedirrot.desc: Sedirrot cleaves chunks of stone and clay from cliffsides using its axe-like beak. The excavated minerals are then consumed to strengthen its rigid hide.
cobblemon.species.condesa.name: Condesa
cobblemon.species.condesa.desc: Condesa is known to make entire canyons its territory. It has been found to carve images of things it likes into cliffsides.
cobblemon.species.cardinite.name: Cardinite
cobblemon.species.cardinite.desc: Though it can fly, Cardinite prefers to chase its prey around on foot, where it is more comfortable. It leaves a trail of small, scorched tracks as it runs.
cobblemon.species.chardinal.name: Chardinal
cobblemon.species.chardinal.desc: Chardinal routinely sets its own nest on fire to keep the eggs at the right temperature. When it takes off, it looks like the blazing streak of a comet.
cobblemon.species.skurrow.name: Skurrow
cobblemon.species.skurrow.desc: Skurrow digs itself underground to find shelter from the desert heat in a series of tunnels. It hisses to alert other Skurrow when danger is approaching.
cobblemon.species.somberado.name: Somberado
cobblemon.species.somberado.desc: Legend has it that Somberado was born of souls that got lost in the vast emptiness of the desert. Now it is forced to wander the badlands endlessly.
cobblemon.species.phlask.name: Phlask
cobblemon.species.phlask.desc: Laboratory glassware possessed by a playful but frightening spirit. It is known to spew chemicals onto random objects to see what happens.
cobblemon.species.noxial.name: Noxial
cobblemon.species.noxial.desc: Noxial have been discovered in both endothermic and exothermic forms. The more extreme the temperature, the more volatile the Noxial.
cobblemon.species.exothermic_noxial.name: Noxial
cobblemon.species.exothermic_noxial.desc: Noxial have been discovered in both endothermic and exothermic forms. The more extreme the temperature, the more volatile the Noxial.
cobblemon.species.fumighast.name: Fumighast
cobblemon.species.fumighast.desc: Within Fumighast are residual chemicals from its time as a Noxial. Using them as catalysts, Fumighast can recreate spontaneous, volatile reactions at will.
cobblemon.species.atomite.name: Atomite
cobblemon.species.atomite.desc: Atomite is the smallest known Pokemon. Sometimes a big group of Atomite will group together to mimic the shape of something else.
cobblemon.species.orbatom.name: Orbatom
cobblemon.species.orbatom.desc: Orbatom is able to discern objects as small as subatomic particles. It has enabled scientists to understand nuclear physics at a fundamental level.
cobblemon.species.squink.name: Squink
cobblemon.species.squink.desc: When confronted, Squink sprays its foes with noxious black ink to escape. While toxic in high doses, it has a distinct flavor and is used in a variety of dishes.
cobblemon.species.squidrift.name: Squidrift
cobblemon.species.squidrift.desc: Squidrift is able to fly by expelling noxious gases at high pressure. Its tentacles are delicacies, but highly toxic if prepared incorrectly.
cobblemon.species.boarealis.name: Boarealis
cobblemon.species.boarealis.desc: Boarealis' psychic powers produce vivid light shows when they interact with magnetic fields. The brilliance of the mane indicates an individual's strength.
cobblemon.species.chelonite.name: Chelonite
cobblemon.species.chelonite.desc: Chelonite uses its psychic control over gravity to levitate itself above the ground. It will sometimes get confused which way is up and float upside-down.
cobblemon.species.galaxagos.name: Galaxagos
cobblemon.species.galaxagos.desc: Galaxagos’ shell is so dense, it exudes a gravitational pull. At night, Chelonite swarm around it, orbiting in a spiral pattern for safety.
cobblemon.species.magnitogre.name: Magnitogre
cobblemon.species.magnitogre.desc: Magnitogre was first discovered when factories became commonplace. It feeds on leftover industrial waste, providing a safe environment for other Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.minarac.name: Minarac
cobblemon.species.minarac.desc: Minarac digs elaborate tunnels to confuse its prey. Its constant search for gemstones also makes it a valuable companion for treasure-hunters.
cobblemon.species.trenchula.name: Trenchula
cobblemon.species.trenchula.desc: Trenchula uses its powerful mandibles to drill into the earth, forming a pitfall trap to ensnare its prey. It often work alongside miners underground.
cobblemon.species.pottle.name: Pottle
cobblemon.species.pottle.desc: It deviously infiltrates homes and fools unwary humans into caring for it. If discovered, Pottle will resist removal by stubbornly rooting into place.
cobblemon.species.trikotta.name: Trikotta
cobblemon.species.trikotta.desc: Trikotta actively seeks out the soil with the most nutrients. It will uproot crops from farmland and then defend its stolen land against angered farmers.
cobblemon.species.terrorcotta.name: Terrorcotta
cobblemon.species.terrorcotta.desc: Terrorcotta is too huge for standard containers. In order to not have their houses carried away, locals make giant clay pots for it to inhabit instead.
cobblemon.species.pueblant.name: Pueblant
cobblemon.species.pueblant.desc: The sprawling colonies built by Pueblant have inspired human architects for millennia. These structures are harder than concrete, lasting for generations.
cobblemon.species.cahokisect.name: Cahokisect
cobblemon.species.cahokisect.desc: Cahokisect's bejeweled carapace made it a symbol of wealth in ancient times. As a result, it is commonly found in the tombs of nobility and royalty.
cobblemon.species.cobrasket.name: Cobrasket
cobblemon.species.cobrasket.desc: Its resting, coiled body resembles a basket. Many unsuspecting merchants have been startled when they reached for one, only to be met with loud hissing.
cobblemon.species.charmbra.name: Charmbra
cobblemon.species.charmbra.desc: Charmbra passes air through the holes on its body to create a melody that hypnotizes its prey. The dazed targets are unable to escape its toxic fangs.
cobblemon.species.cairup.name: Cairup
cobblemon.species.cairup.desc: When it thinks nobody is looking, Cairup has been known to have one-sided talks with its tail. The eye on its forehead stays closed until it's fully developed.
cobblemon.species.kairoglyph.name: Kairoglyph
cobblemon.species.kairoglyph.desc: Kairoglyph values secrets and riddles above all else. The eye on its tail can reveal the innermost secrets of both humans and Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.necronite.name: Necronite
cobblemon.species.necronite.desc: Necronite emits a strange frequency as it floats about the ancient ruins it inhabits. Making contact with this Pokemon can leave one lightheaded.
cobblemon.species.gravollum.name: Gravollum
cobblemon.species.gravollum.desc: Gravollum will sleep motionless for thousands of years, only to awaken and relocate. This has led to ancient monuments seemingly vanishing overnight.
cobblemon.species.diloweed.name: Diloweed
cobblemon.species.diloweed.desc: As food in the desert is scarce, the plates on Diloweed's back absorb solar energy. It curls itself up into a ball and lets the wind carry it if it is tired.
cobblemon.species.pangolash.name: Pangolash
cobblemon.species.pangolash.desc: The plates on Pangolash's back have not only hardened to be highly durable, but also developed sharp edges capable of shredding nearly anything to pieces.
cobblemon.species.ignishell.name: Ignishell
cobblemon.species.ignishell.desc: Ignishell is still young, so its shell has not completely formed. In battle it worriedly covers its soft underbelly, which is very susceptible to attacks.
cobblemon.species.shelosene.name: Shelosene
cobblemon.species.shelosene.desc: Shelosene proudly displays its carapace to show its endurance. The Shelosene with the least damaged shell is idolised by the nest.
cobblemon.species.flarrapin.name: Flarrapin
cobblemon.species.flarrapin.desc: Flarrapin exposes its shell to extreme heat to repair and strengthen it. It is said that the average Flarrapin’s shell has been completely reforged 5 times.
cobblemon.species.desoula.name: Desoula
cobblemon.species.desoula.desc: Desoula feeds on the souls of creatures who have become exhausted by the desert. This nimble Pokemon zips around the desert sands in search of food.
cobblemon.species.necrow.name: Necrow
cobblemon.species.necrow.desc: Necrow has been known to lure people into the desert in an attempt to make them get lost. It then quietly watches from afar, awaiting its prey's demise.
cobblemon.species.vultergyst.name: Vultergyst
cobblemon.species.vultergyst.desc: Vultergyst is considered a harbinger of death. It scours the desert skies in search of fading souls then puts them to rest in its cloak of black feathers.
cobblemon.species.dinkywink.name: Dinkywink
cobblemon.species.dinkywink.desc: While Dinkywink's mouth contains huge, razor sharp teeth, it has yet to develop the strength to utilize them. As such, it prefers to hunt by ramming into prey.
cobblemon.species.dunkywunkr.name: Dunkywunkr
cobblemon.species.dunkywunkr.desc: After its legs had fully developed, Dunkywunkr was able to become the apex predator not only in the seas from which it emerged, but also on dry land.
cobblemon.species.calphite.name: Calphite
cobblemon.species.calphite.desc: Calphite spent many of its early years with its mother. Despite its massive size, it scared easily and trampled much in its path when running in fear.
cobblemon.species.indrolith.name: Indrolith
cobblemon.species.indrolith.desc: Very few things can penetrate Indrolith's impervious hide. This earthen behemoth ferociously defends its own when under attack.
cobblemon.species.solacari.name: Solacari
cobblemon.species.solacari.desc: Ancient peoples venerated Solacari as the herald of the rising sun. Kings would keep many of them in hopes of a long reign.
cobblemon.species.nurshary.name: Nurshary
cobblemon.species.nurshary.desc: Nurshary’s maternal instinct extends beyond its own children. It will often adopt sick or injured Pokemon, caring for them until they return to health.
cobblemon.species.loneleaf.name: Loneleaf
cobblemon.species.loneleaf.desc: Loneleaf considers itself to be ugly and creepy. It carves a wooden mask with a large smile on it to make friends. Sadly, this only alienates it even further.
cobblemon.species.forthorn.name: Forthorn
cobblemon.species.forthorn.desc: Forthorn masquerades as a guardian of the forest, scaring off intruders to awe its fellow Pokemon. In reality, it is quite bashful and desires acceptance.
cobblemon.species.coltergeist.name: Coltergeist
cobblemon.species.coltergeist.desc: The icy blue gazes of Coltergeist herds can often be seen in thick fog patches. Their eerie cries not only cause chills, but also strange, indescribable dreams.
cobblemon.species.fantasmare.name: Fantasmare
cobblemon.species.fantasmare.desc: Fantasmare wanders in the mountains and hills where it stalks lone travellers. It is said to haunt the dreams of those who have seen it.
cobblemon.species.chihaha.name: Chihaha
cobblemon.species.chihaha.desc: Chihaha loves nothing more than to make people laugh. It may look silly and clumsy to some, but in reality, it takes fake pratfalls for the sake of humor.
cobblemon.species.howlequin.name: Howlequin
cobblemon.species.howlequin.desc: Despite lacking thumbs, its dexterity is superior to humans'. Wild Howlequin often taunt trainers by juggling the balls that were too weak to catch it.
cobblemon.species.chegrin.name: Chegrin
cobblemon.species.chegrin.desc: Chegrin takes delight in playing tricks on smaller Pokemon, scaring them with its flexible tail, but all too often, it ends up accidentally scaring itself.
cobblemon.species.cheshade.name: Cheshade
cobblemon.species.cheshade.desc: Cheshade's mane resembles a toothy smile. Hunting in the dark, it appears only as a sinister grin, striking prey with its shadowy claws as they are transfixed.
cobblemon.species.doppole.name: Doppole
cobblemon.species.doppole.desc: Doppole wears a half of a broken Poke Ball as a sturdy improvised helmet. Whilst it might act bold and spunky, in reality, it loves being coddled.
cobblemon.species.artifish.name: Artifish
cobblemon.species.artifish.desc: Despite its predator-like appearance, Artifish is very kind and laid back. It uses its Poke Ball bait to play with other Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.thoraxe.name: Thoraxe
cobblemon.species.pomparunt.name: Pomparunt
cobblemon.species.pomparunt.desc: Pomparunt is commonly found skulking around densely populated cities. It scavenges for food in small packs and often fights with others over scraps.
cobblemon.species.pompagoon.name: Pompagoon
cobblemon.species.pompagoon.desc: Being much stronger and bolder, gangs of Pompagoon will bully Pomparunt out of food. Oftentimes they will then fight among themselves for the stolen loot.
cobblemon.species.hyekuza.name: Hyekuza
cobblemon.species.hyekuza.desc: Fiercely proud and protective of its hairdo, the Hyekuza with the largest and most extravagant pompadour is considered the leader of the pack.
cobblemon.species.erycoon.name: Erycoon
cobblemon.species.erycoon.desc: Erycoon is constantly taking care of the forest it calls its home. It carries seeds and berries in its pouch-like tail to be planted or fed to weaker Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.leukoon.name: Leukoon
cobblemon.species.leukoon.desc: Scientists call Leukoon the immune system of nature. It is able to engulf any threat to its habitat using its massive, void-like maw.
cobblemon.species.toxito.name: Toxito
cobblemon.species.toxito.desc: Toxito are commonly seen at night, looking for their next prey to suck on. They suck up air to appear intimidating, but instead often become slow and sluggish, making them a less formidable foe.
cobblemon.species.sanguito.name: Sanguito
cobblemon.species.sanguito.desc: Sanguito's antennae can sense warmth, helping it find prey in its dimly-lit swamp habitat. It emits a numbing toxin that keeps it undetected while it feeds.
cobblemon.species.orett.name: Orett
cobblemon.species.orett.desc: Born deep underground, Orett feeds on ore to keep its metallic shell strong. The composition of its body depends on what kind of ore it feeds on.
cobblemon.species.anvelid.name: Anvelid
cobblemon.species.anvelid.desc: Anvelid incubates inside mineral-rich cave walls in order to grow. However, it will ferociously attack any Pokemon or people who disturb its hibernation.
cobblemon.species.magroplex.name: Magroplex
cobblemon.species.magroplex.desc: Notoriously protective of its community, Magroplex will go so far as to collapse mines approaching its nests. Its durable body allows it to dig miles underground.
cobblemon.species.viipii.name: Viipii
cobblemon.species.viipii.desc: Although they are friendly to most Pokemon, in the wild, groups of Viipii are known to bicker and fight over nothing for days on end.
cobblemon.species.chilloth.name: Chilloth
cobblemon.species.chilloth.desc: Chilloth floats calmly in the water by connecting its arms to make an inner tube. It lets swimmers hold on when they need to catch their breath.
cobblemon.species.soakoth.name: Soakoth
cobblemon.species.soakoth.desc: Soakoth drifts nonchalantly along river rapids as if they were a gentle stream. Pokemon that can't swim sometimes climb on its belly to cross bodies of water.
cobblemon.species.chayan.name: Chayan
cobblemon.species.chayan.desc: Chayan is a born fighter, sparring with others mere hours after birth. It competes with others in challenges of skill and strength, striving to improve.
cobblemon.species.macuarrior.name: Macuarrior
cobblemon.species.macuarrior.desc: The edges of Macuarrior's blades are extremely sharp. Through constant honing, these blades can effortlessly cut through concrete.
cobblemon.species.ocerumi.name: Ocerumi
cobblemon.species.ocerumi.desc: Ocerumi encases its hands in special clay, baking them in harsh sun. When dried, these stone gauntlets can resist even Ocerumi's earth-shattering punch.
cobblemon.species.fortifry.name: Fortifry
cobblemon.species.fortifry.desc: Only Fortifry that learn to care for others will evolve. Though they are numerous and hardy, few Fortifry evolve due to their inherently selfish nature.
cobblemon.species.oarwish.name: Oarwish
cobblemon.species.oarwish.desc: Oarwish is known to emerge only to help people in need. This has gained it a reputation amongst sailors that it is a sign of luck and can grant wishes.
cobblemon.species.smashiary.name: Smashiary
cobblemon.species.smashiary.desc: Smashiary's reckless fighting style makes use of its long legs and aerial superiority to swoop onto enemies in a flurry of bone-shattering kicks.
cobblemon.species.slatic.name: Slatic
cobblemon.species.slatic.desc: Slatic has not yet mastered its powers of light distortion. As a result, its body parts will suddenly appear out of nowhere as its camouflage falters.
cobblemon.species.telsion.name: Telsion
cobblemon.species.telsion.desc: Telsion's lightning fast tongue carries an impressive electric current that cooks small bugs alive and can stun even the heftiest of opponents.
cobblemon.species.chameleohm.name: Chameleohm
cobblemon.species.chameleohm.desc: By using its ability to manipulate electromagnetic waves, Chameleohm can disrupt the light around it and render itself invisible to the naked eye.
cobblemon.species.glauqua.name: Glauqua
cobblemon.species.glauqua.desc: Even though Glauqua is highly venomous, it is known to be playful and enjoy making new friends. Still, one should try to stay away from its poisonous horns.
cobblemon.species.hydranticus.name: Hydranticus
cobblemon.species.hydranticus.desc: Hydranticus is a curious Pokemon that loves soaring behind ships for weeks on end, happily absorbing the toxic runoff left in their wakes.
cobblemon.species.lintle.name: Lintle
cobblemon.species.lintle.desc: The luster of Lintle's mane is indicative of its health. From birth, it always travels as part of a pair, and remain with its partner its whole life.
cobblemon.species.silkinder.name: Silkinder
cobblemon.species.silkinder.desc: The ribbons on Silkinder's neck are very sensitive, and shine in the moonlight. Silkinder often entwine ribbons as an affectionate gesture.
cobblemon.species.paramoth.name: Paramoth
cobblemon.species.paramoth.desc: On rare occasions, Paramoth will cloud together and perform a complicated, colorful dance. Some say this is related to the movements of the moon.
cobblemon.species.parapy.name: Parapy
cobblemon.species.parapy.desc: Parapy grows inside the mouth of a fish and replaces the tongue of its host. It uses its host's body as a trojan horse, attacking unwitting prey as it swims by.
cobblemon.species.mawasite.name: Mawasite
cobblemon.species.mawasite.desc: Mawasite has now fully overtaken its host's mind and body. By seizing complete control, the bodies have become inseparable.
cobblemon.species.chimpoca.name: Chimpoca
cobblemon.species.chimpoca.desc: Chimpoca, though typically naïve and clumsy, all aspire to become the leaders of their troops. Their brazen actions often lead them into trouble.
cobblemon.species.simayan.name: Simayan
cobblemon.species.simayan.desc: Simayan spend all their time sparring with each other. Their aim is to show that they are the strongest in the group, and thus become the next leader.
cobblemon.species.monkezuma.name: Monkezuma
cobblemon.species.monkezuma.desc: There can be only one Monkezuma per troop, who leads the rest with an iron fist. If another Simayan evolves, the two battle, and the loser is exiled.
cobblemon.species.enigmite.name: Enigmite
cobblemon.species.enigmite.desc: Enigmite selects a round stone and rolls it around tirelessly. When the stone becomes perfectly smooth, Enigmite gains psychic powers.
cobblemon.species.enigmantis.name: Enigmantis
cobblemon.species.enigmantis.desc: Enigmantis uses its perfectly rounded gem to focus its psychic powers. Robbing it of its stone leaves it sluggish and listless.
cobblemon.species.arjibi.name: Arjibi
cobblemon.species.arjibi.desc: Arjibi absorbs light with its colored fins to produce energy. In bright light, it flits about energetically, so fast that film barely registers it as a blur.
cobblemon.species.royjibiv.name: Royjibiv
cobblemon.species.royjibiv.desc: Royjibiv's iridescent scales reflect and amplify sunlight. When flying overhead, this causes it to bathe the ground below it in every color imaginable.
cobblemon.species.barracute.name: Barracute
cobblemon.species.barracute.desc: Barracute hides in the narrow openings between rocks to protect its soft body. It will stick its head out and bite anything unlucky enough to get near it.
cobblemon.species.jawgodon.name: Jawgodon
cobblemon.species.jawgodon.desc: Despite being a fast swimmer, Jawgodon prefers stealing others' prey and eating carrion rather than hunting. It will search on land if food is scarce.
cobblemon.species.drosire.name: Drosire
cobblemon.species.drosire.desc: Drosire cannot draw nutrients from the soil, so it uses its vines to hang from trees and catch bugs. Unaware humans may accidentally walk into it face first.
cobblemon.species.sunduke.name: Sunduke
cobblemon.species.sunduke.desc: Sunduke lead groups of Drosire in return for reverence. As such, they have long been a symbol of royalty, and ancient Urobians fashioned their regalia on them.
cobblemon.species.wispern.name: Wispern
cobblemon.species.wispern.desc: It is common to find a procession of Wispern at a funeral. It is believed that they are there to safely guide the deceased to the afterlife.
cobblemon.species.phantern.name: Phantern
cobblemon.species.phantern.desc: Phantern congregate in large groups at times of celebration. Oddly, its ghostly lights are known to appear at both festivals and funerals.
cobblemon.species.glocto.name: Glocto
cobblemon.species.glocto.desc: Glocto’s molten innards form constantly shifting bubbles of glowing lava. This strange, yet beautiful phenomenon is visible from above the ocean’s surface.
cobblemon.species.lavoon.name: Lavoon
cobblemon.species.lavoon.desc: Lavoon releases molten secretions from its blowhole, which gradually rise to the surface and cool. People collect them to use as alternative fuel.
cobblemon.species.gilla.name: Gilla
cobblemon.species.gilla.desc: From the moment it hatches, Gilla must fend for itself. It hunts on its own, even in its infancy, using poison glands filled with toxic venom.
cobblemon.species.hornizard.name: Hornizard
cobblemon.species.hornizard.desc: Hornizard’s spines contain a potent venom, while its skin secretes an acidic compound. Due to these defenses, it has almost no natural predators.
cobblemon.species.ankillosore.name: Ankillosore
cobblemon.species.ankillosore.desc: Ankillosore will let attackers strike its thick hide so it can line up a blow with its tail. If the impact doesn't fell the foe, the venom surely will.
cobblemon.species.bazilisk.name: Bazilisk
cobblemon.species.bazilisk.desc: While sunbathing, Bazilisk lays in tall grass so that only its dorsal leaf is visible. When prey passes by, however, it jumps up and snaps at it quickly.
cobblemon.species.ornitherb.name: Ornitherb
cobblemon.species.ornitherb.desc: Ornitherb work together to steal eggs from other Pokemon's nests. A few will distract the parents while others make off with their target.
cobblemon.species.dilophlora.name: Dilophlora
cobblemon.species.dilophlora.desc: Dilophlora will commit every rock and plant in its jungle to memory. That way it can swiftly avoid any obstacle while chasing down its prey at high speeds.
cobblemon.species.baboom.name: Baboom
cobblemon.species.baboom.desc: Baboom is vicious towards any outsiders. It can build up an electric charge by rapidly slapping its own rear, which causes thunderous blasts of lightning.
cobblemon.species.icetope.name: Icetope
cobblemon.species.icetope.desc: Icetope's innards are in the constant danger of overheating and melting down. To counteract this, it maintains an extremely low body temperature.
cobblemon.species.chillnobyl.name: Chillnobyl
cobblemon.species.chillnobyl.desc: Chillnobyl appears near radioactive sites and absorbs the radiation there. It is often used to clean up nuclear waste and seek out leaks in nuclear reactors.
cobblemon.species.wendingo.name: Wendingo
cobblemon.species.wendingo.desc: Wendingo lives in a tight-knit pack. It uses its coloration to blend in with its snowy habitat, then cooperates with the pack to take down larger prey.
cobblemon.species.carnibal.name: Carnibal
cobblemon.species.carnibal.desc: Carnibal's ravaging hunger is never satisfied. It can't stand the thought of sharing food with others, so it leaves the pack to hunt on its own.
cobblemon.species.luchito.name: Luchito
cobblemon.species.luchito.desc: Luchito practice grabs and throws on rocks to develop their own signature move. Despite their size, their tail stores a powerful electric charge.
cobblemon.species.eluchadon.name: Eluchadon
cobblemon.species.eluchadon.desc: When Eluchadon is challenged, it holds nothing back against its foe. It builds up static energy in its mane to unleash in an electrifying finishing move.
cobblemon.species.grolem.name: Grolem
cobblemon.species.grolem.desc: Acting as a sentry for temples, Grolem forms a symbiosis with the moss and foliage it wears. Roots run through it like circuitry to deliver solar energy.
cobblemon.species.comossus.name: Comossus
cobblemon.species.comossus.desc: Comossus is theorized to have served as a sentinel for bygone civilizations. It is able to focus natural energies into powerful destructive beams.
cobblemon.species.larvyn.name: Larvyn
cobblemon.species.larvyn.desc: Larvyn's appetite is ravenous. It will eat almost anything, be it wood, rocks or even metal. It uses the nutrients to slowly develop a sturdy shell.
cobblemon.species.dracoon.name: Dracoon
cobblemon.species.dracoon.desc: Having encased itself in a rigid shell, Dracoon begins its transformation. It hardly moves at all, instead directing its entire attention to its growth.
cobblemon.species.basilect.name: Basilect
cobblemon.species.basilect.desc: Basilect uses its powerful pincers to shear and jab at foes. Opposing Basilect will grapple with their pincers and try to hurl the other as far as they can.
cobblemon.species.carbite.name: Carbite
cobblemon.species.carbite.desc: Carbite consumes minerals in excess to toughen its rocky hide. It prefers carbon, so it will occasionally go after live prey.
cobblemon.species.pressaur.name: Pressaur
cobblemon.species.pressaur.desc: Pressaur compresses the minerals it consumes, producing so much energy that it must expel heat through the vents that run along its rugged body.
cobblemon.species.diamat.name: Diamat
cobblemon.species.diamat.desc: In battle, Diamat refracts light through its glittering body to blind foes, then finishes them off with its powerful, unbreakable claws.
cobblemon.species.quecko.name: Quecko
cobblemon.species.quecko.desc: Quecko is hard to find and catch; this makes it very sought after not only by trainers, but also by healers who use its leaves to make medicine.
cobblemon.species.tozecko.name: Tozecko
cobblemon.species.tozecko.desc: Tozecko was worshipped as a god of wind and harvest in ancient times. When offered tribute, it would ensure clear skies and bountiful crops.
cobblemon.species.crakling.name: Crakling
cobblemon.species.crakling.desc: If one hears sharp explosions with no one around, it might be a Crakling, blowing up pebbles for fun. Its tail constantly shoots bright sparks.
cobblemon.species.fuelong.name: Fuelong
cobblemon.species.fuelong.desc: Fuelong idly rests in the clouds at day, but at night it awakes and breathes its colorful fire. From below, it looks like a display of brilliant fireworks.
cobblemon.species.draggar.name: Draggar
cobblemon.species.draggar.desc: Draggar looks fierce from afar, but it is in fact very jovial. It enjoys swimming through even the roughest seas, unafraid of storms or large waves.
cobblemon.species.ragnarow.name: Ragnarow
cobblemon.species.ragnarow.desc: On foggy nights, Ragnarow is often mistaken for an abandoned vessel. Sailors tell stories of the terrible shipwrecks that occur if Ragnarow is approached.
cobblemon.species.eronze.name: Eronze
cobblemon.species.eronze.desc: Eronze's body is made from an ancient metal alloy lost to modern science. It can withstand intense heat and force without the slightest bit of damage.
cobblemon.species.erion.name: Erion
cobblemon.species.erion.desc: Erion is an industrial titan, ravenously consuming fuel and spewing it out as toxic smog. Plants and Pokemon in its wake wither and gasp for air.
cobblemon.species.erace.name: Erace
cobblemon.species.erace.desc: Thought to be damaged beyond repair, Erace was retrofitted with state-of-the-art technology. Its new, advanced body can even withstand atmospheric re-entry.
cobblemon.species.patama.name: Patama
cobblemon.species.patama.desc: Patama presides over land and forests, caring for the plants and Pokemon. It perpetuates the life cycle, making sure death always brings forth new life.
cobblemon.species.machima.name: Machima
cobblemon.species.machima.desc: Machima is said to wander the badlands, shrouded in a perpetual sandstorm. In legend, it whisks intruders away from the desert on a cushion of wind.
cobblemon.species.yacuma.name: Yacuma
cobblemon.species.yacuma.desc: Seeing Yacuma's lights floating in the deep is a bad omen for sailors. Ships that pollute the sea are unlikely to escape its wrath and return to shore.
cobblemon.species.quetzar.name: Quetzar
cobblemon.species.quetzar.desc: Quetzar's wings inspired the ancient Urobians to name the constellations. Legends warn that if it leaves, the night sky will turn pitch black.
cobblemon.species.quetzarspace.name: QuetzarSpace
cobblemon.species.quetzarspace.desc: Quetzar's wings inspired the ancient Urobians to name the constellations. Legends warn that if it leaves, the night sky will turn pitch black.
cobblemon.species.xochi.name: Xochi
cobblemon.species.xotec.name: Xotec
cobblemon.species.meadew.name: Meadew
cobblemon.species.ninfae.name: Ninfae
cobblemon.species.faeuna.name: Faeuna
cobblemon.species.mousic.name: Mousic
cobblemon.species.rabatuta.name: Rabatuta
cobblemon.species.flamelin.name: Flamelin
cobblemon.species.gulliby.name: Gulliby
cobblemon.species.saigull.name: Saigull
cobblemon.species.seaghoul.name: Seaghoul
cobblemon.species.faemie.name: Faemie
cobblemon.species.cotylit.name: Cotylit
cobblemon.species.cotylit.desc: Cotylit are popular as first Pokemon for children because of their docile nature. A happy Cotylit's petals turn deep pink.
cobblemon.species.cotyleaf.name: Cotyleaf
cobblemon.species.cotyleaf.desc: Cotyleaf can be unruly for a novice trainer but are intensely loyal. The color of its foliage reflects its emotional state.
cobblemon.species.nymphlora.name: Nymphlora
cobblemon.species.nymphlora.desc: Nymphora are seen as a symbol of fertility and good luck by the people of Rica. Lush gardens bloom wherever Nymphlora pass through.
cobblemon.species.bunfin.name: Bunfin
cobblemon.species.bunfin.desc: Bunfin live in rocky, mountainous areas, where they mark their territory by scorching surrounding rocks. They can make a high-pitched whistling noise by quickly blowing hot air through their snouts.
cobblemon.species.arsinge.name: Arsinge
cobblemon.species.arsinge.desc: Arsinge eat small rock chunks to keep their internal flame burning strong. Due to their continuous internal combustion, they emit an off-putting scent.
cobblemon.species.rupsen.name: Rupsen
cobblemon.species.rupsen.desc: Rupsen build dens by melting rock. They shoot hot air from their spouts and can communicate long distances by whistling in this way.
cobblemon.species.mirmoor.name: Mirmoor
cobblemon.species.mirmoor.desc: Mirmoor like to play in bogs and other bodies of water. They act tough but run to their parents when threatened.
cobblemon.species.sloowin.name: Sloowin
cobblemon.species.sloowin.desc: Sloowin butt heads in fights of dominance. These Pokemon are always looking for an opportunity to show off their strength.
cobblemon.species.atrocean.name: Atrocean
cobblemon.species.atrocean.desc: Atrocean's anger when battling is unmatched, using any means necessary to acquire victory. Although it's horribly angry in battle, it's strangely docile outside of it.
cobblemon.species.skurrel.name: Skurrel
cobblemon.species.skurrel.desc: Skurrel enjoy playing pranks. They sit high in trees and throw nuts at passersby.
cobblemon.species.sparskia.name: Sparskia
cobblemon.species.sparskia.desc: These Pokemon are ruthless pranksters. Some Sparskia will find sleeping travelers and jolt them awake with electricity.
cobblemon.species.sparruff.name: Sparruff
cobblemon.species.sparruff.desc: During the rainy season, Sparruff fight aggressively over territories. Two males will fight oblivious to anything else going on, and sometimes tumble right in front of trainers.
cobblemon.species.wingale.name: Wingale
cobblemon.species.wingale.desc: Wingale's rounded wings are perfectly adapted for flying through the dense rainforest understory. This Pokemon is a common sight amongst the tall almond trees in the Western Rainforest.
cobblemon.species.yuvirro.name: Yuvirro
cobblemon.species.yuvirro.desc: Yuvirro's song is said to summon rain. They can be heard singing frequently just before the rainy season begins.
cobblemon.species.archick.name: Archick
cobblemon.species.archick.desc: Archick are commonly found along the coast, especially in rocky areas. They can also be found flying over the sea.
cobblemon.species.terundra.name: Terundra
cobblemon.species.terundra.desc: Terundra live in cold regions but migrate to warmer areas every year to lay their eggs. They travel farther than any other Pokemon. They can often be found flying over the ocean.
cobblemon.species.pupsea.name: Pupsea
cobblemon.species.pupsea.desc: Pupsea aren't skilled swimmers, so they spend most of their time on the beach. Because of their docile nature, they make good companions for children.
cobblemon.species.blubbark.name: Blubbark
cobblemon.species.blubbark.desc: They're faster when swimming than they are climbing around on land. Blubbark can be found frolicking in the waves along rocky shorelines.
cobblemon.species.sealord.name: Sealord
cobblemon.species.sealord.desc: Sealord fiercely guard the beaches where Merjestic go to give birth. They attack anyone who approaches the pups.
cobblemon.species.merjestic.name: Merjestic
cobblemon.species.merjestic.desc: Merjestic spend most of their lives out at sea. They will hunt and eat anything smaller than them.
cobblemon.species.cyton.name: Cyton
cobblemon.species.cyton.desc: Cyton have tough shells that protect them from attacks. They live among rocks on the coast, where they can withstand powerful waves breaking.
cobblemon.species.kaidon.name: Kaidon
cobblemon.species.kaidon.desc: Kaidon's shell thickens even further, capable of taking an explosion up-close and coming out unscathed. The slime on its body helps it stay moisturized.
cobblemon.species.skunfume.name: Skunfume
cobblemon.species.skunfume.desc: This Pokemon becomes active at night. Skunfume uses its sweet scent to attract Bug Pokemon to eat.
cobblemon.species.perfessence.name: Perfessence
cobblemon.species.perfessence.desc: This Pokemon's lovely scent is used to make high-end perfumes. Some say it smells just like daisies.
cobblemon.species.tinion.name: Tinion
cobblemon.species.tinion.desc: Tinion burrow underground during the day. They camouflage perfectly amongst tall grass.
cobblemon.species.akoni.name: Akoni
cobblemon.species.akoni.desc: They disguise themselves as grass to ambush prey. When something edible walks across the surface, they bite down.
cobblemon.species.leekadon.name: Leekadon
cobblemon.species.leekadon.desc: They can absorb nutrients directly from the soil through their feet and tail. Despite this, they are still always hungry.
cobblemon.species.larmidge.name: Larmidge
cobblemon.species.larmidge.desc: Larmidge eat algae and leaves that have sunk to the bottoms of shallow ponds. They breathe through the gills on their rear.
cobblemon.species.dormidge.name: Dormidge
cobblemon.species.dormidge.desc: Dormidge has a hard body that protects it from attacks as it awaits evolution. It can wriggle its tail to attempt an escape.
cobblemon.species.chirmidge.name: Chirmidge
cobblemon.species.chirmidge.desc: Chirmidge spend their short lives in search for a mate. They shake their fluffy antennae to release intoxicating pheromones.
cobblemon.species.ostrodd.name: Ostrodd
cobblemon.species.ostrodd.desc: This unusual Pokemon resembles a Bug-type, but is actually a close relative of Krabby. Ostrodd can be found floating lazily in just about any pond.
cobblemon.species.orbizarre.name: Orbizarre
cobblemon.species.orbizarre.desc: This mysterious Pokemon has unknown powers. Researchers are still discovering new moves that this Pokemon can learn.
cobblemon.species.tadport.name: Tadport
cobblemon.species.tadport.desc: It stays out of sight whenever possible, but cannot resist a tasty snack. If spotted, Tadport will try to Teleport away to safety.
cobblemon.species.psionewt.name: Psionewt
cobblemon.species.psionewt.desc: Psionewt walks slowly, so it teleports when in a hurry. This Pokemon concentrates psychic energy in its skin.
cobblemon.species.desmodon.name: Desmodon
cobblemon.species.desmodon.desc: Desmodon uses its sensitive fins to detect changes in the flow of energy. It can even sense people's emotions.
cobblemon.species.leaflit.name: Leaflit
cobblemon.species.leaflit.desc: Leaflit are abundant but can be difficult to spot because of their camouflage. When spotted, they will dash to make a getaway.
cobblemon.species.fauxiage.name: Fauxiage
cobblemon.species.fauxiage.desc: Fauxiage dash through the jungle at lightning speed. Their leaf armor protects them from branches and thorns as they run through brush.
cobblemon.species.fluffaux.name: Fluffaux
cobblemon.species.fluffaux.desc: Fluffaux casts dazzling illusions to avoid being eaten. Its rear is even disguised as a false head.
cobblemon.species.lepillusion.name: Lepillusion
cobblemon.species.lepillusion.desc: Lepillusion can create hypnotizing light shows with its shimmering scales that confuse its foes. When frightened, it will disappear without a trace.
cobblemon.species.tapirunt.name: Tapirunt
cobblemon.species.tapirunt.desc: Tapirunt can be found wallowing in mud throughout the deep jungle. When disturbed, they will not hesitate to attack using their electricity.
cobblemon.species.voltapir.name: Voltapir
cobblemon.species.voltapir.desc: Although usually a solitary Pokemon, sometimes Voltapir can be found traveling with a young Tapirunt. It will defend its young at all costs.
cobblemon.species.odonymph.name: Odonymph
cobblemon.species.odonymph.desc: Hidden in the mud, Odonymph lunges at its prey in the blink of an eye. Its fast-moving claws slash prey before it can respond.
cobblemon.species.nymbide.name: Nymbide
cobblemon.species.nymbide.desc: Nymbide is a threatening predator, lunging at prey while hidden beneath the mud. This Pokemon can take down prey twice its size by grasping with its claws and delivering a powerful bite.
cobblemon.species.dranax.name: Dranax
cobblemon.species.dranax.desc: Dranax is a powerful aerial predator, able to swiftly fly through dense jungle to hunt. It creates powerful sound waves with its wings to incapacitate its targets.
cobblemon.species.skulmet.name: Skulmet
cobblemon.species.skulmet.desc: Skulmet gathers bones in order to protect itself. These Pokemon thrive wherever there is a lot of death.
cobblemon.species.femurk.name: Femurk
cobblemon.species.femurk.desc: Femurk uses bones that it collects to make itself seem scary. However, this Pokemon is easily spooked, and can retreat into its armor to hide.
cobblemon.species.foromen.name: Foromen
cobblemon.species.foromen.desc: This Pokemon has absorbed sinister forces within the jungle to make itself more powerful. Some say that it embodies the anger of the rainforest. It uses monstrous skeletons to arm itself.
cobblemon.species.chirpunch.name: Chirpunch
cobblemon.species.chirpunch.desc: Chirpunch are agile both on wing and on foot. They use kicking moves to take down opponents.
cobblemon.species.taekowl.name: Taekowl
cobblemon.species.taekowl.desc: Taekowl roost high up on cliffs. They spot prey from a great distance, even at night, and attack from above with their talons.
cobblemon.species.minilith.name: Minilith
cobblemon.species.minilith.desc: Minilith cover themselves with dirt and pretend to be rocks. In just a few seconds, a Minilith can dig itself completely underground.
cobblemon.species.bolstone.name: Bolstone
cobblemon.species.bolstone.desc: Bolstone spend most of their time hidden among boulders. They love to bask in the sun, but fight back if disturbed.
cobblemon.species.terrouldite.name: Terrouldite
cobblemon.species.terrouldite.desc: Legends of walking mountains actually describe herds of Terrouldite waking from their slumber. These powerful Pokemon prefer to cover themselves with dirt and sleep.
cobblemon.species.cosmite.name: Cosmite
cobblemon.species.cosmite.desc: Its hard, smooth skin is cool to the touch. Scientists believe that this Pokemon originated from space.
cobblemon.species.shiverel.name: Shiverel
cobblemon.species.shiverel.desc: Shiverel are always cold. They snuggle into their tail to get warm, but because they do not produce any body heat, they are unable to warm up.
cobblemon.species.stoatzen.name: Stoatzen
cobblemon.species.stoatzen.desc: Stoatzen ride on gusts of wind to move swiftly through the air. When a Stoatzen passes by, the temperature can drop 20 degrees Celcius.
cobblemon.species.trinctite.name: Trinctite
cobblemon.species.trinctite.desc: Trinctite attach themselves to the ceilings of caves to sleep. A colony of Trinctite is a dazzling sight for spelunkers.
cobblemon.species.crystallier.name: Crystallier
cobblemon.species.crystallier.desc: Crystallier uses its combined brain power to gather crystals and hold them close to itself for protection. It is believed that the central head is in charge.
cobblemon.species.garrachnid.name: Garrachnid
cobblemon.species.garrachnid.desc: Garrachnid have lived in total darkness for so long that they have lost the ability to see. They use their claws as receivers to detect even the quietest sounds.
cobblemon.species.anau.name: Anau
cobblemon.species.anau.desc: Some think of Anau as the manifested spirits of miners, though they've been around since mining first began in the region. They eat many kinds of ore, particularly those that conduct well.
cobblemon.species.sunole.name: Sunole
cobblemon.species.sunole.desc: Sunole basks on warm tree trunks to store energy for its Fire-type moves. When threatened, it flashes its brightly colored dewlap as a warning.
cobblemon.species.baskilisk.name: Baskilisk
cobblemon.species.baskilisk.desc: Baskilisk can rear up on its hind legs to run away quickly from threats. It can even run directly across hot lava to make an escape.
cobblemon.species.solana.name: Solana
cobblemon.species.solana.desc: Solana are capable of producing enough heat to roast uncooked meats, which is typically their method of consumption. They bask in the sun to absorb energy, and store it in large scutes on their body. When fully charged with energy, Solana's scutes glow.
cobblemon.species.tusslett.name: Tusslett
cobblemon.species.tusslett.desc: Tusslett love to pick fights, but have trouble judging their own strength. This Pokemon's big attitude often gets it into a lot of trouble!
cobblemon.species.rufooster.name: Rufooster
cobblemon.species.rufooster.desc: Rufooster are fiercely territorial and protective. A dominant Rufooster will protect its flock no matter the cost, fighting any Pokemon regardless of size or strength.
cobblemon.species.odorable.name: Odorable
cobblemon.species.odorable.desc: These Pokemon love to follow people around, but their toxic bite is dangerous: bites always become infected and can take weeks to heal.
cobblemon.species.rabite.name: Rabite
cobblemon.species.rabite.desc: Rabite are aggressive and untrusting of humans. They scavenge trash, but prefer to stay on the outskirts of civilization.
cobblemon.species.bubbweed.name: Bubbweed
cobblemon.species.bubbweed.desc: These Pokemon are often content to just float around with the current, but they can be powerful swimmers when needed. They use their kelp to bind enemies and prey.
cobblemon.species.drifsea.name: Drifsea
cobblemon.species.drifsea.desc: Small Pokemon use the kelp growing on Drifsea's back as a refuge from predators. Drifsea can use its large pectoral fins to dash away when in danger, but sometimes the tiny Pokemon living alongside it get left behind.
cobblemon.species.starphin.name: Starphin
cobblemon.species.starphin.desc: A pod of Starphin can stay together even in dark waters using their telepathy. These Pokemon are highly intelligent and social.
cobblemon.species.lunorca.name: Lunorca
cobblemon.species.lunorca.desc: It holds the power of the cosmos in its fluke. The force emitted from its tail swing can carry it into outer space.
cobblemon.species.gupplash.name: Gupplash
cobblemon.species.gupplash.desc: These Pokemon live in big schools and hate to be alone. When faced with a challenge, they team up to solve it.
cobblemon.species.arowish.name: Arowish
cobblemon.species.arowish.desc: Arowish navigate the murky river waters with their psychic powers. They can sense other Pokemon coming towards them, even above the water.
cobblemon.species.tarspook.name: Tarspook
cobblemon.species.tarspook.desc: The eye on its back seems to have a mind of its own. At night this Pokemon's loud wailing cries can be heard for miles.
cobblemon.species.spookaye.name: Spookaye
cobblemon.species.spookaye.desc: They target lost travelers and follow them in their shadows. When their prey goes to sleep, they cut its throat with their long middle finger.
cobblemon.species.fleetle.name: Fleetle
cobblemon.species.fleetle.desc: Fleetle come in many different colors and patterns, which are local to specific areas in Rica. Their bright colors warn predators of their foul taste.
cobblemon.species.vorasect.name: Vorasect
cobblemon.species.vorasect.desc: When chasing prey, Vorasect run faster than their eyes can perceive light, so they charge blindly forward. In their rampage, they will run down anyone standing in their way.
cobblemon.species.crabot.name: Crabot
cobblemon.species.crabot.desc: Crabot endlessly scour the jungle floor in search of food, never stopping to relax. Sometimes, swarms of up to 100 Crabot can form.
cobblemon.species.craborg.name: Craborg
cobblemon.species.craborg.desc: With its powerful arms, Craborg can lift logs and even boulders in search of food. Its claws are sharp enough to cut through small trees.
cobblemon.species.mambolt.name: Mambolt
cobblemon.species.mambolt.desc: Mambolt spend most of their time up high in the trees. Due to their thin bodies, Mambolt are often mistaken for vines. Their loose skin helps them quickly escape if grabbed by a predator.
cobblemon.species.anaconduct.name: Anaconduct
cobblemon.species.anaconduct.desc: Anaconduct uses its long, thin body to constrict its prey. It paralyzes the prey with an electric shock so it can't escape.
cobblemon.species.colobud.name: Colobud
cobblemon.species.colobud.desc: Colobud traverse the jungles of Rica by swinging and jumping through trees. Big groups of Colobud are so noisy that they can be heard from half a mile away.
cobblemon.species.makakari.name: Makakari
cobblemon.species.makakari.desc: This Pokemon appears to have been corrupted by a sinister force within the jungle. The bud on its tail has grown into a carnivorous plant. The tail seems to have a mind of its own, and will sometimes strike prey even while Makakari is sleeping.
cobblemon.species.embear.name: Embear
cobblemon.species.embear.desc: This Pokemon loves to test its strength with friendly battles. Embear cubs can play for hours on end.
cobblemon.species.bearserk.name: Bearserk
cobblemon.species.bearserk.desc: This Pokemon appears to have been corrupted by a sinister force within the jungle. When a Bearserk begins attacking, it will not stop. In their anger, they may start wildfires that consume many acres of rainforest.
cobblemon.species.fumabor.name: Fumabor
cobblemon.species.fumabor.desc: It is easily angered and will chase for no apparent reason. The best chance for escape is to find water, because Fumabor cannot swim.
cobblemon.species.crocoil.name: Crocoil
cobblemon.species.crocoil.desc: Its back is covered in a slick oil that it can use to light flames. Males compete for territory by producing huge flames along their backs and waving their tails.
cobblemon.species.platypoint.name: Platypoint
cobblemon.species.platypoint.desc: They can bristle the spines on their back when threatened. The spines contain a potent toxin that deters predators.
cobblemon.species.platoxic.name: Platoxic
cobblemon.species.platoxic.desc: This Pokemon can inject venom into its opponents using spines on its heels. One kick can deliver enough venom to take down a Wailord.
cobblemon.species.siamouth.name: Siamouth
cobblemon.species.siamouth.desc: Fighting is a matter of pride for Siamouth. They will fiercely fight anything that crosses their path.
cobblemon.species.leaflow.name: Leaflow
cobblemon.species.leaflow.desc: Leaflow lazily rides along rivers using its tail to keep afloat. This Pokemon can walk on land when it needs to, but prefers going with the flow to get around.
cobblemon.species.plecobble.name: Plecobble
cobblemon.species.plecobble.desc: Plecobble latch onto rocks in fast-flowing rivers with their powerful suction mouth. Their thick armor protects them from any attacks.
cobblemon.species.granikan.name: Granikan
cobblemon.species.granikan.desc: Granikan's body is covered with sharp spines, When threatened, it can extend and shoot spines from its fins and body armor.
cobblemon.species.spinox.name: Spinox
cobblemon.species.spinox.desc: Spinox bury themselves in the muddy river floor to wait for unsuspecting prey. They stun the target using a combination of electric shocks and venom.
cobblemon.species.impuck.name: Impuck
cobblemon.species.impuck.desc: These trickster Pokemon play crude pranks on whoever happens to pass by. Impuck can imitate human voices with surprising accuracy, and love to lure people into booby traps.
cobblemon.species.impifaun.name: Impifaun
cobblemon.species.impifaun.desc: Impifaun love to play tricks, and can bend minds by playing a melody through their horns. However, this Pokemon never causes real harm, and is revered by the people of Rica.
cobblemon.species.leptric.name: Leptric
cobblemon.species.leptric.desc: Leptric's thin body lets it appear nearly invisible underwater. This Pokemon hides among corals, but can deliver a shock if spotted.
cobblemon.species.energeel.name: Energeel
cobblemon.species.energeel.desc: Energeel hides inside crevices waiting for prey to pass. When it spots a target, it swiftly lunges forward, bites on, and then stuns the target with electricity.
cobblemon.species.mermew.name: Mermew
cobblemon.species.mermew.desc: This Pokemon gained popularity as the star in a children's cartoon. However, real Mermew are shy and rarely seen.
cobblemon.species.clampurr.name: Clampurr
cobblemon.species.welking.name: Welking
cobblemon.species.amourish.name: Amourish
cobblemon.species.amourish.desc: Amourish are friendly and social Pokemon, and can always be found in groups. They sing together every morning to reinforce social bonds.
cobblemon.species.glamoreef.name: Glamoreef
cobblemon.species.glamoreef.desc: Glamoreef are very particular about their homes, and are constantly tidying up loose stones or debris. They keep Rica's reefs strikingly clean.
cobblemon.species.ricanshellos.name: RicanShellos
cobblemon.species.ricanshellos.desc: When it senses danger, a purple liquid oozes out of it. The liquid is thought to be something like greasy sweat.
cobblemon.species.ricangastrodon.name: RicanGastrodon
cobblemon.species.ricangastrodon.desc: It has strong regenerative capabilities. Even if parts of it are bitten off by fish Pokémon, it will return to normal within a few hours.
cobblemon.species.sweetoad.name: Sweetoad
cobblemon.species.sweetoad.desc: These Pokemon smell sweet, but the toxin in their skin is potent enough to knock out 100 Mamoswine. Any Pokemon that takes a taste of a Sweetoad learns its lesson right away.
cobblemon.species.spoocap.name: Spoocap
cobblemon.species.spoocap.desc: Legend says that this Pokemon is the spirit of a lost child. It sings songs, which carry throughout the forest, in hopes of attracting a friend.
cobblemon.species.sporror.name: Sporror
cobblemon.species.sporror.desc: It consumes the souls of its targets and encorporates them into its body. Its song is the wails of captured souls.
cobblemon.species.bloogoo.name: Bloogoo
cobblemon.species.bloogoo.desc: This Pokemon tries to seem intimidating by flashing its giant blue tongue, but in reality it is very cowardly.
cobblemon.species.lazyrd.name: Lazyrd
cobblemon.species.lazyrd.desc: Lazyrd puffs up its body and waves its tongue to threaten enemies. It prefers to laze around rather than fight, but if attacked, it will spit venom.
cobblemon.species.ampeck.name: Ampeck
cobblemon.species.ampeck.desc: Ampeck is an easy Pokemon to find due to its loud nature. These Pokemon defend their territory by creating loud, booming screeches. The loudest Ampeck wins.
cobblemon.species.boombird.name: Boombird
cobblemon.species.boombird.desc: Boombird uses electricity to amplify its voice. Its booming call can be heard for miles.
cobblemon.species.amara.name: Amara
cobblemon.species.amara.desc: [mara] prance through the plains, spreading flower pollen as they hop. They are caring Pokemon and will tend to any injured Pokemon in need, no matter what species.
cobblemon.species.torkit.name: Torkit
cobblemon.species.scimitear.name: Scimitear
cobblemon.species.scimitear.desc: Scimitear uses electricity to heat up its fangs and claws before an attack. Its super-hot fangs slice through anything with little resistance.
cobblemon.species.ailember.name: Ailember
cobblemon.species.ailember.desc: Ailember is a shy but sweet Pokemon. It is popular as a pet or first Pokemon for a child because it is easy to train.
cobblemon.species.genetorch.name: Genetorch
cobblemon.species.genetorch.desc: Genetorch are agile, cunning, and loyal Pokemon. If you can earn its respect, it will never leave your side.
cobblemon.species.wasplode.name: Wasplode
cobblemon.species.wasplode.desc: Wasplode fiercely defend their nests, which they build with mud. If necessary, a Wasplode will detonate a fiery explosion to save its sisters.
cobblemon.species.pichip.name: Pichip
cobblemon.species.pichip.desc: Every Pichip claims a boulder as its territory and will defend it to the death. Pichip alerts intruders with a loud bark.
cobblemon.species.shifuu.name: Shifuu
cobblemon.species.delibo.name: Delibo
cobblemon.species.delibo.desc: Delibo was created by scientists to help deliver shipments to remote towns in Rica. This Pokemon can fly for days without rest and never gets lost.
cobblemon.species.helibo.name: Helibo
cobblemon.species.helibo.desc: An upgraded version of Delibo, Helibo is ideal for rescue missions in uninhabited areas. It is powerful enough to carry two people at once.
cobblemon.species.drocopter.name: Drocopter
cobblemon.species.drocopter.desc: Illegal modifications to Delibo caused it to evolve into Drocopter. This Pokemon obeys its master's every command, no matter how much pain and suffering it may cause.
cobblemon.species.slitharjo.name: Slitharjo
cobblemon.species.slitharjo.desc: With a body that seems neither liquid or solid, this Pokémon slithers around like a shadow. Although harmless, it startles those who are caught offguard when it rises from the ground.
cobblemon.species.coliber.name: Coliber
cobblemon.species.coliber.desc: Despite its small size, this Pokemon will eagerly attack anything it considers a threat. They establish a strict social hierarchy, but fights between flocks will often break out around a new food source.
cobblemon.species.coliboom.name: Coliboom
cobblemon.species.coliboom.desc: It is highly territorial and will fiercely attack any intruder. Using its psychic powers, it fires slices of energy at its target. Territorial disputes between these Pokemon can create open patches in the forest due to the number of branches sliced from trees.
cobblemon.species.barnub.name: Barnub
cobblemon.species.barnub.desc: This Pokemon eats by filtering particles out of the water. Because of its dislike of bright lights, Barnub tends to be found in very dark locations.
cobblemon.species.detritan.name: Detritan
cobblemon.species.detritan.desc: With Barnub infesting the skeletal remains of an unknown Pokemon, Detritan live a life of stillness, acting as a giant vessel for other Barnub. Its decayed body is as tough and powerful as it is massive.
cobblemon.species.moreel.name: Moreel
