cobblemon.species.moreel.desc: Moreel is a feared predator in the open ocean. These Pokemon come out at night to hunt, but spend the daytime sleeping in dark crevices.
cobblemon.species.darscale.name: Darscale
cobblemon.species.darscale.desc: Rarely seen above 10,000 feet, Darscale may be responsible for stories of sea monsters attacking ships at sea. This Pokemon will grab anything it considers food and pull it down to the depths of the ocean.
cobblemon.species.fridgid.name: Fridgid
cobblemon.species.fridgid.desc: This Pokemon stores water inside its body. By freezing and melting said water, it is capable of adjusting its density in order to float or submerge.
cobblemon.species.cirritwirl.name: Cirritwirl
cobblemon.species.cirritwirl.desc: Cirritwirl drift through the sky in big flocks. It can spin about its tail like a top to whip up a tornado.
cobblemon.species.torricane.name: Torricane
cobblemon.species.torricane.desc: Torricane can fly so effortlessly that it never lands to rest. This Pokemon lives most of its life among the clouds.
cobblemon.species.pixiflake.name: Pixiflake
cobblemon.species.pixiflake.desc: Typically, Pixiflake flutter through the sky at a high altitude. A group of Pixiflake descending can appear like a snowstorm.
cobblemon.species.wyvet.name: Wyvet
cobblemon.species.wyvet.desc: This joyful Pokemon is drawn to bright colors. Trainers seeking Wyvet wear brightly-colored shirts to increase their chances of finding it.
cobblemon.species.draybow.name: Draybow
cobblemon.species.draybow.desc: Draybow can change color to express its emotions. It is highly sensitive to the emotions of others, sometimes projecting its trainer's emotions on its back as well.
cobblemon.species.delphair.name: Delphair
cobblemon.species.delphair.desc: These playful Pokemon can be seen leaping through clouds from a high altitude. They rarely come down to land.
cobblemon.species.aerocea.name: Aerocea
cobblemon.species.aerocea.desc: This Pokemon soars effortlessly through the sky. It hunts by dropping down on flocks of other Pokemon from above, and can swallow Altaria whole.
cobblemon.species.tardidure.name: Tardidure
cobblemon.species.tardidure.desc: This Pokemon is so small that trainers often don't notice it, though it lives all across Rica. When threatened, Tardidure can spit out water to become even smaller. Its tough armor covers it so well when deflated that few attacks can damage it.
cobblemon.species.etornal.name: Etornal
cobblemon.species.etornal.desc: Etornal gather around temples to feed on sacrificed spirits. The inside of Etornal's shell pulses with plasma energy which it uses to create attacks. It is said that they live forever.
cobblemon.species.tunnelid.name: Tunnelid
cobblemon.species.tunnelid.desc: These Pokemon formed many of Rica's cave systems by tunneling through the mountainsides. Their armor is so durable that they can dig straight through ore deposits.
cobblemon.species.solios.name: Solios
cobblemon.species.eghobulbasaur.name: EghoBulbasaur
cobblemon.species.eghobulbasaur.desc: The plants that grow on Bulbasaur use its body for nutrients. Bulbasaur relies on the plant for protection.
cobblemon.species.eghoivysaur.name: EghoIvysaur
cobblemon.species.eghoivysaur.desc: As the body of Ivysaur dries up, it grows a patch of dense vines that aid it in battle.
cobblemon.species.eghovenusaur.name: EghoVenusaur
cobblemon.species.eghovenusaur.desc: Large, thorn covered brambles protect an aged cactus. Small rodent Pokemon tend to make nests in the dry grass patches at the base of the cactus.
cobblemon.species.eghocharmander.name: EghoCharmander
cobblemon.species.eghocharmander.desc: A small dragon Pokemon that enjoys a competitive bout. As it battles, the flame on its tail gets hotter.
cobblemon.species.eghocharmeleon.name: EghoCharmeleon
cobblemon.species.eghocharmeleon.desc: Without pity, its sharp claws destroy foes. If it encounters a strong enemy, it becomes agitated, and the flame on its tail flares with a bluish white color.
cobblemon.species.eghocharizard.name: EghoCharizard
cobblemon.species.eghocharizard.desc: A powerful dragon Pokemon that is said to be hard to tame. It likes to soar high above the clouds.
cobblemon.species.eghosquirtle.name: EghoSquirtle
cobblemon.species.eghosquirtle.desc: Squirtle produces a small cloud as a tail that it then uses to float on top of and keep itself cool. They can often be found snoozing, sprawled out on their own cloud.
cobblemon.species.eghowartortle.name: EghoWartortle
cobblemon.species.eghowartortle.desc: Wartortle's body starts to develop even more cloud forms, allowing it to temporarily hover sometimes. It uses the cloud as a cloak during foggy days.
cobblemon.species.eghoblastoise.name: EghoBlastoise
cobblemon.species.eghoblastoise.desc: Blastoise drift around high in the sky, forming ice crystals on their shell that they use in battle once they've landed.
cobblemon.species.lukpup.name: Lukpup
cobblemon.species.lukpup.desc: A shy Pokemon that only appears in perfect weather conditions. It's seen so rarely that some people aren't convinced that they're real.
cobblemon.species.lukagon.name: Lukagon
cobblemon.species.lukagon.desc: To see a Lukagon in the wild requires incredible luck. It is said that if a Lukagon rubs up against you that you will be cured of any disease you may have.
cobblemon.species.kokiseed.name: Kokiseed
cobblemon.species.kokiseed.desc: A small seed-like Pokemon that enjoys dancing at festivals. It scatters its leaves around for pizaz. It will sometimes try to imitate stronger Pokemon fighting.
cobblemon.species.kokipound.name: Kokipound
cobblemon.species.kokipound.desc: Their passion for dance transitions to martial arts. Can be found sparring on beaches. It hits palm tree trunks with its bare fists.
cobblemon.species.kokismash.name: Kokismash
cobblemon.species.kokismash.desc: These Pokemon are gentle in nature, despite their intimidating demeanor. They enjoy dancing, sparring, and lifting heavy things. They like to protect smaller friends.
cobblemon.species.chargo.name: Chargo
cobblemon.species.chargo.desc: A mountain Pokemon that is kept around villages to keep people warm. They are ditzy and must be watched around flammable things.
cobblemon.species.burnaram.name: Burnaram
cobblemon.species.burnaram.desc: The Pokemon puts on some bulk after evolving as it learns better to control its body. They can stand still for hours, meditating.
cobblemon.species.psysteed.name: Psysteed
cobblemon.species.psysteed.desc: This Pokemon helps nomadic tribes haul building material using its telekenetic powers. Humans also dye the fur with archaic symbols.
cobblemon.species.darpole.name: Darpole
cobblemon.species.darpole.desc: This Pokemon likes to play pranks on trainers who get too close to the edge of a pond, and then dive down into the water where it can't be reached.
cobblemon.species.brutoad.name: Brutoad
cobblemon.species.brutoad.desc: Brutoad are known to be aggressive and territorial, following orders from a stronger lead Pokemon. Their fins are sharp on the edges.
cobblemon.species.godfrogger.name: Godfrogger
cobblemon.species.godfrogger.desc: A lethargic Pokemon that prefers to give orders to its underlings instead of doing things itself. It tries to control wild areas, usually humid and swampy locations.
cobblemon.species.gorochu.name: Gorochu
cobblemon.species.gorochu.desc: Gorochu are competitive by nature. They use their large tails, charged with electricity, to slash at their foes. They inhabit generally hot areas.
cobblemon.species.nidorook.name: Nidorook
cobblemon.species.nidorook.desc: When a Nidorino or Nidorina evolve into Nidorook, they maintain their quadruped form. This evolutionary branch has an emphasis on speed.
cobblemon.species.quezsparce.name: Quezsparce
cobblemon.species.quezsparce.desc: It uses its jaded chin as a plow to move dirt while tunneling. The growth in its wings allows it to be a faster, and more dangerous opponent above ground.
cobblemon.species.faeralynx.name: Faeralynx
cobblemon.species.faeralynx.desc: The fur of a Faeralynx is highly sought after by the wealthy elite. They tend to spend at least 6 hours a day grooming themselves.
cobblemon.species.eghoshellder.name: EghoShellder
cobblemon.species.eghoshellder.desc: This Shellder can often times be found attached to a Slowbro. When removed and left alone, it will hunt down other sea creatures to feed on.
cobblemon.species.skulkraken.name: Skulkraken
cobblemon.species.skulkraken.desc: A metal shell encasing a vicious sea creature. Its claws can rip through the steel hull of a ship. Legend has it that a giant Skulkraken exists in the vast oceans.
cobblemon.species.eghogrimer.name: EghoGrimer
cobblemon.species.eghogrimer.desc: This version of Grimer is made up of hot asphalt. Often used in cities to help fill potholes, this Pokemon's body reaches temperatures of just over 300 degrees.
cobblemon.species.eghomuk.name: EghoMuk
cobblemon.species.eghomuk.desc: As Muk traverses urban areas, various debris and items get stuck in it. The differing street signs that end up in Muk help set it apart from one another.
cobblemon.species.oozma.name: Oozma
cobblemon.species.oozma.desc: When Muk become too hot, their bodies transition into molten lava. Oozma feed off pools of lava to continue to maintain their high body temperature.
cobblemon.species.omeon.name: Omeon
cobblemon.species.omeon.desc: Omeon have a natural connection with the spirits. The flame on the end of its tail will flicker and blow in the direction of any unseen presence.
cobblemon.species.champeon.name: Champeon
cobblemon.species.champeon.desc: Champeon are naturally competitive and will seek out bigger opponents. Can often be found in alley ways, scrapping with the fiercest scavengers.
cobblemon.species.lepideon.name: Lepideon
cobblemon.species.lepideon.desc: Lepideon are natural pollen magnets. If a loved one of Lepideon has allergies to pollen, Lepideon will collect all the pollen in the area to help relieve the irritation.
cobblemon.species.guardeon.name: Guardeon
cobblemon.species.guardeon.desc: If Eevees in a pack evolve, the combination of Guardeon and Champeon can be volatile. Guardeon have an eternal rivalry with any Champeon they meet, even if related.
cobblemon.species.obsideon.name: Obsideon
cobblemon.species.obsideon.desc: Among mountainous Pokemon, it is relatively faster. It rams its obsidian covered spine against Graveler and Onix as a way of playing around to get them to chase it.
cobblemon.species.scorpeon.name: Scorpeon
cobblemon.species.scorpeon.desc: It has been said that Scorpeon's tail has a mind of its own. Scorpeon will get its prey to focus on its face while it steadily aims its stinger for the next strike.
cobblemon.species.sphynxeon.name: Sphynxeon
cobblemon.species.sphynxeon.desc: In ancient times, Sphynxeon were treated as a divine beings sent from the heavens. Many of the designs from the royal wardrobes were inspired by Sphynxeon.
cobblemon.species.nimbeon.name: Nimbeon
cobblemon.species.nimbeon.desc: Nimbeon floats through the air, barely grazing the surface as it's used as a pushing-off point. If winds get too strong, it can blow Nimbeon away.
cobblemon.species.draconeon.name: Draconeon
cobblemon.species.draconeon.desc: Draconeon are considered exotic and are rarely seen outside of Blackthorn City in Johto. Though smaller than most dragons, Draconeon are fierce and passionate.
cobblemon.species.eeveeon.name: Eeveeon
cobblemon.species.eeveeon.desc: Eeveeon is the result of an Eevee with stable DNA. When exposed to the pure energy of an Astral Stone, Eevee is able to maintain its Normal typing during evolution.
cobblemon.species.vareon.name: Vareon
cobblemon.species.vareon.desc: Vareon is the result of an Eevee trying to adapt to overly mutated DNA. This Pokemon seems to be able to change its typing fluidly throughout battle.
cobblemon.species.terathwack.name: Terathwack
cobblemon.species.terathwack.desc: A rarely seen evolution to Marowak. The skull once worn as a Cubone has now become a natural part of the Pokemon. Can often be seen protecting wild Kangaskhan.
cobblemon.species.eghospearow.name: EghoSpearow
cobblemon.species.eghospearow.desc: These Spearow became an invasive species because it had no natural predators. In order to stay at the top of the food chain, it adapted into a vicious predator.
cobblemon.species.eghofearow.name: EghoFearow
cobblemon.species.eghofearow.desc: Because its wings are too thin to fly effectively, it instead uses them as weapons, fanning them out to sweep opponents in all directions.
cobblemon.species.eghohoothoot.name: EghoHoothoot
cobblemon.species.eghohoothoot.desc: The crescent on its head glows brightest when the moon is full. It can confuse prey by convincing them that the moon is coming right at them when it's really just bird.
cobblemon.species.eghonoctowl.name: EghoNoctowl
cobblemon.species.eghonoctowl.desc: Noctowl use the crest on its head to reflect light into the eyes of its prey. On moonless nights, one may mistake the crest as the actual moon.
cobblemon.species.grimfowl.name: Grimfowl
cobblemon.species.grimfowl.desc: In ancient times, people believed Grimfowl to be the harbinger of death, sent from the underworld. Nowadays its feathers are used as funeral decor.
cobblemon.species.eghoazurill.name: EghoAzurill
cobblemon.species.eghoazurill.desc: At birth, the tip of Azurill's tail holds a pebble no larger than a grain of sand. Over time, the pebble grows into a rock too large for Azurill to carry, forcing it to evolve.
cobblemon.species.eghomarill.name: EghoMarill
cobblemon.species.eghomarill.desc: It uses its tail to swing around the rock end with ease. When not in combat, it uses the rock as a perch to see above tall grass and watch for enemies.
cobblemon.species.eghoazumarill.name: EghoAzumarill
cobblemon.species.eghoazumarill.desc: In battle, Azumarill uses its tail as a flail or war hammer, swinging and smashing it into opponents. Outside of battle, it swings its tail fancily to attract a worthy partner.
cobblemon.species.eghotrubbish.name: EghoTrubbish
cobblemon.species.eghotrubbish.desc: As a result of urban clean-up initiatives, many Trubbish were mistakenly thrown into garbage cans. Being too weak to escape, they instead repurpose the cans as armor.
cobblemon.species.eghogarbodor.name: EghoGarbodor
cobblemon.species.eghogarbodor.desc: When Trubbish eat enough to get too big for their can, they will evolve into a Garbodor. They get larger with the more waste they stuff in their dumpster.
cobblemon.species.eghoswablu.name: EghoSwablu
cobblemon.species.eghoswablu.desc: Swablu tuck themselves into the cottony feathers they have to keep warm during blizzards. Flocks hum in unison as they're bundled up.
cobblemon.species.eghoaltaria.name: EghoAltaria
cobblemon.species.eghoaltaria.desc: Altaria's body is so cold that it sometimes freezes the moisture in the air around it into crystals. If you hear an Altaria's song, you can be sure a hail storm is coming.
cobblemon.species.egholotad.name: EghoLotad
cobblemon.species.egholotad.desc: Lotad were used to carry ingredients for chefs many years ago, eventually adapting to serve other purposes in the kitchen. Lotad is a naturally occurring stove top.
cobblemon.species.egholombre.name: EghoLombre
cobblemon.species.egholombre.desc: The flat surface on top of its head sits at a constant 350 degrees Fahrenheit, making it perfect for frying almost any dish a chef could dream up.
cobblemon.species.egholudicolo.name: EghoLudicolo
cobblemon.species.egholudicolo.desc: Anything cooked atop its head gains a unique flavor, which is different for each individual Ludicolo. Some restaurants main attraction is a specific Ludicolo flavoring.
cobblemon.species.sunflorid.name: Sunflorid
cobblemon.species.sunflorid.desc: Sunflorid converts solar energy into nutrition and stores the excess for future use in battle. It has a tendency to singe its own hands while using Fire based attacks.
cobblemon.species.sorcerice.name: Sorcerice
cobblemon.species.sorcerice.desc: This Pokemon's elemental abilities are so powerful that it must live in isolation while maintaining constant focus to prevent itself from freezing everything around it.
cobblemon.species.kecleodon.name: Kecleodon
cobblemon.species.kecleodon.desc: Kecleodon are so good at blending in with their environments, that it was only just discovered recently that Kecleon could even evolve at all.
cobblemon.species.eghomagnemite.name: EghoMagnemite
cobblemon.species.eghomagnemite.desc: Once Hazeport City plateaued in urbanization, many Magnemite migrated to Genisis Forest. Over the years, they became one with the plant life.
cobblemon.species.eghomagneton.name: EghoMagneton
cobblemon.species.eghomagneton.desc: Instead of attaching to each other like standard Magnemite, these Magneton are grown from their original Magnemite form.
cobblemon.species.eghomagnezone.name: EghoMagnezone
cobblemon.species.eghomagnezone.desc: This Magnezone is a result of a sudden mutation causing one of the Magneton's bodies to absorb the other two and grow rapidly in power.
cobblemon.species.eghotangela.name: EghoTangela
cobblemon.species.eghotangela.desc: After its habitat was destroyed to make way for a large city, Tangela was forced to adapt by using left over wire from the maintenance tunnels for its new body.
cobblemon.species.eghotangrowth.name: EghoTangrowth
cobblemon.species.eghotangrowth.desc: Tangrowth has the ability to absorb and supply electricity through the prongs on the ends of its arms, enabling it to act as a sort of living battery.
cobblemon.species.wereyena.name: Wereyena
cobblemon.species.wereyena.desc: In rare occasion, when Mightyena are exposed to pure moonlight, they will evolve into Wereyena. Legends said that these Pokemon were just transformed humans.
cobblemon.species.reaptide.name: Reaptide
cobblemon.species.reaptide.desc: Reaptide lurks in murky waters, searching for prey. It drags its victims deep into the water where they succumb to the high pressure, or suffocate.
cobblemon.species.eghohappiny.name: EghoHappiny
cobblemon.species.eghohappiny.desc: In order to adapt to an environment of egg-stealing predators, Happiny has become hyper-aggressive and territorial. It carries an egg-shaped rock in its pouch.
cobblemon.species.eghochansey.name: EghoChansey
cobblemon.species.eghochansey.desc: Chansey is so obsessed with protecting eggs that it will even defend the nests of other Pokemon species. It uses its rock as a decoy egg to trick other predators.
cobblemon.species.eghoblissey.name: EghoBlissey
cobblemon.species.eghoblissey.desc: Because of the strong bond with their trainer, Blissey will do anything in its power to keep the trainer safe. Blissey are often considered too overbearing.
cobblemon.species.kidfoot.name: Kidfoot
cobblemon.species.kidfoot.desc: Most people consider Kidfoot to be a myth, being rarely seen by the average person. Because they are so elusive, little research has been done on them.
cobblemon.species.snosquatch.name: Snosquatch
cobblemon.species.snosquatch.desc: Snosquatch can be highly aggressive and prone to fits of rage, which can become so intense that they cause avalanches. It will claim mountain tops as its territory.
cobblemon.species.grasquatch.name: Grasquatch
cobblemon.species.grasquatch.desc: Grasquatch's existence was a subject of debate for many years due to its rarity. It is seen as a peaceful guardian of any forest that it inhabits.
cobblemon.species.arctusk.name: Arctusk
cobblemon.species.arctusk.desc: It is believed that Arctusk may share a common ancestor with Phanpy, due to their similar biology. Arctusk roamed frigid environments hundreds of years ago.
cobblemon.species.gigantusk.name: Gigantusk
cobblemon.species.gigantusk.desc: This Pokemon was revived from a specimen found frozen in an ancient glacier. It was hunted by ancient humans for its extremely durable armor.
cobblemon.species.iceros.name: Iceros
cobblemon.species.iceros.desc: At birth, Iceros lacks the strength to lift its horn off the ground. It relies on the care of its herd to survive until it becomes strong enough to move on its own.
cobblemon.species.glacieros.name: Glacieros
cobblemon.species.glacieros.desc: Glacieros shares a common ancestor with the Rhyhorn family. The horn is encased in ice, which makes up about half of the total body weight of these Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.mockroach.name: Mockroach
cobblemon.species.mockroach.desc: Mockroach can detach its head and use it as a projectile. Luckily it can survive for up to three months without its head attached, because it tends to lose it.
cobblemon.species.jollibird.name: Jollibird
cobblemon.species.kablowfish.name: Kablowfish
cobblemon.species.kablowfish.desc: The inside of Kablowfish's body is so highly pressurized that just touching it can cause it to burst, releasing a large cloud of poisonous gas.
cobblemon.species.scalarva.name: Scalarva
cobblemon.species.scalarva.desc: Despite its appearance, Scalarva is actually rather docile. It relies on its sharp spikes and scales for protection, only using violence as a last resort.
cobblemon.species.dragalis.name: Dragalis
cobblemon.species.dragalis.desc: Dragalis's body is composed of solid scales over a dense layer of silk. Its true power slumbers within the innermost layer, waiting to be unleashed.
cobblemon.species.ceregal.name: Ceregal
cobblemon.species.ceregal.desc: In the distant past, it was believed that anyone capable of taming Ceregal was destined to rule. The pattern on its wings take on the face of a frightening dragon.
cobblemon.species.gargon.name: Gargon
cobblemon.species.gargon.desc: Gargon is one of the earliest discovered Dragon Pokemon, and was a symbol of the Dragon Tamer Clan in Johto. Statues of this Pokemon are scattered around the world.
cobblemon.species.wardern.name: Wardern
cobblemon.species.wardern.desc: In ancient times, there was much debate over whether Wardern's ferocity came from its desire to fight evil or it being a vessel for evil itself.
cobblemon.species.dragoyle.name: Dragoyle
cobblemon.species.dragoyle.desc: Hundreds of years ago, this Pokemon would be perched atop cathedrals and large stone architecture. It seemed to want to protect the inhabitants below.
cobblemon.species.porygonx.name: PorygonX
cobblemon.species.porygonx.desc: Porygon-X is an upgrade to Porygon, programmed by Professor Thorn. It is designed to translate quantum data between infinite realities.
cobblemon.species.eghooddish.name: EghoOddish
cobblemon.species.eghooddish.desc: As Oddish's habitat changed, it failed to adapt quick enough, which caused its leafs to wilt. Nowadays, these Oddish can be seen in dark caves and forests.
cobblemon.species.eghogloom.name: EghoGloom
cobblemon.species.eghogloom.desc: Despite their abiotic features, when exposed to enough light, Oddish may evolve into Gloom. Gloom use decorative skulls to scare away other Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.viledoom.name: Viledoom
cobblemon.species.viledoom.desc: Its rotten pollen have turned into deadly spores. Viledoom live dissacoiated from any other living beings due their spores being too dangerous for any ecosystem.
cobblemon.species.mortossum.name: Mortossum
cobblemon.species.mortossum.desc: Mortossum managed to rid its body from the poisonous spores. Despite Mortossums destructive past, its will to focus and act towards the greater good has remained.
cobblemon.species.mushling.name: Mushling
cobblemon.species.mushling.desc: Consuming the spores from this Pokemon has been known to cause psychic hallucinations. It can also lead to nausea and migraines, it is not advised.
cobblemon.species.psycholyte.name: Psycholyte
cobblemon.species.psycholyte.desc: Upon evolution, this Pokemon goes hunting for a suitable stick. They form a strong bond with the chosen stick and use it to channel its psychic powers.
cobblemon.species.shroomage.name: Shroomage
cobblemon.species.shroomage.desc: The spores that Shroomage give off have been found to be dangerous. Hallucinations and other symptoms can sometimes last days. Some people believe the spores grant the consumer special powers.
cobblemon.species.calfpint.name: Calfpint
cobblemon.species.calfpint.desc: They are usually found around their mothers, who are typically raised on farms. It is uncommon to see them by themselves in the wild. When startled, they charge.
cobblemon.species.arbird.name: Arbird
cobblemon.species.arbird.desc: Arbird are sent off on their own mere hours after hatching, left to fend for themselves. Their dense armor keeps them safe from potential predators.
cobblemon.species.girafaraf.name: Girafaraf
cobblemon.species.girafaraf.desc: Exposure to the energy of a Dawn Stone has allowed for the front brain to gain full control of itself. The rear brain withers and becomes just a standard tail.
cobblemon.species.giragira.name: Giragira
cobblemon.species.giragira.desc: Exposure to the energy of a Dusk Stone has strengthened the rear brain of Girafarig. In the process of evolution, the rear brain has convinced the front brain to surrender its power, giving control to the darker half.
cobblemon.species.whave.name: Whave
cobblemon.species.whave.desc: An outgoing whale Pokemon that generally dwells in the deep seas. It is playful with other Pokemon as long as it's not battling.
cobblemon.species.orcabyss.name: Orcabyss
cobblemon.species.orcabyss.desc: A ferocious creature that will impale anything that moves too quickly in an aggressive manner. Its horn is strong enough to burrow through glaciers.
cobblemon.species.zapalope.name: Zapalope
cobblemon.species.zapalope.desc: A Pokemon that zips through dense forests with ease. Its electrical energy allows it to move at high speeds. You can tell a Zapalope trail by the singed edges of the plants around it.
cobblemon.species.joltalope.name: Joltalope
cobblemon.species.joltalope.desc: A Pokemon that expends high amounts of energy during its active hours. During its resting hours, it sleeps for long periods of time in overgrown forest nests. The foliage starts to take root in Joltalopes fur.
cobblemon.species.eghochikorita.name: EghoChikorita
cobblemon.species.eghochikorita.desc: Chikorita's thick, spiky exterior protects it from most predators. The tips of the spikes are coated in a sweet and sticky substance that humans love, but repulses most Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.eghobayleef.name: EghoBayleef
cobblemon.species.eghobayleef.desc: The red part of Bayleef is leathery hard, where the white bottom half of Bayleef is quite soft. Being vulnerable here requires Bayleef to be constantly vigilant of its surroundings.
cobblemon.species.eghomeganium.name: EghoMeganium
cobblemon.species.eghomeganium.desc: The black dots scattered around the white portion of Meganium are seeds. They get scattered around when it battles, eventually leading to the growth of fruit-bearing trees.
cobblemon.species.eghocyndaquil.name: EghoCyndaquil
cobblemon.species.eghocyndaquil.desc: Cyndaquil is always producing a small cloud of volcanic ash, which is electrically charged. It can be tough to handle for new trainers.
cobblemon.species.eghoquilava.name: EghoQuilava
cobblemon.species.eghoquilava.desc: As Quilava gets stronger, it is able to better control its volcanic ash cloud. It has learned to store and use the electricity generated by the cloud.
cobblemon.species.eghotyphlosion.name: EghoTyphlosion
cobblemon.species.eghotyphlosion.desc: Typhlosion is very dangerous to be around if it is not in a good mood. The energy that is generated from the heat and electricity matches that of a nuclear reactor.
cobblemon.species.eghototodile.name: EghoTotodile
cobblemon.species.eghototodile.desc: The saliva in Totodile's mouth is corrosive to most materials. That, combined with its strong jaw, allows it to eat almost anything it gets its mouth on.
cobblemon.species.eghocroconaw.name: EghoCroconaw
cobblemon.species.eghocroconaw.desc: Croconaw's hunched stance appears to be an adaptation to aid it in traversing cramped sewer tunnels. Rattata and Grimer are not safe in the territory of this species.
cobblemon.species.eghoferaligatr.name: EghoFeraligatr
cobblemon.species.eghoferaligatr.desc: This form of Feraligatr thrives in the dark murky waters of swamps and sewers. These Pokemon can cause problems in sewers because their strong jaws can rip through pipes with ease.
cobblemon.species.mewthree.name: Mewthree
cobblemon.species.mewthree.desc: Thorn created this creature, via genetic manipulation, using DNA from Mewtwo and Deoxys. It was meant to be a counter to Arkhaos, but has never been put to the test.
cobblemon.species.oculeus.name: Oculeus
cobblemon.species.oculeus.desc: Oculeus exists as an omniscient, universal force. It uses Unown to observe life all over the universe. Once the Unown is done observing, it is absorbed into Oculeus.
cobblemon.species.arkhaos.name: Arkhaos
cobblemon.species.arkhaos.desc: Arkhaos exists in the void between dimensions, where it lays eggs that spawn Arceus with a new universe. Its rotating ring is used to create rifts in reality.
cobblemon.species.spearex.name: Spearex
cobblemon.species.spearex.desc: A scratch from the barb on its chest can render its foes powerless. It lives deep within the northern jungles.
cobblemon.species.jagrowth.name: Jagrowth
cobblemon.species.jagrowth.desc: Its thorns secrete a poisonous substance that can paralyze anyone who touches it. It is very territorial.
cobblemon.species.venoble.name: Venoble
cobblemon.species.venoble.desc: Its chest flower wafts a mesmerising aroma. The taller their crown leaves are, the more respect they are treated with.
cobblemon.species.caflare.name: Caflare
cobblemon.species.caflare.desc: People used to raise this Pokemon in houses cause of the warmth emanating from its skin. It is believed to bring good luck.
cobblemon.species.bovlame.name: Bovlame
cobblemon.species.bovlame.desc: The flames it produces have a yellowish tint. Forklore has it that they burn only the ones with sinister souls.
cobblemon.species.pharaox.name: Pharaox
cobblemon.species.pharaox.desc: Its fiery energy is said to compare with that of the Sun. Should it consider its opponent strong, it will unleash its full power.
cobblemon.species.bubblebon.name: Bubblebon
cobblemon.species.bubblebon.desc: Groups of these Pokemon tend to gather around ponds happily splashing water to each other. When enraged it defends itself with Bubbles.
cobblemon.species.scufflebon.name: Scufflebon
cobblemon.species.scufflebon.desc: It uses its ears, as if they were hands, to unleash powerful blows. It is very proud of its power.
cobblemon.species.lochare.name: Lochare
cobblemon.species.lochare.desc: With its massive strength it can change the course of a river. It often competes in wrestling matches with other Lochare to prove its might.
cobblemon.species.wombabe.name: Wombabe
cobblemon.species.wombabe.desc: It uses the pouch on its belly to store food. It later shares the food with the rest of the colony.
cobblemon.species.korboral.name: Korboral
cobblemon.species.korboral.desc: It is known for its ability to grow a superb crop of berries using the rich nutrients found in its pouch. It will feed these especially healthy berries to growing Wombabe.
cobblemon.species.macaboo.name: Macaboo
cobblemon.species.macaboo.desc: During stormy nights it can be seen wondering at ports, scaring unsespecting sailors. An encounter with that pokemon is considered bad luck.
cobblemon.species.spectross.name: Spectross
cobblemon.species.spectross.desc: It's found flying around ships that are about to crash. Seeing this Pokemon at sea is considered very bad luck.
cobblemon.species.gloshroom.name: Gloshroom
cobblemon.species.phosporus.name: Phosporus
cobblemon.species.cropiki.name: Cropiki
cobblemon.species.cropiki.desc: A common pest among crop fields. They hold their tails in the air to check for a change in the weather.
cobblemon.species.dwarpy.name: Dwarpy
cobblemon.species.dwarpy.desc: Lucky are those who can grasp the golden tip of a Dwarpy's tail. They gather near places where treasure is found.
cobblemon.species.bonafant.name: Bonafant
cobblemon.species.bonafant.desc: The bell at the tip of its tail makes an eerie, primal sound that aids focus. Because of this, they are kept in places of peace and meditation.
cobblemon.species.wisdaum.name: Wisdaum
cobblemon.species.wisdaum.desc: It lives in seclusion, defending its tail with its four large arms. It is said that the sound of its tail is the sound of enlightenment itself.
cobblemon.species.surchin.name: Surchin
cobblemon.species.surchin.desc: At night, it scavenges the seafloor for discarded shells to fortify its armor. Its eyes allow it to see in the murky darkness.
cobblemon.species.submurchin.name: Submurchin
cobblemon.species.submurchin.desc: Though hard as steel, its spikes are so sensitive to movement that a fast current might cause them to explode.
cobblemon.species.nimbleak.name: Nimbleak
cobblemon.species.nimbleak.desc: A common sight above large industrial cities, they gather in groups where conditions are favorable.
cobblemon.species.dojoku.name: Dojoku
cobblemon.species.dojoku.desc: It is capable of learning multiple fighting styles with ease. It uses them in different sequences to achieve victory.
cobblemon.species.fumaji.name: Fumaji
cobblemon.species.fumaji.desc: Though it maintains a calm attitude, it is a vicious fighter. It exerts immense force with just the palm of its hand.
cobblemon.species.furatle.name: Furatle
cobblemon.species.furatle.desc: It defends itself by skillfully evading enemy attacks. When it finds an opening it strikes in a weird motion.
cobblemon.species.fusecto.name: Fusecto
cobblemon.species.fusecto.desc: It can accelerate dramaticaly to evade and strike its opponent. It strikes using only its fingers.
cobblemon.species.welpyre.name: Welpyre
cobblemon.species.welpyre.desc: An elusive Pokemon, it is said to inhabit the deepest part of the forest. It is often seen guiding lost children back home.
cobblemon.species.keenine.name: Keenine
cobblemon.species.keenine.desc: It senses changes in its surroundings with its whiskers. It is revered in ancient cultures for its alleged powers.
cobblemon.species.shisapien.name: Shisapien
cobblemon.species.shisapien.desc: It is a highly faithful and intelligent being that can sense malice in others. Because of this it is often used to guard sacred places.
cobblemon.species.silnun.name: Silnun
cobblemon.species.silnun.desc: Its fur is extremely soft and velvety. Its comforting touch is said to ease pain and suffering in others.
cobblemon.species.amivelv.name: Amivelv
cobblemon.species.amivelv.desc: Amivelv makes a potent healing tonic by stirring fresh spring water with its horns. Those who drink the tonic regularly are said to live longer.
cobblemon.species.nebulent.name: Nebulent
cobblemon.species.nebulent.desc: This Pokemon's venom is extremely poisonous. It hunts at night, when its body blends in with the night sky.
cobblemon.species.draligne.name: Draligne
cobblemon.species.draligne.desc: Astronomers have long used this pokemon to predict the movements of heavenly bodies. It is more animated beneath the stars.
cobblemon.species.mushcap.name: Mushcap
cobblemon.species.mushcap.desc: They gather in circles to draw on the power of the earth. Those who disturb the ring are sent to another dimension.
cobblemon.species.belyad.name: Belyad
cobblemon.species.belyad.desc: It's eerie, beautiful songs can be heard at the heart of old forests. They pose as trees near bodies of water so they can always see their reflection.
cobblemon.species.petishell.name: Petishell
cobblemon.species.primorse.name: Primorse
cobblemon.species.primorse.desc: Even though it is slow, it moves so gracefully that one can become mesmerised by it. It dwells in large coral reefs.
cobblemon.species.puffoon.name: Puffoon
cobblemon.species.puffoon.desc: It is deliberately clumsy to make others laugh. It is a proud actor.
cobblemon.species.egenpus.name: Egenpus
cobblemon.species.slugly.name: Slugly
cobblemon.species.toxnail.name: Toxnail
cobblemon.species.mandibrine.name: Mandibrine
cobblemon.species.mandibrine.desc: The natural enemy of Surchin. This Pokemon can reach high speeds just by a single wag of its tail.
cobblemon.species.petrifern.name: Petrifern
cobblemon.species.petrifern.desc: Petrifern is known to have lived at the bottom of the worlds most ancient forests. Its convenient roots allowed it to constantly move in search of sunlight.
cobblemon.species.serrarbo.name: Serrarbo
cobblemon.species.serrarbo.desc: Older Serrarbo have sharper leaves and harder bark. They have been known to survive intense forest fires.
cobblemon.species.ruminelk.name: Ruminelk
cobblemon.species.ruminelk.desc: It's horns were so hard, it had to fight with other Ruminelk to sharpen them.
cobblemon.species.ancervus.name: Ancervus
cobblemon.species.ancervus.desc: Its large horns are made of ice that doesn't melt. In the Ice Age, the horns grew to great sizes.
cobblemon.species.ampin.name: Ampin
cobblemon.species.ampin.desc: Ampin are often stepped on accidentally, due to their bodies blending in with the ground most of the time. If they're stepped on, they emit a small zap to scare off the threat.
cobblemon.species.sharquake.name: Sharquake
cobblemon.species.sharquake.desc: Sharquake love to flaunt their large mohawk-like hair. The larger the mohawk is, the more the Sharquake can attract mates. They're also territorial, guarding their mates with their life.
cobblemon.species.polykelp.name: Polykelp
cobblemon.species.venchill.name: Venchill
cobblemon.species.venchill.desc: When it spins, it chills the air around it. These Pokemon are said to be the force behind snow clouds.
cobblemon.species.fungeon.name: Fungeon
cobblemon.species.fungeon.desc: It has been exposed to humidity and as a result it inhaled fungi that led to its evolution. Its mushrooms are used for medicinal purposes.
cobblemon.species.genbrisk.name: Genbrisk
cobblemon.species.genbrisk.desc: This Pokemon is responsible for the frigid temperatures in the Southern Dhiome. Its blizzards are rumored to last for months.
cobblemon.species.voltwin.name: Voltwin
cobblemon.species.voltwin.desc: They move in complementary pairs. Their personality changes depending on their electric charge.
cobblemon.species.vanishade.name: Vanishade
cobblemon.species.vanishade.desc: Vanishade's steel frame hides a malevolent spirit that preys on vanity. Those who gaze too long at their reflection in its surface find their vitality drained, leaving only a hollow shell of their former selves.
cobblemon.species.seviiandoduo.name: SeviianDoduo
cobblemon.species.seviiandodrio.name: SeviianDodrio
cobblemon.species.seviianmantyke.name: SeviianMantyke
cobblemon.species.seviianmantine.name: SeviianMantine
cobblemon.species.seviianteddiursa.name: SeviianTeddiursa
cobblemon.species.seviianursaring.name: SeviianUrsaring
cobblemon.species.seviianfeebas.name: SeviianFeebas
cobblemon.species.seviianmilotic.name: SeviianMilotic
cobblemon.species.seviiancarnivine.name: SeviianCarnivine
cobblemon.species.seviianblitzle.name: SeviianBlitzle
cobblemon.species.seviianzebstrika.name: SeviianZebstrika
cobblemon.species.seviianclauncher.name: SeviianClauncher
cobblemon.species.seviianclawitzer.name: SeviianClawitzer
cobblemon.species.seviiannoibat.name: SeviianNoibat
cobblemon.species.seviiannoivern.name: SeviianNoivern
cobblemon.species.seviianwishiwashi.name: SeviianWishiwashi
cobblemon.species.seviiandhelmise.name: SeviianDhelmise
cobblemon.species.seviiansizzlipede.name: SeviianSizzlipede
cobblemon.species.seviiannymble.name: SeviianNymble
cobblemon.species.seviianlokix.name: SeviianLokix
cobblemon.species.leafin.name: Leafin
cobblemon.species.leafin.desc: The sharp leaf on its head is used to cut through tall grass and vegetation, so it can move more swiftly. Leafin pack a powerful bite despite being usually docile.
cobblemon.species.sharkage.name: Sharkage
cobblemon.species.sharkage.desc: Armed with sharp fins, teeth and claws, most Pokémon don't dare challenge it. It likes chewing on hard objects like rock and metal to strengthen its growing teeth.
cobblemon.species.sharcleave.name: Sharcleave
cobblemon.species.sharcleave.desc: Its large dorsal fin is its main weapon, and grows sharper and sturdier with sunlight. It is an apex predator capable of stalking and hunting its prey even in water and treetops.
cobblemon.species.torshell.name: Torshell
cobblemon.species.torshell.desc: Their high body temperatures causes the sand in their nests to turn into glass. The flames on its head change into various patterns according to their emotions.
cobblemon.species.emberaid.name: Emberaid
cobblemon.species.emberaid.desc: Its light body allows it to float in the air like a will-o'-wisp, often being confused as one. The winds power up its flames and allow it move more freely.
cobblemon.species.galliente.name: Galliente
cobblemon.species.galliente.desc: They are slow and laid back Pokémon who spend most of their time resting, but when wind currents blow, its sail lits up allowing it to move at an impressive high speed.
cobblemon.species.squigill.name: Squigill
cobblemon.species.squigill.desc: Its slippery skin allow its body to never dry while out of water. It prefers live by very clean waters so it is always migrating to new areas.
cobblemon.species.whirlamari.name: Whirlamari
cobblemon.species.whirlamari.desc: It creates small whirlpools in the water with its tentacles as it propels itself forward. It is able to change the patterns of its body to resemble powerful Pokémon and intimidate predators.
cobblemon.species.douseidon.name: Douseidon
cobblemon.species.douseidon.desc: A sonar wave can be beamed from its crest stopping and paralysing its opponents. They are very distrustful of others making very difficult to get along with.
cobblemon.species.pillunge.name: Pillunge
cobblemon.species.pillunge.desc: It moves by curling itself in a ball and rolling, various paths can be found in the forest carved by several Pillunge rolling over time
cobblemon.species.rumball.name: Rumball
cobblemon.species.rumball.desc: It hides inside its shell deflecting any attack from its opponents till they tire, when it notices an opening it will launch its body towards them at full speed.
cobblemon.species.likandua.name: Likandua
cobblemon.species.tamanozzle.name: Tamanozzle
cobblemon.species.jellycap.name: Jellycap
cobblemon.species.jellycap.desc: The bouncy jelly-like substance on its head is poisonous and protect its face, what looks like antennae poking out of its head are actually its eyes.
cobblemon.species.jellohat.name: Jellohat
cobblemon.species.jellohat.desc: It is oblivious to danger as its poisonous jelly hat protects it from anything, but if it happens to lose its hat it will go scurry and hide inside deep caves till another grows.
cobblemon.species.tapiruin.name: Tapiruin
cobblemon.species.tapiruin.desc: Mysterious Pokémon with rock hard skin, that used to be very common but became a rarer sight over the years. It seems like they are quickly adapting to live in subterrain areas.
cobblemon.species.dodonut.name: Dodonut
cobblemon.species.dodonut.desc: They migrate to remote islands after reaching a certain age. Since they are poor fliers to soar over the sea, they use their shells to float across the water.
cobblemon.species.palmfiend.name: Palmfiend
cobblemon.species.palmfiend.desc: Would it lose one of its tail feathers, it loses all its flying capabilities, making it very agitated and dangerous to approach.
cobblemon.species.golmol.name: Golmol
cobblemon.species.golmol.desc: By phasing through the floor and walls they can reach any place without making noise, however they still have to dig tunnels to not get themselves lost underground.
cobblemon.species.phanchasm.name: Phanchasm
cobblemon.species.phanchasm.desc: Their trickster nature can sometimes be difficult to work with, but their excellent sense of smell and massive digging claws have made them perfect companions for miners in search of gold.
cobblemon.species.venemony.name: Venemony
cobblemon.species.venemony.desc: Its poison and strong tentacles are enough to ward off most predators, but when it needs it can dettach from the ocean floor and swim away from danger.
cobblemon.species.anemace.name: Anemace
cobblemon.species.anemace.desc: A brute that fights by swinging its tentacles. They like to display their strength by shattering rocks, sometimes hurting themselves but too prideful to show it.
cobblemon.species.anedusa.name: Anedusa
cobblemon.species.anedusa.desc: Instead of using its arms it fights using its snake head like tentacles, the poison on those is powerful enough to paralyze its foes for hours.
cobblemon.species.dynamight.name: Dynamight
cobblemon.species.dynamight.desc: When angered too much its tail starts flickering as it is prone to explode. They have an appetite for burning wood and charcoal so setting campfire near mountains is ill advised.
cobblemon.species.cregg.name: Cregg
cobblemon.species.cregg.desc: This crafty Pokémon pretends to be an egg so it can hide inside bird nests. Being protected from predators and warmed up during the night.
cobblemon.species.crabelette.name: Crabelette
cobblemon.species.crabelette.desc: They fight eachother over territory. If its outer shell were to break, its inner shell is incredibly light, allowing an almost guaranteed escape from the fight.
cobblemon.species.sardive.name: Sardive
cobblemon.species.sardive.desc: They swim in very large groups in the ocean, if one is too tired to keep swimming it will use its hook tail to cling to another's tail and be pulled alongside.
cobblemon.species.gigantuna.name: Gigantuna
cobblemon.species.gigantuna.desc: It will try to eat anything that fits in its mouth, especially shiny objects. Their scales will glisten and even slightly change color depending on what they eat.
cobblemon.species.echolite.name: Echolite
cobblemon.species.echolite.desc: They emit a bright light from their bodies. The inside of dark caves where groups of Echolite hang on ceillings look like beautiful starry night skies.
cobblemon.species.teravat.name: Teravat
cobblemon.species.teravat.desc: As they fly their wings flap so fast that it generates energy. When that energy is discharged their bodies glow as bright as the sun.
cobblemon.species.symphot.name: Symphot
cobblemon.species.symphot.desc: When alone, it sings beautiful melodies capable of calming down a beast. However when in flocks, the noise that comes out of them is unbearable.
cobblemon.species.clunch.name: Clunch
cobblemon.species.clunch.desc: Its real body is concealed inside a seashell. Due to its light body they will clamp on surfaces to not get carried by strong currents.
cobblemon.species.locklusk.name: Locklusk
cobblemon.species.locklusk.desc: The high durability of its shell combined with its incredible strong bite force, makes sure that anything that ever falls inside its shell is never recovered.
cobblemon.species.bountyrant.name: Bountyrant
cobblemon.species.bountyrant.desc: It is believed that the most beautiful pearl is hidden inside its shell, but nobody was ever able to take it. As the sunlight hits the right angle, its sometimes possible to see a bit of its reflection.
cobblemon.species.biscaneer.name: Biscaneer
cobblemon.species.gingerbeard.name: Gingerbeard
cobblemon.species.lagoonansableye.name: LagoonanSableye
cobblemon.species.lagoonansableye.desc: Its claws have turned into solid gold after touching cursed treasure. Even at the risk of turning itself into a statue, this greedy Pokémon will not stop eating gold.
cobblemon.species.pesteeny.name: Pesteeny
cobblemon.species.tadwobble.name: Tadwobble
cobblemon.species.madhopple.name: Madhopple
cobblemon.species.jadivine.name: Jadivine
cobblemon.species.galegant.name: Galegant
cobblemon.species.tidakeet.name: Tidakeet
cobblemon.species.bumpnotic.name: Bumpnotic
cobblemon.species.shrizzler.name: Shrizzler
cobblemon.species.flintlaw.name: Flintlaw
cobblemon.species.burnslinger.name: Burnslinger
cobblemon.species.shockitt.name: Shockitt
cobblemon.species.felightning.name: Felightning
cobblemon.species.zenithera.name: Zenithera
cobblemon.species.driftilla.name: Driftilla
cobblemon.species.rudeworm.name: Rudeworm
cobblemon.species.coldera.name: Coldera
cobblemon.species.coldozer.name: Coldozer
cobblemon.species.frosterror.name: Frosterror
cobblemon.species.scubeel.name: Scubeel
cobblemon.species.clankeel.name: Clankeel
cobblemon.species.nimbun.name: Nimbun
cobblemon.species.raizinger.name: Raizinger
cobblemon.species.sandime.name: Sandime
cobblemon.species.starena.name: Starena
cobblemon.species.lagoonanlitwick.name: LagoonanLitwick
cobblemon.species.lagoonanlampent.name: LagoonanLampent
cobblemon.species.caskute.name: Caskute
cobblemon.species.barammer.name: Barammer
cobblemon.species.lagoonanfinneon.name: LagoonanFinneon
cobblemon.species.lagoonanlumineon.name: LagoonanLumineon
cobblemon.species.gloomineon.name: Gloomineon
cobblemon.species.boulblin.name: Boulblin
cobblemon.species.lonestone.name: Lonestone
cobblemon.species.geminie.name: Geminie
cobblemon.species.colossalgae.name: Colossalgae
cobblemon.species.plumeron.name: Plumeron
cobblemon.species.kickalon.name: Kickalon
cobblemon.species.wandream.name: Wandream
cobblemon.species.crocrux.name: Crocrux
cobblemon.species.caimarune.name: Caimarune
cobblemon.species.barbeetle.name: Barbeetle
cobblemon.species.scourgeon.name: Scourgeon
cobblemon.species.scourgeon.desc: It uses its steel appendages to gouge Cavitrio from the walls of caves, doing so even when not hungry. They sleep in the rain to allow their metal to oxidize overnight.
cobblemon.species.grapearl.name: Grapearl
cobblemon.species.jamowar.name: Jamowar
cobblemon.species.perchback.name: Perchback
cobblemon.species.skyviator.name: Skyviator
cobblemon.species.crawlycan.name: Crawlycan
cobblemon.species.webbewulf.name: Webbewulf
cobblemon.species.lagoonanhatenna.name: LagoonanHatenna
cobblemon.species.lagoonanhattrem.name: LagoonanHattrem
cobblemon.species.lagoonanhatterene.name: LagoonanHatterene
cobblemon.species.edeereal.name: Edeereal
cobblemon.species.stingfray.name: Stingfray
cobblemon.species.lagoonanremoraid.name: LagoonanRemoraid
cobblemon.species.lagoonanoctillery.name: LagoonanOctillery
cobblemon.species.crystalker.name: Crystalker
cobblemon.species.tyfang.name: Tyfang
cobblemon.species.furycane.name: Furycane
cobblemon.species.lagoonanbinacle.name: LagoonanBinacle
cobblemon.species.gangill.name: Gangill
cobblemon.species.codfather.name: Codfather
cobblemon.species.mantilist.name: Mantilist
cobblemon.species.pummelot.name: Pummelot
cobblemon.species.festivowl.name: Festivowl
cobblemon.species.gobblelisk.name: Gobblelisk
cobblemon.species.drasalys.name: Drasalys
cobblemon.species.dralytra.name: Dralytra
cobblemon.species.cerakeet.name: Cerakeet
cobblemon.species.lagoonantinkatink.name: LagoonanTinkatink
cobblemon.species.lagoonantinkatink.desc: It will scavenge shipwrecks for parts to make toys and play. Metalic objects that make noise are their favorites.
cobblemon.species.lagoonantinkatuff.name: LagoonanTinkatuff
cobblemon.species.lagoonantinkatuff.desc: They will tie scrap metal together with seaweed to make a huge hammer. Since the rusty metal is not durable, they are always looking for more.
cobblemon.species.lagoonantinkaton.name: LagoonanTinkaton
cobblemon.species.lagoonantinkaton.desc: They share a symbiotic relationship with Dhelmise who takes over the seaweed in its body. In trade they are allowed to use its heavy anchor as a makeshift hammer.
cobblemon.species.seasurper.name: Seasurper
cobblemon.species.seasurper.desc: Due to its toxicity, it has no known natural predators other than Toxunken. It is so dangerous to the ecosystem that its evolution item is banned in several regions.
cobblemon.species.veneko.name: Veneko
cobblemon.species.toxunken.name: Toxunken
cobblemon.species.skullocaris.name: Skullocaris
cobblemon.species.exovision.name: Exovision
cobblemon.species.corabdis.name: Corabdis
cobblemon.species.corabdis.desc: Many sailors don't acknowledge it as a Pokemon but as a sea devil. As it opens its massive claw, the vacuum creates huge whirlpools sinking down even the mightiest ships to the bottom of the sea.
cobblemon.species.mobipup.name: Mobipup
cobblemon.species.mobipup.desc: An artificially created Mon designed to be easy for beginners to handle. Its appearance is easily customized.
cobblemon.species.nezutama.name: Nezutama
cobblemon.species.nezutama.desc: Often hides itself among clutches of Eggs. It can use its weak electric abilities to sense the health of an unhatched Egg.
cobblemon.species.nuzzeltama.name: Nuzzeltama
cobblemon.species.nuzzeltama.desc: Nuzzeltama is a never-before-seen evolution of Nezutama that resulted in being frozen solid. It rubs its mitten-like paws to generate static electricity. It generates energy to heat itself up so it can give warm hugs.
cobblemon.species.ovipter.name: Ovipter
cobblemon.species.ovipter.desc: These troublesome Pokemon are notorious egg thieves. They are often seen snatching eggs and carrying them back to their nest.
cobblemon.species.hoppolat.name: Hoppolat
cobblemon.species.hoppolat.desc: It stands rigid as a statue and moves in short hops. Chocolate treats made in its likeness are handed out during spring festivals.
cobblemon.species.brokenstein.name: Brokenstein
cobblemon.species.brokenstein.desc: A failed experiment that was discarded by its creator. Its body appears to have been stitched together from various parts.
cobblemon.species.monstricity.name: Monstricity
cobblemon.species.monstricity.desc: By harnessing the power in lightning, it has achieved a more complete form. However, it tends lash out like a mindless beast and attack anything in sight.
cobblemon.species.cadastrophe.name: Cadastrophe
cobblemon.species.cadastrophe.desc: An infusion of pure, concentrated Spirit and its bond with its Trainer has enabled it to achieve its complete form. It wields devastating power and the ability to call down lightning strikes at will.
cobblemon.species.gobblin.name: Gobblin
cobblemon.species.gobblin.desc: This Pokemon was said to be born from remains of different food that fell into a groddy pond. Although clumsy and awkward-looking, it is loved by many.
cobblemon.species.sheetrick.name: Sheetrick
cobblemon.species.sheetrick.desc: A spirit possessing an old sheet and clothes. Whenever it moves, it shambles and flails its shoes around oddly as if it's dancing.
cobblemon.species.yokid.name: Yokid
cobblemon.species.yokid.desc: Yokid are bad at flying and very paranoid, gathering a coating of thorny vines and branches to protect themselves.
cobblemon.species.creshank.name: Creshank
cobblemon.species.creshank.desc: Creshank have a very cruel personality, making their nests in thorny trees and luring prey there using beautiful singing. If cornered, they fight back using their thorny legs and let out a loud shriek to call for backup.
cobblemon.species.mushmol.name: Mushmol
cobblemon.species.mushmol.desc: Multiple patterns of Mushmol exist, but they co-exist peacefully. This particular Pattern is usually more lazy and spends the majority of time sleeping.
cobblemon.species.mushpunky.name: Mushpunky
cobblemon.species.mushpunky.desc: Mushpunky's arms are made of a rubbery material that can stretch up to a whopping 3 meters. Whenever two meet, they punch each other as a form of greeting.
cobblemon.species.mushilly.name: Mushilly
cobblemon.species.mushilly.desc: The size of the umbrella differs between individuals. There are stories of a Mushilly so big that it took root and it served as a home to a whole forest of Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.mushcary.name: Mushcary
cobblemon.species.mushcary.desc: It clamps shut on prey between its two halves and leeches their life energy. Masks are traditionally made in its resemblance and used as wards against evil spirits.
cobblemon.species.sakurovix.name: Sakurovix
cobblemon.species.sakurovix.desc: The guardian of Easter Island. It awakens in the spring, and its song causes all Pokemon Eggs in its vicinity to hatch. If it does not awaken, the islanders perform a ritual to rouse it from its slumber.
cobblemon.species.nephelith.name: Nephelith
cobblemon.species.nephelith.desc: Nephelith has the ability to create and manipulate clouds into a form of matter strong enough to walk and even build upon. It's believed that the sky region of Cloudia was built on clouds created by Nephelith, along with potentially others.
cobblemon.species.hubiantogepi.name: HubianTogepi
cobblemon.species.hubiantogepi.desc: The shell seems to be filled with joy. It is said that it will share good luck when treated kindly.
cobblemon.species.hubiantogetic.name: HubianTogetic
cobblemon.species.hubiantogetic.desc: Easter Island Togetic is an elusive Pokemon that is responsible for golden eggs appearing all over the island. It likes to remain hidden, and only appears under special circumstances.
cobblemon.species.hubiantogekiss.name: HubianTogekiss
cobblemon.species.hubiantogekiss.desc: Togekiss on Easter Island is an incredibly revered Pokemon. It is the protector of the island, and upon growing too old, it will appoint a new successor.
cobblemon.species.hubiansmeargle.name: HubianSmeargle
cobblemon.species.hubiansmeargle.desc: Smeargle on Easter Island is just as artistic as its Johto counterpart, filling the walls of its cave home with hundreds of colorful chalk drawings. It is unable to learn any move, instead it is born capable of an endless possibility of potential.
cobblemon.species.leafrog.name: Leafrog
cobblemon.species.ribbush.name: Ribbush
cobblemon.species.agacloakis.name: Agacloakis
cobblemon.species.giraze.name: Giraze
cobblemon.species.bonfah.name: Bonfah
cobblemon.species.magmaraffa.name: Magmaraffa
cobblemon.species.damphant.name: Damphant
cobblemon.species.droophant.name: Droophant
cobblemon.species.cyclodon.name: Cyclodon
cobblemon.species.solcorn.name: Solcorn
cobblemon.species.ferrutail.name: Ferrutail
cobblemon.species.tweejay.name: Tweejay
cobblemon.species.marchawk.name: Marchawk
cobblemon.species.harmosoar.name: Harmosoar
cobblemon.species.pipillar.name: Pipillar
cobblemon.species.pipillar.desc: Pipillar is not a bug to be messed with due to tough and stubborn nature. Its pincers can tear other small Pokemon to pieces.
cobblemon.species.vicoon.name: Vicoon
cobblemon.species.vicoon.desc: Vicoon enjoy hanging on high tree branches to purposely fall on trainers or Pokemon. Their main objective is to protect the sleeping larvae on its back. evolve: protect
cobblemon.species.arisfly.name: Arisfly
cobblemon.species.arisfly.desc: Arisfly use their glowing white patterns to lure unsuspecting prey to them at night. Their mating calls also make use of these patterns. evolve: air cutter
cobblemon.species.juvy.name: Juvy
cobblemon.species.juvy.desc: Juvy swoop down from the sky to quickly snatch any valuable that a trainer may be holding. They often work with Thefcoon to pull off larger heists.
cobblemon.species.convird.name: Convird
cobblemon.species.convird.desc: Convird are some of the most scandalous Pokemon as they attempt more large-scale robberies. There was once a report of a single Convird breaking into a high-security bank.
cobblemon.species.thefcoon.name: Thefcoon
cobblemon.species.thefcoon.desc: Despite their adorable appearance, Thefcoon are infamous for their incredible thieving ability. Thefcoon are so sly that their schemes are nearly undetectable.
cobblemon.species.rascoon.name: Rascoon
cobblemon.species.rascoon.desc: Unable to perform the same sneaky plots as before, Rascoon have other Thefcoon retrieve valuable items for them. They are known as the leader of the gang and are hardly ever seen in the wild.
cobblemon.species.bulpy.name: Bulpy
cobblemon.species.bulpy.desc: Families from all over the world pay large amounts of money to get their hands on their own pet Bulpy. Their cuteness has become an internet sensation.
cobblemon.species.filthound.name: Filthound
cobblemon.species.filthound.desc: Filthound's fur is easily covered in mud and saliva if not groomed daily. They are often abandoned due to their natural odor and dirtiness.
cobblemon.species.gleamuse.name: Gleamuse
cobblemon.species.spookrab.name: Spookrab
cobblemon.species.spookrab.desc: Spookrab are rarely ever seen in person as they haunt the beaches through the night. Their claws can mimic the sounds of screaming.
cobblemon.species.crustgeist.name: Crustgeist
cobblemon.species.crustgeist.desc: Crustgeist hide their bodies underground, only exposing their dish. They keep an old shell on their back to create an alluring aroma for their prey.
cobblemon.species.hermish.name: Hermish
cobblemon.species.conkamite.name: Conkamite
cobblemon.species.whirm.name: Whirm
cobblemon.species.grappore.name: Grappore
cobblemon.species.panditsy.name: Panditsy
cobblemon.species.panditsy.desc: Panditsy's unsteady movements are so mesmerizing that just a few moments of observation cause trainers and Pokemon to move in the same fashion. The hypnotic swirl on their head can be dangerous if one is not careful.
cobblemon.species.zangarsh.name: Zangarsh
cobblemon.species.beagasso.name: Beagasso
cobblemon.species.onnidix.name: Onnidix
cobblemon.species.onnibud.name: Onnibud
cobblemon.species.vittion.name: Vittion
cobblemon.species.maskost.name: Maskost
cobblemon.species.tomaskost.name: Tomaskost
cobblemon.species.threevilasks.name: Threevilasks
cobblemon.species.ogopoing.name: Ogopoing
cobblemon.species.ogospiral.name: Ogospiral
cobblemon.species.nesspin.name: Nesspin
cobblemon.species.bitumin.name: Bitumin
cobblemon.species.ligniter.name: Ligniter
cobblemon.species.conflaracite.name: Conflaracite
cobblemon.species.pyrockit.name: Pyrockit
cobblemon.species.zooboom.name: Zooboom
cobblemon.species.kraboom.name: Kraboom
cobblemon.species.audibaah.name: Audibaah
cobblemon.species.bellabaah.name: Bellabaah
cobblemon.species.marifin.name: Marifin
cobblemon.species.umiveil.name: Umiveil
cobblemon.species.sniffreze.name: Sniffreze
cobblemon.species.kloakold.name: Kloakold
cobblemon.species.blastine.name: Blastine
cobblemon.species.navolatle.name: Navolatle
cobblemon.species.lochnes.name: Lochnes
cobblemon.species.lochitent.name: Lochitent
cobblemon.species.turbilly.name: Turbilly
cobblemon.species.dynabuck.name: Dynabuck
cobblemon.species.kristallant.name: Kristallant
cobblemon.species.miniradae.name: Miniradae
cobblemon.species.sorbeak.name: Sorbeak
cobblemon.species.dulswoop.name: Dulswoop
cobblemon.species.dulswoop.desc: Dulswoop typically only come out during the summer, ironically. During migration, the chocolate they melt off forms a type of delicious rain. Children love to run out with bowls to try and catch the delicious syrup.
cobblemon.species.squiwer.name: Squiwer
cobblemon.species.squiwer.desc: Squiwer have the ability to absorb types of mold they are often found relaxing in. Their horrendous stench can drive off even the scariest of Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.quisewer.name: Quisewer
cobblemon.species.quisewer.desc: Quisewer's horrid appearance makes it an unpopular choice among trainers. They are known to be insanely greedy, only obeying those who feed it lots of garbage.
cobblemon.species.bactiny.name: Bactiny
cobblemon.species.bactiny.desc: Bactiny are believed to be tied to the origin of the Pokerus virus. Contact with these Pokemon can cause numerous illnesses.
cobblemon.species.liquphage.name: Liquphage
cobblemon.species.liquphage.desc: Liquphage have no solid form, allowing them to squeeze into the tiniest of spaces. Despite being dangerous to humans, the diseases they carry are ineffective on them.
cobblemon.species.katakun.name: Katakun
cobblemon.species.shurisan.name: Shurisan
cobblemon.species.shaltuff.name: Shaltuff
cobblemon.species.gnawgorus.name: Gnawgorus
cobblemon.species.polluga.name: Polluga
cobblemon.species.junkqual.name: Junkqual
cobblemon.species.trashan.name: Trashan
cobblemon.species.scrapiteer.name: Scrapiteer
cobblemon.species.cactabit.name: Cactabit
cobblemon.species.gymnozard.name: Gymnozard
cobblemon.species.gymnozard.desc: The bulb on its tail contains a carefully collected water supply which it can use to douse itself in water to ward off burns from the hot sun. If attacked, it may use this to soak its enemies.
cobblemon.species.tuxechik.name: Tuxechik
cobblemon.species.juavarrior.name: Juavarrior
cobblemon.species.luxereguin.name: Luxereguin
cobblemon.species.sliezen.name: Sliezen
cobblemon.species.glacitrave.name: Glacitrave
cobblemon.species.oofoe.name: Oofoe
cobblemon.species.intellifoe.name: Intellifoe
cobblemon.species.zallut.name: Zallut
cobblemon.species.zerbrahg.name: Zerbrahg
cobblemon.species.zerbrahg.desc: Curious beings, Zerbarhg typically try to avoid contact with other Pokemon, but rather study them from afar. No one has yet to discover what this research is for.
cobblemon.species.cryvus.name: Cryvus
cobblemon.species.etheeria.name: Etheeria
cobblemon.species.shocalf.name: Shocalf
cobblemon.species.voltuff.name: Voltuff
cobblemon.species.chargibull.name: Chargibull
cobblemon.species.sebrium.name: Sebrium
cobblemon.species.kirastrum.name: Kirastrum
cobblemon.species.vitoshum.name: Vitoshum
cobblemon.species.bubblea.name: Bubblea
cobblemon.species.bubblea.desc: Bubblea are known to float around large bodies of water, like lakes. Rumors say that popping Bubblea's bubbles by force brings it immense pain.
cobblemon.species.chesture.name: Chesture
cobblemon.species.acard.name: Acard
cobblemon.species.hiveum.name: Hiveum
cobblemon.species.gigantoid.name: Gigantoid
cobblemon.species.periyeti.name: Periyeti
cobblemon.species.periyeti.desc: Periyeti live in exile as they abandon themselves from all people and Pokemon. Due to their snow-colored fur, it's nearly impossible to spot one and makes many people doubt their existence.
cobblemon.species.magness.name: Magness
cobblemon.species.tyranntric.name: Tyranntric
cobblemon.species.phoeuck.name: Phoeuck
cobblemon.species.metamarine.name: Metamarine
cobblemon.species.metamarine.desc: Metamarine lurks beneath the deep oceans and in the deepest marinas, emitting an eerie blue glow that somehow shines to the surface of the sea. Those that see this glow flee, as it is an omen of tsunamis and terrible storms to come. The cannon on it's back is capable of obliterating nearly anything in it's path.
cobblemon.species.mechrazore.name: Mechrazore
cobblemon.species.mechrazore.desc: Mechrazore is a man-made mechanical beast, with it's gigantic strength used to fight the Ultra Beast threat. Though it proves ultimately destructive of any environment it's placed in, it's methods of disposing of Ultra Beasts are effective.
cobblemon.species.slanbolos.name: Slanbolos
cobblemon.species.slanbolos.desc: Capable of infesting the deepest reaches of the subconscious, Salanbolos corrupts the mind of those it torments, leaving anger and depression wherever it goes. Though fearsome, it prefers to hide away and remain undetected.
cobblemon.species.oceausky.name: Oceausky
cobblemon.species.nifflom.name: Nifflom
cobblemon.species.interiangenesect.name: InterianGenesect
cobblemon.species.interianarceus.name: InterianArceus
cobblemon.species.interianpiplup.name: InterianPiplup
cobblemon.species.interianprinplup.name: InterianPrinplup
cobblemon.species.interianempoleon.name: InterianEmpoleon
cobblemon.species.snampery.name: Snampery
cobblemon.species.descargot.name: Descargot
cobblemon.species.gastesla.name: Gastesla
cobblemon.species.flasinge.name: Flasinge
cobblemon.species.shaboon.name: Shaboon
cobblemon.species.lunaye.name: Lunaye
cobblemon.species.swolphin.name: Swolphin
cobblemon.species.norspear.name: Norspear
cobblemon.species.narvalor.name: Narvalor
cobblemon.species.cefireon.name: Cefireon
cobblemon.species.cefireon.desc: Draconeon are considered exotic and are rarely seen outside of Blackthorn City in Johto. Though smaller than most dragons, Draconeon are fierce and passionate.
cobblemon.species.cefirandiglett.name: CefiranDiglett
cobblemon.species.cefirandugtrio.name: CefiranDugtrio
cobblemon.species.cefiranmeowthfire.name: CefiranMeowthFire
cobblemon.species.cefiranmeowthfire.desc: Due to its delicate fur and its psychic powers, even veteran Trainers find it difficult to raise this Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.cefiranpersianfire.des: A Persian's six bold whiskers sense air movements to determine what is in its vicinity. It becomes docile if grabbed by the whiskers.
cobblemon.species.cefiranmeowthice.name: CefiranMeowthIce
cobblemon.species.cefiranmeowthice.desc: Due to its delicate fur and its psychic powers, even veteran Trainers find it difficult to raise this Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.cefiranpersianice.name: CefiranPersianIce
cobblemon.species.cefiranpersianice.desc: A Persian's six bold whiskers sense air movements to determine what is in its vicinity. It becomes docile if grabbed by the whiskers.
Due to its delicate fur and its psychic powers, even veteran Trainers find it difficult to raise this Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.cefiranpersianelectric: A Persian's six bold whiskers sense air movements to determine what is in its vicinity. It becomes docile if grabbed by the whiskers.
cobblemon.species.cefiranteddiursa.name: CefiranTeddiursa
cobblemon.species.cefiranteddiursa.desc: It licks its palms that are sweetened by being soaked in honey. A Teddiursa makes its own honey by blending fruits and pollen collected by Beedrill.
cobblemon.species.cefiranursaring.name: CefiranUrsaring
cobblemon.species.cefiranursaring.desc: In forests, it is said that there are many streams and towering trees where an Ursaring gathers food. It walks through its forest collecting food every day.
cobblemon.species.cefiranslugma.name: CefiranSlugma
cobblemon.species.cefiranmagcargo.name: CefiranMagcargo
cobblemon.species.cefirandelibird.name: CefiranDelibird
cobblemon.species.cefiransmeargle.name: CefiranSmeargle
cobblemon.species.cefirancelebi.name: CefiranCelebi
cobblemon.species.cefiranmakuhita.name: CefiranMakuhita
cobblemon.species.cefiranhariyama.name: CefiranHariyama
cobblemon.species.cefiransableye.name: CefiranSableye
cobblemon.species.cefirannumel.name: CefiranNumel
cobblemon.species.cefirancamerupt.name: CefiranCamerupt
cobblemon.species.cefiranvibrava.name: CefiranVibrava
cobblemon.species.cefiranflygon.name: CefiranFlygon
cobblemon.species.cefiransnorunt.name: CefiranSnorunt
cobblemon.species.cefiranglalie.name: CefiranGlalie
cobblemon.species.cefiranswablu.name: CefiranSwablu
cobblemon.species.cefiranaltaria.name: CefiranAltaria
cobblemon.species.cefiranbuneary.name: CefiranBuneary
cobblemon.species.cefiranlopunny.name: CefiranLopunny
cobblemon.species.cefiransnover.name: CefiranSnover
cobblemon.species.cefiranabomasnow.name: CefiranAbomasnow
cobblemon.species.cefiranfroslass.name: CefiranFroslass
cobblemon.species.cefiranpetilil.name: CefiranPetilil
cobblemon.species.cefiranlilligant.name: CefiranLilligant
cobblemon.species.cefirangothitelle.name: CefiranGothitelle
cobblemon.species.cefirangolett.name: CefiranGolett
cobblemon.species.cefirangolurk.name: CefiranGolurk
cobblemon.species.cefiranklefki.name: CefiranKlefki
cobblemon.species.cefiranklefki.desc: The ultrasonic waves it emits from its ears can reduce a large boulder to pebbles. It swoops out of the dark to attack.
cobblemon.species.cefiranfalinks.name: CefiranFalinks
cobblemon.species.polekin.name: Polekin
cobblemon.species.fungorse.name: Fungorse
cobblemon.species.cervantrier.name: Cervantrier
cobblemon.species.lugnis.name: Lugnis
cobblemon.species.luravit.name: Luravit
cobblemon.species.luxpiravit.name: Luxpiravit
cobblemon.species.quisquite.name: Quisquite
cobblemon.species.gambarrel.name: Gambarrel
cobblemon.species.bogaleon.name: Bogaleon
cobblemon.species.astrem.name: Astrem
cobblemon.species.unktena.name: Unktena
cobblemon.species.relicbudew.name: RelicBudew
cobblemon.species.relicbudew.desc: Relic Budew appreciates the traditional aspects of warfare, and despite its young age, enjoys an entertaining duel. It claps on the victor using the buds on its head.
cobblemon.species.relicroselia.name: RelicRoselia
cobblemon.species.relicroselia.desc: A warrior in training, Roselia hone their skills, becoming fearsome despite their short size. They are known for their excellent offensive and defensive capabilities.
cobblemon.species.relicroserade.name: RelicRoserade
cobblemon.species.relicroserade.desc: Ho-OH's ashes caused rapiers to grow out of Relic Roserade's flower buds. It will only take off its mask to a dying opponent and hides its identity at all other times.
cobblemon.species.relicspinda.name: RelicSpinda
cobblemon.species.relicspinda.desc: By the grace of Ho-Oh’s ashes, Spinda walked the wheel of life and attained enlightenment. Strategists and sages alike sought out its guidance.
cobblemon.species.relickoffing.name: RelicKoffing
cobblemon.species.relickoffing.desc: After being touched by Ho-Oh's ashes Koffing used the gas inside itself to become a combustion engine. The gas inside its body is reportedly similar to rocket fuel.
cobblemon.species.relicweezing.name: RelicWeezing
cobblemon.species.relicweezing.desc: Supposedly, Relic Weezing have the explosive force of a thermobaric bomb. However, being planted to the ground, it finds catching prey difficult.
cobblemon.species.relicskiddo.name: RelicSkiddo
cobblemon.species.relicskiddo.desc: Locals in the surrounding area noticed that Relic Skiddo had reemerged, as many of the trees in the forest had been rammed down. This means a Skiddo is about to evolve, and wants to hone its skills.
cobblemon.species.relicgogoat.name: RelicGogoat
cobblemon.species.relicgogoat.desc: Relic Gogoat’s DNA was altered, and rocky outcrops grew all over its body. Old records tell of a mounted Relic Gogoat ending a month-long siege in a matter of seconds, by turning the castle gates to splinters with a full-speed horn bash. No momentum was lost.
cobblemon.species.relicaipom.name: RelicAipom
cobblemon.species.relicaipom.desc: Relic Aipom are known for their throwing skills. Trees, and occasionally an unfortunate Trevenant, are their usual targets for practice.
cobblemon.species.relicambipom.name: RelicAmbipom
cobblemon.species.relicambipom.desc: Ho-Oh’s ashes awakened Ambipom’s hidden martial spirit. Its karate chops are said to crush a steel cuirass like paper.
cobblemon.species.relictentacool.name: RelicTentacool
cobblemon.species.relictentacool.desc: Relic Tentacool's Source of power is the orb it holds in its tentacles. It is incredibly vulnerable without the orb, so it will defend it with its life.
cobblemon.species.relictentacruel.name: RelicTentacruel
cobblemon.species.relictentacruel.desc: Exposed to Ho-Oh’s ashes, its brain grew and reshaped its head, causing it to resemble a steepled hat. It magnifies its power with an orb plucked from a Staryu.
cobblemon.species.relicledyba.name: RelicLedyba
cobblemon.species.relicledyba.desc: Relic Ledyba are often seen training with a Relic Ledian counterpart. It is said that they form close bonds with their mentors, and gift them with tarts made of Combee honey to gain favour.
cobblemon.species.relicledian.name: RelicLedian
cobblemon.species.relicledian.desc: In exchange for their ability to fly, Ledian were gifted steel armor to battle along side their human comrades. Relic Ledian seem to have a strong sense of justice and protect those weaker than themselves.
cobblemon.species.relicflabebe.name: RelicFlabebe
cobblemon.species.relicflabebe.desc: Relic Flabébé can only be seen by those whom have had a near death experience, hence their late discovery.
cobblemon.species.relicfloette.name: RelicFloette
cobblemon.species.relicfloette.desc: Relic Floette gather around hospitals to herd the newly departed. They seem to work as assistants for the Relic Florges in the area.
cobblemon.species.relicflorges.name: RelicFlorges
cobblemon.species.crabble.name: Crabble
cobblemon.species.crabble.desc: It uses its large claw to knock fruit down from trees. Although its soft outer layer makes it resemble a tasty fruit, its bright coloration is actually to warn predators that it tastes foul.
cobblemon.species.carapoma.name: Carapoma
cobblemon.species.carapoma.desc: The arm bearing the larger claw can extend to several times its resting length to clobber opponents. Conversely, the other claw is shrunken to near-uselessness.
cobblemon.species.crustorchard.name: Crustorchard
cobblemon.species.crustorchard.desc: Its shell is as rugged as stone, so all this Pokemon needs to avoid predators is to bunker down and pretend to be a particularly large and hard-to-chew fruit until they lose interest.
cobblemon.species.burrliz.name: Burrliz
cobblemon.species.burrliz.desc: When faced with danger, it prefers to stand its ground and fight no matter the odds, its spiny body making it hard for predators to safely attack.
cobblemon.species.reptack.name: Reptack
cobblemon.species.reptack.desc: Its tear ducts emit fire, and it can torch things with pinpoint accuracy as if shooting a ray of heat from its eyes, but it just as easily relies on its sharp claws to fight instead.
cobblemon.species.calientrop.name: Calientrop
cobblemon.species.calientrop.desc: By day, it buries itself to soak up heat from the sun and sand, with its spines jutting outward as a warning to stay away. Its spines routinely break off and regrow daily.
cobblemon.species.sharby.name: Sharby
cobblemon.species.sharby.desc: It's always on the move, so it rarely gets a chance to sleep. On the rare occasion it gets to take a nap, a strange aura emanates from it that pacifies everything around it too.
cobblemon.species.lamnaw.name: Lamnaw
cobblemon.species.lamnaw.desc: Every day, it dives to great depths that no human could explore without a submarine. Hunting in total darkness, it navigates using electrical pulses from its snout.
cobblemon.species.squalucid.name: Squalucid
cobblemon.species.squalucid.desc: Its own toxic blood enhances its psychic abilities by keeping it in a subconscious state. Though it is blind, it does not need eyesight in its deep sea habitat, and therefore its other senses are greatly heightened.
cobblemon.species.chirunner.name: Chirunner
cobblemon.species.chirunner.desc: At the slightest threat, it sprints away at remarkable speeds—it can keep pace with a speeding car. The sand scattered by its running forms a cloud, allowing it to escape unseen.
cobblemon.species.roaduner.name: Roaduner
cobblemon.species.roaduner.desc: A master of speed and stealth that creates sandstorms to cover its tracks. Then, it strikes with the blade-like feathers under its wings. Roaduner runs fast enough to scale walls, and even ceilings.
cobblemon.species.hoppoint.name: Hoppoint
cobblemon.species.hoppoint.desc: A plant-eating Pokemon that uses its horned head to poke through tree bark and eat the fresh wood within. Farmers despise Hoppoint as they like to devour their precious berry crops.
cobblemon.species.helmhide.name: Helmhide
cobblemon.species.helmhide.desc: Between evolutions, it simply ducks into its armored shell to protect its developing body. The horn gradually lengthens an inch every day.
cobblemon.species.durabarge.name: Durabarge
cobblemon.species.durabarge.desc: The horn on its armored head looks different between regions. Some are so extravagantly shaped that their exact purpose is currently unknown to science.
cobblemon.species.imbirbe.name: Imbirbe
cobblemon.species.imbirbe.desc: It daintily sips nectar from flowers with its long beak. In turn, it helps the plants grow extra healthy because of the natural fertilizer in its saliva.
cobblemon.species.kolalibri.name: Kolalibri
