cobblemon.species.kolalibri.desc: Because of its extreme resistance to toxins, it favors bitter plants. Its beak is very flexible, twisting and bending to reach deep within flowers and guzzle up every last drop of nectar within.
cobblemon.species.blastun.name: Blastun
cobblemon.species.blastun.desc: By igniting the gases in its body, it can jet through the air like a missile. A hard headbutt from this Pokemon can easily dent steel.
cobblemon.species.bugbardier.name: Bugbardier
cobblemon.species.bugbardier.desc: When approached, it shows the bright colors on its shell as a warning to stay away. If provoked, it flips over and shoots a burst of fire from the nozzle on its back.
cobblemon.species.ensprout.name: Ensprout
cobblemon.species.ensprout.desc: Farmers carefully tend to this Pokemon to ensure it grows healthily before evolving. Its leaves look different depending on the type of soil it grows in.
cobblemon.species.treenanza.name: Treenanza
cobblemon.species.treenanza.desc: An assortment of different fruits grows from its body, so it is economically important. When stripped bare of its fruits, it goes dormant until they regrow.
cobblemon.species.cykit.name: Cykit
cobblemon.species.cykit.desc: People who look into its eye find themselves unable to resist doting on it. Some say it's really just because of its infectiously affectionate nature, however.
cobblemon.species.feleye.name: Feleye
cobblemon.species.feleye.desc: Its gaze pacifies foes, making them bend to the whims of this rather aloof Pokemon. It sits as still as a statue unless in the presence of a trusted companion.
cobblemon.species.scribish.name: Scribish
cobblemon.species.scribish.desc: The ink-like black markings on its back are unique to each individual. It eats lots of wood and paper to strengthen its thin exoskeleton.
cobblemon.species.papyrush.name: Papyrush
cobblemon.species.papyrush.desc: It has a keen understanding of written language, so it knows which books are the tastiest. This makes them a nuisance to libraries and other places where books are kept.
cobblemon.species.dirtusk.name: Dirtusk
cobblemon.species.dirtusk.desc: By bathing in mud, this Pokemon can keep cool even during the hot summer months. Due to this coating of mud, plants are sometimes seen sprouting from its head.
cobblemon.species.stalagrus.name: Stalagrus
cobblemon.species.stalagrus.desc: It's able to crush rocks with its heavy body alone. This Pokemon is extremely patient and can wait weeks for food to come by, often becoming cloaked in sand and harder for its prey to spot.
cobblemon.species.buroot.name: Buroot
cobblemon.species.buroot.desc: A plant-like Pokemon that lives underground. Since it can't get energy from the sun, it absorbs nutrients from the roots of desert plants.
cobblemon.species.stinginger.name: Stinginger
cobblemon.species.stinginger.desc: When not on the move, it pokes its tail out of the soil in search of prey. What looks like a fruit is actually a stinger that it uses to drain the life force from anything that comes near.
cobblemon.species.cuptus.name: Cuptus
cobblemon.species.cuptus.desc: Cuptus are born from the sand itself when lightning strikes in the desert. There, they will grow and become a hazard to people traveling across the desert.
cobblemon.species.cactank.name: Cactank
cobblemon.species.cactank.desc: It stores cool, fresh water in its body to withstand the intense heat of the desert. Finding a Cactank often means life or death for weary travelers.
cobblemon.species.colsector.name: Colsector
cobblemon.species.colsector.desc: It wears the cast-off shell of a Bug Pokemon as armor. It hunts the largest Bug-types to carve off parts of their exoskeleton to strengthen its armor.
cobblemon.species.shardodon.name: Shardodon
cobblemon.species.shardodon.desc: As the crystal on its back grows taller, shards of it break off and are left behind. These pieces are often collected and sold as souvenirs, but they are razor-sharp.
cobblemon.species.solardon.name: Solardon
cobblemon.species.solardon.desc: Heat concentrates in its crystal sail while it sunbathes, making it burn to the touch. If it overheats, it can release all of its stored heat energy at once in a scorching wave.
cobblemon.species.buzzoo.name: Buzzoo
cobblemon.species.buzzoo.desc: It's already self-sufficient right after hatching, but it will usually trek in packs of three. Using its keen sense of smell, it can sniff out food from miles away—any scraps will satisfy it.
cobblemon.species.carrioon.name: Carrioon
cobblemon.species.carrioon.desc: Gas builds up under its feather coat and causes it to float in the air. It sprays a foul-smelling red liquid around itself to keep hungry predators away.
cobblemon.species.embuzzle.name: Embuzzle
cobblemon.species.embuzzle.desc: They construct massive nests inside cliff faces, where their eggs are safe from danger. They are called 'janitors of the desert' because they will eat anything they come across, no matter how rotten.
cobblemon.species.scrapint.name: Scrapint
cobblemon.species.scrapint.desc: This Pokemon is very popular, but it's terrible with children—it often ends up released into the wild by unprepared owners. When it bites, it aims for the ankles to trip opponents much larger than it.
cobblemon.species.pupnacious.name: Pupnacious
cobblemon.species.pupnacious.desc: Pupnacious are popular guard Pokemon because of their tenacity and fearsome bite. Because of its diminutive size, people tend to underestimate it and learn their mistake the hard way.
cobblemon.species.lungob.name: Lungob
cobblemon.species.lungob.desc: A missing link between Pokemon of the land and sea. It digs burrows using its mouth, spitting out the sand as a compacted mud ball. Thousands of mud balls littering a lake shore are a sign that this Pokemon is around.
cobblemon.species.dessibello.name: Dessibello
cobblemon.species.dessibello.desc: It can survive on land for long periods of time. Using its powerful lungs, this Pokemon exhales mighty gusts to clear away sand and rock, searching for underground water that it will use to hydrate itself.
cobblemon.species.chardine.name: Chardine
cobblemon.species.chardine.desc: Born survivalists, they live only in remote basins in the desert, where they can handle even the hottest of temperatures. Threats to their unique habitat have made them rare.
cobblemon.species.volray.name: Volray
cobblemon.species.volray.desc: Because it likes to hide under the sand, swimmers are warned to shuffle their feet in the water to avoid stepping on this Pokemon's electrified body.
cobblemon.species.torplitz.name: Torplitz
cobblemon.species.torplitz.desc: The rings on its body are electrical organs, emitting pulses that help it navigate even in pitch-black waters. Touching any part of its body results in a nasty electric shock.
cobblemon.species.sprouton.name: Sprouton
cobblemon.species.sprouton.desc: It thrives on soil rich in metal content, which it stores in its bulb. When it is ready to evolve, it drills deep underground and sprouts.
cobblemon.species.utopion.name: Utopion
cobblemon.species.utopion.desc: Deep within is an organic plant core, protected by several layers of metal. In desolate, polluted lands, this Pokemon will take root, slowly healing the environment.
cobblemon.species.champiant.name: Champiant
cobblemon.species.champiant.desc: Although it is small, this Pokemon is able to lift practically anything, even heavy boulders. In numbers, they can carry an entire Metagross away.
cobblemon.species.filsick.name: Filsick
cobblemon.species.filsick.desc: It's a carrier of many strange diseases. It's believed that those who it points to with its antenna will fall ill, but modern medicine has made it mostly harmless.
cobblemon.species.fevirus.name: Fevirus
cobblemon.species.fevirus.desc: Its burning blood makes it combust at the slightest provocation. Fevirus are known to explode in a fiery burst if they don't simmer down fast enough.
cobblemon.species.shivirus.name: Shivirus
cobblemon.species.shivirus.desc: It's always shuddering and sniffling, even under the warm summer sun. When it sneezes, which is often, the fluid is ejected as razor-sharp bolts of ice.
cobblemon.species.quivirus.name: Quivirus
cobblemon.species.quivirus.desc: Its stiff body often twitches profusely from the pent-up electrical energy within. When touched, it flails about for a very brief moment before freezing up again.
cobblemon.species.snole.name: Snole
cobblemon.species.snole.desc: Tunneling through snow as if it were liquid, it hunts for Sleetle hibernating deep in the soil. Its nose is always covered in frost from constantly pushing against the snow it digs through.
cobblemon.species.digloo.name: Digloo
cobblemon.species.digloo.desc: Digloo is just as at home in the water as it is in soil. Able to cut through ice with ease, it waits for something to wander onto the water's frozen surface, then strikes from below.
cobblemon.species.frosmole.name: Frosmole
cobblemon.species.frosmole.desc: Though its claws are razor-sharp and it can fire off powerful ice beams from its snout, what it's really feared for are the avalanches caused by its constant tunneling.
cobblemon.species.gavile.name: Gavile
cobblemon.species.gavile.desc: Gavile's skin is as dark as a shadow, so during the night it becomes virtually invisible. Shine a light on it, however, and it will scramble away in a panic.
cobblemon.species.chirocodile.name: Chirocodile
cobblemon.species.chirocodile.desc: Its back is so dark it seems to swallow up all light, so you may never see it clinging to the walls of its cave until it springs off and swoops at you.
cobblemon.species.erradio.name: Erradio
cobblemon.species.erradio.desc: The strange energy generated by this Pokemon causes technology to malfunction. It climbs up telephone poles to drink electricity.
cobblemon.species.eyesi.name: Eyesi
cobblemon.species.eyesi.desc: During the day, they blend in among the trees they nest in. At night, however, their big eyes open and they become active, hunting for prey with their unparalleled night vision.
cobblemon.species.eyesaur.name: Eyesaur
cobblemon.species.eyesaur.desc: Eyesaur's eyes are always moving in different directions from each other, as they are sensitive to movement. Legends say that if you lock eyes with it, you turn to stone.
cobblemon.species.crozoicaneyesi.name: CrozoicanEyesi
cobblemon.species.crozoicaneyesi.desc: It relies on electric currents from the ground to achieve lift without much effort. Its feathers stick out in the presence of these currents.
cobblemon.species.crozoicaneyesaur.name: CrozoicanEyesaur
cobblemon.species.crozoicaneyesaur.desc: Hiding in the treetops, it entrances its prey with its hypnotic gaze, luring them up the tree. Then, it suddenly breaks the connection, causing its startled victim to fall to the ground.
cobblemon.species.disructor.name: Disructor
cobblemon.species.disructor.desc: Electricity that passes through it is amplified to extreme levels. It produces sound waves that cause disorientation, making it dangerous to aircraft.
cobblemon.species.rhinozer.name: Rhinozer
cobblemon.species.rhinozer.desc: Rhinozer travel in herds, and as they move along they create visible dirt paths. Other Pokemon learn to cross these paths with caution as they may get trampled by an oncoming herd if they aren't careful.
cobblemon.species.rhinolition.name: Rhinolition
cobblemon.species.rhinolition.desc: Its huge horn is shaped like a scoop, and as it charges forward, it bulldozes all in its path. Rhinolition are often used by construction crews due to their strength and ease of clearing land.
cobblemon.species.notifant.name: Notifant
cobblemon.species.notifant.desc: When it smells smoke with its sensitive trunk, it makes a loud, ringing call to alert other Pokemon to evacuate. Then, it douses the source of the smoke with a blast of water from its trunk.
cobblemon.species.fountusk.name: Fountusk
cobblemon.species.fountusk.desc: This Pokemon has a helpful disposition that makes it a trusted ally of people. Often, they are tasked to rescue trapped people and Pokemon by using their flexible trunks for safe retrieval.
cobblemon.species.eledrant.name: Eledrant
cobblemon.species.eledrant.desc: It can drink a whole swimming pool's worth of water, then blast it from its trunk and tusks. Herds of Eledrant easily combat the brushfires that are common in their native habitat.
cobblemon.species.wraggle.name: Wraggle
cobblemon.species.wraggle.desc: Soil that it walks on becomes enriched, forming fertile lands in the desert. It ruthlessly defends these places from thieves and troublemakers.
cobblemon.species.wranglash.name: Wranglash
cobblemon.species.wranglash.desc: Sensing vibrations in the earth allows it to catch thieves in the oases it calls home. It can extend its neck several times its length to ensnare its target, then drags it underground.
cobblemon.species.hayataga.name: Hayataga
cobblemon.species.hayataga.desc: By grabbing the end of its tail, it spins around and generates electricity. The designers of an experimental all-terrain vehicle were inspired by it.
cobblemon.species.welweed.name: Welweed
cobblemon.species.welweed.desc: Feigning helplessness, it cries for sympathy, pretending to be someone trapped in the sand. Then, it suddenly uproots itself, attacking with its long, sharp-edged leaf.
cobblemon.species.welwitch.name: Welwitch
cobblemon.species.welwitch.desc: Upon evolving, its grudges from its isolation in the desert manifest as power too great to be contained. It cackles wickedly as it ensnares everything with its leaves.
cobblemon.species.vespark.name: Vespark
cobblemon.species.vespark.desc: It's said to have the most excruciatingly painful sting of any Pokemon. Because of this, nothing will challenge it for territory, not even other Vespark.
cobblemon.species.volthroe.name: Volthroe
cobblemon.species.volthroe.desc: The stinger is always surging with electricity. When two Volthroe spar for territory, the impact of their stingers clashing together creates brilliant bursts of sparks.
cobblemon.species.snooseat.name: Snooseat
cobblemon.species.snooseat.desc: From the moment of birth, it searches for a piece of old wood to live in. Once it's found a comfortable-enough object to rest on, it never leaves.
cobblemon.species.taraxaconk.name: Taraxaconk
cobblemon.species.taraxaconk.desc: Bundles of cottony spores cover its fists, cushioning them from the heavy impacts of its punches. If the force of the punch doesn't KO its target, the spores will.
cobblemon.species.phoncrawl.name: Phoncrawl
cobblemon.species.phoncrawl.desc: An early foray into communications tech that became a Pokemon. It can broadcast messages to other Phoncrawl over very long distances.
cobblemon.species.techknot.name: Techknot
cobblemon.species.techknot.desc: It was once a cutting-edge artificial Mon, but was discarded. The frayed wires at its sides crackle with so much electrical energy that it often shorts itself out.
cobblemon.species.trawlossus.name: Trawlossus
cobblemon.species.trawlossus.desc: It stretches the sticky web between its legs to catch prey that fly into it, where they are digested by toxic fluid in the silk. Its paper-thin body easily drifts away in the wind.
cobblemon.species.puppest.name: Puppest
cobblemon.species.puppest.desc: A tricky Pokemon made of cloth that seems to eat and attack only through the puppets on its arms. It is fiercely protective of its puppets and will never let go of them.
cobblemon.species.socktopus.name: Socktopus
cobblemon.species.socktopus.desc: The puppets it holds are made of psychic energy, and they divert attacks away from its soft body. If one of them gets destroyed, it simply generates a new one.
cobblemon.species.germuck.name: Germuck
cobblemon.species.germuck.desc: It was accidentally unearthed from beneath a glacier, but it's mostly harmless. It forms colonies with such exponential growth that it will exhaust all food in the area within days.
cobblemon.species.germasaur.name: Germasaur
cobblemon.species.germasaur.desc: Germasaur is made entirely of tiny Germuck packed together into a form that can be as solid or liquid as it wishes. It's so deathly afraid of cleanliness that it may hide its trainer's soap while they're asleep.
cobblemon.species.flaskantine.name: Flaskantine
cobblemon.species.flaskantine.desc: It uses freezing cold to keep the biohazardous bacteria within from growing out of control. To forcefully remove the plug from atop its head is to ensure certain demise.
cobblemon.species.flingzer.name: Flingzer
cobblemon.species.flingzer.desc: It grows spherical fruit, which it then throws with its enlarged leaf. It catches incoming projectiles with its mouth and spits them back out with twice the force.
cobblemon.species.partae.name: Partae
cobblemon.species.partae.desc: On special occasions, a flame lights on the wick on its head, counting down to something. Once the wick is fully burned away, Partae becomes overcome with vigor and it begins to dance all night long.
cobblemon.species.lostislandspartae.name: LostIslandsPartae
cobblemon.species.lostislandspartae.desc: On special occasions, a flame lights on the wick on its head, counting down to something. Once the wick is fully burned away, Partae becomes overcome with vigor and it begins to dance all night long.
cobblemon.species.loftival.name: Loftival
cobblemon.species.loftival.desc: On the first hour of the new year, it illuminates the night with a dazzling show of pyrotechnics. Dancing synchronously with its allies causes the flames to glow even brighter.
cobblemon.species.lostislandsloftival.de: On the first hour of the new year, it illuminates the night with a dazzling show of pyrotechnics. Dancing synchronously with its allies causes the flames to glow even brighter.
cobblemon.species.hotdach.name: Hotdach
cobblemon.species.hotdach.desc: Its tail constantly grows in segments that fall off as they get too long, leaving behind a trail for other Hotdach to follow. A severed tail segment may continue to burn for several days.
cobblemon.species.schnausage.name: Schnausage
cobblemon.species.schnausage.desc: Its nose-flame is attuned to the quality of the surrounding air, so it burns differently when detecting certain scents. It burns the brightest in the presence of other Schnausage in the pack.
cobblemon.species.hammerod.name: Hammerod
cobblemon.species.hammerod.desc: It delights in showing off on busy roads, causing havoc. The side pods can separate from the main body and move on their own to scope out the surrounding territory.
cobblemon.species.pictolith.name: Pictolith
cobblemon.species.pictolith.desc: The majority of its body is animated by the living paint on its face. If a Pictolith is washed clean, it stops moving entirely.
cobblemon.species.canvalith.name: Canvalith
cobblemon.species.canvalith.desc: This Pokemon allows people to paint on its body because it feeds on the materials in the paint. Eventually, the paint is absorbed and it becomes a blank canvas again.
cobblemon.species.sinklot.name: Sinklot
cobblemon.species.sinklot.desc: This Pokemon makes its home inside of pipes, causing them to become clogged. Its fur is slick and oily to help it move through tight spaces.
cobblemon.species.snareball.name: Snareball
cobblemon.species.snareball.desc: Snareball's fur is extremely coarse and abrasive, like steel wool. It is a welcome sight at sewage treatment plants because it filters out toxic garbage from the water with its fur.
cobblemon.species.whaxzza.name: Whaxzza
cobblemon.species.whaxzza.desc: Whaxzza is covered in an incredibly hot wax that it can control the solidity of—it can be as solid or liquid as the situation requires. Its flame produces a sweet scent that carries for miles.
cobblemon.species.beatzza.name: Beatzza
cobblemon.species.beatzza.desc: It picks berries constantly—not to eat, but to wear on its head. The most extravagantly decorated Beatzza becomes the leader of the pack.
cobblemon.species.manchinade.name: Manchinade
cobblemon.species.manchinade.desc: Its leaves act as a limiter that keeps the energy within from overflowing. If it loses them in a fight, it explodes, sending sharp seeds flying in all directions.
cobblemon.species.mandrazooka.name: Mandrazooka
cobblemon.species.mandrazooka.desc: It grabs Manchinade and spits them out at high speeds to ward off enemies from its territory. Intense heat and toxic gases emanate from its body—parking a car near one will melt the paint right off.
cobblemon.species.buoybie.name: Buoybie
cobblemon.species.buoybie.desc: A bird Pokemon that can neither fly nor swim very well, so it relies on its parents to guide it along. Its feathers are buoyant enough to keep it afloat without needing to tread water, but it can't dive and is often helpless if left unattended.
cobblemon.species.albalue.name: Albalue
cobblemon.species.albalue.desc: Albalue are masters of the sky and sea, able to maneuver through water as swiftly as in the air. However, they're so adapted to this lifestyle that their walking skills leave something to be desired.
cobblemon.species.soponge.name: Soponge
cobblemon.species.soponge.desc: Its porous body can swell to four times its original size by taking in water. It can violently expel this stored water from the tubes on its head.
cobblemon.species.bubbaluffa.name: Bubbaluffa
cobblemon.species.bubbaluffa.desc: Despite its boneless, absorbent body, it has a very tough, rigid texture, and remarkable resistance to pain. Enough of them lined up on a beach could soak up an entire tsunami.
cobblemon.species.anemeany.name: Anemeany
cobblemon.species.anemeany.desc: It gathers in swarms by the water's edge, attacking intruders by stretching out and flailing itself like a club. The colony pushes away boats that try to sail over their land.
cobblemon.species.truculony.name: Truculony
cobblemon.species.truculony.desc: It's so territorial that it will not rest until it has scared off all other Pokemon from its habitat. Colonies of this Pokemon will enter blood feuds that last for generations.
cobblemon.species.lusigusi.name: Lusigusi
cobblemon.species.lusigusi.desc: It perches on rocks with its sucker-foot. It's often mistaken for a bird Pokemon from a distance, but it's only shaped like one; it can't even fly.
cobblemon.species.hermice.name: Hermice
cobblemon.species.hermice.desc: Water vapor in the air around it condenses and freezes into its shell of ice. It must shed this ice daily or risk its whole body fatally freezing over.
cobblemon.species.hermafrost.name: Hermafrost
cobblemon.species.hermafrost.desc: Its icy shell makes it float on the water's surface, which is where it hunts. Its blood temperature is always cold enough to prevent its shell from melting.
cobblemon.species.hagma.name: Hagma
cobblemon.species.hagma.desc: Its body is coated in super-flammable slime that ignites easily. Holding onto this Pokemon is difficult because the slippery slime allows it to wriggle through even the tightest grip.
cobblemon.species.conhagrant.name: Conhagrant
cobblemon.species.conhagrant.desc: It shoots hot slime from its mouth like a cannon to blast apart its food. This slime is hot and corrosive enough to bore through a sunken ship with ease.
cobblemon.species.mesmarine.name: Mesmarine
cobblemon.species.mesmarine.desc: Mesmarine slowly creep across the seafloor collecting minerals from the sand. They use these to form their disorientingly sparkly shells, which are tough enough to resist the battering of waves which would sweep away most other Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.jellop.name: Jellop
cobblemon.species.jellop.desc: Underneath its rubbery head are thin tentacles that can stretch up to a mile long. Get stung by one and you'll be wracked with pain for days.
cobblemon.species.irukarate.name: Irukarate
cobblemon.species.irukarate.desc: Irukarate makes up for its lack of physical strength with its sheer agility, able to dodge an opponent's attack and incapacitate it with a swift pinch in the back of the neck.
cobblemon.species.craberrant.name: Craberrant
cobblemon.species.craberrant.desc: A temperamental Pokemon that emerges from the sea at night, or if disturbed by offshore human activity. Its hard shell is highly resistant to undersea pressures but is also very flexible.
cobblemon.species.frogfew.name: Frogfew
cobblemon.species.frogfew.desc: Frogfew lays flat on the ground in swampy riverbanks, covered in mud and leaf litter except for its sweet-smelling lure. Its sticky body is sometimes stepped upon by unwary creatures too big to be prey, and so it ends up tracked along and somewhat irritated by the whole experience.
cobblemon.species.sundangler.name: Sundangler
cobblemon.species.sundangler.desc: Floating on the water's surface, the flowery tree on its back might look safe to rest under, but its entire body is as sticky as flypaper. Bird Pokemon will roost on top of it and find themselves unable to fly away as it submerges to drown them.
cobblemon.species.psyder.name: Psyder
cobblemon.species.psyder.desc: It spins its web in a spiral pattern, then twirls it around in a disorienting fashion. It is usually most active under the light of the full moon.
cobblemon.species.lunarach.name: Lunarach
cobblemon.species.lunarach.desc: It can manifest a nearly-invisible psychic web between its two horns to catch flying prey, then balls them up in silk and snacks on them.
cobblemon.species.rotpot.name: Rotpot
cobblemon.species.rotpot.desc: It is said this Pokemon was born from the remains of an abandoned greenhouse. Its entire body is dry and brittle, but can reform if torn apart. Rotpot doesn't care at all when this happens.
cobblemon.species.woebehind.name: Woebehind
cobblemon.species.woebehind.desc: It's able to hide itself behind any object, such as a thin pole, tree, or even its own tail, then ambushes its victims when they least expect it. However, it only intends to startle.
cobblemon.species.skuzzly.name: Skuzzly
cobblemon.species.skuzzly.desc: It sticks debris to its head to hide its face, as it believes it's too ugly to be seen. If its face is shown, it vanishes in a blink of light from its glowing tail.
cobblemon.species.clockoo.name: Clockoo
cobblemon.species.clockoo.desc: A nervous Pokemon always fretting about as if it has some overdue business. Every night for a single hour, however, it focuses itself and prowls for those lost in the woods with deadly precision.
cobblemon.species.nocturvian.name: Nocturvian
cobblemon.species.nocturvian.desc: It falls asleep at noon and awakens at midnight, never breaking from this schedule. Old tales tell of a Nocturvian that would kidnap and punish naughty children.
cobblemon.species.lumbrawl.name: Lumbrawl
cobblemon.species.lumbrawl.desc: Should the central head prove too much of a nuisance, the other two will break apart from it. None of them are hindered by this for long due to Lumbrawl's miraculous regenerative abilities.
cobblemon.species.unifly.name: Unifly
cobblemon.species.unifly.desc: A pesky Pokemon infamous for swarming people in large numbers, yet being nearly impossible to fend off. It flies off with whatever human food it can carry.
cobblemon.species.multifly.name: Multifly
cobblemon.species.multifly.desc: Rather than gather food on its own, it prefers to gives orders to the Unifly around it. These underlings will protect it at all costs.
cobblemon.species.amplifly.name: Amplifly
cobblemon.species.amplifly.desc: The swarm has grown large enough to form a pseudo-body, which Amplifly commands its underlings from within. At the slightest disruption, the swarm will disperse and reform elsewhere, good as new.
cobblemon.species.tadpunk.name: Tadpunk
cobblemon.species.tadpunk.desc: It will always follow the lead of the strongest fighter. It's flaky too, being quite likely to ditch a former ally if the tables start to turn.
cobblemon.species.flatriarch.name: Flatriarch
cobblemon.species.flatriarch.desc: Leading its family of Tadpunk, it rules the swamp with an iron fist. However, it has no attachment to them; it is even relentless enough to abandon them if it'd be advantageous to.
cobblemon.species.shiverme.name: Shiverme
cobblemon.species.shiverme.desc: Rumors tell of a feared pirate captain who went down with his ship and all its treasure. At the bottom of the ocean, his soul became a Shiverme and continues to haunt the seas in search of riches.
cobblemon.species.whalpool.name: Whalpool
cobblemon.species.whalpool.desc: When it inhales, it creates a powerful vortex that pulls water—and everything in it—into its mouth. It will intentionally capsize fishing boats solely to gobble up the whole catch.
cobblemon.species.numerea.name: Numerea
cobblemon.species.numerea.desc: It's tiny and weak, making it easy prey, but it can clone itself so quickly that one Numerea can become a swarm of thousands in only a few minutes.
cobblemon.species.amberado.name: Amberado
cobblemon.species.amberado.desc: It's thought that a Combee hive left abandoned with honey reserves still inside will eventually turn into Amberado, a honey Pokemon with its own unique intellect. It will do whatever it takes to defend the hives of its fellow Bug Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.laharva.name: Laharva
cobblemon.species.laharva.desc: It swims in exposed pools of lava. Every day, it migrates to the edge of the shore to eat hardened volcano rocks.
cobblemon.species.ignuana.name: Ignuana
cobblemon.species.ignuana.desc: After a long swim in the lava to heat its body up, Ignuana sneezes out leftover bits of molten rock that had gotten caught in its nose.
cobblemon.species.grily.name: Grily
cobblemon.species.grily.desc: It needs constant exposure to high temperatures to stay happy and healthy, so it lives in hot places where nothing else can grow. Its fireproof shell lets it comfortably float on top of lava.
cobblemon.species.charcool.name: Charcool
cobblemon.species.charcool.desc: It thrives in soil enriched with volcanic ash. Its flowers take on their most spectacular color and size only after a wildfire has burned away all competing plants.
cobblemon.species.denkyu.name: Denkyu
cobblemon.species.denkyu.desc: These lighter-than-air Pokemon often get stuck to each other due to the static electricity they generate—and release. A startled Denkyu may start a chain reaction of electrical bursts through all its neighbors.
cobblemon.species.electrocuke.name: Electrocuke
cobblemon.species.electrocuke.desc: It controls its electric field to form a raging thundercloud around itself. It is sometimes considered an emissary of the Forces of Nature.
cobblemon.species.shankrosite.name: Shankrosite
cobblemon.species.shankrosite.desc: This Pokemon was once hunted to near-extinction as food. Over time, the remaining population adapted and became armored, inedible Rock-type Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.teayke.name: Teayke
cobblemon.species.teayke.desc: Teayke's head fills up with water and leaves when it rains. When it gets angry, its blood comes to a boil and brews the leaves into fresh tea. Generally it's angry because it has a hard time drinking from its own head.
cobblemon.species.teayrant.name: Teayrant
cobblemon.species.teayrant.desc: It's greedy and antisocial, hoarding as much food as it can for itself. It hides its favorite berries inside its pouch, slowly turning their juice into a rare drink that it is fiercely protective of.
cobblemon.species.thermonster.name: Thermonster
cobblemon.species.thermonster.desc: Thermonster is irritable, and blood rises up into its horns in tandem with its level of anger. When it reaches a boiling point, it attacks everything around it in a berserk fury before cooling off and settling back down.
cobblemon.species.pteroast.name: Pteroast
cobblemon.species.pteroast.desc: It's lightweight for a Steel-type Pokemon, so it can easily fly. Flocks of them congregate in volcanic plains, frolicking in the warm updrafts that emerge from the ground.
cobblemon.species.ferrodactyl.name: Ferrodactyl
cobblemon.species.ferrodactyl.desc: The gear in its head moves to stimulate its brain. It can fly across the world without tiring—its fiery blood runs so hot that it can even brave the icy cold of the poles.
cobblemon.species.clawhyde.name: Clawhyde
cobblemon.species.clawhyde.desc: It lives in deep caves and reflexively snatches up passing prey in the dark with its huge hands. Even a tiny cut from its claws can prove fatal.
cobblemon.species.voltato.name: Voltato
cobblemon.species.voltato.desc: It communicates with other Voltato with gentle electric vibrations. If you feel the ground periodically shivering under you, it may be this Pokemon at work.
cobblemon.species.levitato.name: Levitato
cobblemon.species.levitato.desc: The electrical pulses this Pokemon emits cause it to float in the air. When it burrows into the ground to gather nutrients from the soil, it releases waves that jam communication signals.
cobblemon.species.sleetle.name: Sleetle
cobblemon.species.sleetle.desc: Sleetle spends all day rolling a ball of snow around. This snowball actually contains frozen food collected from its surroundings that it will use as rations to sustain its evolution.
cobblemon.species.cacold.name: Cacold
cobblemon.species.cacold.desc: It hides in a cocoon made of snow and tree bark. When the seasons change and it becomes warmer outside, it thaws and evolves.
cobblemon.species.scaralanche.name: Scaralanche
cobblemon.species.scaralanche.desc: It's a sturdy Pokemon that tirelessly accumulates snow onto its snowball to make it bigger. When time comes to lay eggs, it hides them deep within the snowball to protect them from predators. Occasionally, it may roll the snowball down the mountain slopes, and anything trampled beneath it becomes food for the young Sleetle within.
cobblemon.species.aquaz.name: AquaZ
cobblemon.species.aquaz.desc: A high-tech artificial Pokemon designed to explore the deepest depths of the ocean. The bubble on its head contains a lens that lets it record what it finds, which can then be uploaded onto a computer for study.
cobblemon.species.auroreel.name: Auroreel
cobblemon.species.auroreel.desc: A rare and peaceful Pokemon, sailors fear its silhouette which resembles more dangerous Pokemon, but those courageous enough to approach it kindly are said to be blessed with good luck.
cobblemon.species.lurelit.name: Lurelit
cobblemon.species.lurelit.desc: A cave-dwelling Pokemon that leads prey astray with misleading beams of light. It hates the touch of sunlight.
cobblemon.species.grimfernal.name: Grimfernal
cobblemon.species.grimfernal.desc: Its glowing eye is shaped like a Poke Ball. The eye flickers enticingly while the rest of its body remains hidden in darkness.
cobblemon.species.skite.name: Skite
cobblemon.species.skite.desc: It floats in the wind, firmly anchored to the ground by the barbs on its tail. When in danger, it detaches itself and flutters away.
cobblemon.species.despairay.name: Despairay
cobblemon.species.despairay.desc: It swoops down and engulfs prey whole with its flat body. At the dawn of winter, Despairay migrate in great flocks to the warmer regions south, in such numbers that they may block out the sun.
cobblemon.species.channichill.name: Channichill
cobblemon.species.smolter.name: Smolter
cobblemon.species.smolter.desc: It eats hot coals to keep its heart burning. Because the energy produced inside them is more efficient than a regular coal engine, a crew of Smolter can keep a train running for weeks.
cobblemon.species.boilunk.name: Boilunk
cobblemon.species.boilunk.desc: It sprays suffocating smoke from the spout on top of its head. The whistle of a contented Boilunk is regarded as a sign of good luck by people in northern Ferroa and locomotive aficionados alike.
cobblemon.species.crystabrawl.name: Crystabrawl
cobblemon.species.crystabrawl.desc: Crystabrawl's body brims with energy that can't be contained, so it moves erratically. It always knows when its opponent will make a move, then swiftly blocks with one of its hands.
cobblemon.species.icicrawl.name: Icicrawl
cobblemon.species.icicrawl.desc: A film of ice-cold slime coats its body. By spitting this slime from its mouth, it aids humans in factories to keep machinery from overheating.
cobblemon.species.glacicrawl.name: Glacicrawl
cobblemon.species.glacicrawl.desc: It captures its food by freezing it with blasts of liquid nitrogen. Because it's totally blind, it detects movement with a thin net of ice along the ground.
cobblemon.species.velvedrake.name: Velvedrake
cobblemon.species.velvedrake.desc: This Pokemon's body is cold enough to quickly lower a room's temperature to freezing. It constantly shoots blasts of ice out of its shoulder vents.
cobblemon.species.snipion.name: Snipion
cobblemon.species.snipion.desc: In ancient seas, it held its prey down with its claws and stabbed them with its heavy tail. When this tail is reared up, it warns potential predators to stay away.
cobblemon.species.crozoicansnipion.name: CrozoicanSnipion
cobblemon.species.crozoicansnipion.desc: After hiding itself in mud or seaweed, it remains perfectly still, waiting for something to swim close. Then, it grabs its prey and repeatedly jabs it with its sharp tail.
cobblemon.species.chainscraw.name: Chainscraw
cobblemon.species.chainscraw.desc: It was part of a now-extinct lineage of Bug Pokemon relatives. The undersides of its claws spin and vibrate at such rates that it is easily able to grind through stone.
cobblemon.species.crozoicanchainscraw.de: The speed at which it can strike with its pincers is unmatched, able to shear a log in half in a blink. To keep the edges of its pincers sharp, it will claim a specific rock face as its personal whetstone.
cobblemon.species.enigmore.name: Enigmore
cobblemon.species.enigmore.desc: Schools of Enigmore dig for food with their clawed snouts. Its fossils, found in ancient shales, are among the oldest of all Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.oculustrous.name: Oculustrous
cobblemon.species.oculustrous.desc: It is thought to be the first creature to have evolved advanced intelligence, and that its psychic eye foretold its species' extinction.
cobblemon.species.remainstone.name: Remainstone
cobblemon.species.remainstone.desc: An attempted reconstruction from several shattered fossils resulted in this strange new Pokemon. It sometimes acts as though it is tethered between multiple different realities. (Resurrected from Broken Fossil)
cobblemon.species.broogah.name: Broogah
cobblemon.species.broogah.desc: An ancient Pokemon that builds tools and armor from stone. Though they have a tough and rugged exterior, they're known to be quite compassionate and cooperative among each other.
cobblemon.species.platoul.name: Platoul
cobblemon.species.platoul.desc: It wears a piece of metal like a mask to shield its face. Historically, Platoul wore discarded shields and armor, though modern Platoul are often found holding on to pieces of scrap metal instead.
cobblemon.species.victorelic.name: Victorelic
cobblemon.species.victorelic.desc: Victorelic frequently appear in the aftermath of a great catastrophe, salvaging the armor from fallen warriors and wearing it as a shell. At a glance, this Pokemon is sometimes mistaken for a loved one returned from the grave.
cobblemon.species.batellite.name: Batellite
cobblemon.species.batellite.desc: A spacefaring Pokemon that sleeps in the planet's orbit and enters the atmosphere to feed. If a manmade object in space suddenly breaks out of orbit, a jealous Batellite is likely to blame.
cobblemon.species.purrth.name: Purrth
cobblemon.species.purrth.desc: With its pair of beaks, it will deliver a vicious nip if handled. It takes a very skilled trainer to earn the trust of this skittish Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.terrachnid.name: Terrachnid
cobblemon.species.terrachnid.desc: It is able to maneuver easily across rough terrain as it stalks its prey, even able to walk on walls and ceilings to ambush an unsuspecting target.
cobblemon.species.miserachnid.name: Miserachnid
cobblemon.species.miserachnid.desc: It's told of in storybooks where it is a feared devourer of humans, and is hunted by a vengeful warrior who must slay it in its cavernous lair.
cobblemon.species.messoul.name: Messoul
cobblemon.species.messoul.desc: It came from a meteor that passed through a cloud of smog. Very large ones can be found near major cities and highways, gorging on the exhaust fumes of cars.
cobblemon.species.wastenaut.name: Wastenaut
cobblemon.species.wastenaut.desc: The interior of its tough skin is filled with toxic slime. It sucks up as much poison as it can hold, then explosively releases it all.
cobblemon.species.celestar.name: Celestar
cobblemon.species.celestar.desc: This Pokemon drifts through the upper atmosphere in large groups. It is made of a dense material not common on Earth.
cobblemon.species.celestroid.name: Celestroid
cobblemon.species.celestroid.desc: As Celestroid moves, it leaves behind a very long and bright trail of light. It is common practice in many parts of the world to wish upon a Celestroid as it flies overhead.
cobblemon.species.deltabulbasaur.name: DeltaBulbasaur
cobblemon.species.deltabulbasaur.desc: A Delta Species discovered by EchoTheThird. The crystal growing from its back uses its mental energy to grow.
cobblemon.species.deltaivysaur.name: DeltaIvysaur
cobblemon.species.deltaivysaur.desc: Its body naturally changes in order to help counteract the crystal's growing weight. Its crystal resonates with increased brain activity.
cobblemon.species.deltavenusaur.name: DeltaVenusaur
cobblemon.species.deltavenusaur.desc: In order to increase its psychic powers, a shard of its crystal is embedded in its forehead. Even when it sleeps, its crystal is capable of providing protection.
cobblemon.species.deltacharmander.name: DeltaCharmander
cobblemon.species.deltacharmander.desc: A Delta Species discovered by EchoTheThird. While the flame on its tail does not appear immediately after its birth, it burns more fiercely with age.
cobblemon.species.deltacharmeleon.name: DeltaCharmeleon
cobblemon.species.deltacharmeleon.desc: Its claws tear into its foe's spirit. When facing powerful opponents, the flame on its tail gives off the appearance of a face.
cobblemon.species.deltacharizard.name: DeltaCharizard
cobblemon.species.deltacharizard.desc: The flame on its tail grows in the presence of strong opponents. Its breath gives the impression of being engulfed in magma but causes no physical harm.
cobblemon.species.deltasquirtle.name: DeltaSquirtle
cobblemon.species.deltasquirtle.desc: A Delta Species discovered by EchoTheThird. Though its shell causes it to stand out when hiding in the shadows, it conceals itself using the cloth on its back.
cobblemon.species.deltawartortle.name: DeltaWartortle
cobblemon.species.deltawartortle.desc: Its tail splits to better conceal the back of its shell while it waits for foes. Its gloves help better channel its inner spirit energy.
cobblemon.species.deltablastoise.name: DeltaBlastoise
cobblemon.species.deltablastoise.desc: Though its shell now blends in with the darkness, it welcomes foolish opponents who attack it from behind. It concentrates its spirit into blasts of energy.
cobblemon.species.deltapidgey.name: DeltaPidgey
cobblemon.species.deltapidgey.desc: A Delta Species discovered by RuneBlad3. It uses its piercing gaze to petrify foes and then perches on top of their immobile bodies.
cobblemon.species.deltapidgeotto.name: DeltaPidgeotto
cobblemon.species.deltapidgeotto.desc: This Pokemon stealthily creeps around caves and labyrinths, hoping to catch intruders off guard with its glare. It avoids mirrors and pools of water at all costs.
cobblemon.species.deltapidgeot.name: DeltaPidgeot
cobblemon.species.deltapidgeot.desc: A living creature that looks directly into this Pokemon's eyes will be turned to stone. It breaks off very small pieces of its victims to help digest food.
cobblemon.species.deltapikachu.name: DeltaPikachu
cobblemon.species.deltapikachu.desc: When preparing for lift-off, it winds up its tail dozens of times. When it releases its tail, it experiences a tremendous burst of speed and soars into the air.
cobblemon.species.deltaraichu.name: DeltaRaichu
cobblemon.species.deltaraichu.desc: Flying at high speeds have led to it losing most of its hair. Despite gaining weight due to its obsession with pancakes, it darts around in the air faster than a jet.
cobblemon.species.deltadiglett.name: DeltaDiglett
cobblemon.species.deltadiglett.desc: A Delta Species discovered by Zazulitao. As it prefers to create tunnels within the snow, it is common for explorers to fall into the holes that it creates.
cobblemon.species.deltadugtrio.name: DeltaDugtrio
cobblemon.species.deltadugtrio.desc: Since the triplets think exactly alike, they can work together to avoid producing avalanches. This no longer applies when one of them falls asleep.
cobblemon.species.deltagrowlithe.name: DeltaGrowlithe
cobblemon.species.deltagrowlithe.desc: A Delta Species discovered by LunarDusk. They are fiercely loyal to reputable trainers and those of high status.
cobblemon.species.deltaarcanine.name: DeltaArcanine
cobblemon.species.deltaarcanine.desc: If placed in front of castles or temples, this Pokemon will watch the entrance without moving. Its strength is determined by its claws, teeth, and eyes.
cobblemon.species.deltatentacool.name: DeltaTentacool
cobblemon.species.deltatentacool.desc: A Delta Species discovered by xxxHexxxx. Foes grabbed by its tentacles are slowly drained of their strength while succumbing to its poison.
cobblemon.species.deltatentacruel.name: DeltaTentacruel
cobblemon.species.deltatentacruel.desc: It is seldom seen except when disposing of the remains of carcasses. The sacs on its head produce more poison when it senses a foe nearby.
cobblemon.species.deltageodude.name: DeltaGeodude
cobblemon.species.deltageodude.desc: A Delta Species discovered by EchoTheThird. They are easily mistaken for parts of ruins and may surprise travelers attempting to use them for a bench.
cobblemon.species.deltagraveler.name: DeltaGraveler
cobblemon.species.deltagraveler.desc: They station themselves among ruins and act as guardians. Despite rarely moving, they quickly rush across the ground to drive away intruders who bring ill will.
cobblemon.species.deltagolem.name: DeltaGolem
cobblemon.species.deltagolem.desc: Despite possessing no discernible organs, it moves with both a mind and will of its own. It can sense trespassers from the heart of its living space.
cobblemon.species.deltadoduo.name: DeltaDoduo
cobblemon.species.deltadoduo.desc: A Delta Species discovered by TheTurtleScream. Though it possesses two independent brains, one brain will always inevitably usurp control over the other.
cobblemon.species.deltadodrio.name: DeltaDodrio
cobblemon.species.deltadodrio.desc: Even while aware of mind control, the three heads are cooperative with one another. As one head falls asleep, another awakens and becomes the manipulator.
cobblemon.species.deltagrimer.name: DeltaGrimer
cobblemon.species.deltagrimer.desc: A Delta Species discovered by EchoTheThird. With sand absorbed into its circulation, it can vanish into surrounding sand to escape from predators.
cobblemon.species.deltamuk.name: DeltaMuk
cobblemon.species.deltamuk.desc: It puts anything it finds in its massive mouth and hunts smaller Pokemon as prey. It tracks sand everywhere it goes, making it tedious to care for indoors.
cobblemon.species.deltakoffing.name: DeltaKoffing
cobblemon.species.deltakoffing.desc: A Delta Species discovered by Zero_Breaker. It discharges electricity when hit physically. It uses this as a defensive mechanism against predators.
cobblemon.species.deltaweezing.name: DeltaWeezing
cobblemon.species.deltaweezing.desc: The sound it makes when dispensing electricity has been compared to a lightning bolt striking nearby.
cobblemon.species.deltatangela.name: DeltaTangela
cobblemon.species.deltatangela.desc: A Delta Species discovered by winkright. It lures prey towards its home in the earth before grabbing and pinning them.
cobblemon.species.deltascyther.name: DeltaScyther
cobblemon.species.deltascyther.desc: A Delta Species discovered by EchoTheThird. Its scythes are immensely sharp but also very fragile, and can easily be shattered when hit from the side.
cobblemon.species.deltaelectabuzz.name: DeltaElectabuzz
cobblemon.species.deltaelectabuzz.desc: After midnight they can be seen congregating on rooftops. However, they always make sure to return to their original positions before morning.
cobblemon.species.deltamagmar.name: DeltaMagmar
cobblemon.species.deltamagmar.desc: It can now breath underwater using the oxygen in the tank on its back. It returns to the surface once per week in order to refuel.
cobblemon.species.deltaditto.name: DeltaDitto
cobblemon.species.deltaditto.desc: A Delta Species discovered by EchoTheThird. When rearranging its cell structure to transform itself, it sometimes makes a mistake and becomes a different type.
cobblemon.species.deltakabuto.name: DeltaKabuto
cobblemon.species.deltakabuto.desc: A Delta Species discovered by PokeNerd123. Though they buzz harmlessly when alone, a swarm can decimate a city's worth of crops within minutes.
cobblemon.species.deltakabutops.name: DeltaKabutops
cobblemon.species.deltakabutops.desc: This Pokemon's changes during evolution led to it becoming a carnivore instead of an herbivore. It hovers above trees in search of prey.
cobblemon.species.deltasnorlax.name: DeltaSnorlax
cobblemon.species.deltasnorlax.desc: Trees and plants tend to grow on this Pokemon’s back because it moves so little. It loves eating food while playing with tiny Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.deltadratini.name: DeltaDratini
cobblemon.species.deltadratini.desc: A Delta Species discovered by PokeNerd123. Because its body constantly releases electrical energy, it prefers to hide within the depths of the ocean.
cobblemon.species.deltadragonair.name: DeltaDragonair
cobblemon.species.deltadragonair.desc: Having better control over its power, it can sometimes be seen peeking above the ocean surface. If it sneezes, it looses a massive discharge of electricity.
cobblemon.species.deltadragonite.name: DeltaDragonite
cobblemon.species.deltadragonite.desc: A courageous and kind Pokemon, it braves storms to lead shipwrecked crews to land. It can travel underwater at a speed of 400 knots.
cobblemon.species.deltacyndaquil.name: DeltaCyndaquil
cobblemon.species.deltacyndaquil.desc: A Delta Species discovered by 1ofthe4rocketbros. When placed in darkness, it will automatically generate more and more electricity from its tesla coil.
cobblemon.species.deltaquilava.name: DeltaQuilava
cobblemon.species.deltaquilava.desc: Its DNA continuously changes and reconstructs its body into a machine. As it becomes more dependent on electricity, it makes its home in power plants.
cobblemon.species.deltatyphlosion.name: DeltaTyphlosion
cobblemon.species.deltatyphlosion.desc: On stormy nights it ventures outdoors and pulsates in response to lightning strikes. When calm, it can induce macroshock in humans from 100 feet away.
cobblemon.species.deltahoothoot.name: DeltaHoothoot
cobblemon.species.deltahoothoot.desc: A Delta Species discovered by Aboodie. Its ears are sensitive enough to hear a snowflake fall upon the snow on the ground from across the forest.
cobblemon.species.deltanoctowl.name: DeltaNoctowl
cobblemon.species.deltanoctowl.desc: Rather than flee from physical attacks, at times it will stare down the opponent's attack head on, startling them, and then freezing them to the bone.
cobblemon.species.deltachinchou.name: DeltaChinchou
cobblemon.species.deltachinchou.desc: A Delta Species discovered by CommanderPhoenix. When it senses danger, it emits bright flames and fades into the shadows.
cobblemon.species.deltalanturn.name: DeltaLanturn
cobblemon.species.deltalanturn.desc: The flames it produces are extraordinarily hot. Due to its reclusive nature, lost travelers that stumble upon it may mistake its presence for the gateway to hell.
cobblemon.species.deltapichu.name: DeltaPichu
cobblemon.species.deltapichu.desc: A Delta Species discovered by EchoTheThird. As it is still inept at flying, it practices gliding from high altitudes at incredible speed.
cobblemon.species.deltaaipom.name: DeltaAipom
cobblemon.species.deltaaipom.desc: A Delta Species discovered by SixteenDraws and EchoTheThird. It sneakily places the end of its tail on people's shoulders, making others wonder if they saw a white hand.
cobblemon.species.deltasunkern.name: DeltaSunkern
cobblemon.species.deltasunkern.desc: A Delta Species discovered by DankRabbit and EchoTheThird. It is able to emit a purple fire that poisons its enemies.
cobblemon.species.deltasunflora.name: DeltaSunflora
cobblemon.species.deltasunflora.desc: Sunflora convert fire and poison into nutrition. It purges its enemy's uncleanliness with fire.
cobblemon.species.deltayanma.name: DeltaYanma
cobblemon.species.deltayanma.desc: A Delta Species discovered by SapphirePhoenix. Though it specializes in camouflage, it is also a great flier capable of quickly chasing down lured prey.
cobblemon.species.deltawooper.name: DeltaWooper
cobblemon.species.deltawooper.desc: A Delta Species discovered by EchoTheThird. This mischievous Pokemon likes to surprise people on Halloween with tons of candy.
cobblemon.species.deltaquagsire.name: DeltaQuagsire
cobblemon.species.deltaquagsire.desc: Despite its appearance, this Delta Species is kind to every Pokemon it meets. It glows with Halloween spirit.
cobblemon.species.deltamisdreavus.name: DeltaMisdreavus
cobblemon.species.deltamisdreavus.desc: A Delta Species discovered by EchoTheThird. This Pokemon does its best to bring everyone into the holiday spirit. It's only happy when everyone else is.
cobblemon.species.deltagirafarig.name: DeltaGirafarig
cobblemon.species.deltagirafarig.desc: A Delta Species discovered by nico. The tail's insults temper the Pokemon's iron will, becoming stronger as the Pokemon grows.
cobblemon.species.deltadunsparce.name: DeltaDunsparce
cobblemon.species.deltadunsparce.desc: A Delta Species discovered by LunarDusk. Despite having a menacing appearance, it is quite friendly and skates across ponds' surfaces.
cobblemon.species.deltascizor.name: DeltaScizor
cobblemon.species.deltascizor.desc: Its exoskeleton is coated with a thick layer of ice. The layer of ice reforms once per year.
cobblemon.species.deltashuckle.name: DeltaShuckle
cobblemon.species.deltashuckle.desc: A Delta Species discovered by Zazulitao. Every punch that it takes causes its crank to turn; when its limit is reached, it bashes into foes with its head.
cobblemon.species.deltaremoraid.name: DeltaRemoraid
cobblemon.species.deltaremoraid.desc: A Delta Species discovered by Missingo_OP. The farther it goes away from pools of lava, the more rapidly the magma on its head cools down and hardens.
cobblemon.species.deltaoctillery.name: DeltaOctillery
cobblemon.species.deltaoctillery.desc: It hides its tentacles behind its beard-like smokescreen and attacks without warning. Against stronger foes, it will grab them and submerge them in lava.
cobblemon.species.deltaelekid.name: DeltaElekid
cobblemon.species.deltaelekid.desc: A Delta Species discovered by Ubodot. Though it tries to remain as still as possible around humans, it cannot withstand heavy rain, causing it to flee indoors.
cobblemon.species.deltamagby.name: DeltaMagby
cobblemon.species.deltamagby.desc: A Delta Species discovered by Ubodot. Though it is a Water-type Pokemon, it is incapable of breathing underwater and aims to hold its breath longer everyday.
cobblemon.species.deltatreecko.name: DeltaTreecko
cobblemon.species.deltatreecko.desc: A Delta Species discovered by SixteenDraws. It takes up residence within dojos where it trains against humans and Pokemon alike.
cobblemon.species.deltagrovyle.name: DeltaGrovyle
cobblemon.species.deltagrovyle.desc: As its skill grows, so does its fighting spirit. Its strength is great enough to stand on par with black belts.
cobblemon.species.deltasceptile.name: DeltaSceptile
cobblemon.species.deltasceptile.desc: After becoming a master of its dojo, it begins to regain its primal instincts. Its draconic traits cause it to have no equal within the karate world.
cobblemon.species.deltatorchic.name: DeltaTorchic
cobblemon.species.deltatorchic.desc: A Delta Species discovered by NoNameDummy. From birth it has the ability to give orders to other wild Pokemon and have them obey without question.
cobblemon.species.deltacombusken.name: DeltaCombusken
cobblemon.species.deltacombusken.desc: It lazes about while giving its underlings commands. Its power is believed by some to have been bestowed upon it by gods of unknown origin.
cobblemon.species.deltablaziken.name: DeltaBlaziken
cobblemon.species.deltablaziken.desc: It soars to amazing heights, storing power that it draws from the sun. Even when it cannot be seen from the ground below, it keeps a watchful eye on those it protects.
cobblemon.species.deltalotad.name: DeltaLotad
cobblemon.species.deltalotad.desc: A Delta Species discovered by Kalorian. It is known to entertain small Pokemon by performing magic tricks for them.
cobblemon.species.deltalombre.name: DeltaLombre
cobblemon.species.deltalombre.desc: From morning until night, it trains and practices its magic. During the evening it puts on magic shows for large crowds.
cobblemon.species.deltaludicolo.name: DeltaLudicolo
cobblemon.species.deltaludicolo.desc: Its knowledge and strength make it a common source of advice for its community. It produces massive barriers to protect those important to it.
cobblemon.species.deltaseedot.name: DeltaSeedot
cobblemon.species.deltaseedot.desc: A Delta Species discovered by SketchyGamer. Its face flashes at varying frequencies depending on its mood at time.
cobblemon.species.deltanuzleaf.name: DeltaNuzleaf
cobblemon.species.deltanuzleaf.desc: Though it has a cloud around its waist, it is still too heavy to levitate. It clings to its cloud desperately whenever someone gets too close to it.
cobblemon.species.deltashiftry.name: DeltaShiftry
cobblemon.species.deltashiftry.desc: It is said to appear suddenly during thunderstorms. When it needs to feed, it will insert its arms into electrical outlets.
cobblemon.species.deltaralts.name: DeltaRalts
cobblemon.species.deltaralts.desc: A Delta Species discovered by EchoTheThird and Zero_Breaker. It uses its own ice and electricity to help make its trainer's life easier.
cobblemon.species.deltakirlia.name: DeltaKirlia
cobblemon.species.deltakirlia.desc: This Pokemon loves dancing to swing music. As it grows more excited from dancing, it generates sparks and snow begins to fall within the surrounding area.
cobblemon.species.deltagardevoir.name: DeltaGardevoir
cobblemon.species.deltagardevoir.desc: To protect its trainer, it can drop the temperature of itself and its surroundings to 0°K. It discharges sparks when nuzzling trainers to keep them from freezing.
cobblemon.species.deltasableye.name: DeltaSableye
cobblemon.species.deltasableye.desc: A Delta Species discovered by SketchyGamer. It digs deep holes into the earth in search of charcoal and molten rocks, which it uses for food.
cobblemon.species.deltamawile.name: DeltaMawile
cobblemon.species.deltamawile.desc: A Delta Species discovered by spimission. Luring foes with its innocence and sweet appearance, it devours them and sends nutrients through the vines on its head.
cobblemon.species.deltaaron.name: DeltaAron
cobblemon.species.deltaaron.desc: A Delta Species discovered by Draexzhan. Cracks in its armor allow more and more flames to escape as it takes damage.
cobblemon.species.deltalairon.name: DeltaLairon
cobblemon.species.deltalairon.desc: A territorial Pokemon that defends its land by releasing bursts of flames from within its armor. Deafening explosions can be heard when it collides with objects.
cobblemon.species.deltaaggron.name: DeltaAggron
cobblemon.species.deltaaggron.desc: It aggressively pursues stronger opponents each and every day. The gouges in its armor generate more flames and allow it to boast more of its strength.
cobblemon.species.deltameditite.name: DeltaMeditite
cobblemon.species.deltameditite.desc: A Delta Species discovered by ensentiumseraph. Its powerful, goat-like legs allow it to scale steep mountain walls with little to no difficulty.
cobblemon.species.deltamedicham.name: DeltaMedicham
cobblemon.species.deltamedicham.desc: A deep love for nature runs through this Pokemon's veins. It will immediately begin dancing to music featuring pipes or cymbals.
cobblemon.species.deltaplusle.name: DeltaPlusle
cobblemon.species.deltaplusle.desc: A Delta Species discovered by powerpow. It is cheerful and warms up its friends using its fiery power.
cobblemon.species.deltaminun.name: DeltaMinun
cobblemon.species.deltaminun.desc: A Delta Species discovered by powerpow. It is quite jovial and cools down its friends using its icy power.
cobblemon.species.deltaroselia.name: DeltaRoselia
cobblemon.species.deltaroselia.desc: This Pokemon can be found on clear nights, dancing before the moon. If discovered, it puts onlookers to sleep and flees into the shadows.
cobblemon.species.deltawailmer.name: DeltaWailmer
cobblemon.species.deltawailmer.desc: A Delta Species discovered by EchoTheThird. Currently, it is still unknown how this Pokemon manages to keep itself in the air despite its weight.
cobblemon.species.deltawailord.name: DeltaWailord
cobblemon.species.deltawailord.desc: Hail falls over the land below as this Pokemon flies. It is suspected that the phrase 'the sky is falling' originated due to its shadow blanketing the ground.
cobblemon.species.deltanumel.name: DeltaNumel
cobblemon.species.deltanumel.desc: A Delta Species discovered by bradleyinabox. The first of its kind was known to have appeared at the ground zero of a nuclear explosion.
cobblemon.species.deltacamerupt.name: DeltaCamerupt
cobblemon.species.deltacamerupt.desc: This Pokemon feeds on nuclear radiation. It has been shown that atoms within its vicinity become more and more unstable as its temper reaches its peak.
cobblemon.species.deltafeebas.name: DeltaFeebas
cobblemon.species.deltafeebas.desc: A Delta Species discovered by 1ofthe4rocketbros. Though it desires to scare strangers, it is timid and oftentimes ends up frightening itself instead.
cobblemon.species.deltamilotic.name: DeltaMilotic
cobblemon.species.deltamilotic.desc: It is known to lurk within graveyards. Memories from the life of its skeleton inspire it to ruthlessly protect a worthy master.
cobblemon.species.deltasnorunt.name: DeltaSnorunt
cobblemon.species.deltasnorunt.desc: A Delta Species discovered by EchoTheThird. It is said that this Pokemon helps to guard volcanoes and deep caves from intruders.
cobblemon.species.deltaglalie.name: DeltaGlalie
cobblemon.species.deltaglalie.desc: This Pokemon has the power to evaporate entire oceans with a single breath.
cobblemon.species.deltaclamperl.name: DeltaClamperl
cobblemon.species.deltaclamperl.desc: A Delta Species discovered by yungbro. It catches prey in its jaws by pretending to be an unassuming shellfish.
cobblemon.species.deltahuntail.name: DeltaHuntail
cobblemon.species.deltahuntail.desc: A savage creature which prefers to live in solitude within dark caves. If another organism ventures into its domain, it will assault them relentlessly.
cobblemon.species.deltagorebyss.name: DeltaGorebyss
cobblemon.species.deltagorebyss.desc: A friendly creature which prefers to share its living space with other cave-dwelling Pokemon. It prefers the warmth of tropical climates.
cobblemon.species.deltaspiderbeldum.name: DeltaSpiderBeldum
cobblemon.species.deltaspiderbeldum.desc: A Delta Species discovered by Zero_Breaker. It builds webs in trees, ensnaring prey, and then subdues them with its venom.
cobblemon.species.deltaspidermetang.name: DeltaSpiderMetang
cobblemon.species.deltaspidermetang.desc: The string it produces is both unnaturally thin and impossibly strong. Clothing weaved together using its silk is flexible yet stronger than titanium.
cobblemon.species.deltaspidermetagross.d: Rather than resorting to capturing prey using webs, it resorts to other trickery. Foes entering its domain may see it as a tiger, a demon, or a giant spider.
cobblemon.species.deltaruinbeldum.name: DeltaRuinBeldum
cobblemon.species.deltaruinbeldum.desc: A Delta Species discovered by LunarDusk and Cowctus. It is said that beneath its rough exterior exists a crystal shard of unimaginable value.
cobblemon.species.deltaruinmetang.name: DeltaRuinMetang
cobblemon.species.deltaruinmetang.desc: As multiple altered Beldums come into contact with each other, their crystals resonate, causing their cores to fuse. They then reconstruct into a single entity.
cobblemon.species.deltaruinmetagross.des: After two altered Metang fuse into this Pokemon, all but the exterior of its body is composed of crystal. Additional crystals allow it to break free of its rocky shell.
cobblemon.species.deltaregirock.name: DeltaRegirock
cobblemon.species.deltaregirock.desc: A Delta Species discovered by Lucci85. Being made of sand, it can easily replenish itself and in some cases ward off Water-type attacks with ease.
cobblemon.species.deltaregice.name: DeltaRegice
cobblemon.species.deltaregice.desc: A Delta Species discovered by Lucci85. Though its entire body is composed of water, it is unable to alter its molecules into that of a gas or a solid.
cobblemon.species.deltaregisteel.name: DeltaRegisteel
cobblemon.species.deltaregisteel.desc: A Delta Species discovered by Lucci85. Its emergence from pools of magma is said to be blinding due to its core glowing with extreme heat.
cobblemon.species.deltaturtwig.name: DeltaTurtwig
cobblemon.species.deltaturtwig.desc: A Delta Species discovered by NoNameDummy. Made from sand, the shell on its back hardens as it floats along the ocean's surface. As it dives, the shell softens.
cobblemon.species.deltagrotle.name: DeltaGrotle
cobblemon.species.deltagrotle.desc: It lives along the water's surface in oceans. During the day, it dives underwater regularly to refresh the sea life taking shelter on its back.
cobblemon.species.deltatorterra.name: DeltaTorterra
cobblemon.species.deltatorterra.desc: As it moves in the ocean continuously, pirates store their loot in its back for safekeeping. It oftentimes participates in treasure hunts for younger Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.deltashinx.name: DeltaShinx
cobblemon.species.deltashinx.desc: A Delta Species discovered by EchoTheThird. A single scratch from it is toxic enough to faint targets as it flees into the wild.
cobblemon.species.deltaluxio.name: DeltaLuxio
cobblemon.species.deltaluxio.desc: This Pokemon's poison is potent enough to cause fainting just from standing downwind of it.
cobblemon.species.deltaluxray.name: DeltaLuxray
cobblemon.species.deltaluxray.desc: One drop of its venom is potent enough to incapacitate 2000 Rattata.
cobblemon.species.deltabudew.name: DeltaBudew
cobblemon.species.deltabudew.desc: A Delta Species discovered by 1ofthe4rocketbros and EchoTheThird. It hides itself from the sun during the day and stares longingly at the moon at night.
cobblemon.species.deltaroserade.name: DeltaRoserade
cobblemon.species.deltaroserade.desc: Its fans are capable of whipping up vicious gales. Though shy, it will become aggressive if its dance is interrupted.
cobblemon.species.deltacombee.name: DeltaCombee
cobblemon.species.deltacombee.desc: A Delta Species discovered by LunarDusk. The middle body hosts a reactor; it uses this to power up its Fire-type moves.
cobblemon.species.deltavespiquen.name: DeltaVespiquen
cobblemon.species.deltavespiquen.desc: It hovers in the air with electromagnetic force produced from its reactor. If it doesn't consume enough food for fuel, it will be unable to fly.
cobblemon.species.deltaambipom.name: DeltaAmbipom
cobblemon.species.deltaambipom.desc: It plays pranks by frightening people with its detachable head. If its spirit leaves its body, its body is left without arms.
cobblemon.species.deltadrifloon.name: DeltaDrifloon
cobblemon.species.deltadrifloon.desc: A Delta Species discovered by yungbro. It is formed by the passionate spirits of people and Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.deltadrifblim.name: DeltaDrifblim
cobblemon.species.deltadrifblim.desc: Though it is drowsy during the daytime, it flies off in the evening in big groups. No one knows where they go.
cobblemon.species.deltabuneary.name: DeltaBuneary
cobblemon.species.deltabuneary.desc: A Delta Species discovered by nico. It uses its techniques to rob the weak, causing its parents to scold it constantly.
cobblemon.species.deltalopunny.name: DeltaLopunny
cobblemon.species.deltalopunny.desc: Having found inner peace, it fights for the future. As a parent, it never seems to be able to take its eyes off of its mischievous children.
cobblemon.species.deltamismagius.name: DeltaMismagius
cobblemon.species.deltamismagius.desc: This Pokemon loves making snow-ghosts with humans. It has an unquenchable love for the holidays.
cobblemon.species.deltamunchlax.name: DeltaMunchlax
cobblemon.species.deltamunchlax.desc: A Delta Species discovered by Sparrows413. This Pokemon lays in the fields all day after eating, absorbing nutrients from the sun.
cobblemon.species.deltariolu.name: DeltaRiolu
cobblemon.species.deltariolu.desc: A Delta Species discovered by Ubodot. It practices sanitizing and preserving the bodies of the deceased, showing them one final form of respect.
cobblemon.species.deltalucario.name: DeltaLucario
cobblemon.species.deltalucario.desc: The afterlife and rebirth of souls are sacred to this Pokemon. It will fiercely guard any tomb or cemetery that it comes across from graverobbers.
cobblemon.species.deltacroagunk.name: DeltaCroagunk
cobblemon.species.deltacroagunk.desc: A Delta Species discovered by pokefan1241. Its cheeks hold large amounts of fire. It generates thick smog to sneak up behind its opponents and attack them.
cobblemon.species.deltatoxicroak.name: DeltaToxicroak
cobblemon.species.deltatoxicroak.desc: Its knuckles generate flames so intense that they can be used as fiery knives. Stabbing with these flames can easily melt holes in steel.
cobblemon.species.deltatangrowth.name: DeltaTangrowth
cobblemon.species.deltatangrowth.desc: A vicious Pokemon which spreads its tendrils beneath the ground, ensnaring unsuspecting trespassers. It uses their cries for help to lure more prey.
cobblemon.species.deltaelectivire.name: DeltaElectivire
cobblemon.species.deltaelectivire.desc: After midnight they can be seen congregating on rooftops. However, they always make sure to return to their original positions before morning.
cobblemon.species.deltamagmortar.name: DeltaMagmortar
cobblemon.species.deltamagmortar.desc: With additional armor, this Pokemon can easily endure pressures at the bottom of the ocean. Its cannons serve as defense from lurking dangerous opponents.
cobblemon.species.deltayanmega.name: DeltaYanmega
cobblemon.species.deltayanmega.desc: Using its wings to generate massive gusts, it blends in with surrounding foliage and tricks prey into seeking shelter beneath its leaves.
cobblemon.species.deltagallade.name: DeltaGallade
cobblemon.species.deltagallade.desc: A master swordfighter, it uses both Electric- and Ice-type attacks to defeat opponents. Over time it numbs its opponents and decreases their reaction speeds.
cobblemon.species.deltafroslass.name: DeltaFroslass
cobblemon.species.deltafroslass.desc: This Pokemon has the power to evaporate entire oceans with a single breath.
cobblemon.species.deltasnivy.name: DeltaSnivy
cobblemon.species.deltasnivy.desc: A Delta Species discovered by Aboodie. They usually form small colonies in the midst of raging seas, where they are protected from predators.
cobblemon.species.deltaservine.name: DeltaServine
cobblemon.species.deltaservine.desc: Despite rarely coming up above the water's surface, on rainy days they use the cover of clouds to laze about on rocks and take in the fresh sea air.
cobblemon.species.deltaserperior.name: DeltaSerperior
cobblemon.species.deltaserperior.desc: Though they viciously protect their domains from outsiders, they admire and welcome the company of trainers who brave the oceans to meet them.
cobblemon.species.deltapurrloin.name: DeltaPurrloin
cobblemon.species.deltapurrloin.desc: A Delta Species discovered by Zero_Breaker. This Pokemon wanders the city streets while scaring people with its illusions.
cobblemon.species.deltaliepard.name: DeltaLiepard
cobblemon.species.deltaliepard.desc: This Pokemon makes use of illusions and trickery to catch its prey.
cobblemon.species.deltavenipede.name: DeltaVenipede
cobblemon.species.deltavenipede.desc: A Delta Species discovered by DankRabbit. It is highly aggressive and will attempt to set its surroundings on fire when agitated.
cobblemon.species.deltawhirlipede.name: DeltaWhirlipede
cobblemon.species.deltawhirlipede.desc: Though it prefers to remain still and blend in with its surroundings, when threatened it bursts forward at high speed and then crashes into its opponent explosively.
cobblemon.species.deltascolipede.name: DeltaScolipede
cobblemon.species.deltascolipede.desc: Though it prefers to remain still and blend in with its surroundings, when threatened it bursts forward at high speed and then crashes into its opponent explosively.
cobblemon.species.deltawaterpetilil.name: DeltaWaterPetilil
cobblemon.species.deltawaterpetilil.desc: A Delta Species discovered by Steads42. It can be seen from within submarines, frolicking along the deep sea floor.
cobblemon.species.deltawaterlilligant.de: The flame atop its head burns so intensely that not even water can douse it. It has been know to help guide diving humans to safety.
cobblemon.species.deltafairypetilil.name: DeltaFairyPetilil
cobblemon.species.deltafairypetilil.desc: A Delta Species discovered by shadowsofme. It gracefully descends upon weary travelers, restoring their morale and energy in the process.
cobblemon.species.deltafairylilligant.de: Capable of producing massive barriers that provide weaker Pokemon with a sanctuary, it observed the Torren Region from afar during its greatest times of crisis.
cobblemon.species.deltadarumaka.name: DeltaDarumaka
cobblemon.species.deltadarumaka.desc: A Delta Species discovered by potatoking12. Being quite mischievous, it runs through streets at night while making strange noises.
cobblemon.species.deltadarmanitan.name: DeltaDarmanitan
cobblemon.species.deltadarmanitan.desc: When facing weakened foes, it can sometimes possess them by passing through them. It still tries to use doors despite passing straight through them.
cobblemon.species.deltamaractus.name: DeltaMaractus
cobblemon.species.deltamaractus.desc: A Delta Species discovered by mushgloom. They move systematically, causing their gears and motors to produce an almost musical sound effect.
cobblemon.species.deltaberrydwebble.name: DeltaBerryDwebble
cobblemon.species.deltaberrydwebble.desc: A Delta Species discovered by MorallyIncorrect. It makes homes in various berry bushes until they stop producing fruit.
cobblemon.species.deltaberrycrustle.name: DeltaBerryCrustle
cobblemon.species.deltaberrycrustle.desc: With its powerful pincers, it tills the earth and plants berries from the hedge on its back, creating future homes for itself and its offspring.
cobblemon.species.deltacakedwebble.name: DeltaCakeDwebble
cobblemon.species.deltacakedwebble.desc: A Delta Species discovered by DankRabbit. It entices strangers with its sweet scent, taking offense if they do not immediately attempt to taste its frosting.
cobblemon.species.deltacakecrustle.name: DeltaCakeCrustle
cobblemon.species.deltacakecrustle.desc: While it does not mind sharing its pastry with others, it will stab thieves with its fork. Its body is quite cold in order to preserve the freshness of its cake.
cobblemon.species.deltascraggy.name: DeltaScraggy
cobblemon.species.deltascraggy.desc: A Delta Species discovered by DankRabbit. Despite being a Grass-type, it is quite adept at hunting Bug-types for food.
cobblemon.species.deltascrafty.name: DeltaScrafty
cobblemon.species.deltascrafty.desc: The tuft of grass on its head is surprisingly hard; it can be used to break through rocks.
cobblemon.species.deltayamask.name: DeltaYamask
cobblemon.species.deltayamask.desc: A Delta Species discovered by Palfi. This Pokemon formed from radioactive waste that was carelessly dumped in landfills.
cobblemon.species.deltacofagrigus.name: DeltaCofagrigus
cobblemon.species.deltacofagrigus.desc: This Pokemon frequents nuclear landfills in order to keep surrounding areas free from radiation. Destroying its exterior would produce an explosion exceeding 720 kilotons.
cobblemon.species.deltasolosis.name: DeltaSolosis
cobblemon.species.deltasolosis.desc: A Delta Species discovered by Steads42. Its survival is dependent upon its soul remaining bound to its rock.
cobblemon.species.deltaduosion.name: DeltaDuosion
cobblemon.species.deltaduosion.desc: As its power grows, so do the number of rocks under its control. Each rock appears to have a mind of its own.
cobblemon.species.deltareuniclus.name: DeltaReuniclus
cobblemon.species.deltareuniclus.desc: Extraordinarily cunning, it can survive any attack so long as a fragment of itself remains within a rock.
cobblemon.species.deltaemolga.name: DeltaEmolga
cobblemon.species.deltaemolga.desc: A Delta Species discovered by EchoTheThird. On cold nights they spit hot embers on their tails and feet to ignite them. The ensuing blaze can be seen for miles.
cobblemon.species.deltakarrablast.name: DeltaKarrablast
cobblemon.species.deltakarrablast.desc: A Delta Species discovered by bradleyinabox. For unknown reasons, this Pokemon is extremely friendly towards Shelmet.
cobblemon.species.deltaescavalier.name: DeltaEscavalier
cobblemon.species.deltaescavalier.desc: It drenches the shell of a Shelmet in its own saliva before wearing it, creating a sugary, white coating. The steel armor is then resistant to Fire-type attacks.
cobblemon.species.deltafoongus.name: DeltaFoongus
cobblemon.species.deltafoongus.desc: A Delta Species discovered by Ubodot. It disguises itself as a harmless umbrella and then frightens people attempting to grab it by licking their hand.
cobblemon.species.deltaamoonguss.name: DeltaAmoonguss
cobblemon.species.deltaamoonguss.desc: Though not always malicious in nature, they offer to shield Pokemon from the rain using their arms only to play pranks once the Pokemon's guard has dropped.
cobblemon.species.deltalitwick.name: DeltaLitwick
cobblemon.species.deltalitwick.desc: A Delta Species discovered by Aboodie. It shares its flames with others by occupying dark spaces and illuminating its surroundings.
cobblemon.species.deltalampent.name: DeltaLampent
cobblemon.species.deltalampent.desc: It has been known to appear next to children having nightmares, basking them in its warmth and eliminating all negative thoughts and emotions.
cobblemon.species.deltachandelure.name: DeltaChandelure
cobblemon.species.deltachandelure.desc: Its flames will never harm its trainer. On the contrary, being engulfed in its flames purifies both the body and soul while also increasing a person's lifespan.
cobblemon.species.deltaaxew.name: DeltaAxew
cobblemon.species.deltaaxew.desc: A Delta Species discovered by NoNameDummy. It takes large bites out of docked boats, forcing local fishermen to invest in boats made of extremely strong metal.
cobblemon.species.deltafraxure.name: DeltaFraxure
cobblemon.species.deltafraxure.desc: Growing bolder as it becomes stronger, it prefers to bite boats being used by fishermen. However, sometimes they are careless and are pierced by fish hooks.
cobblemon.species.deltahaxorus.name: DeltaHaxorus
