cobblemon.species.rapidashx.desc: A peaceful tempered X Pokemon. However, if it gets furious, it wraps itself in thunderclouds and triggers raging lightning storms.
cobblemon.species.storm_rapidashx.name: RapidashX
cobblemon.species.storm_rapidashx.desc1: A peaceful tempered X Pokemon. However, if it gets furious, it wraps itself in thunderclouds and triggers raging lightning storms.
cobblemon.species.rapidashstorm.name: RapidashStorm
cobblemon.species.rapidashstorm.desc: A peaceful tempered X Pokemon. However, if it gets furious, it wraps itself in thunderclouds and triggers raging lightning storms.
cobblemon.species.cacneax.name: CacneaX
cobblemon.species.cacneax.desc: Because its appearance resembles a severed head, everyone who fights this Cacnea is scared to death.
cobblemon.species.cacturnex.name: CacturneX
cobblemon.species.cacturnex.desc: Its internal body is made of a straw-like material. It shoots its needles to cast cursed spell against enemies.
cobblemon.species.swirlixx.name: SwirlixX
cobblemon.species.swirlixx.desc: The appealing sweet fragrance it releases vaguely resembles that of Leppa Berries. Behind its delicious appearence lies an acid filling.
cobblemon.species.slurpuffx.name: SlurpuffX
cobblemon.species.slurpuffx.desc: Anyone who digests its sweets will feel a strong sense of nausea. The more you eat them, the bigger Slurpuff gets.
cobblemon.species.budewx.name: BudewX
cobblemon.species.budewx.desc: If you put your ear to its sound organ, you will hear the sound of a soft breathing. When it's fired up, the sound becomes deafening.
cobblemon.species.roseliax.name: RoseliaX
cobblemon.species.roseliax.desc: Using the auricular organs on its arms, Roselia amplifies the range of its voice. It can even break rocks at full volume.
cobblemon.species.roseradex.name: RoseradeX
cobblemon.species.roseradex.desc: It waves its stings to modify any sound wave at will. If it interferes with its opponent's heartbeat, it will cause them irreparable harm.
cobblemon.species.mareaniex.name: MareanieX
cobblemon.species.mareaniex.desc: When frightened, it shoots fire and sparks from the top of its head. It appears to be pretty friendly with others of the same specie.
cobblemon.species.toxapexx.name: ToxapexX
cobblemon.species.toxapexx.desc: The special toxin it secretes, when heated, shines brightly. It lures preys and traps tem, using its body as a cage.
cobblemon.species.greninjax.name: GreninjaX
cobblemon.species.greninjax.desc: It moves under cover of darkness. It throws knives of hell fire at its opponents, piercing their flesh and leaving them with atrocious burns.
cobblemon.species.mewtwox.name: MewtwoX
cobblemon.species.mewtwox.desc: It has been further genetically modified by Team Dimension. Its psychic powers are frightening.
cobblemon.species.raichux.name: RaichuX
cobblemon.species.raichux.desc: Gym Leader Surge's faithful companion, it has been brought back to life after a terrible accident. It is as fast as fragile.
cobblemon.species.bisharpx.name: BisharpX
cobblemon.species.bisharpx.desc: The Bisharp owned by Dimension Sergeant S. The consciences of both A & B's Bisharp coexist in this Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.scovilex.name: ScovileX
cobblemon.species.scovilex.desc: The Scovile owned by Dimension Colonel Dahlia. When ingested, its seeds will electrocute the body from the inside.
cobblemon.species.tyranitarx.name: TyranitarX
cobblemon.species.tyranitarx.desc: The Tyranitar owned by Dimension General Victor. It generates a defeaning buzz by vibrating its wings.
cobblemon.species.dittox.name: DittoX
cobblemon.species.dittox.desc: Following a great number of experiments, it became extremely unstable, but it developed the ability to Transform even without seeing its target.
cobblemon.species.aegislashx.name: AegislashX
cobblemon.species.aegislashx.desc: It's mentioned in legends as the companion of the First King. It uses its momentum to move at high speeds.
cobblemon.species.tapufinix.name: TapuFiniX
cobblemon.species.tapufinix.desc: One of the four beast from Xenoverse, Dragalisk's elite soldiers. It is held by the Cardinal Chua.
cobblemon.species.tapulelex.name: TapuLeleX
cobblemon.species.tapulelex.desc: One of the four beast from Xenoverse, Dragalisk's elite soldiers. It is held by the Cardinal Niva.
cobblemon.species.tapukokox.name: TapuKokoX
cobblemon.species.tapukokox.desc: One of the four beast from Xenoverse, Dragalisk's elite soldiers. It is held by the Cardinal Peyote.
cobblemon.species.tapubulux.name: TapuBuluX
cobblemon.species.tapubulux.desc: One of the four beast from Xenoverse, Dragalisk's elite soldiers. It is held by the Cardinal Abraham.
cobblemon.species.dragaliskx.name: DragaliskX
cobblemon.species.dragaliskx.desc: This being, created to replace the Dark Lord, is a concentration of pure Fury energy. Although it's smaller to the original Dragalisk, it's still very powerful and lethal.
cobblemon.species.shyleonx.name: ShyleonX
cobblemon.species.shyleonx.desc: Made of pure X Energy, this serpentine Pokemon wraps around enemies until it chokes them.
cobblemon.species.trishoutx.name: TrishoutX
cobblemon.species.trishoutx.desc: Made of pure X Energy, this Pokemon attacks its enemies ruthlessly until you knock them out.
cobblemon.species.shulongx.name: ShulongX
cobblemon.species.shulongx.desc: Made of pure X Energy, this Pokemon stuns its enemies from behind, then takes advantage of them and hits them relentlessly.
cobblemon.species.unownearth.name: UnownEarth
cobblemon.species.unownearth.desc: Their appearance resembles the symbol in Dragalisk's mouth, which is why the Cardinals have considered them profane since time immemorial.
cobblemon.species.unownxenoverse.name: UnownXenoverse
cobblemon.species.unownxenoverse.desc: For centuries they have been considered sacred as their appearance resembles the symbol on the Luxflon's gem.
cobblemon.species.fyrmite.name: Fyrmite
cobblemon.species.fyrmite.desc: They are most active during the summer and autumn, feeding on leaves and twigs. They get aggravated easily and may sting you, leaving serious burns. They launch themselves like a rocket missile towards their foes.
cobblemon.species.carabomb.name: Carabomb
cobblemon.species.carabomb.desc: They launch themselves into the air like a rocket as a quick escape from enemies. Launch speeds can reach up to 200 MPH. Do not bother Carabomb while they are asleep, they may explode on contact. In festivals, they are often used as firework displays.
cobblemon.species.bombeezle.name: Bombeezle
cobblemon.species.bombeezle.desc: Wild Bombeezle in a swarm can be dangerous. They will carry and drop Carabomb on their enemies if they feel threatened. They launch multiple flaming missiles towards their opponents, leaving them with a bad burn.
cobblemon.species.winvern.name: Winvern
cobblemon.species.winvern.desc: Found only in the northern snowy parts of Avoris, these Pokemon can withstand harsh freezing weather with the help of their thick feathers. They were actually born and raised in the cold as their nests were made with snow. So it's no surprise these Pokemon love to play in the snow.
cobblemon.species.arctalon.name: Arctalon
cobblemon.species.arctalon.desc: They can notice the tiniest of movements with their keen eyes, even from the highest of pine trees of northern Avoris. They developed thick feathers for better protection against the cold weather and their foes. Their talons are made of very hard ice that can pierce through flesh.
cobblemon.species.falcryo.name: Falcryo
cobblemon.species.falcryo.desc: Known to the Avorian people as the Protector of the North, these majestic Pokemon survey their territory from the sky. They shoot out sharp ice-covered feathers towards their targets, never missing them, even from high up in the sky due to their keen eyes and perfect aim.
cobblemon.species.springily.name: Springily
cobblemon.species.springily.desc: Floating at the water's surface, they absorb sunlight for energy. The leaf on top senses changes in the weather. During the spring season, large groups of them can be found in ponds or lakes.
cobblemon.species.faelily.name: Faelily
cobblemon.species.faelily.desc: Faelily are gentle Pokemon. They store water in their leaf-bowl, which they then purify. They share the water with Pokemon in need, and can also be seen watering plants and flowers.
cobblemon.species.skewern.name: Skewern
cobblemon.species.skewern.desc: Residing in trees, they drop down onto enemies below, hitting them with their spike. A large group of them can damage their enemy very badly. They fight with Seedot over territory.
cobblemon.species.pierceed.name: Pierceed
cobblemon.species.pierceed.desc: They developed thick armor to defend against attacks from their rival, Nuzleaf. With their piercing arms, they knock down trees where Nuzleaf reside in within their territory.
cobblemon.species.skowl.name: Skowl
cobblemon.species.skowl.desc: Active during the night, groups of Skowl gather at spots where there is supernatural activity, especially on nights of the full moon when activity is peaked. An old tale says if Skowl are on top your roof during the nights of a full moon, those who reside in the house will be cursed with misfortunes.
cobblemon.species.owlminous.name: Owlminous
cobblemon.species.owlminous.desc: Being caught in the piercing gaze of an Owlminous will leave you paralyzed in fear. They say their soulless glares are them envisioning your demise. Before you can react they disappear into the pitch black sky. They are known as omens of unfortunate events yet to come.
cobblemon.species.mouskrow.name: Mouskrow
cobblemon.species.mouskrow.desc: Stumbling upon a Mouskrow community, you will find burrows in which they live in. To avoid getting lost, they create trails around their area. They have trails leading to other Mouskrow communities to assist each other with delivering food and supplies. Their thick coats turn white in the winter so they can blend in with the snow to hide from enemies.
cobblemon.species.mousummit.name: Mousummit
cobblemon.species.mousummit.desc: They travel along mountains while carrying their young on their back to search for food and shelter. They mark their paths with their scent so they do not get lost. Their young like to stay under their belly for warmth.
cobblemon.species.stumple.name: Stumple
cobblemon.species.stumple.desc: The sticky sap that drips from Stumple's nose is incredibly bitter to humans, but is considered a delicacy among Bug-type Mons. It has trouble running from them on account of its stubby legs.
cobblemon.species.grample.name: Grample
cobblemon.species.grample.desc: The length and density of its mustache-shaped sap is an indicator of its age. More mature Grample are even known to have lengthy beards and a sweeter sap.
cobblemon.species.echomori.name: Echomori
cobblemon.species.echomori.desc: It's been studied that the sounds produced from Echomori can reach 140 Decibels. A group of Echomori can sound like a thunderstorm. Their sounds can echo as far as hundreds of miles. They are fascinated by the sounds of music and will buzz along with the rhythm. They are often found gathered at music festivals or concerts.
cobblemon.species.sipsap.name: Sipsap
cobblemon.species.sipsap.desc: They can trace the scent of a Grample's sweet sap from miles away. A group of Sipsap will travel nonstop until they find the sap.
cobblemon.species.ransap.name: Ransap
cobblemon.species.ransap.desc: Ransap have a rivalry with Ursaring, as they prevent Ransap from eating their favorite treat: the sweet sap of Grample. They grow feral if deprived of the sap for too long. Eating the sap will cause them to go into a frenzy.
cobblemon.species.berricutie.name: Berricutie
cobblemon.species.berricutie.desc: Berricutie grows the most sweet and tart berries. The happier they are, the sweeter and tarter the berries grow. They're great for fruit salads and smoothies, perfect for a hot summer day.
cobblemon.species.frutanista.name: Frutanista
cobblemon.species.frutanista.desc: Frutanista grows a wide variety of fruits that vary by their mood. Their fruits are the most delicious when they are at their happiest. They like to offer their fruits to their trainers.
cobblemon.species.grabbit.name: Grabbit
cobblemon.species.grabbit.desc: Their sticky webbing can latch onto anything. They hide in dark areas, waiting to snatch food and other items from passersby.
cobblemon.species.frobber.name: Frobber
cobblemon.species.frobber.desc: They lurk in dark areas, waiting for prey to snare with their sticky webbed hands. Their toxin-laced webs progressively poisons their foes.
cobblemon.species.attraknid.name: Attraknid
cobblemon.species.attraknid.desc: Attraknid's webs are coated with an irresistible sweet scent which lures and traps prey. The aroma hypnotizes their prey into becoming their helper.
cobblemon.species.malevoness.name: Malevoness
cobblemon.species.malevoness.desc: Attraknid's webs are coated with an irresistible sweet scent which lures and traps prey. The aroma hypnotizes their prey into becoming their helper.
cobblemon.species.picocacto.name: Picocacto
cobblemon.species.picocacto.desc: Groups of wild Picocacto guard and protect their territory from invaders. With its perfect aim and timing, it shoots spikes at any threat it sees.
cobblemon.species.desperogue.name: Desperogue
cobblemon.species.desperogue.desc: It shoots multiple spikes at once, never missing its target. Desperogue pair up with a Desperasca to fight for territory and food in desert areas.
cobblemon.species.desperasca.name: Desperasca
cobblemon.species.desperasca.desc: It skillfully delivers powerful kicks and blows on its foe, surely knocking them out. After knocking them out, it leaves a kiss mark on them as a warning sign to others.
cobblemon.species.aridart.name: Aridart
cobblemon.species.aridart.desc: Found in the hot deserts of Avoris, these Pokemon adapted to the harsh living conditions and are able to survive without food or water for months. With the skillful use of their limbs they easily dash across rocky terrains and even through deep sand at high speeds. They can outspeed almost any of their enemies.
cobblemon.species.territhorn.name: Territhorn
cobblemon.species.territhorn.desc: It burrows itself in sand to keep cool, while also waiting for prey. When prey approaches, it shakes the ground vigorously to trap it in the sand.
cobblemon.species.wrecktonic.name: Wrecktonic
cobblemon.species.wrecktonic.desc: It burrows itself in sand to keep cool, while also waiting for prey. When prey approaches, it shakes the ground vigorously to trap it in the sand.
cobblemon.species.elescent.name: Elescent
cobblemon.species.elescent.desc: The berries they eat produce a sweet aroma. Unfortunately, this also attracts predators. But they've managed to produce a highly strong aroma that makes the air around them unbreathable.
cobblemon.species.aromaphant.name: Aromaphant
cobblemon.species.aromaphant.desc: The reason why the air in Avoris is so clean is because Aromaphant also acts as an air purifier by filtering it through its nose. The aroma it produces varies by the berries it consumes. Their aroma is also collected to make expensive perfumes.
cobblemon.species.madambrella.name: Madambrella
cobblemon.species.madambrella.desc: Being sensitive to sunlight, they carry parasols for protection. They spend the night collecting and wearing valuable items of those that were once living.
cobblemon.species.avorianmaractus.name: AvorianMaractus
cobblemon.species.avorianmaractus.desc: Once every fall, groups of this Pokemon gather and dance in unison throughout the entire night. Other Ghost-type Pokemon are invited to dance along with them. The bone-chilling rattling in their hollow bodies is enough to paralyze adults with fear.
cobblemon.species.maracabre.name: Maracabre
cobblemon.species.maracabre.desc: They dance all night as a way of honoring the departed. It is said these Pokemon help wandering spirits find their way to visit their living relatives. The trail of petals they leave guide them back home to the world of spirits.
cobblemon.species.cacotile.name: Cacotile
cobblemon.species.cacotile.desc: Traveling through the rough terrains of Avoris, you're likely to encounter Cacotile. They store water in their tails and provide water to those in need. These carefree Pokemon are usually friendly to strangers, as long as they don't mess with their habitat.
cobblemon.species.tankodile.name: Tankodile
cobblemon.species.tankodile.desc: Their bodies can expand to store up to 300 gallons of water. The flower on their back spins as it shoots water from their tails. Many are used by locals for water transport purposes.
cobblemon.species.pyramud.name: Pyramud
cobblemon.species.pyramud.desc: Due to the intense heat on their soft moist bodies, they adapted to building their triangle-shaped shells using mud. A Pyramud without its shell will dry up under the sun in minutes.
cobblemon.species.pyradoom.name: Pyradoom
cobblemon.species.pyradoom.desc: Hiding its lower self in the sand, the gold bits on its shell shine to attract curious prey. As prey approaches, it quickly grabs them and drags them under the sand.
cobblemon.species.avorianmrmime.name: AvorianMrMime
cobblemon.species.avorianmrmime.desc: It combines dancing with boxing, clowning on its opponents to frustrate them. Then it delivers powerful strikes to knock them out. Its sweet aroma is known to make foes dizzy.
cobblemon.species.avorianroselia.name: AvorianRoselia
cobblemon.species.avorianroselia.desc: It flaunts its glowing flowers while dancing in a flaming manner. It has adapted to transforming solar light energy into chemical energy that ignites when it comes into contact with air.
cobblemon.species.bublit.name: Bublit
cobblemon.species.bublit.desc: When Bublit is happy, it emits a warm, vivid light from its body. The dimmer the light, the more unhappy or unwell the Bublit is. On occasion, massive gatherings of Bublit are encountered, resulting in swathes of ocean lit up at night.
cobblemon.species.nautilite.name: Nautilite
cobblemon.species.nautilite.desc: Electrical charges produced in its body propel it and allow it to sustain flight on its long, blanket-like tentacles. They seemingly communicate via a pattern of flashes from their eyes.
cobblemon.species.tentalcyon.name: Tentalcyon
cobblemon.species.tentalcyon.desc: Tentalcyon tend to be rather aloof and elusive. Though usually solitary, they've been noted to gather during thunderstorms, swooping around and feeding on the electrical energy. Their cloak-like tentacles pulsate with colours in a mesmerising manner, which they use to stun their enemies and escape.
cobblemon.species.friney.name: Friney
cobblemon.species.friney.desc: Friney's tapered, aerodynamic body makes it an excellent swimmer. They love to challenge other Pokemon to races, effortlessly taking advantage of the ocean currents to gain the upper hand.
cobblemon.species.ripplier.name: Ripplier
cobblemon.species.swordier.name: Swordier
cobblemon.species.swordier.desc: Swordier's nose grew so long that it broke off. Now, it wields the sharp blade as a sword. Whenever a Swordier comes across another of its kind, they will bow, and battle each other. It is dangerous to try to intervene.
cobblemon.species.nomstar.name: Nomstar
cobblemon.species.nomstar.desc: Nomstar are insatiable eaters that can't resist biting everything they come across. Much to their frustration, their teeth are rubbery and can barely penetrate anything. The end result is a drooling mess.
cobblemon.species.disastar.name: Disastar
cobblemon.species.disastar.desc: Its personality is as prickly as its body. It spends most of its days eating, as it becomes very irritable and inconsolable the hungrier it gets. Its mood only improves when it has bonded with a Trainer.
cobblemon.species.ferossicle.name: Ferossicle
cobblemon.species.ferossicle.desc: It has fed so much that it has become large and sluggish. Using the mouth on its stomach, it can swallow prey many times its own size. Should you stumble across a cave full of treasure and bones - it's most likely a Ferossicle lair.
cobblemon.species.planten.name: Planten
cobblemon.species.planten.desc: Millions of Planten fill the Oceane region, and feed its many inhabitants. During summer, they become hyperactive and dye the seas a bright green colour.
cobblemon.species.handren.name: Handren
cobblemon.species.handren.desc: The green hand-like goo that covers Handren is loaded with life-promoting nutrients, keeping the core alive. This goo seems to be made up of many tiny Planten.
cobblemon.species.digdog.name: Digdog
cobblemon.species.digdog.desc: Digdogs can be found lying either beneath or right on top of huge sand piles. They're incredibly lax, and are known to be unresponsive to any physical stimuli when asleep.
cobblemon.species.groundhound.name: Groundhound
cobblemon.species.groundhound.desc: It spends the daytime sleeping, but awakens during the night and traverses wide swathes of the ocean floor to track down food. It has an incredible sense of smell that can locate food from 5km away.
cobblemon.species.sweal.name: Sweal
cobblemon.species.sweal.desc: Sweal spend most of their entire lives sleeping. The coat covering them starts off white but darkens as they age - it is extremely soft and highly sought after.
cobblemon.species.fleezer.name: Fleezer
cobblemon.species.fleezer.desc: Fleezer slam their heads against ice to break it up, their silky coat absorbing the impact. The value of Fleezer fur was once so highly prized that they adapted to life in the icy seas to escape predation.
cobblemon.species.swirlsea.name: Swirlsea
cobblemon.species.swirlsea.desc: Swirlsea can untangle their head tentacles and use them to wrap and strangle their prey. Although their venom is still weak, their barbs are as bad as a bee sting.
cobblemon.species.spirashell.name: Spirashell
cobblemon.species.spirashell.desc: Spirashell rapidly spins in place and buries itself into the sea bed to wait for evolution. Sometimes they are dug up by collectors, only to suffer a nasty sting.
cobblemon.species.sealestial.name: Sealestial
cobblemon.species.sealestial.desc: It moves gracefully like a dancer but also has a dark side. After stinging its prey and paralyzing it, it proceeds to slowly swallow it alive.
cobblemon.species.urchum.name: Urchum
cobblemon.species.urchum.desc: Venomous spines line its body. It is only vulnerable if all its spines break, although they grow back.
cobblemon.species.urtichum.name: Urtichum
cobblemon.species.urtichum.desc: If all its spines are broken off, it can release a cloud of poison from its posterior.
cobblemon.species.parrosea.name: Parrosea
cobblemon.species.parrosea.desc: Parrosea's gills are so large that it can use them for short periods of flight. It's favourite food is Coralony, though they rely on their parents to feed them it.
cobblemon.species.nauticaw.name: Nauticaw
cobblemon.species.nauticaw.desc: Hardened scales adorn the top of Seaparrot's head, which it uses to headbutt wildly when enraged. The gills have grown so large that they can produce strong gusts of wind.
cobblemon.species.coronacaw.name: Coronacaw
cobblemon.species.coronacaw.desc: The Coronacaw with the largest crest will lead the colony. Although seemingly fragile, the crests can withstand tremendous force and make good shields. Shards that break off become 'sea glass' and wash up on beaches, and are very popular with collectors.
cobblemon.species.reefam.name: Reefam
cobblemon.species.reefam.desc: There is always one leader and two followers. The followers are completely dependant - should they lose their leader, they will wander aimlessly and starve. Two forms have been discovered in the Oceane region.
cobblemon.species.appendash.name: Appendash
cobblemon.species.appendash.desc: It travels for miles across the ocean seeking beautiful fish to attach to its body. If it loses its group of followers it will grow incredibly weak and die out of vanity. The followers will put their lives on the line to defend Appendash.
cobblemon.species.nutsy.name: Nutsy
cobblemon.species.nutsy.desc: It leads a relaxed lifestyle, aimlessly letting currents carry it away without a sole concern. Its not unusual for a Nutsy to have travelled through hundreds of kilometres in a lifetime.
cobblemon.species.jawson.name: Jawson
cobblemon.species.jawson.desc: Jawson are constantly growing new teeth and replacing the current ones. The teeth shed have been used by the people of Oceane going back hundreds of years as primitive cooking utensils for slicing and chopping.
cobblemon.species.merbebi.name: Merbebi
cobblemon.species.merbebi.desc: Though small and weak, it exhibits a secret talent. In brief moments of distress, its able to control its appearance to become almost transparent. Unfortunately, it doesn't have full control over it.
cobblemon.species.shrimpnotize.name: Shrimpnotize
cobblemon.species.shrimpnotize.desc: It moves in an irregular, dance-like manner. Combined with its body patterns, it never fails to complete entrance any potential threats or prey. Once vulnerable, it unleashes a volley of punches from its spring-powered arms.
cobblemon.species.phantamaron.name: Phantamaron
cobblemon.species.phantamaron.desc: It moves in an irregular, dance-like manner. As it dances, it phases in and out of view and leaves any potential threats or prey frozen in fear. While distracted, it siphons off their life energy without them even realising.
cobblemon.species.rayscal.name: Rayscal
cobblemon.species.rayscal.desc: They make their home in deep, ocean trenches lined with geothermal vents. The sight of Rayscal swooping in the darkness among the burning towers is thought to have inspired our concept of hell.
cobblemon.species.rayth.name: Rayth
cobblemon.species.rayth.desc: They often command large groups of normally mischievous Rayscal to do more sinister things like attack ships. Their horns are burning hot to the touch.
cobblemon.species.minusplus.name: Minusplus
cobblemon.species.minusplus.desc: Whilst drifting on warm currents they will often bump into others, their psychic power drawing them together and getting stuck. The longest chain ever found had over 100 individuals!
cobblemon.species.siphonowar.name: Siphonowar
cobblemon.species.siphonowar.desc: Since merging, their psychic power is tripled - but now finds itself prone to sudden mood swings. A touch from one of its fingers is enough to see all your memories and thoughts.
cobblemon.species.uphonowar.name: Uphonowar
cobblemon.species.uphonowar.desc: Upon evolving, they're drawn deep into the abyss. Some believe there is a signal calling to them, but the source has never been discovered. Entire colonies have been discovered moving the same way as if controlled by single host.
cobblemon.species.cachaleen.name: Cachaleen
cobblemon.species.cachaleen.desc: Its head is cushioned by such a large layer of blubber that it cannot feel any impact. It crashes into icebergs and gobbles up the surprised creatures that were taking refuge below.
cobblemon.species.submalot.name: Submalot
cobblemon.species.submalot.desc: One of the largest living Pokemon, it's also one of the rarest. Individuals are often found with large, suction-like scars, a sign of terrifying battles with giant Pokemon deep in the depths. The owner of these tentacles has yet to be identified.
cobblemon.species.porpice.name: Porpice
cobblemon.species.porpice.desc: The two, dense pads on their back function as buoyancy devices. Should it fall ill, these will cease to function and Porpice won't be able to swim upright.
cobblemon.species.balacier.name: Balacier
cobblemon.species.balacier.desc: A filter feeder, it inhales water and blows it out in the form of snow from its blow-hole. Because of this, their pods are always enshrouded in misty, underwater snowstorms. The cold surroundings freeze their prey and leave them unable to escape their giant, gaping mouths.
cobblemon.species.armacle.name: Armacle
cobblemon.species.armacle.desc: Armacle are never found alone. They attach themselves to the underside of boats, reefs, or even other Pokemon. When approached, they violently launch volleys of sand to defend their territory.
cobblemon.species.barbarrage.name: Barbarrage
cobblemon.species.barbarrage.desc: Barbarrage no longer relies on being attached to others and is free to navigate the ocean. Its cannon-like head is able to rotate a full 360 degrees, which it uses to launch attacks with perfect precision.
cobblemon.species.snaptrap.name: Snaptrap
cobblemon.species.snaptrap.desc: Snaptrap are masters of stealth; they will bury their bodies flat out under the sand, completely still. With their pink fleshy middle exposed, they snap shut on curious intruders.
cobblemon.species.snaggrip.name: Snaggrip
cobblemon.species.snaggrip.desc: The jaws of its shell are strong enough to slice a truck in half. When threatened, they shut closed tight and are impossible to reopen by human force alone.
cobblemon.species.merluscious.name: Merluscious
cobblemon.species.spunch.name: Spunch
cobblemon.species.spunch.desc: By filling its fists with water, it can expand its punches to incredible proportions. Unfortunately, they still cause little damage. It's true power lies in absorbing damage within its springy body.
cobblemon.species.upporecut.name: Upporecut
cobblemon.species.upporecut.desc: Upporecut's body has hardened in areas due to rigorous training and battle experience, but it still can absorb water. It's punches cause far more damage, with enough power to cause bruising on contact.
cobblemon.species.twintacle.name: Twintacle
cobblemon.species.twintacle.desc: Due to their lack of limbs, Twintacle use their powerful twin-tails in battle. Whipping them around, they can knock out opponents either with the twin-tails themselves or using its body as a flail.
cobblemon.species.undallure.name: Undallure
cobblemon.species.undallure.desc: Undallure are springy and love to cheer on their teammates while they battle. Their head has tendrils that can hold Pokemon in place using sticky goo they excrete, and can even extend to whip them at others.
cobblemon.species.ghoubloon.name: Ghoubloon
cobblemon.species.ghoubloon.desc: It dislikes human contact, so it seeks the most remote, secret hideaways. Unfortunately, this just makes them more sought after by treasure hunters. It's able to create coins, but they are only illusions which fade away in a day.
cobblemon.species.drenchest.name: Drenchest
cobblemon.species.drenchest.desc: Expeditions to find its hoard of valuables invariably end in disaster. Some say they form from the souls of pirates who lost everything trying to strike it rich.
cobblemon.species.medissin.name: Medissin
cobblemon.species.medissin.desc: Medissin are always found wrapped around a bone-like rod. Should the rod be taken from it, it will fall ill and fade away. So will whoever took the rod.
cobblemon.species.mambaboo.name: Mambaboo
cobblemon.species.mambaboo.desc: Mambaboo channel their Ghost powers through the gem in their rod. Different variations of Mambaboo have been found with different coloured Gems. Their power is so great that they have been known to temporarily revive dead brethen to aid them in battle.
cobblemon.species.floink.name: Floink
cobblemon.species.floink.desc: It's body is squishy and light, and completely defenceless. Were it not for their popularity with children, they would probably long be extinct. A Floink preservation society exists to ensure the survival of their species.
cobblemon.species.hypnode.name: Hypnode
cobblemon.species.hypnode.desc: The two attachments atop its head are constantly twitching and sensing the surroundings. It is incredibly shy and will teleport at the slightest opportunity.
cobblemon.species.cupscape.name: Cupscape
cobblemon.species.cupscape.desc: Cupscapes are small, sparkling pieces of reef that are generally very docile and passive. They hardly move, and typically let other lifeforms take refuge on top of them.
cobblemon.species.nodescape.name: Nodescape
cobblemon.species.nodescape.desc: When a Hypnode has taken residence inside a Cupscape, it evolves into Nodescape. The Cupscape always appears to let the Hypnode take residence, but its partnership with it is considered parasitic.
cobblemon.species.reefazoid.name: Reefazoid
cobblemon.species.reefazoid.desc: The Cupscape itself has evolved, and grows a much larger exterior. The Hypnode takes advantage of this and makes it into a pilot-able armor for itself. Its rock-hard coral surface is considered unbreakable.
cobblemon.species.amusea.name: Amusea
cobblemon.species.finfetti.name: Finfetti
cobblemon.species.harlefin.name: Harlefin
cobblemon.species.ziptide.name: Ziptide
cobblemon.species.ziptide.desc: Ziptide live for speed. They're usually seen zig zagging wherever you can find mad waves, bro. Taking a ziptide is harder said than done, if you're even fast enough to catch one.
cobblemon.species.moreen.name: Moreen
cobblemon.species.moreen.desc: Moreen are always competing for who has the biggest front and back fins - the bigger they are the more beautiful they consider them.
cobblemon.species.salpackin.name: Salpackin
cobblemon.species.salpackin.desc: Apart from using it as jet propulsion to provide movement, Salpackin in the Ammo Formation will continue to store water causing their tough bodies to stiffen via high turgor pressure. These pokemon always occur in swarms.
cobblemon.species.eletta.name: Eletta
cobblemon.species.eletta.desc: Eletta born from messages lost to the tide emerge with personalities reflecting the letter's contents. It is said they continue to drift along the tides, longing to find their recipients and finally deliver the tidings no matter how long it takes.
cobblemon.species.sentresha.name: Sentresha
cobblemon.species.sentresha.desc: Sentresha are obsessed with reaching their goal, be it a person or place. They set sail in their makeshift bottle-ship, and zap anything deemed an obstacle in their way.
cobblemon.species.origalleon.name: Origalleon
cobblemon.species.origalleon.desc: Origalleon have let go of their obsessions, instead deciding to spend the rest of its days at sea offering aid to pokemon and people alike. But should they ever find what they were searching for, they pledge to be by its side forever.
cobblemon.species.tatatot.name: Tatatot
cobblemon.species.drumbum.name: Drumbum
cobblemon.species.symphonia.name: Symphonia
cobblemon.species.camozoic.name: Camozoic
cobblemon.species.churlice.name: Churlice
cobblemon.species.churlice.desc: Churlice's Limbtacles were a bright red-orange when heat coursed through them. When it wasn't feeding, this ancient Pokemon would hide amongst the rocks hoping to be left alone.
cobblemon.species.torchurn.name: Torchurn
cobblemon.species.torchurn.desc: In ancient times, these Pokemon would anchor themselves close to the shore partially-submerged. Torchurn used sunlight to enhance their flames whilst incubating with enough intensity to breach its hardened Limbtacle shell, which doubled as a deterrent to predators.
cobblemon.species.altarath.name: Altarath
cobblemon.species.altarath.desc: Believed to exude flames that even the seas couldn't fully contain, Altarath were only found in relatively inhospitable waters of its time. It is debated to this day if they were attracted to these areas, or if they made them that way with their powers.
cobblemon.species.topsee.name: Topsee
cobblemon.species.topsee.desc: In the distant past, these Pokemon were a common source of light on the seafloor. They used their psychic abilities to hoodwink other Pokemon drawn to their light into protecting or ignoring them while they amble about.
cobblemon.species.hallucid.name: Hallucid
cobblemon.species.hallucid.desc: Through complicated motions and shifting the color of the lights emitted from its tentacles, this ancient Pokemon was believed to have enhanced and expanded its psychic influence to confound all the known senses.
cobblemon.species.spectrance.name: Spectrance
cobblemon.species.spectrance.desc: By rapidly shifting colours, this Pokemon over-stimulates opponents until they're incapacitated. In its time, Spectrance kept hypnotised victims in strategic locations around its den, allowing them to move only to fend off invaders in its place.
cobblemon.species.grasstache.name: Grasstache
cobblemon.species.papalgae.name: Papalgae
cobblemon.species.lavrassire.name: Lavrassire
cobblemon.species.mamagma.name: Mamagma
cobblemon.species.kellyp.name: Kellyp
cobblemon.species.kellyp.desc: Its scales give off a breathtakingly vibrant hue when touched by sunlight. Despite being a highly-coveted artistic resource, the method of incorporating the scales of Kellyp has thus far been a tightly-kept trade secret among only a few distinguished lineages.
cobblemon.species.ferrush.name: Ferrush
cobblemon.species.ferrush.desc: Ferrush seemingly defy known laws of physics through their ability to run on either side of the ocean surface with unmatched deftness. Though they primarily roam the photic zone, encounters with these fierce Pokemon on land have been documented.
cobblemon.species.bwobble.name: Bwobble
cobblemon.species.bwobble.desc: Bwobble are immediately abandoned at birth and never know their parents. Their plump, rubbery bodies protect them from the abuse they constantly receive as they wander aimlessly.
cobblemon.species.noxical.name: Noxical
cobblemon.species.noxical.desc: The struggle endured as a Bwobble has made it unusually strong. Although their bodies are now armored and able to handle a lot more, it's still fairly weak and suceptible.
cobblemon.species.venomenace.name: Venomenace
cobblemon.species.venomenace.desc: Fuelled by an unforgiving rage, it's driven by the revenge of every memory of suffering. Using its large, broad wings it effortlessly flies across the depths and breathes a volley of poison miasma on those down below.
cobblemon.species.octomuray.name: Octomuray
cobblemon.species.octomuray.desc: Octomuray was discovered by the Professor of the Onnuri region.
cobblemon.species.cycaroon.name: Cycaroon
cobblemon.species.cycaroon.desc: Cycaroon have a great obsession for treasures, even founding their own crews if necessary in order to find one. Despite being quite rude, a true bond will emerge within the crew members. Cycaroon live both on land and in ocean depths, in some cases inside wrecked ships. They can swim at 200 km/h.
cobblemon.species.argoceane.name: Argoceane
cobblemon.species.argoceane.desc: It's been credited with the creation of all ocean life. Whenever there is a mass extinction, it pours out with recovery and diversification. Its large, cornucopian shell is always brimming with life energy.
cobblemon.species.dreadtyde.name: Dreadtyde
cobblemon.species.dreadtyde.desc: Feared throughout history as the cause for all mass extinctions, it seeps a red algae from its spines that dyes entire oceans red and deprives everything of life. It slumbers, biding its time until the next extinction.
cobblemon.species.abysside.name: Abysside
cobblemon.species.abysside.desc: Lord of the Underworld, Abysside can unhinge its jaws to swallow entire submarines, crew included. It wanders the deepest, darkest, most unexplored depths, endlessly hungering for drowned souls to collect.
cobblemon.species.pinecoon.name: Pinecoon
cobblemon.species.vigileaf.name: Vigileaf
cobblemon.species.enforester.name: Enforester
cobblemon.species.capillar.name: Capillar
cobblemon.species.capillar.desc: Despite their small size, Capillar have a very tough attitude and will rear up and puff out their antenna when threatened. Ancient civilizations once held festivals to honor their bravery and ornate bodies.
cobblemon.species.beacoon.name: Beacoon
cobblemon.species.beacoon.desc: Large amounts of energy stored for evolution cause Beacoon to glow slightly. Large groups of them often hang from branches, lighting the way of people and pokemon travelling through forests.
cobblemon.species.fulgoryu.name: Fulgoryu
cobblemon.species.fulgoryu.desc: They have large heads with a set of fake teeth to intimidate foes. A strange draconic power burns deep within their bodies, causing their heads, wings and underside to occasionally glow vibrantly
cobblemon.species.feebleg.name: Feebleg
cobblemon.species.feebleg.desc: Feebleg are quite timid, often hiding in dark places. Many people and pokemon are scared of their large fangs, but their bite is actually relatively weak and harmless.
cobblemon.species.webbind.name: Webbind
cobblemon.species.webbind.desc: Webbind's body is covered in incredibly sticky webbing. Large clumps of them can often be found stuck together along with various debris.
cobblemon.species.taranterror.name: Taranterror
cobblemon.species.taranterror.desc: It's always in a state of agitation, quick to deliver an extremely painful bite. The prickly hair covering its body stands on end to make it look more intimidating and can also be fired off as an attack
cobblemon.species.dorsel.name: Dorsel
cobblemon.species.dorsel.desc: Dorsel thrive in rivers, often ignored by predators because they are so small and meager. They feed primarily on the dead skin of other river pokemon, who are not bothered by it in the slightest.
cobblemon.species.riverous.name: Riverous
cobblemon.species.riverous.desc: Riverous have a short temper and large appetite, often dominating rivers and lakes to the point of complete desolation. They can even chase prey outside of water for a short time.
cobblemon.species.stalacbite.name: Stalacbite
cobblemon.species.stalagoyle.name: Stalagoyle
cobblemon.species.cloddle.name: Cloddle
cobblemon.species.cloddle.desc: Its body is soft yet durable due to a core deep inside of compressed, ever-hardening earth. It has an easygoing temperment and can commonly be seen in quarries and dig sites.
cobblemon.species.temperock.name: Temperock
cobblemon.species.temperock.desc: The core is even stronger than before and the outside has also hardened but become somewhat brittle. They harden themselves both physically and mentally by secluding themselves deep in cramped caves.
cobblemon.species.diamondure.name: Diamondure
cobblemon.species.diamondure.desc: Their indestructibly-hard heads polished to perfection captivate lovers of both toughness and beauty. It's believed that they all have one small structural weak point, the position of which is unique to each Diamondure.
cobblemon.species.claggy.name: Claggy
cobblemon.species.claggy.desc: Its shape and demeanor are very similar to Scraggy. It builds mud and sharp twigs into a nest around itself to feel protected and confident. If the nest is destroyed, it flees in a panic
cobblemon.species.scrachty.name: Scrachty
cobblemon.species.scrachty.desc: As long as the nest of mud and thorns around its lower half is in good shape, it struts around confidently and carefree. When it's not spending time maintaining its nest, it tends to the comb on its head instead.
cobblemon.species.meansprout.name: Meansprout
cobblemon.species.meansprout.desc: Meansprout are laughably weak in battle, so they instead toy with foes psychologically, sprouting up and whispering behind their back or using vines to trip them up.
cobblemon.species.meanstalk.name: Meanstalk
cobblemon.species.meanstalk.desc: They constantly do things like covertly stealing or misplacing people's belongings or using their vines to tamper with outdoor equipment. They yield beans that are extremely bitter, said to be indicative of their true inner rage and malice.
cobblemon.species.sinistalk.name: Sinistalk
cobblemon.species.sinistalk.desc: Sinistalk are extremely cruel and tricky fighters, adept at dodging due to their highly flexible bodies. They delight in wrapping foes tightly in their thorny vines and watching them suffer. They oddly dislike bright sunlight and prefer to slowly creep and overtake objects in the shade or at night.
cobblemon.species.boowee.name: Boowee
cobblemon.species.stridoar.name: Stridoar
cobblemon.species.byteau.name: Byteau
cobblemon.species.sharpig.name: Sharpig
cobblemon.species.sharpig.desc: It constantly rubs up against trees and rocks to keep the spines on its back sharpened. Despite being small and clumsy, it has a wild and fearless attitude.
cobblemon.species.boarazer.name: Boarazer
cobblemon.species.boarazer.desc: It has an extremely short temper and a wild one should be met with the utmost caution. Once is starts charging, anything in its path will be torn to shreds.
cobblemon.species.hoofin.name: Hoofin
cobblemon.species.cervidrake.name: Cervidrake
cobblemon.species.wardrab.name: Wardrab
cobblemon.species.wardrab.desc: Wardrab are said to be created by spirits possessing old clothes. They tend to avoid contact with people, although their somewhat cute appearance has caused a resurgence of antique fashion trends in some places.
cobblemon.species.menasuit.name: Menasuit
cobblemon.species.menasuit.desc: Menasuit often lurk in places like abandoned houses and dark alleys. They never attack, but rather stalk people persistently and feed off of their fear and uncertainty. If you're alone and see a figure out of the corner of your eye, chances are it's a Menasuit.
cobblemon.species.dapperition.name: Dapperition
cobblemon.species.dapperition.desc: Dapperition's body is made of shadows, allowing it to move freely just about anywhere. Don't be fooled by their armless appearance. They can easily hypnotize someone using the pattern on their chest and suddenly form eerie arms to snatch them up.
cobblemon.species.oddancer.name: Oddancer
cobblemon.species.dancentric.name: Dancentric
cobblemon.species.plumplasm.name: Plumplasm
cobblemon.species.plumplasm.desc: Plumplasm are very messy eaters, loving any food they can get their hands on. One can see the shadow of whatever they eat through their bodies, slowly disappearing as it gets digested
cobblemon.species.phantomnom.name: Phantomnom
cobblemon.species.phantomnom.desc: Phantomnom can store many things inside their bodies, but anything that get stored becomes covered in drool. This drool is incredibly slimy and gives anyone touched by it extreme chills and a feeling of immense disgust and nausea, even if they felt perfectly fine beforehand.
cobblemon.species.varitasianbonsly.name: VaritasianBonsly
cobblemon.species.varitasianbonsly.desc: If its body gets too damp, it will die. So, in a process reminiscent of sweating, its eyes expel moisture.
cobblemon.species.varitasiansudowoodo.de: Despite appearing to be a tree, its body is closer to rocks and stones. It's so popular with the elderly that there's a magazine devoted to this Pokemon. Fans obsess over the particular length and angle of its arms.
cobblemon.species.sudoferno.name: Sudoferno
cobblemon.species.varitasianmimejr.name: VaritasianMimeJr
cobblemon.species.varitasianmrmime.name: VaritasianMrMime
cobblemon.species.mrcrime.name: MrCrime
cobblemon.species.germite.name: Germite
cobblemon.species.germite.desc: Germite are believed to be a particular type of germ that eventually evolved into a pokemon. They can fire off the growths on their body, coating whatever they hit in gooey slime that causes mild sickness if touched.
cobblemon.species.gastropox.name: Gastropox
cobblemon.species.gastropox.desc: They look for companionship but unfortunately spread sickness wherever they go. Their flat, mucus-coated bodies allow them to slip into many places where they're usually not wanted.
cobblemon.species.agitwin.name: Agitwin
cobblemon.species.agitwin.desc: It is made up of two separate entities that share a psychic link. Despite this, they oddly constantly act against each other in a struggle for dominance.
cobblemon.species.naeglerium.name: Naeglerium
cobblemon.species.naeglerium.desc: Naeglerium has the ability to psychically feed on thoughts and emotions. It also often acts very unpredictably. Because of these qualities, long-term exposure to Naeglerium is usually not recommended.
cobblemon.species.dicell.name: Dicell
cobblemon.species.minicule.name: Minicule
cobblemon.species.minicule.desc: A strange pokemon that can freely alter its own size. They are extremely social with their own kind, almost as if drawn to each other by some unknown force.
cobblemon.species.atomix.name: Atomix
cobblemon.species.atomix.desc: Atomix possess a body structure that heavily resembles atoms; researches are being committed on whether this is simply a coincident or something else.
cobblemon.species.kwiklik.name: Kwiklik
cobblemon.species.kwiklik.desc: It was originally created as a means of transporting data across cyberspace. Since then, it unfortunately became popular with unsavory types due to its ability to slip into hard to reach places, both physical and digital.
cobblemon.species.binarray.name: Binarray
cobblemon.species.binarray.desc: Tampering from various parties caused an unexpected evolution in its code. It eats data and gives off a powerful electric shock which makes it very problematic in technology-heavy areas.
cobblemon.species.purradox.name: Purradox
cobblemon.species.purradox.desc: Purradox were originally created as an artificial domestic companion pokemon. However at some point, the data used to create them became corrupted and the project was abandoned. They eventually escaped and multiplied, exhibiting very strange and erratic behavior due to the corruption like inexplicably vanishing in an instant.
cobblemon.species.varitasianimpidimp.des: Though incapable of flight, the large wing-like tuft of hair on Varitan Impidimp's head makes it more aerodynamic and able to leap between tall trees. By rapidly swinging its head around, it can whip up somewhat strong gusts of wind.
cobblemon.species.varitasianmorgrem.name: VaritasianMorgrem
cobblemon.species.varitasianmorgrem.desc: Varitan Morgrem's hair has adapted to act as wings, allowing it to fly for short periods of time. It delights in swooping down suddenly and scaring people.
cobblemon.species.grimpire.name: Grimpire
cobblemon.species.grimpire.desc: The majority of Grimpire's hair acts as wings, easily carrying its light skinny frame. It swoops down and ensnares foes in its hair, magically draining their life force. It dislikes the sun for some reason and often hides away during the day.
cobblemon.species.varitasianhatenna.name: VaritasianHatenna
cobblemon.species.varitasianhatenna.desc: Hatenna of Varitas adapted to living in desert climates. The tassel of hair on the top of its head is very sensitive to changes in the wind. When confronted, it uses its other two hair tassels to whip up sand and escape.
cobblemon.species.varitasianhattrem.name: VaritasianHattrem
cobblemon.species.varitasianhattrem.desc: Using the braids on its head, it pummels foes to get them to quiet down. One blow from those braids would knock out a professional boxer.
cobblemon.species.hatterage.name: Hatterage
cobblemon.species.hatterage.desc: If you're too loud around it, you risk being torn apart by the claws on its tentacle. This Pokemon is also known as the Forest Witch.
cobblemon.species.varitasianmantyke.name: VaritasianMantyke
cobblemon.species.varitasianmantyke.desc: It adapted to hiding on the seafloor rather than leaping out of water. Unlike the more common form of Mantyke, it can often be quite shy.
cobblemon.species.varitasianmantine.name: VaritasianMantine
cobblemon.species.varitasianmantine.desc: It half-buries itself in the sandy seafloor as camouflage. It can move surprisingly quickly through the sand and its tail developed a special barbed tip for attacking quickly while staying hidden.
cobblemon.species.knifish.name: Knifish
cobblemon.species.pisword.name: Pisword
cobblemon.species.volcamone.name: Volcamone
cobblemon.species.varitasianhorsea.name: VaritasianHorsea
cobblemon.species.varitasianhorsea.desc: If Horsea senses danger, it will reflexively spray a dense black ink from its mouth and try to escape. This Pokemon swims by cleverly flapping the fin on its back.
cobblemon.species.varitasianseadra.name: VaritasianSeadra
cobblemon.species.varitasianseadra.desc: Seadra generates whirlpools by spinning its body. The whirlpools are strong enough to swallow even fishing boats. This Pokemon weakens prey with these currents, then swallows it whole.
cobblemon.species.varitasiankingdra.name: VaritasianKingdra
cobblemon.species.varitasiankingdra.desc: Kingdra lives at extreme ocean depths that are otherwise uninhabited. It has long been believed that the yawning of this Pokemon creates spiraling ocean currents.
cobblemon.species.bluega.name: Bluega
cobblemon.species.narwave.name: Narwave
cobblemon.species.bleakoat.name: Bleakoat
cobblemon.species.punchill.name: Punchill
cobblemon.species.snowbrawl.name: Snowbrawl
cobblemon.species.varitasianklink.name: VaritasianKlink
cobblemon.species.varitasianklink.desc: At the price of one minigear atrophying, it has now developed a somewhat soft, flexible outer membrane. Though it often floats, its seems to enjoy rolling along the ground, as it helps it both move faster and generate energy faster.
cobblemon.species.varitasianklang.name: VaritasianKlang
cobblemon.species.varitasianklang.desc: Given its increase in weight, Klang can now easily bowl over small obstacles with its large wheel. It can also swing either part of itself around by its joint to cause major damage.
cobblemon.species.tanklang.name: Tanklang
cobblemon.species.tanklang.desc: Varitan Klink and Klang have seemingly developed the ability to join together and create Tanklang. Upon evolving, Tanklang gains a specialized cannon attachment on its right side with a yellow core. Similarly to Klinklang's red core and spiked wheel, Tanklang stores its energy in the yellow core which can then be fired from its cannon with immense power
cobblemon.species.goopipe.name: Goopipe
cobblemon.species.goopipe.desc: Its body is made of loose sludge so it seeks refuge in old bits of pipe to give it a more solid form. It is currently being investigated if it has any kind of relation to Grimer & Muk.
cobblemon.species.piplex.name: Piplex
cobblemon.species.piplex.desc: Its main body is made up of two pipe pieces that it can freely turn in different orientations. Piplex mainly live in sewers and will link up with eachother to hide themselves from maintenance workers.
cobblemon.species.sinklutter.name: Sinklutter
cobblemon.species.sinklutter.desc: Now sporting a sink, seemingly endless sludge spews forth from it. It can fire off the sludge of its body from the top faucet with enough force to dent a ship's hull.
cobblemon.species.varitasianonix.name: VaritasianOnix
cobblemon.species.varitasianonix.desc: Onix has a magnet in its brain. It acts as a compass so that this Pokemon does not lose direction while it is tunneling. As it grows older, its body becomes increasingly rounder and smoother.
cobblemon.species.galactix.name: Galactix
cobblemon.species.galactix.desc: Galactix are made up of refined ore similar to Steelix, but their bodies are much more nimble and loosely-formed, held together primarily by a strong psychic field. Rings of pure energy form between their segments, allowing them to compress themselves and release the energy in a burst of amazing speed.
cobblemon.species.varitasiancubone.name: VaritasianCubone
cobblemon.species.varitasiancubone.desc: It wears its mother's skull on its head, so no one knows what its bare face looks like. However, it's clear that it's always crying.
cobblemon.species.varitasianmarowak.name: VaritasianMarowak
cobblemon.species.varitasianmarowak.desc: They thump their bones rhythmically to communicate among themselves. There are nearly 50 different rhythmic patterns.
cobblemon.species.marowing.name: Marowing
cobblemon.species.varitasianwobbuffet.de: It cannot attack on its own, yet its glaring tail intimidates others into doing what it says. The main body seems to be unaware of this and simply thinks it's tougher than it actually is.
cobblemon.species.dustout.name: Dustout
cobblemon.species.kirinirik.name: Kirinirik
cobblemon.species.kirinirik.desc: Kirinirik's lighter head prefers to approach situations calmly and analytically, while its darker head is much more brash and violent so they don't often get along. However, if Kirinirik's heads both focus their energy in tandem, they are capable of unleashing tremendous mystic power.
cobblemon.species.coreef.name: Coreef
cobblemon.species.smeartiste.name: Smeartiste
cobblemon.species.concealeon.name: Concealeon
cobblemon.species.concealeon.desc: It still cannot make its red stripes invisible upon evolving. However, it can now change the color of them based on its mood.
cobblemon.species.pestilint.name: Pestilint
cobblemon.species.pestilint.desc: They often live in largely populated areas, creating nests out of dust and other soft materials. These pokemon are often considered a problem because their nests can cause breathing difficulties and become a major fire hazard
cobblemon.species.carvesta.name: Carvesta
cobblemon.species.carvesta.desc: Once mistaken for Larvesta for its shape, it normally lies at the bottom of the ocean and ensnares passing prey with its tentacles. It can also propel itself backwards to skewer foes with its pointed shell
cobblemon.species.molcarona.name: Molcarona
cobblemon.species.molcarona.desc: Its shape and illuminative abilities are oddly similar to Volcarona. It appears as a hypnotically beautiful nebula in the ocean abyss as it surrounds the onlooker with its tentacles to attack
cobblemon.species.grimire.name: Grimire
cobblemon.species.grimire.desc: A creature made of mud and bones that mysteriously came to life similarly to Grimer, hence its name. Through only recently discovered, research suggests that it has actually existed before Grimer which has caused some debate over its naming.
cobblemon.species.stuk.name: Stuk
cobblemon.species.stuk.desc: Its tar-like body has seeped into the bones stuck in it which allows it to control them. It subdues prey with its clawed arm and drags them in with its other sticky arm to absorb them and add their bones to itself.
cobblemon.species.nebulull.name: Nebulull
cobblemon.species.nebulull.desc: A recently discovered extrateresstrial pokemon mistaken for Morelull. It can concentrate eletricity into the antennae on its head and fire off lasers. Scientists are still debating whether the resemblence to Morelull is truly coincidental or if Morelull is some kind of relative that adapted to life on Earth.
cobblemon.species.xenotic.name: Xenotic
cobblemon.species.xenotic.desc: It is highly intelligent and adept at tinkering with machines so it builds a special helmet to both amplify its psychic power and help it move around. Sightings of it floating through the sky were thought to be hoaxes until its relatively recent discovery.
cobblemon.species.fretal.name: Fretal
cobblemon.species.fretal.desc: A forest-dwelling pokemon that for some reason searches for a flower to cover its head with. It has an extremely reclusive and meek demeanor and becomes greatly distraught if the flower is blown off of its head.
cobblemon.species.canopeace.name: Canopeace
cobblemon.species.canopeace.desc: It has a very friendly, easygoing personality that makes it a great companion for anyone. It often sits quietly to meditate and absorb sun rays with the flowers on its head which helps its long grassy hair grow.
cobblemon.species.grassola.name: Grassola
cobblemon.species.grassola.desc: It slowly moves along the forest floor, camougoomyed among old pieces of wood. It was initially mistaken for Corsola due to the way branches sprout from it
cobblemon.species.graceola.name: Graceola
cobblemon.species.graceola.desc: They normally stay very still to absorb sunlight but every year groups of them will come together and do beautiful dances to welcome the coming of spring.
cobblemon.species.varitasianoddish.name: VaritasianOddish
cobblemon.species.varitasiangloom.name: VaritasianGloom
cobblemon.species.severm.name: Severm
cobblemon.species.severm.desc: They like to make their homes in old stumps. Because of this, they can be dangerous to Phantump if the two meet.
cobblemon.species.infesteed.name: Infesteed
cobblemon.species.infesteed.desc: Despite their gruesome appearance, they are relatively docile worms living in old wood. The worms work in tandem to puppet the wood in a way that's still not well-known to researchers.
cobblemon.species.varitasianbounsweet.de: Heavy pollution of its habitat caused it to spoil and succumb to parasites, yet it still lives on somehow. It's unknown whether it controls the worm in its head or vice versa.
cobblemon.species.varitasiansteenee.name: VaritasianSteenee
cobblemon.species.varitasiansteenee.desc: It can use the multiple worms from its head to attack foes. It has an uptight and cruel temperment so it does this often. Most stay away from it anyways because it doesn't smell particularly good.
cobblemon.species.frankensteen.name: Frankensteen
cobblemon.species.frankensteen.desc: Most of its body is hollowed out, dead plant matter using controlled worms as hair and appendages. It uses its long, sleeve-like arms to ensnare victims and slowly suck away their life force.
cobblemon.species.varitasianphantump.des: The stumps of Varitan Phantump are particularly overrun with fungus, giving them power over its growth. Though sometimes they exhibit odd behavior, believed to be an effect of the fungus.
cobblemon.species.varitasiantrevenant.de: It now appears to be fully under the control of the fungus on its body, often shambling around eerily as if being puppeted. Its only concern seems to be maintaing the fungus and spreading its spores at much as possible.
cobblemon.species.varitasianflabebe.name: VaritasianFlabebe
cobblemon.species.varitasianflabebe.desc: They collect spores and keep them on their head for various uses. They will sit quietly on mushrooms if observed but are likely to do something mischeivious if you look away.
cobblemon.species.varitasianfloette.name: VaritasianFloette
cobblemon.species.varitasianfloette.desc: It picks its favorite mushroom and uses it to shield itself from sunlight. If enraged, it swings the mushroom around madly spreading spores everywhere.
cobblemon.species.sporges.name: Sporges
cobblemon.species.sporges.desc: Sporges use the sticky fungus they wear around their necks to both ensnare prey and poison it at the same time. They often have a vain attitude despite being covered in fungus most pokemon find to be repulsive.
cobblemon.species.varitasianyamask.name: VaritasianYamask
cobblemon.species.varitasianyamask.desc: It's bound to a mirror, possibly as a punishment for extreme vanity when alive. It constantly gazes at itself, sometimes appearing to show discomfort, yet it never looks away. Legends say that the mirror has the power to steal one's soul if looked into.
cobblemon.species.mirrorigus.name: Mirrorigus
cobblemon.species.mirrorigus.desc: Mirrorigus appear as an ornate mirror that oddly doesn't seem to reflect its surroundings. Looking into one will show a person their ideal self. Once they are distracted, Mirrorigus springs to life and attacks with razor-sharp mirror shards.
cobblemon.species.varitasianswablu.name: VaritasianSwablu
cobblemon.species.varitasianswablu.desc: Living in ponds among water plants caused its cottony wings to become filled with seeds and plant matter over time. It uses its new appearance to help camouflage itself.
cobblemon.species.varitasianaltaria.name: VaritasianAltaria
cobblemon.species.varitasianaltaria.desc: As they swim, their cottony wings soak up water which helps sustain them. Many people enjoy their company and set up special ponds dedicated to housing them and feeding them.
cobblemon.species.varitasianporygon.name: VaritasianPorygon
cobblemon.species.varitasianporygon.desc: At some point an unknown group obtained the source code for Porygon and attempted to make their own version. It seemingly didn't go as planned as this version is noticeably different and exhibits various glitches.
cobblemon.species.varitasianporygon2.des: Continued tampering allowed Porygon to successfully evolve. It still exhibits many glitches but is now well-made enough to pass Silph Co. software compatibility checks which can make it potentially dangerous.
cobblemon.species.porygon0.name: Porygon0
cobblemon.species.porygon0.desc: Interfacing with official Silph Co. software caused it to unexpectedly evolve into this new unknown form. It seems to have stabilized but posseses the ability to spread computer viruses at will as well as an actively malicious AI.
cobblemon.species.varitasiandreepy.name: VaritasianDreepy
cobblemon.species.varitasiandreepy.desc: In certain remote areas of Varitas, surviving Dreepy were discovered. Their limbs aren't very well equipped for land travel so they prefer to spend most of their time in shallow waters.
cobblemon.species.varitasiandrakloak.des: It's capable of flying faster than 120 mph. It battles alongside Dreepy and dotes on them until they successfully evolve.
cobblemon.species.varitasiandragapult.de: When it isn't battling, it keeps Dreepy in the holes on its horns. Once a fight starts, it launches the Dreepy like supersonic missiles.
cobblemon.species.frostooth.name: Frostooth
cobblemon.species.jawcicle.name: Jawcicle
cobblemon.species.alliglacier.name: Alliglacier
cobblemon.species.einymph.name: Einymph
cobblemon.species.zweiphid.name: Zweiphid
cobblemon.species.hydreinopod.name: Hydreinopod
cobblemon.species.varitasianslugma.name: VaritasianSlugma
cobblemon.species.varitasianslugma.desc: An increase of conductive minerals in its lava caused it to eventually take on this strange new form. As electricity runs through it, small spikes jut out of its surface following the electricity's paths
cobblemon.species.varitasianmagcargo.des: It can transfer the mass of its strange fluid body to the spike on its back for shape shifting such as extending it or adding more spikes. It uses this large spike both for attacking and conducting electricity.
cobblemon.species.varitasiantyrogue.name: VaritasianTyrogue
cobblemon.species.varitasiantyrogue.desc: Tyrogue of Varitas adapted to hone their minds rather than their bodies. However, they are often inexperienced and will act clumsy or foolish.
cobblemon.species.varitasianhitmonlee.de: They channel psychic energy through their legs to move around at great speed. Their psychic training has led them to be quite reclusive.
cobblemon.species.varitasianhitmonchan.d: They channel psychic power through their hands to create powerful orbs of energy used for both attacking and defending.
cobblemon.species.varitasianhitmontop.de: For some reason they use psychic energy to suspend themselves in midair. They can hypnotize foes by swinging their entire bodies back and forth.
cobblemon.species.varitasianmunchlax.des: They compete viciously for food. If you have something it wants to eat, it will chase you down relentlessly until it gets it.
cobblemon.species.snarlax.name: Snarlax
cobblemon.species.snarlax.desc: They are extremely bad-tempered and light sleepers. They will eat anything that comes into their territory without hesitation so they must be met with extreme caution when exploring.
cobblemon.species.varitasiantynamo.name: VaritasianTynamo
cobblemon.species.varitasiantynamo.desc: Generations of living in muddy water neutralized its electrical charge. It instead began to focus more on swimming and burrowing through swampy terrain.
cobblemon.species.varitasianeelektrik.de: It's so slippery that it can comfortably swim through muddy ground as if it's liquid. It swallows vast amounts of mud, absorbs any nutrients or plant matter in it and then spits up what's left.
cobblemon.species.varitasianeelektross.d: It lurks in murky swamps, digging complex tunnel systems. It feeds mainly on plant matter and will occasionally hunt down grass type pokemon to latch onto and drain their life force with its powerful gaping mouth.
cobblemon.species.lasaur.name: Lasaur
cobblemon.species.lasaur.desc: It can concentrate a weak electric charge in the crest on its head. Though this only produces minor electric attacks, it also stimulates its brain, heightening its reflexes.
cobblemon.species.lectrosaur.name: Lectrosaur
cobblemon.species.lectrosaur.desc: It can fire off powerful electrical attacks using its antenna-like horn. Massive groups of them were believed to congregate during thunderstorms in prehistoric times.
cobblemon.species.confectious.name: Confectious
cobblemon.species.confectious.desc: It is a being of discarded candy that somehow gained sentience and now roams the fairgrounds searching for more sweets to eat. It ensnares opponents in a sticky sugary goo that's nearly impossible to escape by force.
cobblemon.species.garbadjinn.name: Garbadjinn
cobblemon.species.garbadjinn.desc: The large Garbadjinn springs to life from its small trashcan to rain sickeningly-sweet junk food on foes. Despite its size, its body is light and covered in sugar that sparkles like stars.
cobblemon.species.slowpose.name: Slowpose
cobblemon.species.slowpose.desc: Its frozen, vacant expression reminiscent of Slowpoke is actually a defense mechanisim of its vitals shutting down to disinterest predators, yet it mysteriously stays alive. It feeds by using its tail to attract bug pokemon and in more recent years, scavenging through trash.
cobblemon.species.slowtow.name: Slowtow
cobblemon.species.slowtow.desc: When lying frozen among trash, a Trubbish bit its tail believing it to be dead and caused them both to unexpectedly fuse. The transformed trubbish stays with Slowtow because it knows its sense of smell is better for leading them both to trash. When the trubbish bites down with poison teeth, Slowtow's senses become heightened.
cobblemon.species.slowswing.name: Slowswing
cobblemon.species.slowswing.desc: When competing for food, a Trubbish bit down on its head and the poison increased both its intellect and ghostly power. It stores a variety of snacks, tools and other objects of interest in the pouch on its front. It was named both after Slowking and because its tail tends to swing back and forth when it's in deep thought.
cobblemon.species.varitasianmilcery.name: VaritasianMilcery
cobblemon.species.varitasianmilcery.desc: Living in areas with humid, salty air caused its body to curdle. This also effected its demeanor as it now acts much more mischieviously. It likes to create puddles from its own gooey body for others to slip and fall into.
cobblemon.species.varitasianalcremie.des: Milcery adorning itself with various savory dish toppings mysteriously causes evolution. Its body is now made of extremely strong-smelling cheese. The cheese's flavor can vary wildly and while most find it sickening overall, a few with an acquired taste consider it a delicacy.
cobblemon.species.varitasiantogepi.name: VaritasianTogepi
cobblemon.species.varitasiantogepi.desc: Something in Varitan Togepi's diet caused its shell to harden and take on a golden color. It is rarely found and highly sought-after.
cobblemon.species.varitasiantogetic.name: VaritasianTogetic
cobblemon.species.varitasiantogetic.desc: Upon evolving, its shell forms into magnificent armor. It is a slightly clumsier flier than standard Togetic because the armor makes it heavier, but has a hardened head to compensate.
cobblemon.species.togetect.name: Togetect
cobblemon.species.togetect.desc: It does not tolerate antagonism and will defend those it befriends with its life. Just spreading its wings and showing off its gold armor is enough to put onlookers in speechless awe.
cobblemon.species.varitasianraikou.name: VaritasianRaikou
cobblemon.species.varitasianraikou.desc: Raikou embodies the speed of lightning. The roars of this Pokemon send shock waves shuddering through the air and shake the ground as if lightning bolts had come crashing down.
cobblemon.species.varitasianentei.name: VaritasianEntei
cobblemon.species.varitasianentei.desc: Entei embodies the passion of magma. This Pokemon is thought to have been born in the eruption of a volcano. It sends up massive bursts of fire that utterly consume all that they touch.
cobblemon.species.varitasiansuicune.name: VaritasianSuicune
cobblemon.species.varitasiansuicune.desc: Suicune embodies the compassion of a pure spring of water. It runs across the land with gracefulness. This Pokemon has the power to purify dirty water.
cobblemon.species.africanusanslowpoke.de: Debido a la incompetencia de los esclavistas por atrapar mejores pokémon, estos han sido esclavizados y obligado a trabajar en canteras.
cobblemon.species.africanusanslowbro.des: Cuando los esclavistas notan sufiente odio en un slowpoke. traen un shellder de la playa más cercana y lo hacen evolucionar.
cobblemon.species.africanusanslowking.de: Slowking es el resultado del reconocimiento por parte de los esclavistas a Slowbro, dándole una evolución más inteligente capaz de manejar a varios Slowking, quedándose por encima suya en la cadena de mando.
cobblemon.species.africanusanponyta.name: AfricanusanPonyta
cobblemon.species.africanusanponyta.desc: Al nacer, es muy débil y apenas puede ponerse en pie. Con todo, se va haciendo más fuerte al tropezarse y caerse en su intento por seguir a sus progenitores.
cobblemon.species.africanusanrapidash.de: Cuando los Ponyta de Occidentis ganan fuerza en las piernas para saltar y sus pequeñas alas pueden planear, evoluciona en Rapidash, siendo capaces de volar a sitios muy lejanos. La primera de especie de Rapidash Occidentis en ser capturada fue Bucéfalo,el Rapidash de Alejandro Magno.
cobblemon.species.africanusantauros.name: AfricanusanTauros
cobblemon.species.africanusantauros.desc: Le resulta imposible estarse quieto, por lo que los romanos les ponen una armadura desde que nacen, la cual sintetizan cómo su propia piel, ganando mucha resistencia y docilidad.
cobblemon.species.africanusanmachop.name: AfricanusanMachop
cobblemon.species.africanusanmachop.desc: Se entrena hasta la extenuación para dominar todo tipo de artes marciales. Es tan fuerte que puede llevar a un luchador de sumo sobre los hombros.
cobblemon.species.africanusanmachoke.des: Machoke lleva un cinturón para controlar su abrumadora energía. Como es tan peligroso, nadie se lo ha quitado nunca.
cobblemon.species.africanusanmachamp.des: Es imposible defenderse de los puñetazos y golpes que reparte con los cuatro brazos que tiene. Si aparece un rival fuerte, le entran unas ganas enormes de luchar.
cobblemon.species.africanusanphanpy.name: AfricanusanPhanpy
cobblemon.species.africanusanphanpy.desc: Las enormes orejas que tiene Phanpy le sirven para abanicarse. Cuando tiene calor, las usa para refrescarse. Ya desde pequeño es entrenado para que tenga mucha fuerza y la use en beneficio del ejército cartaginés.
cobblemon.species.africanusandonphan.des: Donphan es tan fuerte que puede arrasarr fácilmente varias filas de legionarios. Su piel se ha endurecido, ganando el tipo roca. Para hacerle daño, no bastan los ataques comunes.
cobblemon.species.africanusanbronzor.des: Se descubrieron herramientas con su forma en tumbas antiguas, pero se desconoce si tiene relación.
cobblemon.species.africanusanbronzong.de: Se produjo un gran revuelo cuando encontraron uno en una obra después de 2000 años durmiendo.
cobblemon.species.africanusancherubi.des: La pequeña esfera, dulce y sabrosa, contiene los nutrientes necesarios para evolucionar.
cobblemon.species.africanusancherrim.des: Baco bendijo a los Cherrim como agradecimiento al pueblo de Occidentis por su gran devoción a este en todos los actos públicos y privados de sus habitantes.
cobblemon.species.africanusankricketot.d: Los pueblos galos usaron a los Kricketot cómo instrumento durante generaciones, adaptándose estos a sus bárbaras costumbres.
Tras siglos de convivencia con los galos, Kricketune es capaz de luchar cómo un galo más.
cobblemon.species.africanusangothita.des: Cuando Perseo derrotó a la Gorgona, esta puso varios pequeños huevos de los que salió este Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.africanusangothorita.d: La luz de las estrellas origina su poder. De noche, marca su posición haciendo levitar piedras con su poder psíquico.
En su fase de mayor poder, es capaz de utilizar el poder petrificante de su madre, la Gorgona.
cobblemon.species.africanusanhonedge.des: Las espadas forjadas en tierra Hispana eran usadas por soldados, y una vez estos morían, si habían luchado con valor, se reencarnaban en estos pokémon.
cobblemon.species.africanusandoublade.de: Al adquirir almas de guerreros más poderosos, se divide en dos espadas. Se comunican entre sí mediante telepatía y coordinan los ataques para rebanar al enemigo.
cobblemon.species.africanusanaegislash.d: Cuando consigue un alma de gran héreo,evoluciona. Siendo un Pokémon digno de cónsules durante generaciones.
cobblemon.species.africanusancomfey.name: AfricanusanComfey
cobblemon.species.africanusancomfey.desc: Prende flores en su tallo, que es muy rico en nutrientes. Las flores se revitalizan y desprenden una agradable fragancia.
cobblemon.species.petiolis.name: Petiolis
cobblemon.species.petiolis.desc: Este pokémon es muy juguetón y mortífero, la leyenda dice que es descendiente de la loba que amamantó a los fundadores de Roma.
cobblemon.species.virilis.name: Virilis
cobblemon.species.virilis.desc: Se dice que aquellos entrenadores que cuentan con un Virilis son bendecidos por los dioses a hacer grandes hazañas en la vida.
cobblemon.species.lupercalis.name: Lupercalis
cobblemon.species.lupercalis.desc: La leyenda cuenta que fue uno de sus ascendientes fue la que amamantó a Rómulo y Remo, los fundadores de Roma.
cobblemon.species.harregg.name: Harregg
cobblemon.species.harregg.desc: Este pokémon es un pequeño ave imperial que no ha llegado aún de salir del cascarón,aunque parezca adorable hay que tener mucho cuidado con él,podría calcinarte en cuestión de segundos. Necesita el calor para vivir y su huevo está a más de 300 Cº,no sobreviviría fuera de él en esta fase. Siempre ha sido un símbolo de Roma y estos adoran la línea evolutiva de este pokémon.
cobblemon.species.igneagle.name: Igneagle
cobblemon.species.igneagle.desc: Igneagle es la evolución de Harreg, es un pokémon muy activo, cómo consecuencia suele robar armas y montar jaleo, pero si está de tu lado, será una gran ayuda.
cobblemon.species.imperiavem.name: Imperiavem
cobblemon.species.imperiavem.desc: Imperiavem es un majestuoso pokémon y los soldados suelen llevarlo en sus estandartes. Su velocidad ha llegado a compararse con la del dios Mercurio.
cobblemon.species.hipporos.name: Hipporos
cobblemon.species.hipporos.desc: Hipporos es un pequeño hipocampo, le gusta jugar y come insectos y pequeños peces, sus escamas le protegen y sus bigote le avisan de peligros, usa su veneno para debilitar a sus presas, suelen ser pasivos y agradables con los humanos.
cobblemon.species.equxic.name: Equxic
cobblemon.species.equxic.desc: Equxic es la evolución de Hipporos, usa su veneno para cazar, en esta forma empieza a usar el poder de sus devastadores coletazos, aunque aún no sabe controlarlos.
cobblemon.species.marecampus.name: Marecampus
cobblemon.species.marecampus.desc: Marecampus es un fiero pokémon enviado por Neptuno,sus devastadores coletazos pueden provocar olas de hasta 7 metros.
cobblemon.species.fawniae.name: Fawniae
cobblemon.species.fawniae.desc: Ser místico, se dice que vino a Occidentis gracias al dios Fauno, en agradecimiento a los hombres.
cobblemon.species.houndplut.name: Houndplut
cobblemon.species.houndplut.desc: Creado por Plutón, protegen los mundos infernales con sus temibles colmillos.
cobblemon.species.aristosiansentret.name: AristosianSentret
cobblemon.species.aristosiansentret.desc: Sentret's mosslike fur perfectly blends with foliage, so it's difficult to spot it as it camouflages itself in leaves. It won't sleep until it's sure its body is hidden entirely.
