cobblemon.species.brainergy.name: Brainergy
cobblemon.species.nostanmorelull.name: NostanMorelull
cobblemon.species.nostanshiinotic.name: NostanShiinotic
cobblemon.species.primmella.name: Primmella
cobblemon.species.primmella.desc: Primmella are very light and wispy pokemon that are swept up even in light breezes. Often times, especially in rain and storms, they clump together and are blown by the strong winds.
cobblemon.species.primmadame.name: Primmadame
cobblemon.species.primmadame.desc: People try to keep close to them and use their floating bodies for protection from the downpour.
cobblemon.species.primmoiselle.name: Primmoiselle
cobblemon.species.primmoiselle.desc: Primmoiselle are very sophisticated and classy Pokemon, but fierce fighters in battle nonetheless.
cobblemon.species.plasduck.name: Plasduck
cobblemon.species.plasduck.desc: Plasduck keep their feet tucked under their body while they float on the surface effortlessly.
cobblemon.species.fauxmingo.name: Fauxmingo
cobblemon.species.swandola.name: Swandola
cobblemon.species.buldough.name: Buldough
cobblemon.species.buldough.desc: It's beloved as a pet among families of all sizes. Both throughout Nosto and overseas, they're often used as a mascot for bakeries because of their resemblance to certain types of pastries.
cobblemon.species.nostandiglett.name: NostanDiglett
cobblemon.species.nostandiglett.desc: It spends most of its time partially underground, leaving only its leaf poking out. Wherever this Pokemon burrows, the soil is left perfectly tilled for planting crops.
cobblemon.species.nostandugtrio.name: NostanDugtrio
cobblemon.species.nostandugtrio.desc: Those who have tried to pull it out of the ground haven't had much luck; it has long roots tightly ingrained into the earth.
cobblemon.species.duggout.name: Duggout
cobblemon.species.duggout.desc: The largest head decides where the team goes. They work cooperatively to drill powerfully through tough ground.
cobblemon.species.seasaw.name: Seasaw
cobblemon.species.chainjaw.name: Chainjaw
cobblemon.species.atlarv.name: Atlarv
cobblemon.species.atlagon.name: Atlagon
cobblemon.species.pigstyk.name: Pigstyk
cobblemon.species.lumboar.name: Lumboar
cobblemon.species.hogstead.name: Hogstead
cobblemon.species.planebe.name: Planebe
cobblemon.species.staurbor.name: Staurbor
cobblemon.species.mantaqua.name: Mantaqua
cobblemon.species.nostanshellder.name: NostanShellder
cobblemon.species.nostanshellder.desc: The shell of these Shellder is so durable and tough that even some of the strongest Fighting-types cannot pry it open!
cobblemon.species.nostancloyster.name: NostanCloyster
cobblemon.species.nostancloyster.desc: These Cloyster have developed a large, muscular cannon that can shoot high pressure water at foes, enough to blast through steel!
cobblemon.species.merineon.name: Merineon
cobblemon.species.teslax.name: Teslax
cobblemon.species.teslax.desc: Their bodies are almost completely transparent, making them extremely hard to find in daylight. At night, however, their multicoloured lights flicker beautifully.
cobblemon.species.zexalax.name: Zexalax
cobblemon.species.zexalax.desc: Specialised cords connect each unit together, forming one collective mind. A strong electrical field surrounds them. Anything that breaches that field will be shocked with huge amounts of electricity.
cobblemon.species.diagem.name: Diagem
cobblemon.species.cephalotox.name: Cephalotox
cobblemon.species.feiring.name: Feiring
cobblemon.species.feiring.desc: If it takes a liking to a human, it will give them its ring and protect that person from any harm.
cobblemon.species.pendelf.name: Pendelf
cobblemon.species.pendelf.desc: It pays close attention to its wearer's heartbeat to monitor its health. It radiates an aura that wards off hex.
cobblemon.species.encrona.name: Encrona
cobblemon.species.encrona.desc: Monarchs from the distant past always kept Encrona by their side to protect them from bewitching spells.
cobblemon.species.tilow.name: Tilow
cobblemon.species.tilow.desc: Tilow produce a small, warm flame on top of their head by using an oil they produce inside their bodies.
cobblemon.species.candhoul.name: Candhoul
cobblemon.species.candhoul.desc: Their bodies are very gooey and sticky. They drip behind them as they walk leaving a big mess, so wild Candhoul are often labelled as pests.
cobblemon.species.chandemise.name: Chandemise
cobblemon.species.novil.name: Novil
cobblemon.species.novil.desc: It is said that if you stare into its eye for long enough, you will have visions of unspeakable horrors from the past.
cobblemon.species.azatome.name: Azatome
cobblemon.species.azatome.desc: Each book possesses various writings in an alien language, they are rumoured to tell the story of the end of the universe.
cobblemon.species.necromanos.name: Necromanos
cobblemon.species.necromanos.desc: Necromanos absorb people's souls, leaving only the lifeless body leftover. It is said that each soul becomes a new tendril.
cobblemon.species.vaniteeny.name: Vaniteeny
cobblemon.species.vaniteeny.desc: Vaniteeny are very shy and will not move in the presence of another being. They stand very still on all 4 of their legs.
cobblemon.species.boodoir.name: Boodoir
cobblemon.species.boodoir.desc: Now more powerful, each 4 of its separate faces fight for control over what they will do. Boodoir tend to be indecisive which is hinders their ability to battle.
cobblemon.species.maspook.name: Maspook
cobblemon.species.cresprit.name: Cresprit

cobblemon.species.ironjet.name: IronJet
cobblemon.species.ferociousfins.name: FerociousFins
cobblemon.species.irondragon.name: IronDragon
cobblemon.species.psypole.name: Psypole
cobblemon.species.psypole.desc: Psypole are very intelligent Pokemon that hatch with an orb. The orb helps them learn to control their psychic abilities.
cobblemon.species.telefrog.name: Telefrog
cobblemon.species.telefrog.desc: Telefrog has the ability to use its psychic powers to full effect. To train Telefrog one should do their best to develop a friendship with it.
cobblemon.species.tarotoad.name: Tarotoad
cobblemon.species.tarotoad.desc: When a person is acting strangely or suspiciously, it is a figure of speech to suggest that a Tarotoad is influencing their thoughts.
cobblemon.species.boxeroo.name: Boxeroo
cobblemon.species.boxeroo.desc: These feisty Pokemon play fight to display their markings. More markings are a source of pride for Boxeroo.
cobblemon.species.marsupunch.name: Marsupunch
cobblemon.species.marsupunch.desc: Marsupunch are proud of their scars, and often attempt to flaunt them in front of other Marsupunch. This inevitably results in more fighting.
cobblemon.species.kankombat.name: Kankombat
cobblemon.species.kankombat.desc: Kankombat are intimidating in stature, standing far taller than the average human grows. So, while it is dangerous to get on the wrong side of a Kankombat, it's quite easy to see them coming.
cobblemon.species.seijitsu.name: Seijitsu
cobblemon.species.seijitsu.desc: Seijitsu are pack Pokemon and become very protective of those close to them. They love to run around and chase other Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.kousetsu.name: Kousetsu
cobblemon.species.kousetsu.desc: Kousetsu consider those close to them to be part of their pack, and will protect them by cuddling up to them for warmth.
cobblemon.species.mangetsu.name: Mangetsu
cobblemon.species.mangetsu.desc: Mangetsu have evolved to control the harsh cold weather, rather than merely surviving it. They use their sharp claws and keen senses to hunt for prey.
cobblemon.species.rockroach.name: Rockroach
cobblemon.species.rockroach.desc: Rockroach mimic stones when trainers pass by. The moment they turn away, however, Rockroach will emerge to follow them.
cobblemon.species.boulderoach.name: Boulderoach
cobblemon.species.boulderoach.desc: Boulderoach chew up rocks to plaster on their shells. They have mined out entire caverns to reinforce the layers of stone and mud.
cobblemon.species.axolil.name: Axolil
cobblemon.species.axolil.desc: Axolil have a petrifying fear of drying out. If taken away from water and released, they will dowse for the nearest source of fresh water.
cobblemon.species.visimander.name: Visimander
cobblemon.species.visimander.desc: Visimander are alert Pokemon, whose sensitivity more than makes up for their blindness. They can physically and psychically map their surroundings in a fraction of a second.
cobblemon.species.webbat.name: Webbat
cobblemon.species.webbat.desc: Webbat's fangs excrete a potent venom, which coagulates blood into a thick, syrupy puck. Due to their small size, Webbat wait to ambush their victims.
cobblemon.species.vamprachne.name: Vamprachne
cobblemon.species.vamprachne.desc: Vamprachne spin their own wings out of sticky gossamer. They store food, attractive objects, and their unruly young in them.
cobblemon.species.cutesnoot.name: Cutesnoot
cobblemon.species.cutesnoot.desc: Cutesnoot love food, and often cause mischief while seeking for it. The easiest way to befriend a Cutesnoot is by leaving out an offering of food.
cobblemon.species.coatisnotti.name: Coatisnotti
cobblemon.species.coatisnotti.desc: Coatisnotti are tricksters who work in packs to steal food from humans and Pokemon. Each pack member has an assigned role in their schemes, based upon the Coatisnotti's strength.
cobblemon.species.ospuny.name: Ospuny
cobblemon.species.ospuny.desc: Ospuny have downy feathers, but rarely make a fuss about preening. They prefer to let their feathers naturally grow and fall out.
cobblemon.species.osprowl.name: Osprowl
cobblemon.species.osprowl.desc: Osprowl practice their flying maneuvers on prey and unsuspecting targets alike. Osprowl keep small collections of objects they have collected in daring flights.
cobblemon.species.ospredator.name: Ospredator
cobblemon.species.ospredator.desc: Ospredator are the bane of humans who attempt to research them. This is because they refuse to let intruders anywhere near their territory.
cobblemon.species.pakrat.name: Pakrat
cobblemon.species.pakrat.desc: Pakrat will live and forage almost anywhere, adding various finds to the pouch of leaves around their middle.
cobblemon.species.bakpakrat.name: Bakpakrat
cobblemon.species.bakpakrat.desc: Bakpakrat are nomadic, wandering the region, so they can deliver mail to humans and Pokemon alike.
cobblemon.species.royalarva.name: Royalarva
cobblemon.species.royalarva.desc: It is said that Royalarva look perpetually sad because they are ashamed of their ugliness.
cobblemon.species.superbpa.name: Superbpa
cobblemon.species.superbpa.desc: Superbpa spend long periods of time sleeping. Even when they are awake, they prefer to lay motionless inside flowers.
cobblemon.species.regalocera.name: Regalocera
cobblemon.species.regalocera.desc: While Regalocera are proud of their majestic beauty, they are far from cocky, spending most of their energy protecting and nourishing weaker Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.carapad.name: Carapad
cobblemon.species.carapad.desc: Carapad use their shells to mimic lily pads. People and Pokemon alike often fall for their disguise. But, if disturbed, Carapad will shoot a jet of water at the offender's face.
cobblemon.species.puripad.name: Puripad
cobblemon.species.puripad.desc: Puripad's air of gentleness draws in smaller Pokemon, who will then rest on their shells.
cobblemon.species.simpaima.name: Simpaima
cobblemon.species.simpaima.desc: It is so often distracted by the light reflecting off its body that it can hardly focus. They struggle to complete complex tasks.
cobblemon.species.arowisen.name: Arowisen
cobblemon.species.arowisen.desc: It is so often distracted by the light reflecting off its body that it can hardly focus. They struggle to complete complex tasks.
cobblemon.species.spidoux.name: Spidoux
cobblemon.species.spidoux.desc: Countless foragers of Vereshad have succumbed to Spidoux's poison after mistaking its abdomen for a Pecha Berry.
cobblemon.species.aracide.name: Aracide
cobblemon.species.aracide.desc: It can envenom the foe by biting or by being bitten. This Pokemon will intentionally leave itself open to attack.
cobblemon.species.mimectar.name: Mimectar
cobblemon.species.mimectar.desc: Mimetcar resemble unsuspecting sunflowers most of the time. If they are attacked, their monstrous true form will appear.
cobblemon.species.skittail.name: Skittail
cobblemon.species.skittail.desc: Timiphid are very weak, but they move fast. They move in unpredictable patterns to avoid being hit by attacks.
cobblemon.species.timiphid.name: Timiphid
cobblemon.species.timiphid.desc: Be careful when approaching Skittail. While they are quite timid, they may caller for help from something bigger.
cobblemon.species.chromite.name: Chromite
cobblemon.species.chromite.desc: When two Chromite meet, they will have a contest by hitting each other. The one whose armor cracks first loses.
cobblemon.species.oviseed.name: Oviseed
cobblemon.species.oviseed.desc: Oviseed almost never move. Doing so requires them to lift their roots, and that takes a lot of time and energy.
cobblemon.species.hoofern.name: Hoofern
cobblemon.species.hoofern.desc: The main body has grown its own legs, and the roots have receded. Hoofern can move freely.
cobblemon.species.asparies.name: Asparies
cobblemon.species.asparies.desc: The roots that were once its legs have grown around the body, protecting the Pokemon as it charges about.
cobblemon.species.pixipetal.name: Pixipetal
cobblemon.species.pixipetal.desc: Pixipetal try to dance, but often lose their balance. They use their vines to keep from falling over.
cobblemon.species.florafay.name: Florafay
cobblemon.species.florafay.desc: Florafay will string together many graceful gestures into a unique dance. Each movement means something different.
cobblemon.species.zapouch.name: Zapouch
cobblemon.species.zapouch.desc: Zapouch's life deep underwater is shrouded in mystery. They come to the surface of the ocean when they are ready to evolve.
cobblemon.species.mannovolt.name: Mannovolt
cobblemon.species.mannovolt.desc: Mannovolt ensnare prey with their appendages and deliver electric shocks. If Mannovolt are not careful, they can shock themselves.
cobblemon.species.hemocto.name: Hemocto
cobblemon.species.hemocto.desc: A tricky parasite, Hemocto will hold on to the nearest living thing and drain it of its blood. They can navigate well even in the murky ocean depths.
cobblemon.species.alucuttle.name: Alucuttle
cobblemon.species.alucuttle.desc: Alucuttle drain the blood of their prey before discarding it. Their sharp teeth were once used for knives.
cobblemon.species.sorroul.name: Sorroul
cobblemon.species.sorroul.desc: Always in tears. While trainers may comfort it to prevent it from wailing, Sorroul's tears will keep flowing.
cobblemon.species.depressoul.name: Depressoul
cobblemon.species.depressoul.desc: Depressoul will actively move away from those that tell it to feel better. It responds best to trainers that are willing to quietly sit beside it.
cobblemon.species.spectorment.name: Spectorment
cobblemon.species.spectorment.desc: The shrieks of Spectorment are said to evoke the most painful memories a person has experienced. Staying near one for extended periods is incredibly difficult to bear.
cobblemon.species.accerval.name: Accerval
cobblemon.species.accerval.desc: They are quick to chase small Pokemon, but will cower away from larger ones.
cobblemon.species.warrush.name: Warrush
cobblemon.species.warrush.desc: Because they run so fast, debris that strikes the body leaves permanent marks. The older a Warrush, the more scars it has.
cobblemon.species.hauntodile.name: Hauntodile
cobblemon.species.hauntodile.desc: It is said that Hauntodile hunts to add the prey's body heat to itself. However, its skin is always cold to the touch.
cobblemon.species.necrodile.name: Necrodile
cobblemon.species.necrodile.desc: Necrodile learn by eating the experiences of the dying. It learned to stand on two legs by eating the memories of humans, or so it is said.
cobblemon.species.gichet.name: Gichet
cobblemon.species.gichet.desc: Gichet have small jaws, but they will clack them together loudly when threatened.
cobblemon.species.crickjaw.name: Crickjaw
cobblemon.species.crickjaw.desc: Crickjaw have small bodies compared to their heads, which have grown substantially during evolution. Their massive jaws are supported by these large craniums.
cobblemon.species.tascorch.name: Tascorch
cobblemon.species.tascorch.desc: Tascorch always have a flame burning at the back of their throat. When they are sick, the fire burns at a lower temperature.
cobblemon.species.tastorture.name: Tastorture
cobblemon.species.tastorture.desc: Tastorture have numerous growths around their upper body. To some trainers, the more growths their Tastorture has, the cooler it is.
cobblemon.species.shrimpink.name: Shrimpink
cobblemon.species.shrimpink.desc: Oddly enough, Shrimpink emit a pleasant aroma that draws in Pokemon and humans alike. Their tough shells make them inedible, however.
cobblemon.species.armaroma.name: Armaroma
cobblemon.species.armaroma.desc: Armaroma emit a sickly-sweet smell from their bodies. It appears to confuse predators that rely on smell.
cobblemon.species.pricklebun.name: Pricklebun
cobblemon.species.pricklebun.desc: Timid and easily frightened, this Pokemon often avoids danger by hiding among cacti and other drybrush. The fruit that grows from its ears is used to make tasty jams and jellies.
cobblemon.species.cackrabbit.name: Cackrabbit
cobblemon.species.cackrabbit.desc: Although less skiddish than its predecessor, this Pokemon will spray needles by violently shaking its body whenever it feels threatened. This makes it a difficult Pokemon for young trainers to train.
cobblemon.species.sonoralope.name: Sonoralope
cobblemon.species.sonoralope.desc: Its powerful arms and legs enable this Pokemon to make huge bounds across the desert landscape. Sonoralope protects Pokemon from danger with thorny, bone-cracking kicks.
cobblemon.species.chubren.name: Chubren
cobblemon.species.chubren.desc: A bit of a glutton, this bird is a nuisance to grass-type Pokemon because of its constant attempts to eat their fruits.
cobblemon.species.roadren.name: Roadren
cobblemon.species.roadren.desc: Roadren speed over desert grounds at over 700 miles per hour. Before they start a run, their tails will flare in warning, letting others know to get out of the way.
cobblemon.species.malleamole.name: Malleamole
cobblemon.species.malleamole.desc: The tendrils on its nose can be shortened and lengthened, to an extent. It moves them around to feel its way forward.
cobblemon.species.shoxin.name: Shoxin
cobblemon.species.shoxin.desc: It will do a handstand just before it sprays poison. The poison is electrically conductive.
cobblemon.species.noxurge.name: Noxurge
cobblemon.species.noxurge.desc: Noxurge will coat their fur in a thin layer of poison. When startled, they will send electricity coursing through it to create a blinding flash.
cobblemon.species.calientoad.name: Calientoad
cobblemon.species.calientoad.desc: This easygoing Pokemon prefers to move as little as possible to conserve energy while avoiding anything flammable.
cobblemon.species.picantoad.name: Picantoad
cobblemon.species.picantoad.desc: This Pokemon has no agility with which to speak of. Instead, it shoots thick jets of lava from its eyes with impeccable accuracy and range.
cobblemon.species.volcantoad.name: Volcantoad
cobblemon.species.volcantoad.desc: The 'toad' in its name is a misnomer - they avoid water as much as they can. An organ in Volcántoad's throat is filled with lava, which they release while scaling mountains.
cobblemon.species.baquini.name: Baquini
cobblemon.species.baquini.desc: Due to overfishing, this Pokemon's population has dropped to almost zero in the wild.
cobblemon.species.modelfin.name: Modelfin
cobblemon.species.modelfin.desc: Modelfin shares an eerie connection with the netting around its neck. It cannot remove it by any means, but Modelfin can unravel the netting at will to astonish unwanted company.
cobblemon.species.muertapoise.name: Muertapoise
cobblemon.species.muertapoise.desc: It is said that the hook this Pokemon carries is used to sink fishing ships as penance for its own death.
cobblemon.species.formanbulbasaur.name: FormanBulbasaur
cobblemon.species.spiksaur.name: Spiksaur
cobblemon.species.gemsaur.name: Gemsaur

cobblemon.species.metakurs.name: Metakurs
cobblemon.species.formanunown.name: FormanUnown
cobblemon.species.chainown.name: Chainown
cobblemon.species.twinz.name: Twinz
cobblemon.species.formangirafarig.name: FormanGirafarig
cobblemon.species.formanpineco.name: FormanPineco
cobblemon.species.formanforretress.name: FormanForretress
cobblemon.species.crystshell.name: Crystshell
cobblemon.species.formandunsparce.name: FormanDunsparce
cobblemon.species.dunrada.name: Dunrada
cobblemon.species.formansnubbull.name: FormanSnubbull
cobblemon.species.formangranbull.name: FormanGranbull
cobblemon.species.formanqwilfish.name: FormanQwilfish
cobblemon.species.formanshuckle.name: FormanShuckle
cobblemon.species.formanheracross.name: FormanHeracross
cobblemon.species.herapaltin.name: Herapaltin
cobblemon.species.formanteddiursa.name: FormanTeddiursa
cobblemon.species.swabear.name: Swabear
cobblemon.species.slugem.name: Slugem
cobblemon.species.formanslugma.name: FormanSlugma
cobblemon.species.macargold.name: Macargold
cobblemon.species.formancorsola.name: FormanCorsola
cobblemon.species.formanremoraid.name: FormanRemoraid
cobblemon.species.siscorp.name: Siscorp
cobblemon.species.formandelibird.name: FormanDelibird
cobblemon.species.formanskarmory.name: FormanSkarmory
cobblemon.species.formanhoundour.name: FormanHoundour
cobblemon.species.formanhoundoom.name: FormanHoundoom
cobblemon.species.formanphanpy.name: FormanPhanpy
cobblemon.species.formandonphan.name: FormanDonphan
cobblemon.species.formansmeargle.name: FormanSmeargle
cobblemon.species.milalien.name: Milalien
cobblemon.species.formanlarvitar.name: FormanLarvitar
cobblemon.species.toothitar.name: Toothitar
cobblemon.species.rodanitar.name: Rodanitar
cobblemon.species.formanraikou.name: FormanRaikou
cobblemon.species.formanentei.name: FormanEntei
cobblemon.species.formansuicune.name: FormanSuicune
cobblemon.species.formanlugia.name: FormanLugia
cobblemon.species.formanhooh.name: FormanHooh
cobblemon.species.celeby.name: Celeby
cobblemon.species.formantreecko.name: FormanTreecko
cobblemon.species.muecko.name: Muecko
cobblemon.species.skeptile.name: Skeptile
cobblemon.species.formantorchic.name: FormanTorchic
cobblemon.species.galatoo.name: Galatoo
cobblemon.species.secrebuyo.name: Secrebuyo
cobblemon.species.formanmudkip.name: FormanMudkip
cobblemon.species.salathyst.name: Salathyst
cobblemon.species.soljailer.name: Soljailer
cobblemon.species.oreon.name: Oreon
cobblemon.species.oreon.desc: Thought to be a mythical Pokemon, Oreon have only been seen by a small handful of trainers. It's soft, delicious body can regenerate rapidly.
cobblemon.species.hoennianvenonat.name: HoennianVenonat
cobblemon.species.hoennianvenonat.desc: Timid by nature, the wild Venonat in Hoenn prefer to live in damp, dark places. Their large, glowing eyes can see clearly even in total blackness.
cobblemon.species.muramoth.name: Muramoth
cobblemon.species.muramoth.desc: Lucemoth are social and friendly, often times forming close bonds with trainers and Pokemon. They are drawn to bright lights and shiny objects.
cobblemon.species.lucemoth.name: Lucemoth
cobblemon.species.lucemoth.desc: Unlike its relative Venomoth, a Muramoth foregoes flight, instead leaving its wings draped around it's body for protection. They prefer to live in total solitude.
cobblemon.species.drilladin.name: Drilladin
cobblemon.species.hoenniandunsparce.name: HoennianDunsparce
cobblemon.species.hoenniandunsparce.desc: This Pokemon's eyesight is so poor that it can barely see objects directly in front of it. It escapes predators by shocking them with its electric tail.
cobblemon.species.drasparath.name: Drasparath
cobblemon.species.drasparath.desc: It's body is dotted with holdes that loose intense jets of air. When agitated, it will send an electrical current through it's air streams to create violent thunderclouds.
cobblemon.species.hoennianmareanie.name: HoennianMareanie
cobblemon.species.hoennianmareanie.desc: It protects its soft, viscous body with a thick layer of sturdy rock and debris. Prolonged exposure to dry air causes its skin to harden into brittle spines.
cobblemon.species.hoenniantoxapex.name: HoennianToxapex
cobblemon.species.hoenniantoxapex.desc: It disguises itself as a simple rock to catch unsuspecting prey off guard. Toxapex then rams it's entire body into it's victim, paralyzing it with it's toxic spines.
cobblemon.species.mallarki.name: Mallarki
cobblemon.species.mallarki.desc: The sprig of green onion it holds with it's beak is it's weapon of choice. It makes short work of most foes with a single, deft strike.
cobblemon.species.hoennianpinsir.name: HoennianPinsir
cobblemon.species.hoennianpinsir.desc: It grips its prey in its pincers and crushes the life out of them. It can't move if it's cold, so it prefers to inhabit warm, dry places.
cobblemon.species.hoennianteddiursa.name: HoennianTeddiursa
cobblemon.species.hoennianteddiursa.desc: It's palms constantly give off a warm glow. When in distress, the heat from it's palms can become so intense that they burn through even solid metal.
cobblemon.species.hoennianursaring.name: HoennianUrsaring
cobblemon.species.hoennianursaring.desc: Ursaring gather food from trees using their lengthy, extendable tongues. It's fearsome claws are actually intended to aid in peeling hard-skinned fruits.
cobblemon.species.hoenniandodrio.name: HoennianDodrio
cobblemon.species.hoenniandodrio.desc: Its middle head dominates the other two, issuing orders as it sees fit. They often travel alongside wild Marowak when hunting for prey.
cobblemon.species.hoennianskarmory.name: HoennianSkarmory
cobblemon.species.hoennianskarmory.desc: A Pokemon that has a body and wings of molten steel. In the heat of battle, the blades on its wings glow white-hot and emit clouds of burning steam.
cobblemon.species.hoenniantynamo.name: HoennianTynamo
cobblemon.species.hoenniantynamo.desc: It releases a foul odor to ward off any potential predators. They travel in large clusters, resulting in unbearable smells as they move from place to place.
cobblemon.species.hoennianeelektrik.name: HoennianEelektrik
cobblemon.species.hoennianeelektrik.desc: Through frequent shedding of it's skin, this Pokemon grows in size at an incredible rate. It devours sand and leaves behind rare minerals as waste
cobblemon.species.hoennianeelektross.des: An Eelektross is scarcely seen above ground. It's monstrous jaws can crush even the hardest materials beneath the surface of the earth.
cobblemon.species.hoennianmaractus.name: HoennianMaractus
cobblemon.species.hoennianmaractus.desc: Maractus were forced out of the desert due to competition with rival Cacturne. It's ability to survive nonetheless is a testament to its hardiness.
cobblemon.species.silviper.name: Silviper
cobblemon.species.silviper.desc: Silviper roamed the world as a ferocious predator in ancient times. It's long body is fortified with venom-infused silver scales.
cobblemon.species.zangoro.name: Zangoro
cobblemon.species.zangoro.desc: Zangaro are often spoken of in stories meant to frighten misbehaving children. Its black fur cloaks it during the night when it comes out to hunt prey.
cobblemon.species.hoenniantangela.name: HoennianTangela
cobblemon.species.hoenniantangela.desc: It's body is covered in pointy, dead vines that it collects at a young age. If anyone attempts to peer into it's nest to view it's real body, it becomes highly aggressive.
cobblemon.species.hoenniantangrowth.name: HoennianTangrowth
cobblemon.species.hoenniantangrowth.desc: This Pokemon will resort to any means necessary to win in a fight. It stands upright on it's vines to appear larger and more menacing.
cobblemon.species.hoennianpawniard.name: HoennianPawniard
cobblemon.species.hoennianpawniard.desc: Though clumsy and prone to error, a Pawniard will never give up on it's journey to grow stronger. It constantly seeks out new sparring partners.
cobblemon.species.hoennianbisharp.name: HoennianBisharp
cobblemon.species.hoennianbisharp.desc: Chivalrous to a fault, these Pokemon will defend their Trainers with unwavering loyalty. In the wild, they are often seen with a troupe of Pawniard in tow.
cobblemon.species.hoenniansolosis.name: HoennianSolosis
cobblemon.species.hoenniansolosis.desc: Solosis in Hoenn have adapted on a cellular level to resemble common berries. They avoid unwanted attention by hiding within fruit trees.
cobblemon.species.hoennianduosion.name: HoennianDuosion
cobblemon.species.hoennianduosion.desc: It constantly devours berries by absorbing them through it's jelly-like membrane. Their brilliant gold color glows brightly after they finish a meal.
cobblemon.species.hoennianreuniclus.name: HoennianReuniclus
cobblemon.species.hoennianreuniclus.desc: It constantly devours berries by absorbing them through it's jelly-like membrane. Their brilliant gold color glows brightly after they finish a meal.
cobblemon.species.hoenniangoomy.name: HoennianGoomy
cobblemon.species.hoenniangoomy.desc: It uses it's horns to check out it's surroundings. They're very sensitive, so if you grab them, it will feel a strong shock and be unable to move.
cobblemon.species.goolossal.name: Goolossal
cobblemon.species.goolossal.desc: This enormous evolution of Goomy is entirely unique to the Hoenn region. Goolossal are often accompanied by hordes of Goomy that serve them willingly.
cobblemon.species.hoennianshuckle.name: HoennianShuckle
cobblemon.species.hoennianshuckle.desc: A Shuckle hides under rocks, keeping its body concealed inside its shell while eating stored berries. The berries mix with its body fluids to become juice.
cobblemon.species.hoennianemolga.name: HoennianEmolga
cobblemon.species.hoennianemolga.desc: Emolga swoop down from the sky in an effort to frighten townsfolk. Due to their adorable appearance, however, they are rarely successful.
cobblemon.species.hoennianonix.name: HoennianOnix
cobblemon.species.hoennianonix.desc: There is a cave in a far-away region where this Pokemon is said to have originated from. They migrated to Hoenn when the waters in their homeland grew too warm.
cobblemon.species.chrysalix.name: Chrysalix
cobblemon.species.chrysalix.desc: Chrysalix are a new species discovered by researchers conducting experiments on the crystalline Onix in Shoal Cave. They continue to grow larger with age.
cobblemon.species.hoenniantentacool.name: HoennianTentacool
cobblemon.species.hoenniantentacool.desc: It's body is almost entirely composed of water. It grasps it's foes with it's four long tentacles, then brutally shocks it until it falls unconscious.
cobblemon.species.hoenniantentacruel.des: Despite being smaller than Tentacruel in other regions, this variant is far more aggressive, It can administer deadly jolts of electricity when aggravated.
cobblemon.species.hoennianseel.name: HoennianSeel
cobblemon.species.hoennianseel.desc: Seel hunt for prey in the warm, temperate seas of Hoenn. When threatened, they curl their tailfin into a fist-like ball that can deliver crushing blows.
cobblemon.species.hoenniandewgong.name: HoennianDewgong
cobblemon.species.hoenniandewgong.desc: It's lackadaisical nature often tricks unsuspecting trainers into believing it to be friendly. A swift strike from it's tail-fin teaches them otherwise.
cobblemon.species.hoennianchinchou.name: HoennianChinchou
cobblemon.species.hoennianchinchou.desc: It lives in depth beyond sunlight's reach, waiting patiently for prey to swim by. The lights on its antennae can cause intense hallucinations.
cobblemon.species.hoennianlanturn.name: HoennianLanturn
cobblemon.species.hoennianlanturn.desc: The light-emitting flame on its head is used to lure in unsuspecting prey on the seafloor. It ensnares its victims within its body and siphons their life force.
cobblemon.species.hoennianqwilfish.name: HoennianQwilfish
cobblemon.species.hoennianqwilfish.desc: Qwilfish latch their tails to rocks on the seafloor and wait for unsuspecting prey to swim by. When it spots a target, it unleashes an explosion of toxic fumes.
cobblemon.species.slingray.name: Slingray
cobblemon.species.slingray.desc: It fashions a slingshot-like apparatus to it's fins using kelp from the seafloor. Slingray hunt by leaping out of the ocean and flinging rocks at unsuspecting prey.
cobblemon.species.bawlfrog.name: Bawlfrog
cobblemon.species.hoenniandreepy.name: HoennianDreepy
cobblemon.species.hoenniandreepy.desc: Dreepy are notorious pranksters. They often dart around in packs, looking for humans or Pokemon to play tricks on. It's den is littered with stolen valuables.
cobblemon.species.hoenniandrakloak.name: HoennianDrakloak
cobblemon.species.hoenniandrakloak.desc: Nurturing to a fault, this Pokemon will fervently watch over young Dreepy to keep them out of trouble. It becomes anxious if it has no Dreepy to care for.
cobblemon.species.hoenniandragapult.name: HoennianDragapult
cobblemon.species.hoenniandragapult.desc: Explorers of old would often mistake the Dreepy it carries as additional heads. To this day, this Pokemon is still known as the 'Volcanic Hydra'
cobblemon.species.hoennianregigigas.name: HoennianRegigigas
cobblemon.species.hoennianregigigas.desc: After eons of being sealed away, all that remains of Regigigas is its skeletal structure. In its prime, this Pokemon was capable of reshaping the world.
cobblemon.species.vitellion.name: Vitellion
cobblemon.species.crawb.name: Crawb
cobblemon.species.metunn.name: Metunn
cobblemon.species.glimruff.name: Glimruff
cobblemon.species.glimruff.desc: At dawn, they howl by the seashore. The golden leaf on its forehead catches the light of the sunrise and casts a brilliant glow, considered a good omen by sailors.
cobblemon.species.gildog.name: Gildog
cobblemon.species.gildog.desc: The feather-like leaves on its body are coveted, but also razor-sharp, and it will attack with a rush of strikes if it's threatened. Its forelegs are covered in tough, protective bark.
cobblemon.species.heraldise.name: Heraldise
cobblemon.species.heraldise.desc: With a burst of speed, it can gracefully sprint across the forest canopy, as if flying. The gold leaves on its body gather in sunlight to become more luminous, the energy allowing it to run even faster.
cobblemon.species.noviss.name: Noviss
cobblemon.species.noviss.desc: It has a piercing stare, and never seems to take its eyes off something it's interested in, often sitting motionless for hours. One lick from its tongue can cause paralysis.
cobblemon.species.volkydra.name: Volkydra
cobblemon.species.volkydra.desc: If it winds up in danger, this Pokemon paralyzes its enemies with a single glare, then escapes into the grass. With enough focus from its eyes, this Pokemon can light fires from a distance.
cobblemon.species.thermodusa.name: Thermodusa
cobblemon.species.thermodusa.desc: Its eyes generate electromagnetic energy. By intensely focusing its stare, it slows down its target's nerves until the point of total paralysis, allowing it to approach and strike without any chance of escape.
cobblemon.species.mollup.name: Mollup
cobblemon.species.mollup.desc: On its tail is a coral polyp that is slowly growing. When this Pokemon eats, it feeds the polyp too, and they will eventually evolve together.
cobblemon.species.polypod.name: Polypod
cobblemon.species.polypod.desc: The coral polyp on its back secretes minerals that harden its body into a shell. Because its coral polyp collects food for it, it spends most of its time sleeping without a care in the world.
cobblemon.species.carcoral.name: Carcoral
cobblemon.species.carcoral.desc: Carcoral's body is covered in a kind of spiny coral which thrives in clean water. It's been known to rescue people who are drowning, but only if they respect the seas it lives in.
cobblemon.species.shrewpy.name: Shrewpy
cobblemon.species.shrewpy.desc: It follows other Pokemon to find its way to food; if it's left alone, it will get lost and starve.
cobblemon.species.rattotem.name: Rattotem
cobblemon.species.rattotem.desc: The three Shrewpy form a coordinated group. They don't fear anything because nothing can sneak up on them; one remains awake while the other two sleep.
cobblemon.species.sootillar.name: Sootillar
cobblemon.species.sootillar.desc: A hardy Bug Pokemon that thrives even in heavily industrialized areas. It's considered a pest as it likes to enter houses through chimneys, attracted by the soot lining the inside.
cobblemon.species.cloakhrys.name: Cloakhrys
cobblemon.species.cloakhrys.desc: It filters pollutants out of the air to form its cocoon of toxic smoke. Everything around it within a small radius withers away as it silently awaits evolution.
cobblemon.species.chimneoth.name: Chimneoth
cobblemon.species.chimneoth.desc: Chimneoth's wings are patterned to let it hide against tree bark. Populations of this Pokemon have darker wings the closer they are to human civilization because of pollution.
cobblemon.species.turbird.name: Turbird
cobblemon.species.turbird.desc: It's one of the most lightweight bird Pokemon, so it can fly at consistent fast speeds for hours. When it sees food, it flies directly at it with bullet-like precision.
cobblemon.species.aeracer.name: Aeracer
cobblemon.species.aeracer.desc: Aeracer's ability to maintain sustained flight is strong enough that it could circle the moon several times before tiring. It nests on cliff faces where predators cannot reach it.
cobblemon.species.swifterror.name: Swifterror
cobblemon.species.swifterror.desc: By becoming completely airborne, it's lost the need to walk almost entirely. It can track down its target for miles with pinpoint accuracy, then catches it with its talons.
cobblemon.species.shamseed.name: Shamseed
cobblemon.species.shamseed.desc: Shamseed is always obliviously happy. Even though its leaves are considered a good luck charm, it remains cheerful even as it's escaping danger.
cobblemon.species.luckopatch.name: Luckopatch
cobblemon.species.luckopatch.desc: It's considered supremely good luck if you can catch a Luckopatch, but they're tricksters at heart, and easily evade capture from many would-be hunters.
cobblemon.species.malignat.name: Malignat
cobblemon.species.malignat.desc: This Pokemon saps energy from unhappy people. On busy subway trains full of people making their morning commute, many Malignat can be found hooked underneath the train.
cobblemon.species.skeejack.name: Skeejack
cobblemon.species.skeejack.desc: Skeejack delights in causing trouble, dismantling whatever breakable objects it can find. Its most favorite pastime is hijacking vehicles and driving off with them.
cobblemon.species.helful.name: Helful
cobblemon.species.helful.desc: Dust sticks to this Pokemon's body and forms its protective overcoat. It can clean a dirty floor simply by rolling around on its side.
cobblemon.species.gatherelf.name: Gatherelf
cobblemon.species.gatherelf.desc: When a Gatherelf enters a home, it generally wants to help tidy the place up. Annoy one, however, and it will make a terrible mess and never return.
cobblemon.species.rokkap.name: Rokkap
cobblemon.species.rokkap.desc: Born from old rocks, they are irritable Pokemon that live in the mountains. They often hike down into the surrounding forests and cause trouble, marking trees by gouging the bark with their claws.
cobblemon.species.dreadcap.name: Dreadcap
cobblemon.species.dreadcap.desc: When it takes down a foe, the rock cone on its head becomes slightly taller. Excessively cruel Dreadcap are eventually punished as their heads become too heavy to hold up, leaving them pinned to the ground forever.
cobblemon.species.shpell.name: Shpell
cobblemon.species.shpell.desc: Its psychic power is stored under its shell, and that power is bestowed on any who wear it. Any attempts to remove the shell result in Shpell retreating inside and preventing its acquisition, however.
cobblemon.species.wiznail.name: Wiznail
cobblemon.species.wiznail.desc: It spends most of its time in deep thought, protected by its shell. As it contemplates, it generates a psychic barrier that strengthens its defenses and repels attackers.
cobblemon.species.forlawn.name: Forlawn
cobblemon.species.forlawn.desc: It looks like any ordinary patch of grass, but it's filled with magical energy. Tread on a Forlawn and you will surely lose your way.
cobblemon.species.foaloch.name: Foaloch
cobblemon.species.foaloch.desc: It walks uneasily due to its young legs, so it spends most of its time in the water while its body strengthens. The lily pad on its back is buoyant and allows it to tread water without fear of drowning, though it tends to drift off if unattended.
cobblemon.species.neyloch.name: Neyloch
cobblemon.species.neyloch.desc: At full running speed, it can gallop on the surface of water. Only a trusted companion can ride this Pokemon; anyone else would be kicked off or worse, dragged to the bottom of the sea.
cobblemon.species.quarina.name: Quarina
cobblemon.species.quarina.desc: Schools of Quarina will poke their heads out of the water and sing in unison, blowing air from the horn on their heads to produce a melodic sound. Different lakes are associated with different songs.
cobblemon.species.sonoreef.name: Sonoreef
cobblemon.species.sonoreef.desc: The gentle motion of its tail fins creates a bell-like sound with a calming effect. It can use its fins to fly above the water, allowing it to carry its song through the air across great distances.
cobblemon.species.ottoil.name: Ottoil
cobblemon.species.ottoil.desc: It didn't appear in the region until modern times, but it doesn't cause trouble with the native Pokemon. A film of waterproof goo keeps it insulated in chilly water.
cobblemon.species.slithotter.name: Slithotter
cobblemon.species.slithotter.desc: Slithotter are fierce but cooperative Pokemon, patrolling the Mythirean rivers for food. They take down their prey by latching on with their razor-sharp fangs and wearing it down with sheer numbers.
cobblemon.species.naiadawn.name: Naiadawn
cobblemon.species.naiadawn.desc: A Bug Pokemon that lives in water, and spends most of its life in this form. It sometimes leaps out of the water in an attempt to fly, but can't.
cobblemon.species.maynoon.name: Maynoon
cobblemon.species.maynoon.desc: It has the shortest period before evolution of any Pokemon. After congregating with others of its kind above the lake it was born in, it becomes dormant and falls into the water, all in the span of an hour.
cobblemon.species.nymphemeral.name: Nymphemeral
cobblemon.species.nymphemeral.desc: The discarded husk of a Maynoon that had reached the end of its life. It's possessed by some lingering essence of its former self, so it floats aimlessly throughout the night.
cobblemon.species.nooch.name: Nooch
cobblemon.species.nooch.desc: It doesn't gather food for itself; rather, it establishes a psychic link with another being and steals nutrients telekinetically. The link is broken if it tastes salty food, which it hates.
cobblemon.species.salamuncher.name: Salamuncher
cobblemon.species.salamuncher.desc: Salamuncher is so driven by intense hunger that its psychic power is stored in its stomach rather than its tiny brain. Its stomach rumbling induces hunger in anything close enough to hear it.
cobblemon.species.mockerel.name: Mockerel
cobblemon.species.mockerel.desc: Though it looks like a fish, it's actually a Grass Pokemon that hunts in the water. It tangles up prey with the leaf on its belly when they are enticed by its sweet smell.
cobblemon.species.geobat.name: Geobat
cobblemon.species.geobat.desc: It climbs on cave walls with its strong wing claws. Disturbing the silence of a cave may cause many sleeping Geobat to fall from the ceiling at the same time.
cobblemon.species.protebat.name: Protebat
cobblemon.species.protebat.desc: Because of the rocky armor covering its body, Protebat's wings are useless for flight, but it uses them to guard against attacks. It can fold completely into a ball and resemble an ordinary stone.
cobblemon.species.deecoin.name: Deecoin
cobblemon.species.deecoin.desc: When it forages in the dirt for food, its back points up and looks like a coin. When something attracted by the shine comes close, Deecoin becomes startled and attacks.
cobblemon.species.bankarak.name: Bankarak
cobblemon.species.bankarak.desc: It gobbles up anything that has monetary value. People looking for riches inside a Bankarak's den will end up knocked over as this Pokemon eats all of their money.
cobblemon.species.cushimera.name: Cushimera
cobblemon.species.cushimera.desc: Its tail looks like a mouth lined with razor teeth, but it's just for show; this Pokemon prefers to shy away from conflict. In the presence of children, it becomes placid and will not try to escape.
cobblemon.species.fungotta.name: Fungotta
cobblemon.species.fungotta.desc: Fungotta usually live underground, but emerge during rainy weather to happily frolic in the downpour. Inhaling the clouds of spores this Pokemon creates induces fear.
cobblemon.species.chanterra.name: Chanterra
cobblemon.species.chanterra.desc: They sprout from the graves of the dead after rainfall. Resembling ancient warriors, they keep watch for trespassers and defend those resting places with their lives.
cobblemon.species.noxight.name: Noxight
cobblemon.species.noxight.desc: Other Pokemon are scared away by the eye markings on its body, which glow a sinister red. In the chance that a Pokemon isn't fooled, Noxight whips up a gust from its gas-filled body and floats away.
cobblemon.species.strappen.name: Strappen
cobblemon.species.strappen.desc: It moves by sliding across the ground as if it were ice-skating. If it falls over, its hard head armor protects it from any injury.
cobblemon.species.ruffiguin.name: Ruffiguin
cobblemon.species.ruffiguin.desc: Ruffiguin are extremely territorial. When something they don't like wanders into their habitat, they will rush it down in packs and attack with their sharp wings.
cobblemon.species.salmonic.name: Salmonic
cobblemon.species.salmonic.desc: Salmonic are born in the inland rivers and travel to the sea to eat and grow. When they become adults, they return to the river they were born in.
cobblemon.species.cephamore.name: Cephamore
cobblemon.species.cephamore.desc: These tiny Pokemon swarm swimmers in great numbers out of curiosity, sensing their thoughts. They mean no harm, but they secrete a toxic fluid that can sicken people.
cobblemon.species.casanauta.name: Casanauta
cobblemon.species.casanauta.desc: As part of its courtship ritual, it present a bouquet of torn-off Tentacruel tentacles as a gift to a Sirenara. The more potent the venom, the more likely she will accept the Casanauta's offer.
cobblemon.species.sirenara.name: Sirenara
cobblemon.species.sirenara.desc: It uses its mesmerizing voice and movements to attract Casanauta, but the call often summons hapless sailors who end up lost at sea. The embrace of a Sirenara is deadly, as it feeds on life energy.
cobblemon.species.platinux.name: Platinux
cobblemon.species.platinux.desc: Electricity builds up on the surface of its snout over time, which it can release as a devastating concentrated bolt. When its bristly fur stands on end, it's a sign that it's fully charged and ready to attack.
cobblemon.species.mermor.name: Mermor
cobblemon.species.mermor.desc: It's small and picked on by other sea Pokemon, so it hides inside of shells for protection. However, it tends to get stuck and becomes even easier to catch.
cobblemon.species.shellance.name: Shellance
cobblemon.species.shellance.desc: When it evolved, it became intelligent enough to create crude weapons out of seashells. It uses these to scare off anything that enters its territory.
cobblemon.species.aquarrior.name: Aquarrior
cobblemon.species.aquarrior.desc: Aquarrior are guardians of the sea, but are feared. They will attack boats without provocation and drag the crew to the seafloor.
cobblemon.species.banshoal.name: Banshoal
cobblemon.species.banshoal.desc: Banshoal prizes itself on its appearance and loves to be the center of attention, which it achieves by overshadowing all competition with its colorful fins. However, its squawking voice is shrill enough to break glass.
cobblemon.species.radroot.name: Radroot
cobblemon.species.powaflowa.name: Powaflowa
cobblemon.species.powaflowa.desc: It points its head towards the sun to collect sunlight with its energy-absorbing petals. Since it can't see, it detects sources of heat and lets loose bolts of stored electricity at them.
cobblemon.species.hooligrub.name: Hooligrub
cobblemon.species.hooligrub.desc: It eats plant roots and even crops on occasion by scooping them out of the soil. When it's angry, the red parts of its body become intensely hot and power up its attacks.
cobblemon.species.fulgorough.name: Fulgorough
cobblemon.species.fulgorough.desc: Brash and extremely confident, it takes its territory by putting on a fearsome display with its horn and wings, but it flees if it ends up outmatched in a fight.
cobblemon.species.argonacre.name: Argonacre
cobblemon.species.argonacre.desc: Argonacre are prized for their beautiful crystal shells, grown over the course of their whole lives. They were once plentiful, but poaching has made them rare.
cobblemon.species.gargarool.name: Gargarool
cobblemon.species.gargarool.desc: Its body is always boiling hot to the touch from chemical processes going on inside of it; wherever it goes, water turns to steam and the air surges with electricity. When the sea bubbles over with strange foam, sailors are warned to stay away.
cobblemon.species.snuffellow.name: Snuffellow
cobblemon.species.snuffellow.desc: It communicates with honks and hoots after it eats its fill of warm food. Train operators use Snuffellow as a convenient substitute if the whistle fails to work, and they are rewarded with a share of hot coals to eat.
cobblemon.species.belostoke.name: Belostoke
cobblemon.species.belostoke.desc: It uses gusts of smog to smoke out its Bug Pokemon prey, then sucks them up by inhaling through its tiny mouth. The leftover shells of its prey are used as fuel to create more smoke.
cobblemon.species.hadrosmoke.name: Hadrosmoke
cobblemon.species.hadrosmoke.desc: It engages in fierce endurance battles among other Hadrosmoke. The two challengers strain their nasal sacs to blow steam from their horns; the one who passes out from exhaustion first is ousted from the territory.
cobblemon.species.aardpipe.name: Aardpipe
cobblemon.species.aardpipe.desc: It sticks its nose into the burrows of Bug Pokemon and honks loudly to draw them out. However, it also has a habit of doing this through open windows, making it an annoyance.
cobblemon.species.gauzerpent.name: Gauzerpent
cobblemon.species.gauzerpent.desc: Because its body is wrapped up, it grabs objects using the frayed edges of its bandages. It can deliver forceful slaps by spinning its whole body.
cobblemon.species.underrap.name: Underrap
cobblemon.species.underrap.desc: Most of Underrap's body is hollow, so it can easily squeeze itself through tight spaces or stretch its arms to punch. If you were to be pulled inside of it, you would be drained of all bodily fluids in seconds.
cobblemon.species.thawrax.name: Thawrax
cobblemon.species.thawrax.desc: It's extremely sensitive to temperature—if it's not in direct sunlight, it freezes solid. Thawrax can only thrive in hot and dry conditions that thaw its icy covering.
cobblemon.species.candore.name: Candore
cobblemon.species.candore.desc: It loves to gnaw on rocks—it considers precious gems a sweet treat. To keep its body clean, it will wander into wave-battered sea caves and be smoothed down by erosion.
cobblemon.species.sucrostone.name: Sucrostone
cobblemon.species.sucrostone.desc: The rocky shell covering Sucrostone's body is actually extremely sweet, like sugar. It eats by opening its shell and pulling food in with such speed that its inner body cannot be seen.
cobblemon.species.knotyors.name: Knotyors
cobblemon.species.knotyors.desc: Some believe that the gold nugget that it's wrapped around is actually an egg. These Pokemon are always trying to steal each other's gold nuggets, so some Knotyors will even try to eat their gold to hide it.
cobblemon.species.heeleap.name: Heeleap
cobblemon.species.heeleap.desc: A tightly-coiled tail allows this Pokemon to bounce to great heights. When in danger, its tail can rapidly uncoil to a sharpened point to use as a weapon.
cobblemon.species.sparroing.name: Sparroing
cobblemon.species.sparroing.desc: Sparroing nimbly bound across rooftops with their springy feet, damaging roofs and causing all sorts of trouble. The coiled legs can extend up to ten times in length to kick enemies with iron force.
cobblemon.species.whirlibyg.name: Whirlibyg
cobblemon.species.whirlibyg.desc: Whirlibyg rotates as it gently floats to the ground. After landing, it climbs the nearest tree to do it all over again. This way, it can cover great distances across the forest much faster than on foot.
cobblemon.species.alpurr.name: Alpurr
cobblemon.species.alpurr.desc: Alpurr lives high in the mountains, chasing prey into higher altitudes to overexert it. Its fur has sharp, bristly edges, so petting it isn't recommended without protective gloves.
cobblemon.species.feliridge.name: Feliridge
cobblemon.species.feliridge.desc: Its fur accumulates minerals from its mountain habitat, forming sharp, rocky spikes. In the winter months, the spikes increase even further in size as snow piles on them.
cobblemon.species.scooclops.name: Scooclops
cobblemon.species.scooclops.desc: It's almost weightless when moving fast enough, so it can glide between rooftops and valleys without falling down. However, Scooclops cannot steer at all and crashes into obstacles easily.
cobblemon.species.motocyclops.name: Motocyclops
cobblemon.species.motocyclops.desc: Motocyclops live for speed. At night, when people are all asleep, packs of this Pokemon race each other on the streets. Its spiked wheels maintain perfect traction even on rough or icy terrain.
cobblemon.species.draybale.name: Draybale
cobblemon.species.grumbale.name: Grumbale
cobblemon.species.grumbale.desc: The hair covering its body scatters as it thrashes about in a rage. Because the hair contains built-up static electricity, it inflicts a terribly prickly feeling when touched.
cobblemon.species.clinglee.name: Clinglee
cobblemon.species.clinglee.desc: It is unsatisfied without the company of others, attaching its sticky body to passersby. If truly desperate for attention, it will release a pheromone from the valves on its head that attracts other Clinglee.
cobblemon.species.valentox.name: Valentox
cobblemon.species.valentox.desc: Evo Pixie PunchSTAB Fairy - Pixie PunchSTAB Fairy - Tackle Normal - Baby-Doll Eyes Fairy 7 CuddleSTAB Fairy 11 AcidSTAB Poison 14 Sweet Kiss Fairy 19 SludgeSTAB Poison 22 Uproar Normal 25 Attract Normal 27 Cherub ArrowSTAB Fairy 31 Screech Normal 35 Acid SpraySTAB Poison 38 Tearful Look Normal 42 Sludge WaveSTAB Poison 46 Love LariatSTAB Fairy 49 Destiny Bond Ghost 53 Outrage Dragon
cobblemon.species.pastryderm.name: Pastryderm
cobblemon.species.pastryderm.desc: Pastryderm is covered in a sugary powder that it sprays from its trunk. It's known as 'a baker's best friend' because this powder can make any confection much tastier.
cobblemon.species.bonfear.name: Bonfear
cobblemon.species.bonfear.desc: The lantern it carries absorbs heat, so everything around it becomes cold. No matter how much warmth it steals, however, Bonfear is always shivering.
cobblemon.species.tamareath.name: Tamareath
cobblemon.species.tamareath.desc: A Tamareath's tail is decorated with baubles representing its past lives. Biologically immortal, its life only ends when it chooses to be buried alongside a lifelong companion.
cobblemon.species.facadino.name: Facadino
cobblemon.species.facadino.desc: It continues to wear pieces of its egg long after it has hatched. While most of the eggshell falls off as it grows, the piece on its face remains forever, and will eventually merge with its skin when it evolves.
cobblemon.species.maskilisk.name: Maskilisk
cobblemon.species.maskilisk.desc: A mysterious Pokemon that lives in the woods, a covering of feathers keeps it warm in the winter months. There are stories of a human child that was raised by these Pokemon as one of their own.
cobblemon.species.maskrusher.name: Maskrusher
cobblemon.species.maskrusher.desc: A solitary Pokemon that lives only in the deepest forests of Mythire. Seeing one standing tall in the woods is a rare sight to behold, but this Pokemon can charge with its rock-hard head at any intruder.
cobblemon.species.selpolar.name: Selpolar
cobblemon.species.selpolar.desc: It can live on land by shifting its form to walk upright. However, it's most at home in the sea, where it serenades sailors passing by, sometimes to their doom.
cobblemon.species.venowhal.name: Venowhal
cobblemon.species.venowhal.desc: Slow on land but very agile underwater, it skewers rivals with its poison tusk. Its age can be determined by the frequency of battle scars on its body.
cobblemon.species.tentalum.name: Tentalum
cobblemon.species.tentalum.desc: It sits motionless for hours until the sun shines on it just right. It's believed that it uses the sun's rays to tell the time so it can stick to its routine.
cobblemon.species.octempus.name: Octempus
cobblemon.species.octempus.desc: It's somewhat listless, but always follows commands on schedule. One Octempus became world famous for accurately predicting the results of battle tournaments.
cobblemon.species.furibal.name: Furibal
cobblemon.species.furibal.desc: Furibal huddle together during the cold winter nights, their fluffy bodies keeping each other warm. They also do this to hide their blue tails, which stick out among the snow.
cobblemon.species.cottontile.name: Cottontile
cobblemon.species.cottontile.desc: When it lies flat against the ground, it looks like a big pile of snow. Its body is actually very slender underneath its thick coat of fur, so it moves swiftly.
cobblemon.species.snomint.name: Snomint
cobblemon.species.snomint.desc: It's often seen playing in snow and leaf piles in the winter. It only thrives on clean water; Snomint is nowhere to be found in areas with dirty, polluted slush.
cobblemon.species.snofresh.name: Snofresh
cobblemon.species.snofresh.desc: The effervescent aroma from the leaves of this Pokemon soothes the body and mind, so they're brewed to create teas and perfumes. Eaten raw, however, the leaves will freeze you solid!
cobblemon.species.snomatcha.name: Snomatcha
cobblemon.species.snomatcha.desc: It bears few leaves because it can synthesize energy from its green body alone. What sparse leaves it does grow are considered among the rarest of herbs, but obtaining them is a dangerous challenge.
cobblemon.species.chillade.name: Chillade
cobblemon.species.frosillade.name: Frosillade
cobblemon.species.frosillade.desc: It launches snowballs that are loaded with small chunks of metal, which bolsters the strength of the impact. Only other Frosillade can hope to compete in their snowball fights.
cobblemon.species.wrestlegent.name: Wrestlegent
cobblemon.species.wrestlegent.desc: Wrestlegent has a stern disposition and rarely ever shows any sign of emotion, but it has a kind heart deep down. When its friends are in danger, it will immediately pummel its enemies with cold fury to protect them.
cobblemon.species.aragaunt.name: Aragaunt
cobblemon.species.aragaunt.desc: The spines on its neck are receptive to even the slightest movement. Hooked to the ceiling, Aragaunt suddenly stretches its head down and grabs prey with its fangs.
cobblemon.species.arbyssno.name: Arbyssno
cobblemon.species.arbyssno.desc: Trenchula lives in total darkness, sensing the movements of its prey. When it moves, it makes no sound at all.
cobblemon.species.icthymp.name: Icthymp
cobblemon.species.memoram.name: Memoram
cobblemon.species.memoram.desc: This Pokemon can sense the feelings of others using the energy stored in its curved horns. If it detects ill will, it will repel the foe with ear-splitting wailing, signaling the rest of the herd to assist.
cobblemon.species.puwallop.name: Puwallop
cobblemon.species.boxbuffer.name: Boxbuffer
cobblemon.species.boxbuffer.desc: It's able to swell its fists with water to make them heavier and stronger. By lowering its head and raising its fists, it can easily cushion all damage before rebounding with a brutal counterattack.
cobblemon.species.shelswap.name: Shelswap
cobblemon.species.shelswap.desc: An odd, secretive Pokemon. It collects lost eggs and brings them to safe new homes and parents. It's thought to have evolved from a mysterious egg that never hatched, so it protects the eggs of others.
cobblemon.species.vermacrom.name: Vermacrom
cobblemon.species.vermacrom.desc: Wherever Vermacrom burrows, its super-heated mouth leaves behind smooth tunnels in the earth. It's believed that as its body cools towards the end of its life, the charred debris left behind will eventually recombine into a new Vermacrom.
cobblemon.species.lodie.name: Lodie
cobblemon.species.lodie.desc: The magnetic field generated by Lodie causes it to attract others of its kind, creating colonies. When two Lodie collide, they emit a wave of electric energy as long as they're making contact.
cobblemon.species.lodeoni.name: Lodeoni
cobblemon.species.lodeoni.desc: It's given power by the many Lodie that swarm around its body. They keep it clean of the many metal objects that are attracted by its magnetic pull.
cobblemon.species.ballistikon.name: Ballistikon
cobblemon.species.ballistikon.desc: With a vault from its arms, Ballistikon can roll into a rapid spin, tearing up the ground in its path. Its reinforced armor is so tough that it can use itself as a battering ram to crash through steel.
cobblemon.species.ribitar.name: Ribitar
cobblemon.species.ribitar.desc: It was revived from a fossil found in a tar pit. Strangely, this Pokemon's face is inside its mouth! This peculiarity has made it a true scientific curiosity as to how it survived like this.
cobblemon.species.amphibrea.name: Amphibrea
cobblemon.species.amphibrea.desc: Amphibrea basks in sunlight for most of the day, using its sticky skin like boiling-hot flypaper. In spite of its heavy body, its spring-like hind legs can vault its bulk into the air to crush foes.
cobblemon.species.timidon.name: Timidon
cobblemon.species.timidon.desc: A cowardly Pokemon often abandoned by its parents at birth. In the absence of parental care, it collects whatever it can find with little regard for its own basic needs, hoarding them in its lonesome burrow.
cobblemon.species.enduron.name: Enduron
cobblemon.species.enduron.desc: It collects shiny objects and uses them to build up its shell, slowly strengthening its weak body. It wears the first object it ever found on its forehead, and uses it to magnify its psychic power to intense levels.
cobblemon.species.chrystasis.name: Chrystasis
cobblemon.species.chrystasis.desc: It's entombed itself in a crystal cocoon, but it will never hatch. Inside, its psychic power becomes so intense that it can still move around, even though its inner body slumbers within.
cobblemon.species.effipy.name: Effipy
cobblemon.species.effipy.desc: Its feathers are made of sharp metal fibers that can cut through stone. This Pokemon is very hard to please and will chirp incessantly if it doesn't get its way.
cobblemon.species.harpiron.name: Harpiron
cobblemon.species.harpiron.desc: Harpiron are very fussy and stubborn Pokemon that aren't willing to back down from what they've learned. In ancient times, they were used to guard sacred places.
cobblemon.species.mistoria.name: Mistoria
cobblemon.species.mistoria.desc: A spirit of calm weather and the eternal rival of Vortereign. It uses its power over water to weaken the intense summer storms created by it and its rival's constant quarreling.
cobblemon.species.vortereign.name: Vortereign
cobblemon.species.vortereign.desc: A spirit of winter who battles with Mistoria over control of the sea; the coming of winter is a sign that it's gotten the upper hand. As long as it's active, the weather rages, preventing the sailing of ships.
cobblemon.species.pestinox.name: Pestinox
cobblemon.species.pestinox.desc: A cruel Pokemon of the sea that detests humans almost as much as it hates the coming of summer. It spreads misery wherever it goes, but if it touches clean, fresh water, it will be kept away.
cobblemon.species.solstarian.name: Solstarian
cobblemon.species.solstarian.desc: Old legends tell of an ancient, evil Pokemon that burned the land with its one eye before being struck down by a hero. It is possible that this is a resurrection of that Pokemon from the legend.
cobblemon.species.garlone.name: Garlone
cobblemon.species.garlone.desc: Told in old stories, Garlone defended the Mythire region from invaders and evil forces. In a single night, it was able to drive off an entire army with its strength and skill.
cobblemon.species.mementori.name: Mementori
cobblemon.species.mementori.desc: Wherever Mementori roosts, a terrible battle is sure to follow. When the carnage has ceased, it guides the spirits of the fallen to the afterlife.
cobblemon.species.aggronut.name: Aggronut
cobblemon.species.aggronut.desc: Aggronut are always keen to pick a fight, making them hard to train. It's assumed this is only done as a form of play, as Aggronut are only observed doing this with either their parents, or their trainers.
cobblemon.species.kerbunsta.name: Kerbunsta
cobblemon.species.kerbunsta.desc: Kernbusta has a hardened shell that insulates the intense heat inside of its body. To vent its anger, it launches itself at foes with an explosive headbutt.
cobblemon.species.harebinger.name: Harebinger
cobblemon.species.harebinger.desc: Aggressive by nature, Harebinger dig burrows in enemy territory as a display of superiority. They only show kindness to their own family, biological or chosen, and blast other dens with kernel missiles.
cobblemon.species.meltuff.name: Meltuff
cobblemon.species.meltuff.desc: Meltuff like to act like they're the toughest Pokemon you've ever seen, never accepting gifts and always scoffing at forms of affection. When left all alone with it's trainers, however... they love to be hugged and fed snacks.
cobblemon.species.magrumble.name: Magrumble
cobblemon.species.magrumble.desc: Magrumble are noted as being quite simple, enjoying food and basic forms of comedy as entertainment. They will make, quote, 'lava-farts' with their mouths and hand, much to the amusement of more immature trainers.
cobblemon.species.nibblish.name: Nibblish
cobblemon.species.nibblish.desc: Nibblish are rough-and-tumble by nature, and enjoy playfighting with all sorts of Pokémon. They often will bite too hard while playing, and will feel bad for days.
cobblemon.species.vicera.name: Vicera
cobblemon.species.vicera.desc: Vicera are still as jolly as their previous evolution, but often times will be overtaken by a need to bite things, rather than having it be by accident. They still feel bad afterwards, however.
cobblemon.species.marawder.name: Marawder
cobblemon.species.marawder.desc: Marawder are towering, brutal Pokémon that have forsaken their kindly demeanor and have fully adopted their instincts as fighters. That is, that's what they'd like for you to think. In private, Marawder are as jovial as ever.
cobblemon.species.squirelutton.name: Squirelutton
cobblemon.species.squirelutton.desc: Squireluttons are nutorious for stealing lots of food right before hibernating season. They keep it all in hollowed out trees, and gorge on the food until spring.
cobblemon.species.muncheek.name: Muncheek
cobblemon.species.muncheek.desc: Muncheeks love to sit around and do absolutely nothing. They're so lazy that they're known to become completely stationary for 10 days. They feed on the food supplies Squirluttons gather.
cobblemon.species.scuffbill.name: Scuffbill
cobblemon.species.scuffbill.desc: Scuffbill are considered ruffians by nature, but their rough upbringing only exemplifies their inordinate anger. Their beak is rough and powerful, capable of taking most blows that would normally cause heavy damage.
cobblemon.species.balaefax.name: Balaefax
cobblemon.species.balaefax.desc: Balaefax are downright cruel in their parentage, favoring their strongest chicks while leaving the others to starve. Once fully grown, Balaefax are capable of destroying solid brick walls with their kicks.
cobblemon.species.larintenant.name: Larintenant
cobblemon.species.larintenant.desc: Battle-hardened Wingulls in Fliga push themselves to evolve into Larintenants, and will then train their flock to harass snack-having beachgoers until they eat or faint. It's theorized they do this because, despite evolving, they're still fairly unintelligent.
cobblemon.species.avalossiannincada.name: AvalossianNincada
cobblemon.species.shinodea.name: Shinodea
cobblemon.species.shinodea.desc: As Avalossian Nincada grow and evolve, their hunting techniques of sneak attacks and preying on the oblivious lead them to evolve into Shinodea. Shinodea wield razor sharp wings, capable of slicing ignorant quarry into ribbons before they even have a chance to react.
cobblemon.species.larvhilt.name: Larvhilt
cobblemon.species.larvhilt.desc: Larvhilt often train each others' stingers by sparring, with the loser usually breaking their own and needing to regrow it. When they get tired, Larvhilt will climb to the tops of trees and stab themselves into it, falling asleep within the leaves.
cobblemon.species.cutlassp.name: Cutlassp
cobblemon.species.cutlassp.desc: Waspieres form nests in the damp forests with their own kind. They carry their stingers as sabers, wielding them with intense precision. Waspieres are very competitive, and will spare with just about anything until they either faint or pass out from exhaustion.
cobblemon.species.beani.name: Beani
cobblemon.species.beani.desc: Beani are born in a somewhat atypical fashion. While they're completely capable of hatching normally, farmers like to plant the eggs in the ground and keep them safe until the Beani is born. Beani are universally beloved due to secreting a salty liquid that is often used by chefs.
cobblemon.species.setsubean.name: Setsubean
cobblemon.species.setsubean.desc: The salty liquid Beani produce slowly evolves into a sort of mental enhancer for the Pokemon, helping it evolve into Setsubean and unlocking it's full telekinetic abilities. If a trainer tastes the post-evolution liquid, they become susceptible to brainwashing.
cobblemon.species.sconsimese.name: Sconsimese
cobblemon.species.kashigan.name: Kashigan
cobblemon.species.jatilohunn.name: Jatilohunn
cobblemon.species.jatilohunn.desc: Jatilohunn often do not see their offspring until they're fully grown, as they are extremely aggressive with the same gender of their species. Despite this, they will defend their Kangaskhan mates with their life.
cobblemon.species.avalossianshellos.name: AvalossianShellos
cobblemon.species.avalossianshellos.desc: Avalossian Shellos, specifically the moist variant, dwell deep in dank caves, munching on moss and the remains of deceased Pokemon alike. Their teeth are blade-like in nature, capable of being sharpened on the stone walls of it's home.
cobblemon.species.avalossiangastrodon.de: Long ago, it had a shell on its back. There's now a vestigial plate on its back that's hard but thin.
cobblemon.species.calaloof.name: Calaloof
cobblemon.species.calaloof.desc: Calaloof are timid Pokémon, and like to hide most of their face within discarded bags. These scaredy-pods are capable of a light hypnosis by shifting colors on their suction pods, but this has proven less effective on Pokémon of higher intelligence.
cobblemon.species.cephalofear.name: Cephalofear
cobblemon.species.cephalofear.desc: Despite its far more intimidating appearance, Cephalofear are still quite shy, and prefer to hide their face (or what little remains to fit inside) within the small brown bag it has held onto. To scare away foes or hypnotize prey, it will flash multiple colors across its body, sending any who gaze upon it into a fugue state.
cobblemon.species.scarasoil.name: Scarasoil
cobblemon.species.bowlaphod.name: Bowlaphod
cobblemon.species.bowlaphod.desc: Bowlaphods are used to the high temperature in Fliga, and have adapted to make sure they don't roast in the intense heat. They roll wet balls of mud and dung and bury the ball for their young.
cobblemon.species.budy.name: Budy
cobblemon.species.budy.desc: Budys frequently try to replicate how humans look and act by growing their moss out. They often have a hard time deciding what rocks to pick and how much they should grow, leading to a lopsided body.
cobblemon.species.growdup.name: Growdup
cobblemon.species.growdup.desc: Growdup, more organized and less eccentric than their prior evolution, prefer to sit around in grassy areas and find flowers to put on their body. Though they don't show it, they love it when kids come to play with it.
cobblemon.species.fubber.name: Fubber
cobblemon.species.jodoge.name: Jodoge
cobblemon.species.avalossianhappiny.name: AvalossianHappiny
cobblemon.species.avalossianhappiny.desc: When it sees something round and white, Happiny puts it into the pouch on its stomach. It sometimes becomes overloaded and can't move.
cobblemon.species.avalossianchansey.name: AvalossianChansey
cobblemon.species.avalossianblissey.name: AvalossianBlissey
cobblemon.species.pollutail.name: Pollutail
cobblemon.species.oiphinae.name: Oiphinae
cobblemon.species.hazarachi.name: Hazarachi
cobblemon.species.hazarachi.desc: Hazarachi drift about in the pitch-black depths of the sea, swallowing whatever they please. They bellow out the digested remains of their food as a potent pollutant that can suffocate anything in mere seconds.
cobblemon.species.gallostone.name: Gallostone
cobblemon.species.opalian.name: Opalian
cobblemon.species.opalian.desc: Gallantly defending the deep caverns of Fliga, Opalian are the perfect blend of elegance and toughness. Many Opalian never leave the deeper parts of the cavern due to their defensive attitudes.
cobblemon.species.avalossianparas.name: AvalossianParas
cobblemon.species.avalossianparasect.des: Avalossian Parasects emit a cloud of infectious spores on a constant basis. Thankfully, professors have studied how to counteract the diseases brought on by the spores, allowing Parasect to be kept as companions easier.
cobblemon.species.avalossianaipom.name: AvalossianAipom
cobblemon.species.avalossianaipom.desc: Avalossian Aipoms have a particular obsession with bones, and the sound they make when knocked together. Entire bands of Aipom will gather to smack bones on each other's skull helmets to make a grim, yet funky, beat.
cobblemon.species.slambizom.name: Slambizom
cobblemon.species.slambizom.desc: Avalossian Aipom often evolve into Slambizom, which allows them to each others heads with their tail-clubs for even louder 'performances'. Slambizom will continue to wear their skull helmets until they're completely shattered from the constant drumming.
cobblemon.species.macaqdeath.name: Macaqdeath
cobblemon.species.macaqdeath.desc: Upon receiving a skull helmet of another Aipom, Avalossian Aipom grow incredibly introspective and morose, evolving into Macaqdeath. Their creativity with music is translated into morbid theatrics with haunting soliloquies.
cobblemon.species.cocyfish.name: Cocyfish
cobblemon.species.cocyfish.desc: Cocyfish will loom over buildings and houses, waiting to consume the souls of the soon-to-be deceased. It's stomach glows with it's victims. To see a flock of them above any area is seen as a bad omen.
cobblemon.species.maliospi.name: Maliospi
cobblemon.species.maliospi.desc: Maliospi are deadly hunters that can infest riverbanks. They will swim so quickly that they have often had their scales fall of their body from the speeds they travel in the water. They also don't sleep, and only get rest when they've fainted in battle.
cobblemon.species.helsteteri.name: Helsteteri
cobblemon.species.helsteteri.desc: Helsteteri, instead of expending energy on chasing their prey as their unevolved brethren do, prefer to terrify and ensnare their prey with their new ghastly appearance and peeled scales. They are known to drain their victims bodies until completely empty.
cobblemon.species.avalossianralts.name: AvalossianRalts
cobblemon.species.avalossianralts.desc: If its horns capture the warm feelings of people or Pokémon, its body warms up slightly.
cobblemon.species.avalossiankirlia.name: AvalossianKirlia
cobblemon.species.avalossiankirlia.desc: The cheerful spirit of its Trainer gives it energy for its psychokinetic power. It spins and dances when happy.
cobblemon.species.avalossiangardevoir.de: Avalossian Gardevoir are still protectors by nature, but rather than bond with trainers, it seems to have sworn itself to an ancient order of sorts. They can grant the sword in their chest to worthy warriors, or use it themselves.
cobblemon.species.avalossiangallade.name: AvalossianGallade
cobblemon.species.avalossiangallade.desc: Avalossian Gallade are stalwart defenders of justice, and are often seen defending weaker Pokémon from cruel predators and trainers alike. They are known to gather in places that hold ancient importance.
cobblemon.species.twillowl.name: Twillowl
cobblemon.species.twillowl.desc: Twillowl are more active during the night. When the skies are starry, they fly in large groups for unknown reasons, which fills the skies with their slight gleam.
cobblemon.species.astrowl.name: Astrowl
cobblemon.species.astrowl.desc: Astrowl have always been used for delivering messages, because they never forget the directions to places they have visited before. It's said they use the stars to guide themselves.
cobblemon.species.nyaqua.name: Nyaqua
cobblemon.species.whiskereef.name: Whiskereef
cobblemon.species.intelattod.name: Intelattod
cobblemon.species.intelattod.desc: Intelattod are said to have dated back since the Stone Age. Then, they were as big as a fully grown trainer. Even if they're not nearly as large as their ancestors, they're still equally, if not more powerful.
cobblemon.species.slynx.name: Slynx
cobblemon.species.slynx.desc: It is said that a group of Meowth were once abandoned in the deep jungles of Fliga, learning to fend for themselves as they grew into Slynx. They are capable of ripping through almost any material like butter with its razor-sharp claws.
cobblemon.species.tragobite.name: Tragobite
cobblemon.species.sphyrnizor.name: Sphyrnizor
cobblemon.species.sphyrnizor.desc: Sphyrnizor are considerably dumb, only knowing how to swim and seek out pulses of electricity. When battling, if it's fully charged, it will tear it's opponents apart in a blind fury.
cobblemon.species.carchankle.name: Carchankle
cobblemon.species.carchankle.desc: Carchankle are fairly passive Pokemon, and are often found dwelling in the sand with their mates. Being omnivorous, they suck up nutrients from the sandy floor below, not minding whatever they suck into their mouths.
cobblemon.species.avalossiantreecko.name: AvalossianTreecko
cobblemon.species.avalossiantreecko.desc: Living in the rocky mountains of Fliga, Treecko prefer to snack on minerals to provide nutrients to its sturdy skin.
cobblemon.species.avalossiangrovyle.name: AvalossianGrovyle
cobblemon.species.meekat.name: Meekat
