cobblemon.species.ayreianswanna.desc: Swanna start to dance at dawn. The one dancing in the middle is the leader of the flock.
cobblemon.species.ayreianvanillite.name: AyreianVanillite
cobblemon.species.ayreianvanillite.desc: Unable to survive in cold areas, it makes itself comfortable by breathing out air to cause sandstorms. It burrows into the sand to sleep.
cobblemon.species.ayreianvanillish.name: AyreianVanillish
cobblemon.species.ayreianvanillish.desc: Unable to survive in cold areas, it makes itself comfortable by breathing out air to cause sandstorms. It burrows into the sand to sleep.
cobblemon.species.ayreianvanilluxe.name: AyreianVanilluxe
cobblemon.species.ayreianvanilluxe.desc: Its outer shell is as hot as the inside of an active volcano. It obliviously burns everything in its vicinity to a crisp, be it friend or foe.
cobblemon.species.ayreianskiddo.name: AyreianSkiddo
cobblemon.species.ayreianskiddo.desc: These Pokemon prefer to live in areas with harsh climate, as they can withstand most elements.
cobblemon.species.ayreiangogoat.name: AyreianGogoat
cobblemon.species.ayreiangogoat.desc: Being incredibly defensive of their offspring, these Pokemon will purposely cause avalanches to scare away mountain climbers.
cobblemon.species.ayreianphantump.name: AyreianPhantump
cobblemon.species.ayreianphantump.desc: After a lost child perished in the forest, their spirit possessed a tree stump, causing the spirit's rebirth as this Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.ayreiantrevenant.name: AyreianTrevenant
cobblemon.species.ayreiantrevenant.desc: A collection of lost spirits, with the sole purpose of defending wildlife from those who seek to destroy it.
cobblemon.species.ayreianpancham.name: AyreianPancham
cobblemon.species.ayreianpancham.desc: Wanting to make sure it's taken seriously, Pancham's always giving others a glare. But if it's not focusing, it ends up smiling.
cobblemon.species.ayreianpangoro.name: AyreianPangoro
cobblemon.species.ayreianpangoro.desc: Angrier than a raging inferno, it pummels opponents with a fiery might. The fire emanating from its body is hot enough to melt the metal of a jet plane.
cobblemon.species.ayreiancarbink.name: AyreianCarbink
cobblemon.species.ayreiancarbink.desc: The bands of iron spinning around it's core protect it from almost every kind of attack.
cobblemon.species.ayreianklefki.name: AyreianKlefki
cobblemon.species.ayreianklefki.desc: Radiating with electricity, it was commonly used to access electronically locked facilities.
cobblemon.species.ayreianpumpkaboo.name: AyreianPumpkaboo
cobblemon.species.ayreianpumpkaboo.desc: When taking spirits to the afterlife, small Pumpkaboo prefer the spirits of children to those of adults.
cobblemon.species.ayreiangourgeist.name: AyreianGourgeist
cobblemon.species.ayreiangourgeist.desc: Soft cries emanate from its body in the dead of night. The sounds are said to be the wails of spirits who are resting in the afterlife.
cobblemon.species.ayreiannoibat.name: AyreianNoibat
cobblemon.species.ayreiannoibat.desc: It likes to think it has wings that allow it to fly when in reality it just floats around.
cobblemon.species.ayreiannoivern.name: AyreianNoivern
cobblemon.species.ayreiannoivern.desc: While it may look intimidating, it has a gentle and caring disposition. That said, it will shoot down anyone threatening its protege with beams of light.
cobblemon.species.ayreianfennekin.name: AyreianFennekin
cobblemon.species.ayreianfennekin.desc: This Pokemon is only seen near secluded icy lakes. They only emerge to drink from the springs when they are alone.
cobblemon.species.ayreianbraixen.name: AyreianBraixen
cobblemon.species.ayreianbraixen.desc: When the twig is plucked from its tail, friction sets the twig alight. The flame is used to send signals to its allies.
cobblemon.species.ayreiandelphox.name: AyreianDelphox
cobblemon.species.ayreiandelphox.desc: Travelers may be able to witness the songs of these foxes during an aurora. However, their voices also enhance the ice they use to chase off unwanted company.
cobblemon.species.ayreiantyrunt.name: AyreianTyrunt
cobblemon.species.ayreiantyrunt.desc: This is an ancient Pokémon. It has a violent disposition, and it uses its hefty jaws to tear everything apart.
cobblemon.species.ayreiantyrantrum.name: AyreianTyrantrum
cobblemon.species.ayreiantyrantrum.desc: After being buried for 100,000,000 years in a volcano, this Pokémon has been altered by the heat. It has the presence of a king, vicious but magnificent.
cobblemon.species.ayreianlitleo.name: AyreianLitleo
cobblemon.species.ayreianlitleo.desc: It can be found in greatly polluted areas. The fumes that emit from their mane can knock out a full-grown adult.
cobblemon.species.ayreianpyroar.name: AyreianPyroar
cobblemon.species.ayreianpyroar.desc: Adapted to the polluted grounds that have become its territory, it preys upon the smaller Pokémon in the urban landscape and defends its territory viciously from humankind.
cobblemon.species.ayreiancutiefly.name: AyreianCutiefly
cobblemon.species.ayreiancutiefly.desc: It propels itself forward by combusting its sweat, which creates a small explosion as it is similar to gunpowder.
cobblemon.species.ayreianribombee.name: AyreianRibombee
cobblemon.species.ayreianribombee.desc: During the New Year night, multiple Ribombee can be seen fluttering in the sky, creating eye-striking explosions via their peculiar powder.
cobblemon.species.ayreianmimikyu.name: AyreianMimikyu
cobblemon.species.ayreianmimikyu.desc: Said to be a furious spirit that inhabited a popular doll. When said doll is damaged, the hatred of the specter takes form.
cobblemon.species.ayreianyungoos.name: AyreianYungoos
cobblemon.species.ayreianyungoos.desc: Its stomach takes up most of its long torso. It's a big eater, so the amount Trainers have to spend on its food is no laughing matter.
cobblemon.species.ayreiangumshoos.name: AyreianGumshoos
cobblemon.species.ayreiangumshoos.desc: Its stomach takes up most of its long torso. It's a big eater, so the amount Trainers have to spend on its food is no laughing matter.
cobblemon.species.ayreiangrookey.name: AyreianGrookey
cobblemon.species.ayreiangrookey.desc: It attacks with rapid jolts of its stick. As it strikes with amazing speed, it gets more and more charged.
cobblemon.species.ayreianthwackey.name: AyreianThwackey
cobblemon.species.ayreianthwackey.desc: When it's drumming out rapid beats in battle, it gets so caught up in the rhythm that it won't even notice that it's already knocked out its opponent.
cobblemon.species.ayreianrillaboom.name: AyreianRillaboom
cobblemon.species.ayreianrillaboom.desc: Its ferocious drumming summons violent thunderstorms. It uses wind currents to direct its electric attacks.
cobblemon.species.ayreiansizzlipede.name: AyreianSizzlipede
cobblemon.species.ayreiansizzlipede.desc: It wraps prey up with its heated body, cooking them in its coils. Once they're well-done, it will voraciously nibble them down to the last morsel.
cobblemon.species.ayreiancentiskorch.des: While its burning body is already dangerous on its own, this excessively hostile Pokemon also has large and very sharp fangs.
cobblemon.species.ayreianhatenna.name: AyreianHatenna
cobblemon.species.ayreianhatenna.desc: Aware of its cuteness, it invites itself in the dens of other Pokemon and slowly fills them with spider webs.
cobblemon.species.ayreianhattrem.name: AyreianHattrem
cobblemon.species.ayreianhattrem.desc: Its leg-hairs have enough power to bend a metal pole in two. Because of this, they have no natural predators, and thrive in gloomy forests.
cobblemon.species.ayreianhatterene.name: AyreianHatterene
cobblemon.species.ayreianhatterene.desc: It plays with its prey with unimaginable cruelty, as it feeds off of terror. Usually, it leaves the poor victim's life hanging on by a thread, literally.
cobblemon.species.ayreianobstagoon.name: AyreianObstagoon
cobblemon.species.ayreianobstagoon.desc: It evolved after experiencing numerous fights. While crossing its arms, it lets out a shout that would make any opponent flinch.
cobblemon.species.ayreianalcremie.name: AyreianAlcremie
cobblemon.species.ayreianalcremie.desc: A run-in with a mixer caused the cream to spiral. Those lucky enough to taste its rich flavour say it's to die for.
cobblemon.species.ayreiansprigatito.name: AyreianSprigatito
cobblemon.species.ayreiansprigatito.desc: When it knows it cannot win, it will messily summon a cloud of poisonous gas and attempt a quick getaway.
cobblemon.species.ayreianfloragato.name: AyreianFloragato
cobblemon.species.ayreianfloragato.desc: Floragato deftly wields the poisonous flower buds under its hoodie, throwing them at opponents like grenades.
cobblemon.species.ayreianmeowscarada.des: While it may look innocent, it has a dangerous personality. It tricks other Pokemon into accepting its bouquet, which then erupts into a shower of venomous spikes.
cobblemon.species.ayreianquaxly.name: AyreianQuaxly
cobblemon.species.ayreianquaxly.desc: They aim for a clean mind state, but they are still inexperienced, and will anger quickly.
cobblemon.species.ayreianquaxwell.name: AyreianQuaxwell
cobblemon.species.ayreianquaxwell.desc: They nest behind waterfalls, meditating for up to 10 hours a day. That said, the slightest mischief can send them into a frenzy.
cobblemon.species.ayreianquaquaval.name: AyreianQuaquaval
cobblemon.species.ayreianquaquaval.desc: After reaching a crystal clear state of mind, this Pokemon can execute even the most head-spinning dance moves flawlessly.
cobblemon.species.ayreianmagnemite.name: AyreianMagnemite
cobblemon.species.ayreianmagnemite.desc: At times, Magnemite runs out of fuel and ends up on the ground. If you give coal to a grounded Magnemite, it'll start moving again.
cobblemon.species.ayreianmagneton.name: AyreianMagneton
cobblemon.species.ayreianmagneton.desc: The two heads that aren't constantly burning are always trying to detatch themselves from the third head, with little result.
cobblemon.species.magnemelt.name: Magnemelt
cobblemon.species.magnemelt.desc: It is so surrounded by magma that you'll almost never see it's original body.
cobblemon.species.ayreianluvdisc.name: AyreianLuvdisc
cobblemon.species.ayreianluvdisc.desc: It floats about pretending to be dead, waiting for its prey to approach before attacking.
cobblemon.species.loathedisc.name: Loathedisc
cobblemon.species.loathedisc.desc: It floats about pretending to be dead, waiting for its prey to approach before attacking.
cobblemon.species.gyropass.name: Gyropass
cobblemon.species.gyropass.desc: It freely controls three small units called Mini-Noses using magnetic force.
cobblemon.species.amacorala.name: Amacorala
cobblemon.species.amacorala.desc: It's hard as rock skin, and fast firing water from it's head made it the perfect frontline during conflict.
cobblemon.species.solacor.name: Solacor
cobblemon.species.solacor.desc: When a Corsola's home waters get polluted, there is a chance that it may evolve into Solacor as a means of survival. Solacor's rocky armor is fragile and crumbling, but can be manipulated however it sees fit to protect its watery core.
cobblemon.species.dunmyth.name: Dunmyth
cobblemon.species.dunmyth.desc: It digs into the ground with its tail and makes a mazelike nest. It can fly just a little.
cobblemon.species.dundragon.name: Dundragon
cobblemon.species.dundragon.desc: It can't fly, but it will use it's wings to jump incredibly high and reach enemies.
cobblemon.species.wolfum.name: Wolfum
cobblemon.species.wolfum.desc: It collects the fallen hairs and sheddings of other Pokemon to build a wolflike body, allowing it to blend in with other Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.supiritto.name: Supiritto
cobblemon.species.supiritto.desc: This Pokemon will pretend to be an empty shedding and wait for it's prey to get close enough before attacking.
cobblemon.species.infernadeer.name: Infernadeer
cobblemon.species.infernadeer.desc: Loyal to a fault, it and Rapidash were in a constant rivarly as the preferred mount of kings. The metal that adorns its body is heatproof.
cobblemon.species.cradecart.name: Cradecart
cobblemon.species.cradecart.desc: Also known as the scavenger of the sea, it picks up discarded body parts of other acquatic Pokemon and builds a tough exoskeleton.
cobblemon.species.sylure.name: Sylure
cobblemon.species.sylure.desc: It baits stronger Pokemon with its weak appearance, before ambushing them with the full might of its traveling colony.
cobblemon.species.syrallure.name: Syrallure
cobblemon.species.syrallure.desc: The sweet aroma emitted from its mane is used in various cosmetics, but it is also lethal in high doses. Fairy tales about sightings of this Pokemon usually don't end well.
cobblemon.species.syrenade.name: Syrenade
cobblemon.species.syrenade.desc: Its beautiful voice allures sailors lost at sea. While they're distracted, Syrenade signals the other members of its colony to ransack their ships.
cobblemon.species.tartot.name: Tartot
cobblemon.species.tartot.desc: The bubbly coating encapsulating its body is nigh-impenetrable. Scientists have been studying its behaviour in different environments for quite some time.
cobblemon.species.teranigrade.name: Teranigrade
cobblemon.species.teranigrade.desc: A Tartot that was never exposed to powerful elements. The liquid that it's covered with absorbs most attacks.
cobblemon.species.fire_teranigrade.name: Teranigrade
cobblemon.species.fire_teranigrade.desc1: The chemically charged body of Tartot reacted to poisonous chemicals of a famous laboratory, changing its body structure to a cellular level.
cobblemon.species.ice_teranigrade.name: Teranigrade
cobblemon.species.ice_teranigrade.desc1: The chemically charged body of Tartot reacted to the freezing air of a snowstorm, changing its body structure to a cellular level.
cobblemon.species.setsarec.name: Setsarec
cobblemon.species.setsarec.desc: Almost immobile, its rock-hard skin bounces back most attacks. It's said that if you make eye contact, you will be turned into stone.
cobblemon.species.dunemoth.name: Dunemoth
cobblemon.species.dunemoth.desc: The wings are covered with dustlike scales. Every time it flaps its wings, it looses highly toxic dust.
cobblemon.species.dofrio.name: Dofrio
cobblemon.species.dofrio.desc: The head in the middle has a very nasty temper, while the head above it is whimsical and carefree.
cobblemon.species.siginome.name: Siginome
cobblemon.species.siginome.desc: It moves sporadically, infesting the abandoned temples of deserts. The two heads can switch control between each other at will.
cobblemon.species.khortares.name: Khortares
cobblemon.species.khortares.desc: The ultimate weapon of the Defiance. An agglomeration of constant nuclear reactions, its monster arm can tear apart a landscape, while its palm can cure the terminally ill.
cobblemon.species.reincarnape.name: Reincarnape
cobblemon.species.reincarnape.desc: After its anger left its body after passing, a fiery sensation of euphoria made Primeape evolve. It spuns around happily while shooting massive flames.
cobblemon.species.togenix.name: Togenix
cobblemon.species.togenix.desc: Its majestic presence is only second to the beatiful aurora that seems to follow it wherever it goes. It flies carefree, protecting the weak and unfortunate.
cobblemon.species.reapatisse.name: Reapatisse
cobblemon.species.reapatisse.desc: If you smell a pungent odor deep at night, then a Reapatisse is said to have laid its eyes on you. It whistles quietly as it floats around.
cobblemon.species.habaneevil.name: Habaneevil
cobblemon.species.habaneevil.desc: Each head can be considered its own Pokemon, as they have vastly different levels of emotions. All of them share a knack for pyromania, though.
cobblemon.species.gatiriopteryx.name: Gatiriopteryx
cobblemon.species.gatiriopteryx.desc: It transmutes momentum into electricity while running. Questionable studies state that it's the missing link between the galarian fossils and a certain thunderbird.
cobblemon.species.therapex.name: Therapex
cobblemon.species.therapex.desc: Its peculiar head shape allows it to store poison, which it then expells when it bites into enemies. In the scientific community, its canines are often argument for debate.
cobblemon.species.astralaxy.name: Astralaxy
cobblemon.species.astralaxy.desc: Said to inhabit the ozone layer, they are the most recent fossil discovered. Upon closer inspection, their bodies seem to be filled to the brim with rare minerals.
cobblemon.species.masimuthi.name: Masimuthi
cobblemon.species.masimuthi.desc: They lay dormant in springs, and only come out of their dwellings if they hear a song. They look intimidating, but they may approach good singers.
cobblemon.species.wraifanggal.name: Wraifanggal
cobblemon.species.wraifanggal.desc: It flies silently through the night, hanging the lower part of its body to grab prey. No one knows what happens to those unfortunate enough to meet it.
cobblemon.species.mujineon.name: Mujineon
cobblemon.species.mujineon.desc: Legend goes that the golden rings of a Mujineon are the byproduct of failed exorcisms. To taunt humans, Mujineon collects those rings in its tail.
cobblemon.species.spareon.name: Spareon
cobblemon.species.spareon.desc: The weird limb like appendages attached to its belt have the power to blow a large boulder to smithereens in half a second.
cobblemon.species.almireon.name: Almireon
cobblemon.species.almireon.desc: The mirror that makes up its tail end has the curious property to reflect magic. Aristocrats cherished this Pokemon, as it warded off the hexes of Mujineon.
cobblemon.species.evoleon.name: Evoleon
cobblemon.species.evoleon.desc: Discovered recently, this evolution of Eevee seems to have a completely stabilized DNA. It can harness the power of the entire type spectrum.
cobblemon.species.caeleon.name: Caeleon
cobblemon.species.caeleon.desc: Soaring freely above the clouds, it usually descends due to curiousness. This Pokemon can turn even the weakest gust of wind into a mighty gale.
cobblemon.species.saureon.name: Saureon
cobblemon.species.saureon.desc: Regarded as a scientific mystery, this Pokemon shares traits from mammals and reptiles alike. Its tail has an unprecedented destructive power.
cobblemon.species.burreon.name: Burreon
cobblemon.species.burreon.desc: The spikes that cover its back can effortlessly penetrate most defenses. For this reason, they were used in the war as tools of area denial.
cobblemon.species.halluceon.name: Halluceon
cobblemon.species.halluceon.desc: It erupts colorful spores from its tail and neck, which warp reality to whoever breathes them in. Halluceon itself might be under those same effects.
cobblemon.species.vultema.name: Vultema
cobblemon.species.vultema.desc: Its blood, akin to lava, boils with a temperature of 700 °C when in combat to sustain its massive body. When it walkes, it leaves behind scorched ground.
cobblemon.species.parlomai.name: Parlomai
cobblemon.species.parlomai.desc: Extremely loyal, it has been the companion of queens alongside Rapidash. It can enact psychic barriers to protect its masters from harm.
cobblemon.species.valevant.name: Valevant
cobblemon.species.valevant.desc: Extremely loyal, it has been the companion of kings alongside Infernadeer. Its sheer strength made it a faithful guardian to its masters.
cobblemon.species.narwail.name: Narwail
cobblemon.species.narwail.desc: The furious spirits of hunted Dewgong have been reborn into Narwail. The cries of the wraiths swirling inside is the last thing heard by its prey.
cobblemon.species.morphias.name: Morphias
cobblemon.species.morphias.desc: This rare species has the ability of seeing the future, a power that can potentially change fate itself.
cobblemon.species.svetrier.name: Svetrier
cobblemon.species.svetrier.desc: It warps away both people and Pokemon in its vicinity via unknown portals, causing all sorts of havoc.
cobblemon.species.drukknir.name: Drukknir
cobblemon.species.drukknir.desc: Untamed and carefree, it devastates the ground it gallops by creating pressurized water underneath its hooves.
cobblemon.species.sleihesnire.name: Sleihesnire
cobblemon.species.sleihesnire.desc: A legendary Pokemon said to have galloped through every dimension. For motives unknown, it split in two long ago.
cobblemon.species.applidunn.name: Applidunn
cobblemon.species.applidunn.desc: The sprout on its back has been fully realized and is now a safe haven for applin to grow and feed.
cobblemon.species.ayreianfletchling.name: AyreianFletchling
cobblemon.species.ayreianfletchling.desc: When this Pokemon gets excited, its body temperature lowers harshly. If you touch a Fletchling with bare hands, you might catch a cold.
cobblemon.species.ayreianfletchinder.des: Fletchinder launches embers into the den of its prey. When the prey comes leaping out, Fletchinder's sharp talons finish it off.
cobblemon.species.fleumflame.name: Fleumflame
cobblemon.species.fleumflame.desc: Historically regarded as heralds or signs of rainfall to come in the wake of a drought, Fleumflames are often seen soaring across the ocean, where they can dive hundreds of meters beneath the surface to hunt prey that are drawn to their flame's light.
cobblemon.species.frigideer.name: Frigideer
cobblemon.species.frigideer.desc: Loyal to a fault, it and Rapidash were in a constant rivarly as the preferred mount of kings. The metal that adorns its body is heatproof.
cobblemon.species.twigit.name: Twigit
cobblemon.species.twigit.desc: Twigit are rare Pokémon found in deep forests. While typically smug, if they see a Pokémon in need they will do what they can. The bush around their neck will actually grow berries, which they horde for the winter season.
cobblemon.species.harestic.name: Harestic
cobblemon.species.harestic.desc: Harestic mystify audiences by quickly disappearing from one place and reappearing in another. They are known for playing innocent tricks.
cobblemon.species.katorit.name: Katorit
cobblemon.species.katorit.desc: Katorit use their large manes to scare off potential threats. By sticking their heads inside the bush, it appears as if they are big and scary. They're actually quite nice.
cobblemon.species.kuuby.name: Kuuby
cobblemon.species.kuuby.desc: Kuuby float around carefree most of their days but are very easily startled. This usually leads to their inner heat coming out and setting the surroundings on fire.
cobblemon.species.kitsu.name: Kitsu
cobblemon.species.kitsu.desc: Kitsu start out active but as they get stronger begin to sleep more than they are awake. This is due to the amount of heat they exhaust daily. Waking one up from their slumber will result in an unfavorable heatwave!
cobblemon.species.kitsurah.name: Kitsurah
cobblemon.species.kitsurah.desc: Kitsurah have free control over local gravity and can use this to float. They draw and compress rocks to their arms so when they punch, they really pack a punch!
cobblemon.species.kikro.name: Kikro
cobblemon.species.kikro.desc: Kikro are small noisy Pokémon who inhabit swamps. They use the vocal sac on their throat to let out huge bursts of sound when threatened.
cobblemon.species.gekroak.name: Gekroak
cobblemon.species.gekroak.desc: While sometimes found to be mischievous, Gekroak are typically seen as guards of their territory. Each section of the swamp sounds slightly different, this is how you tell which Gekroak own what territory.
cobblemon.species.sennitoad.name: Sennitoad
cobblemon.species.sennitoad.desc: These Pokémon are rarely seen, and will only come out from the depths of their swamp when their young is in trouble. A single croak can turn a five-story building to rubble.
cobblemon.species.centillite.name: Centillite
cobblemon.species.centillite.desc: Centillite is baffling to scientists. Their strange structure allows them to give off odd signals that appears to be how they communicate with others of their kind. Some believe they are even trying to communicate with other planets.
cobblemon.species.cocoolite.name: Cocoolite
cobblemon.species.cocoolite.desc: Cocoolite are tiny data centers that intercept signals from all around them. They then forward these signals into the atmosphere, but no one knows where they're sending them.
cobblemon.species.mosquilite.name: Mosquilite
cobblemon.species.mosquilite.desc: Upon emerging, Mosquillite fly into the atmosphere and orbit the planet continuously. They send and receive signals, and sometimes shoot them deep into the unknown of space.
cobblemon.species.azuling.name: Azuling
cobblemon.species.azuling.desc: Azuling are some of the most cheerful Pokémon in the world. They live a relaxed life and have no worries at all. This is due to their high intelligence making it easy to outsmart any threat.
cobblemon.species.psyzul.name: Psyzul
cobblemon.species.psyzul.desc: Psyzul are seen as the young geniuses of the sky. They outsmart predators so easily that some starve in the process of trying to catch it.
cobblemon.species.psyclone.name: Psyclone
cobblemon.species.psyclone.desc: Psyclone are seen throughout the sky, watching over the world and learning from everything they see. Their loss of feet through evolution forces them to refine their wings and mind.
cobblemon.species.biroo.name: Biroo
cobblemon.species.biroo.desc: It runs away from its own shadow most of the day, fearing something that we don't know. Some believe that the shadow is alive.
cobblemon.species.noctoa.name: Noctoa
cobblemon.species.noctoa.desc: Noctoa differ in day and night. During the day, Noctoa is as kind as it was as a Biroo. But at night, it becomes a truly violent monstrosity.
cobblemon.species.edglet.name: Edglet
cobblemon.species.edglet.desc: Edglet are fierce and territorial. When born, they begin to grow a sharp horn-like appendage on their head that is sharp enough to slice an Onix in half.
cobblemon.species.hawkedge.name: Hawkedge
cobblemon.species.hawkedge.desc: Hawkedge patrol the skies looking for anything that has entered its territory. If it sees anything at all, it will dive bomb them with slices sharp enough to cut a Steelix in half.
cobblemon.species.euthiscus.name: Euthiscus
cobblemon.species.euthiscus.desc: Euthiscus are very sensitive Pokémon, so they tend to avoid interacting with others. If they find a berry they really like, they'll cling to it like it is the only thing they care about.
cobblemon.species.hibidali.name: Hibidali
cobblemon.species.hibidali.desc: Hibidali go from forest to forest to find Pokémon in need and give them one of their berries, as they remember how berries made them grow into what they are now.
cobblemon.species.stalagtic.name: Stalagtic
cobblemon.species.stalagtic.desc: Stalagtic are often too small to see unless they're on the move. Because of this, many step on their spiked top and get seriously injured.
cobblemon.species.conamite.name: Conamite
cobblemon.species.conamite.desc: Many texts from ancient civilizations write about one of their people being impaled by structures similar to Conamite. Rather odd, as they've only been seen moving since 2000 years ago.
cobblemon.species.archemite.name: Archemite
cobblemon.species.archemite.desc: Archemite are considered the toughest stones in the entire world, even being able to take a meteor impact and come out unscathed. Though sometimes they drop their defenses to make their claws sharper.
cobblemon.species.symphy.name: Symphy
cobblemon.species.symphy.desc: Symphy can feel thunderstorms coming from many miles away. When it feels a storm coming, it climbs up a tree and sings a soothing song for the entire forest to hear. This lets other forest Pokémon know about the coming storm and also makes sure they are not afraid of it.
cobblemon.species.duranae.name: Duranae
cobblemon.species.duranae.desc: Their shells are nearly indestructible, this is to protect their soft vulnerable insides from being hurt. They ram walls in caves to find rare minerals to eat.
cobblemon.species.atroceros.name: Atroceros
cobblemon.species.atroceros.desc: Eating lots of minerals has caused Atroceros's skin to harden almost as hard as its shell. It can withstand powerful physical attacks and retaliate twice as hard.
cobblemon.species.nymphik.name: Nymphik
cobblemon.species.nymphik.desc: Nymphick will stay awake day and night fighting its targets, even if it is outmatched. While they aren't exactly the strongest, nobody can say that they aren't trying.
cobblemon.species.hoppercut.name: Hoppercut
cobblemon.species.hoppercut.desc: Hoppercut never sleep and are always on the lookout for foes that they can challenge. Quite often, these targets end up being evil, making many consider it a hero.
cobblemon.species.bratanat.name: Bratanat
cobblemon.species.bratanat.desc: It's full of so much disease that it has eventually become immune to all sickness. Because of this incredible power, Bratanat is always cheerful and happy. It spends its days playfully pranking others but it has to keep a distance so it doesn't give anyone a disease.
cobblemon.species.witherwind.name: Witherwind
cobblemon.species.witherwind.desc: Witherwind are seen as bad omens to people and Pokémon. They are incredibly immune to disease, they use their psychic ability to neutralize viruses and then telepathically pass them on to fester in other organisms as a survival mechanic. Witherwind has the power to consume anything in its white belly, which is deeper than an Ultra Wormhole.
cobblemon.species.sasaggot.name: Sasaggot
cobblemon.species.frostyke.name: Frostyke
cobblemon.species.frostyke.desc: It buries itself in the snow and attacks through ambushed strikes. It makes a distinct chilling howl that makes one shudder.
cobblemon.species.blizound.name: Blizound
cobblemon.species.blizound.desc: With heightened hearing from its ears and powerful sound projection from its jaws, Blizound uses a variety of resonating projectiles and freezing frontal assaults to hunt prey and locate allies.
cobblemon.species.steetic.name: Steetic
cobblemon.species.steetic.desc: Steetic is a very weak Pokémon that steals and deceives to survive. It uses the immense amounts of static electricity in its mane to stun enemies and escape battles.
cobblemon.species.cheetatic.name: Cheetatic
cobblemon.species.cheetatic.desc: Cheetatic has a calm and collected demeanor, but is very competitive. It controls the static electricity in its mane to send off powerful electric shocks in a battle.
cobblemon.species.harpirit.name: Harpirit
cobblemon.species.harpirit.desc: It plays a serene tone with its harp-like tail. Those who listen to the sound are captivated by its loveliness and follow it endlessly, never to be seen again.
cobblemon.species.trickgrin.name: Trickgrin
cobblemon.species.trickgrin.desc: Trickgrin act innocent during day and aren't found very often in daylight, but at night they appear everywhere, ready to take whatever catches their eyes. Trickgrin are natural rivals to Delibird.
cobblemon.species.bluble.name: Bluble
cobblemon.species.bluble.desc: Bluble are seen as the most adorable cosmic Pokémon that exist. Their odd ears release a liquid that protects it from harm, necessary to survive in the rough cosmos.
cobblemon.species.humideor.name: Humideor
cobblemon.species.humideor.desc: Humideor keeps everything in a kilometer distance humid merely by being there. Due to the water released from its ears, it requires constant absorption of liters of water to survive.
cobblemon.species.joltter.name: Joltter
cobblemon.species.joltter.desc: Joltter stay close to their family throughout most of their young life. If one gets seperated from its pack, it will bury itself in the dirt until someone comes to save it.
cobblemon.species.boltter.name: Boltter
cobblemon.species.boltter.desc: Playful in nature and easily to get along with, it lives with its family for protection until leaving for a mate during young adulthood. It is said that the longer the whiskers, the more electricity it can generate, thus being an ideal method to show off among each other. Experienced Boltter can propel themselves through the ground at amazing speeds, electrocuting threats along the way.
cobblemon.species.anglure.name: Anglure
cobblemon.species.anglure.desc: Often living in sunken ships, it is thought that Anglure are the reason the ships sunk in the first place. The lights they emit are seen from deep within the ocean and make those who see it extremely curious, enough so to lead them on a wrong path.
cobblemon.species.anglow.name: Anglow
cobblemon.species.anglow.desc: While Anglow's teeth look like they are for biting, they're actually a defense machanism. Not only does the intimidation often scare opponents, it's also extremely useful as the teeth are as hard as diamond, making it so that Anglow can block incoming attacks with it.
cobblemon.species.alluard.name: Alluard
cobblemon.species.alluard.desc: Alluard's teeth are so abnormally large that it can't actually move them. They weigh as much as a car's tire, every single one. Due to this Alluard can only use its teeth as a shield of sorts and attacks with its angler.
cobblemon.species.cubeat.name: Cubeat
cobblemon.species.cubeat.desc: They sing softly for others to hear in the forest. If they get a big audience, Cubeat use the speakers on their body to amplify their sound.
cobblemon.species.raccoustic.name: Raccoustic
cobblemon.species.raccoustic.desc: Raccoustic's sound has evolved to be more grunge than when it was younger. The sounds it creates are unappealing and can cause devastating damage if played too loudly.
cobblemon.species.grizzwave.name: Grizzwave
cobblemon.species.grizzwave.desc: Grizzwave wants nothing more than to play its sounds for huge crowds. Its speakers are so powerful it can be heard thousands of miles away.
cobblemon.species.osbearne.name: Osbearne
cobblemon.species.osbearne.desc: Osbearne amplifies its physical power by blasting loud sounds out of its speakers. By combining these two strengths, it can reduce an entire building to dust in one punch.
cobblemon.species.cowctus.name: Cowctus
cobblemon.species.cowctus.desc: Cowctus stores large amounts of liquid inside its body so it can last a very long time in the hot desert. Drinking this liquid will cause anyone else to hallucinate.
cobblemon.species.mallocolt.name: Mallocolt
cobblemon.species.mallocolt.desc: It's unsure if Mallocolt exists outside of peoples dreams. Its mane tastes of marshmallows and the rocks that fall off of its body taste of sugar.
cobblemon.species.candicorn.name: Candicorn
cobblemon.species.candicorn.desc: Only heard of in legend, anyone who sees a Candicorn is blessed with sweet dreams and treats the rest of their life.
cobblemon.species.shoul.name: Shoul
cobblemon.species.shoul.desc: Shoul will appear in snowstorms and mimic the cries of a child. When it fools someone into getting close, Shoul will absorb their soul into the mirror on its chest.
cobblemon.species.ghoskarf.name: Ghoskarf
cobblemon.species.ghoskarf.desc: Stalking strangers who get lost in snowstorms, Ghoskarf will follow someone for hours until they freeze solid. It will then keep the stature as a trophy.
cobblemon.species.shroudice.name: Shroudice
cobblemon.species.shroudice.desc: During a blizzard in a tundra, Shroudice will appear, just staring at lost travelers, waiting for their actions. Because it looks fairly human from a distance, people will sometimes approach, only to get their souls sealed in its mirror.
cobblemon.species.varymite.name: Varymite
cobblemon.species.varymite.desc: Varymite are small but very potent. Some people claim a bite from Varymite temporarily sent them to another point in time and space.
cobblemon.species.varantox.name: Varantox
cobblemon.species.varantox.desc: Varantox hunts prey by putting webs coated in a powerful poison which can distort the reality around it. They use this to disorient those they trap.
cobblemon.species.mosglet.name: Mosglet
cobblemon.species.mosglet.desc: They travel much faster in water than on land. Using the holes in their body, Mosglet quickly fire balls of mucus at anything that threatens them.
cobblemon.species.tarnavis.name: Tarnavis
cobblemon.species.tarnavis.desc: Tarnavis were used as ocean transportation for all of recorded history. Their large bodies allow for multiple people to be ferried from one place to another easily.
cobblemon.species.torpeban.name: Torpeban
cobblemon.species.torpeban.desc: They roam around hot areas lighting anything it sees on fire. No one is sure if the markings on Torpeban are its face, or if it even has a face at all.
cobblemon.species.amoni.name: Amoni
cobblemon.species.adizine.name: Adizine
cobblemon.species.tsandchi.name: Tsandchi
cobblemon.species.tsandchi.desc: They spend day and night wandering caves and fields looking for opponents to fight. Their body is resillient, but they can quickly patch themselves up using mud and sand if it gets torn.
cobblemon.species.bagarrough.name: Bagarrough
cobblemon.species.bagarrough.desc: After evolving, they spend most of their time teaching weak Pokémon new moves. Their headbands grow back, so when their body is torn after a fight, they use it to patch themselves up.
cobblemon.species.gemeral.name: Gemeral
cobblemon.species.gemeral.desc: The crystal Gemeral grow on their back allows them to take in energy. They store massive amounts of energy within and only release it when they feel threatened.
cobblemon.species.lushan.name: Lushan
cobblemon.species.lushan.desc: Lushan spends all its life eating minerals in hopes of finding rare gems. The more gems it eats, the more power it can hold within. They can use this energy to fire devastating beams of light.
cobblemon.species.canoling.name: Canoling
cobblemon.species.canoling.desc: Canoling will roll around, finding anything it can to launch out of the cannon on its head. They are often used for fireworks.
cobblemon.species.canoblast.name: Canoblast
cobblemon.species.canoblast.desc: Canoblast's wheels have flattened, allowing it large defensive shields in place of its speed. The cannon has been optimized so it may launch long-range blasts.
cobblemon.species.nyashi.name: Nyashi
cobblemon.species.nyashi.desc: There were rumors that Nyashi are actually deceased Pokémon, due to their pale, cold skin, and slow breathing pattern. However, numerous researches debunked that theory.
cobblemon.species.felinshii.name: Felinshii
cobblemon.species.felinshii.desc: If they do not move for a long period of time, their body will start getting stiff, so they stretch and train all the time to prevent this. They can drain the life force of their prey by sinking their claws into them.
cobblemon.species.elepod.name: Elepod
cobblemon.species.elepod.desc: Elepod conducts electricty inside its protective bubble, but gets distracted by all the pretty sparks. This often leads to it bumping into a comet. They fight often with Mojicle.
cobblemon.species.jellectric.name: Jellectric
cobblemon.species.jellectric.desc: Sometimes people mistake Jellectric for stars when stargazing. The electricty that it conducts within its body is strong enough to be felt throughout an entire star system.
cobblemon.species.mojicle.name: Mojicle
cobblemon.species.mojicle.desc: Mojicle like to show off their strange abilities in front of the whole ocean. The stripe on their head changes to suite their mood.
cobblemon.species.evercle.name: Evercle
cobblemon.species.evercle.desc: Evercle come across as friendly, but beware of the large beak they have beneath their tentacles. They often quarrel with Jellectric.
cobblemon.species.snowze.name: Snowze
cobblemon.species.snowze.desc: Snowze have very thick fur, so they never truly get cold. They go to desolate snow-covered mountains so they can sleep without being disturbed.
cobblemon.species.pebbuin.name: Pebbuin
cobblemon.species.pebbuin.desc: Although they aren't capable of long term flight, Pebbuin can lift off the ground just long enough to launch itself at an opponent. They don't hurt much, though.
cobblemon.species.pengerupt.name: Pengerupt
cobblemon.species.pengerupt.desc: Pengerupt wander deep into volcanos so they may fill their bodies with hot lava. They will then travel to the top of the volcano and shoot it into the air. No one knows why they do this.
cobblemon.species.chaballic.name: Chaballic
cobblemon.species.chaballic.desc: Chaballic can create large illusions of themselves by striking odd poses, and they use this to stun their foes in fear. They're very stubborn when it comes to changing colors.
cobblemon.species.poperi.name: Poperi
cobblemon.species.poperi.desc: Poperi have a trained sense of smell which is used to hunt for food. They are used in law enforcement to track down criminals, and attack with their heavy set arms.
cobblemon.species.lizgroko.name: Lizgroko
cobblemon.species.lizgroko.desc: When a battle gets heated, their tail and bulb on their back will begin to glow. They really do not like when their opponents run away, and they will chase them to no end.
cobblemon.species.spranamos.name: Spranamos
cobblemon.species.spranamos.desc: Spranamos has a growth on its back that is used to mix spices into a concoction of potent poison. It's very spicy, so it's easy to get burned. Some people like the taste.
cobblemon.species.embay.name: Embay
cobblemon.species.embay.desc: Embay use their fiery wings to intimidate predators. If that fails, they'll blow a smoke screen to escape, as they are often too passive to fight back.
cobblemon.species.marvelaze.name: Marvelaze
cobblemon.species.marvelaze.desc: Marvelaze are small but extremely quick Pokémon. It leaves a trail of marvelous fire behind when it flies through the air so that its Embay children can find it.
cobblemon.species.ribikun.name: Ribikun
cobblemon.species.ribikun.desc: It can sit for days waiting for prey. When demoisturized, its body becomes rigid like a statue. It prefers shade, suggesting the dry environment it dwells in was once upon a time more lush.
cobblemon.species.kunama.name: Kunama
cobblemon.species.kunama.desc: When it is properly hydrated, its body is slimey and flexible. It has a level-headed disposition and takes a pragmatic approach to survival.
cobblemon.species.dragurn.name: Dragurn
cobblemon.species.dragurn.desc: When born Dragurn find a vessel to hide within to protect themselves from predators. They will stay in their new-found homes all of their life.
cobblemon.species.drajinn.name: Drajinn
cobblemon.species.drajinn.desc: Drajinn have outgrown their home, but are now stuck and unable to fully emerge. Despite this, they will still live their lives as if there's nothing wrong.
cobblemon.species.kobble.name: Kobble
cobblemon.species.kobble.desc: Kobble spin at a dangerously fast speed. Because of this, they can never tell which direction they are going and often forget what they were even doing in the first place.
cobblemon.species.yamaki.name: Yamaki
cobblemon.species.yamaki.desc: Although fast and powerful, Yamaki is constantly confused. No one can get close enough to help it stop spinning, so it will probably spin the rest of its life.
cobblemon.species.gareed.name: Gareed
cobblemon.species.gareed.desc: Gareed smell heavily of garlic. It is said that in ancient times when people were afraid of vampires, they would keep Gareed around.
cobblemon.species.gnarlic.name: Gnarlic
cobblemon.species.gnarlic.desc: Often found roaming farms to aid farmers, Gnarlic scare away birds with bursts of flames. They like to hoard objects they finds in their nests.
cobblemon.species.garsome.name: Garsome
cobblemon.species.garsome.desc: Garsome takes in large amounts of nutrients from the soil, often killing plants all around it. It will then physically eat the plants as well. Its flames will burn more intense if its well-fed.
cobblemon.species.folida.name: Folida
cobblemon.species.folida.desc: Folida often plays with its food as if it were a toy. Even when hunting for food, it always finds a way to make it fun for itself.
cobblemon.species.savark.name: Savark
cobblemon.species.savark.desc: Savark live on a diet of solely Bug-type Pokémon. Once it sees one, it will not stop hunting it down until either the bug or itself goes down.
cobblemon.species.clavarma.name: Clavarma
cobblemon.species.clavarma.desc: They can raise their internal temperature extremely high. They use this to completely incinerate anything they put inside their body.
cobblemon.species.sarcospike.name: Sarcospike
cobblemon.species.sarcospike.desc: Sarcospike stand in one place all day seemingly lifeless, but as soon as something comes close, they pierce it with their spikes and store it in their body to burn it alive. They let out a faint, sad laugh while burning their victim.
cobblemon.species.kotsumo.name: Kotsumo
cobblemon.species.kotsumo.desc: Kotsumo resembles a doll and is popular with kids. It is terrified of getting sick, and so tends to keep to itself to prevent that from happening.
cobblemon.species.keshigami.name: Keshigami
cobblemon.species.keshigami.desc: Keshigami is extremely shy, and will avoid any confrontation if possible. They are very hard to bond with because of this, but can make a very good partner if you can get them to open up.
cobblemon.species.kokesheity.name: Kokesheity
cobblemon.species.kokesheity.desc: Kokosheity love the spotlight. They make friends very quickly and are often seen on TV or performing on stages all around the world.
cobblemon.species.typheon.name: Typheon
cobblemon.species.typheon.desc: An often calm Pokémon that spends most of its days watching clouds. When it finds a specific cloud it likes, it chases it non-stop.
cobblemon.species.astreon.name: Astreon
cobblemon.species.astreon.desc: Astreon are almost never paying attention. They daydream constantly of space and the stars, and will spend all night staring at the sky.
cobblemon.species.illuseon.name: Illuseon
cobblemon.species.illuseon.desc: Illuseon has a magical aura that allows them to control what those around them see. They can disappear in an instant but they're never really gone.
cobblemon.species.icheon.name: Icheon
cobblemon.species.icheon.desc: Different parts of Icheon's body make different noises. This allows them to imitate almost any sound it has ever heard, including entire songs.
cobblemon.species.fulgeon.name: Fulgeon
cobblemon.species.fulgeon.desc: Although small, Fulgeon can be very nasty to strangers. Often times they are extremely stuck up and see themselves above the world. They absorb light through their body gems.
cobblemon.species.shyneon.name: Shyneon
cobblemon.species.shyneon.desc: Due to Eevee's ability to adapt to any situation, it has the opportunity to become one of the only known truly Crystal-type Pokémon by being exposed to highly concentrated crystal radiation.
cobblemon.species.asawaji.name: Asawaji
cobblemon.species.asawaji.desc: Most often seen roaming deserted ruins from an age long past, Asawaji act as some sort of defender. Perhaps no one told them the ruins they patrol are no longer in use.
cobblemon.species.chichaw.name: Chichaw
cobblemon.species.chichaw.desc: Chichaw show how they feel by how they bite you. Depending on if it bites gently or bites through flesh, it shows if it likes or dislikes you. Though even the gentle bites hurt.
cobblemon.species.terrevour.name: Terrevour
cobblemon.species.terrevour.desc: Terrevour will attempt to devour any Pokémon, being able to even bite through Aggron's steel. Old tyrants would feed Pokémon who failed in battle to their Terrevour.
cobblemon.species.kindeshu.name: Kindeshu
cobblemon.species.kindeshu.desc: Kindeshu looks like an old toy, so children are more likely to find comfort in it. However, once it gains a child's trust it will change form and absorb the child's light energy to feed itself.
cobblemon.species.phantitute.name: Phantitute
cobblemon.species.phantitute.desc: Phantitute searches for the damaged dolls of children in poverty. It'll act like a friend towards the child, but will become extremely protective, to the point where some people say that the kid is being held hostage.
cobblemon.species.rablin.name: Rablin
cobblemon.species.rablin.desc: Rablin spend most of their life asleep as if under some sort of spell. They are still able to function when asleep, but it's almost as if they're being controlled. When Rablin awakes, they're back to their normal self.
cobblemon.species.gilkun.name: Gilkun
cobblemon.species.bencho.name: Bencho
cobblemon.species.senfetta.name: Senfetta
cobblemon.species.plakidd.name: Plakidd
cobblemon.species.peaf.name: Peaf
cobblemon.species.pearry.name: Pearry
cobblemon.species.igniff.name: Igniff
cobblemon.species.rafflare.name: Rafflare
cobblemon.species.heliark.name: Heliark
cobblemon.species.oceadon.name: Oceadon
cobblemon.species.mohavi.name: Mohavi
cobblemon.species.tyragaan.name: Tyragaan
cobblemon.species.murmurino.name: Murmurino
cobblemon.species.cerarmor.name: Cerarmor
cobblemon.species.flyfin.name: Flyfin
cobblemon.species.teranium.name: Teranium
cobblemon.species.komisaur.name: Komisaur
cobblemon.species.clusteorus.name: Clusteorus
cobblemon.species.aklyteor.name: Aklyteor
cobblemon.species.ferociraptor.name: Ferociraptor
cobblemon.species.pterysoar.name: Pterysoar
cobblemon.species.hoatzan.name: Hoatzan
cobblemon.species.astralf.name: Astralf
cobblemon.species.cosmoose.name: Cosmoose
cobblemon.species.gueel.name: Gueel
cobblemon.species.yoppa.name: Yoppa
cobblemon.species.crystail.name: Crystail
cobblemon.species.crystail.desc: A strange creature only talked about in ancient legends of the Kuria region. They roam the halls of crystal power, and swarm any invaders they can find in hopes of keeping their secrets safe.
cobblemon.species.glacyo.name: Glacyo
cobblemon.species.glacyo.desc: These Pokémon were once trusted to guard the secrets of the crystal power. They use Crystail to swarm intruders and then finish them off with a powerful crystal attack. No one knows where they came from.
cobblemon.species.wurmidrake.name: Wurmidrake
cobblemon.species.wurmidrake.desc: It silently feeds on leaves seemingly without end. Though small and weak, it somehow projects a rather menacing aura.
cobblemon.species.visacoon.name: Visacoon
cobblemon.species.visacoon.desc: It uses the same scare trick as Wurmidrake to ward off predators. Its shell has shaped itself to produce a more convincing image. It peers unblinking from within its cocoon, patiently awaiting evolution.
cobblemon.species.visarab.name: Visarab
cobblemon.species.visarab.desc: Because it has focused all of its saved energy into achieving evolution, it has a short lifespan. Its wings will turn red and glow faintly, casting its bone-white body in an ominous red light.
cobblemon.species.lumeny.name: Lumeny
cobblemon.species.lumeny.desc: Lumeny is a very gentle Pokémon and prefers not to fight, but instead to help. The soothing light coming from its antenna and tails gives a warm feeling that can make other Pokémon and even people feel a lot better.
cobblemon.species.inood.name: Inood
cobblemon.species.shibark.name: Shibark
cobblemon.species.gardraog.name: Gardraog
cobblemon.species.gardraog.desc: Frenzy PlantSTAB Grass Grass PledgeSTAB Grass Snore Normal Play Rough Fairy Grass KnotSTAB Grass Solar BeamSTAB Grass Earthquake Ground Attract Normal Confide Normal Double-Edge Normal Facade Normal Giga Impact Normal Hidden Power Normal Hyper Beam Normal Natural Gift Normal Protect Normal Return Normal Round Normal Secret Power Normal Sleep Talk Normal Substitute Normal Toxic Poison Rest Psychic
cobblemon.species.frilzard.name: Frilzard
cobblemon.species.venomane.name: Venomane
cobblemon.species.membraze.name: Membraze
cobblemon.species.finvore.name: Finvore
cobblemon.species.bullark.name: Bullark
cobblemon.species.crushark.name: Crushark
cobblemon.species.crushark.desc: Hydro CannonSTAB Water Water PledgeSTAB Water
cobblemon.species.caviat.name: Caviat
cobblemon.species.rodat.name: Rodat
cobblemon.species.maggotle.name: Maggotle
cobblemon.species.rocurl.name: Rocurl
cobblemon.species.beetil.name: Beetil
cobblemon.species.matrimite.name: Matrimite
cobblemon.species.gremite.name: Gremite
cobblemon.species.militherm.name: Militherm
cobblemon.species.lightile.name: Lightile
cobblemon.species.voltako.name: Voltako
cobblemon.species.raigeko.name: Raigeko
cobblemon.species.inbex.name: Inbex
cobblemon.species.titanbex.name: Titanbex
cobblemon.species.titanbex.desc: Snore Normal Iron HeadSTAB Steel Charge Beam Electric Electro Ball Electric Thunder Wave Electric Wild Charge Electric Body Press Fighting Solid Kick Fighting Bulldoze Ground Earthquake Ground Landslide Ground Attract Normal Body Slam Normal Confide Normal Facade Normal Frustration Normal Giga Impact Normal Headbutt Normal Hidden Power Normal Hyper Beam Normal Protect Normal Return Normal Sleep Talk Normal Substitute Normal Work Up Normal Toxic Poison Rest Psychic Zen Headbutt Psychic Sandstorm Rock Bolt InSTAB Steel Heavy SlamSTAB Steel Iron TailSTAB Steel
cobblemon.species.liglit.name: Liglit
cobblemon.species.chickoo.name: Chickoo
cobblemon.species.neskoo.name: Neskoo
cobblemon.species.falkoo.name: Falkoo
cobblemon.species.coccoala.name: Coccoala
cobblemon.species.coccoala.desc: When a Coccoala becomes deeply fond of his trainer, it hugs them so tightly that they become out of breath.
cobblemon.species.kitkin.name: Kitkin
cobblemon.species.munchwin.name: Munchwin
cobblemon.species.nemokat.name: Nemokat
cobblemon.species.nettini.name: Nettini
cobblemon.species.oosail.name: Oosail
cobblemon.species.sagilin.name: Sagilin
cobblemon.species.roadile.name: Roadile
cobblemon.species.tarvial.name: Tarvial
cobblemon.species.cavorm.name: Cavorm
cobblemon.species.lumbrig.name: Lumbrig
cobblemon.species.ampelly.name: Ampelly
cobblemon.species.jelectric.name: Jelectric
cobblemon.species.bovinda.name: Bovinda
cobblemon.species.nirvache.name: Nirvache
cobblemon.species.tabooves.name: Tabooves
cobblemon.species.drizzlen.name: Drizzlen
cobblemon.species.cumucloud.name: Cumucloud
cobblemon.species.tulifun.name: Tulifun
cobblemon.species.tulifun.desc: With a rapid spin of its leaves it is able to produce winds anywhere from faint to strong in power. When doing this it is known to often make itself dizzy quite easily.
cobblemon.species.twoolepin.name: Twoolepin
cobblemon.species.twoolepin.desc: Their big heavy feet keep them grounded on the floor as they spin the petals on their heads. Some fields can contain a hundred Twoolepin of different colours.
cobblemon.species.terbipan.name: Terbipan
cobblemon.species.terbipan.desc: A single Terbipan can create winds of enough force able to power a windmill for a whole day. They are used to help power rural towns with no other access to sources of energy.
cobblemon.species.scalfib.name: Scalfib
cobblemon.species.lagostr.name: Lagostr
cobblemon.species.goatee.name: Goatee
cobblemon.species.goatee.desc: Adept climbers, Goatee are only found in mountainous areas, where their nimble feet keep them out of danger.
cobblemon.species.faram.name: Faram
cobblemon.species.faram.desc: Though very difficult to domesticate, delicious goat's cheese can be created from their milk. They will ram rocks and mountainsides to strengthen their heads for battle.
cobblemon.species.crapore.name: Crapore
cobblemon.species.crapore.desc: It feeds by filtering the water through its porous carapace, which retains both algae and small plankton.
cobblemon.species.sniponge.name: Sniponge
cobblemon.species.sniponge.desc: Its shell is covered by a very versatile spongy material: it is very soft if it is swollen with water, while it is very compact if dry.
cobblemon.species.peblock.name: Peblock
cobblemon.species.dugmite.name: Dugmite
cobblemon.species.dugmite.desc: Dugmite build their shells out of highly compressed sand. Construction sites employ them to create bricks for use in desert areas.
cobblemon.species.edjaw.name: Edjaw
cobblemon.species.edjaw.desc: Edjaw's powerful stone mouth is able to crush the largest of boulders with little effort. It's said that they preserve the minerals they digest in their stomach, refining them over time.
cobblemon.species.banshed.name: Banshed
cobblemon.species.maskape.name: Maskape
cobblemon.species.triboon.name: Triboon
cobblemon.species.encefalug.name: Encefalug
cobblemon.species.muscolin.name: Muscolin
cobblemon.species.bosteroid.name: Bosteroid
cobblemon.species.bosteroid.desc: Bosteroids are always looking for a better challenge when it comes to flexing. They toss entire trees as a warm-up, and crush enormous boulders with their arms.
cobblemon.species.batnap.name: Batnap
cobblemon.species.staracula.name: Staracula
cobblemon.species.uselake.name: Uselake
cobblemon.species.monartide.name: Monartide
cobblemon.species.cramic.name: Cramic
cobblemon.species.clamsure.name: Clamsure
cobblemon.species.sweetweet.name: Sweetweet
cobblemon.species.paswan.name: Paswan
cobblemon.species.lampea.name: Lampea
cobblemon.species.lampea.desc: Lampea pick up whatever fits their mouth and spit it out forcefully. They are even able to knock down medium-sized trees with a single hit.
cobblemon.species.bullama.name: Bullama
cobblemon.species.bullama.desc: It is told that a pea plant is constantly growing inside Bullama's body.
cobblemon.species.kelbanast.name: Kelbanast
cobblemon.species.kelbanast.desc: In order to shoot as accurately as possible, they're able to stretch their neck up to three meters (9.8 feet). They also use that skill to reach the highest foliage, which is unreachable to most other Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.tessent.name: Tessent
cobblemon.species.tessensei.name: Tessensei
cobblemon.species.wastered.name: Wastered
cobblemon.species.hammeradio.name: Hammeradio
cobblemon.species.eice.name: Eice
cobblemon.species.dreice.name: Dreice
cobblemon.species.icigloo.name: Icigloo
cobblemon.species.wijin.name: Wijin
cobblemon.species.summojin.name: Summojin
cobblemon.species.raggal.name: Raggal
cobblemon.species.dollipop.name: Dollipop
cobblemon.species.pompadame.name: Pompadame
cobblemon.species.pelurche.name: Pelurche
cobblemon.species.beargue.name: Beargue
cobblemon.species.urslash.name: Urslash
cobblemon.species.froska.name: Froska
cobblemon.species.froska.desc: Froska enjoy spending their time making small snowmen whenever they can, making each one have at least one thing unique to them. Whenever they make similar ones, they topple over the older ones instead.
cobblemon.species.mafreozee.name: Mafreozee
cobblemon.species.mafreozee.desc: Mafreozee can bend even the thickest ice with their mind, creating intricate and beautiful statues from them. They often accompany sculptors and love to express their thoughts through their art rather than their 'words'.
cobblemon.species.ribone.name: Ribone
cobblemon.species.skelenid.name: Skelenid
cobblemon.species.ugnulash.name: Ugnulash
cobblemon.species.nuspice.name: Nuspice
cobblemon.species.pepprex.name: Pepprex
cobblemon.species.anemulp.name: Anemulp
cobblemon.species.illuquid.name: Illuquid
cobblemon.species.crasquidor.name: Crasquidor
cobblemon.species.celluler.name: Celluler
cobblemon.species.paperlane.name: Paperlane
cobblemon.species.himegami.name: Himegami
cobblemon.species.jawful.name: Jawful
cobblemon.species.opilape.name: Opilape
cobblemon.species.opilape.desc: Their fingers are covered with a layer of hair that allows them to climb on all types of material.
cobblemon.species.oragnutan.name: Oragnutan
cobblemon.species.oragnutan.desc: It moves easily through the jungle, swaying over its cobwebs as if they were ropes.
cobblemon.species.possasse.name: Possasse
cobblemon.species.vasegeist.name: Vasegeist
cobblemon.species.slipole.name: Slipole
cobblemon.species.slipole.desc: As soon as they feel their home heating up, these Pokemon will migrate marching in a row until they reach a colder home.
cobblemon.species.pengoof.name: Pengoof
cobblemon.species.pengoof.desc: It camouflages its eggs by covering them with snow but, given the similar shape, they are often mistaken for snowballs and launched.
cobblemon.species.rolloch.name: Rolloch
cobblemon.species.bouldart.name: Bouldart
cobblemon.species.gyroar.name: Gyroar
cobblemon.species.nuggle.name: Nuggle
cobblemon.species.nuggle.desc: Nuggles are often valued for the bulb of solid gold atop their heads. When without their gold nugget, they feel incredible discomfort.
cobblemon.species.piragmid.name: Piragmid
cobblemon.species.piragmid.desc: Piragmid's body is cumbersome and heavy, but it seems to strut around with little difficulty. It can often trip on itself, breaking some gold off from it's head.
cobblemon.species.eldoredo.name: Eldoredo
cobblemon.species.eldoredo.desc: Eldoredo lives in small groups deep within caves. It hides itself from miners who often mistaken it for real gold and take it away from his fellow conspecifics.
cobblemon.species.crimera.name: Crimera
cobblemon.species.chiverna.name: Chiverna
cobblemon.species.sellfish.name: Sellfish
cobblemon.species.junkid.name: Junkid
cobblemon.species.junkid.desc: Comprised of pieces of junk screwed together and given life, Junkid are typically timid until approached gingerly. They love to bed fed small pieces of discarded garbage.
cobblemon.species.tankyard.name: Tankyard
cobblemon.species.tankyard.desc: Tankyards laze around in junkyards waiting for new garbage to arrive. As soon as it comes, they start to compact it using their strong steel crushers. After being made into cubes, Tankyard will typically eat them in one bite.
cobblemon.species.narnail.name: Narnail
cobblemon.species.unirval.name: Unirval
cobblemon.species.elekto.name: Elekto
cobblemon.species.ambrachios.name: Ambrachios
cobblemon.species.lizmoke.name: Lizmoke
cobblemon.species.charnosaur.name: Charnosaur
cobblemon.species.charnosaur.desc: Charnosaur's smoke is as hot as fire itself. It can spew red hot magma from it's maw to defend itself.
cobblemon.species.germinell.name: Germinell
cobblemon.species.hyriginell.name: Hyriginell
cobblemon.species.larvatt.name: Larvatt
cobblemon.species.sparkroll.name: Sparkroll
cobblemon.species.megawatt.name: Megawatt
cobblemon.species.fulolf.name: Fulolf
cobblemon.species.teekaboo.name: Teekaboo
cobblemon.species.pendodoom.name: Pendodoom
cobblemon.species.piczarre.name: Piczarre
cobblemon.species.dorimedon.name: Dorimedon
cobblemon.species.lapot.name: Lapot
cobblemon.species.simulogre.name: Simulogre
cobblemon.species.falchik.name: Falchik
cobblemon.species.valkite.name: Valkite
cobblemon.species.calvakair.name: Calvakair
cobblemon.species.cetoacean.name: Cetoacean
cobblemon.species.nicklack.name: Nicklack
cobblemon.species.silvern.name: Silvern
cobblemon.species.avidrage.name: Avidrage
cobblemon.species.valialty.name: Valialty
cobblemon.species.oweesage.name: Oweesage
cobblemon.species.koslich.name: Koslich
cobblemon.species.eiseith.name: Eiseith
cobblemon.species.excanth.name: Excanth
cobblemon.species.florcoon.name: Florcoon
cobblemon.species.florcoon.desc: Florcoon are rather energetic Pokemon, who like foraging through small forests for fallen berries and such. They are generally friendly, but upon evolution it can grow a rather aggressive nature. A Florcoon likes nothing better than to walk up to a person's behind and poke them with their horns.
cobblemon.species.bufaroon.name: Bufaroon
cobblemon.species.bufaroon.desc: If trained properly Bufaroon can become great battlers or even gaurd dogs. Through evolution they grow an aggressive nature, but if trained from a Florcoon they can be more of a help. Wild Bufaroons are quite dangerous and warning is given to those who come across any.
cobblemon.species.grandaroon.name: Grandaroon
cobblemon.species.grandaroon.desc: Grandaroon is the final evolution of the grass starter Floracoon. Grandaroon is a great tank in battle. It has less of an aggressive nature than Bufaroon, which allows it to focus on the more important things in life.
cobblemon.species.pyrall.name: Pyrall
cobblemon.species.pyrall.desc: Basically a burning ball of fluff, Pyrall are fearsome battlers that always put 110% into their battles. They rarely befriend people, but if they do that person is a friend for life; Pyrall will fight for them no matter what.
cobblemon.species.baufire.name: Baufire
cobblemon.species.baufire.desc: This Pokemon is said to be the origin of the beliefs of demons, because of their blood red fur and its two horns. However in battle this Pokemon is as strong as a bulldozer and can take down the toughest of foes.
cobblemon.species.inferlauf.name: Inferlauf
cobblemon.species.inferlauf.desc: Inferlauf are hardly ever seen in the wild because of their shy nature. Inferlauf were once poached for their fur. Their long dangling ears sense movement in the Earth, so they can easily hide if they hear footsteps.
cobblemon.species.aquaff.name: Aquaff
cobblemon.species.aquaff.desc: Aquaff loves ramming into buildings to strengthen itself. A great fighter in both the water and on land, Aquaff and its evolutions are known for their Water Pulses, which they send from the orb in the middle of their stomach.
cobblemon.species.aqualf.name: Aqualf
cobblemon.species.aqualf.desc: Out of the other evolved starters of Midamis, Aqualf is probably the calmest and wise. They have great intellect and are extremely loyal to their trainers. Wild Aqualf are usually found by springs and reservoirs, where they love to relax and bathe on the banks.
cobblemon.species.oxatear.name: Oxatear
cobblemon.species.oxatear.desc: A Pokemon that has said to have been recorded in scrolls by Ancient Egyptians. It was said that Oxatear brought rain to those places suffering of famine and plague. This could be true, as Oxatear is well known for their complicated Rain Dances, but no one is 100% sure.
cobblemon.species.mitorch.name: Mitorch
cobblemon.species.taratorcha.name: Taratorcha
cobblemon.species.terramite.name: Terramite
cobblemon.species.terramite.desc: Terramite are a symbol of patience and wisdom across Rikoto. Known as 'Nature's Time Capsules', they can lie immobile under desert sand for decades at a time.
cobblemon.species.terragrip.name: Terragrip
cobblemon.species.geropian.name: Geropian
cobblemon.species.malropian.name: Malropian
cobblemon.species.malropian.desc: Malropian's tail cannot sting, rather, it can spray terrible acid that can melt skin. It's large appearance can be quite intimidating, comparable to Drapion.
cobblemon.species.rabolt.name: Rabolt
cobblemon.species.rabolt.desc: Rabolts are very hyper Pokemon. Though relatively fragile, they are often feared by Trainers for the fact that they will go beyond the bitter end in battle, damaging themselves as much as the opponent to lay a hit.
cobblemon.species.rabullet.name: Rabullet
cobblemon.species.rabullet.desc: Rabullet love charging into things, no matter what. Due to doing, this they have resistance to any recoil damage their brutal charging normally gives. Rabullet may match the speed of bullets themselves and can seriously injure someone by brushing past during these speed-freak moments.
cobblemon.species.flurse.name: Flurse
cobblemon.species.elvile.name: Elvile
cobblemon.species.raniron.name: Raniron
cobblemon.species.raniron.desc: Cute, dainty Pokemon that are often used by girls because of its pretty and sweet appearence. But don't judge Raniron on its appearance as they put up a fight and can hold their own, even for such small Pokemon. Raniron, despite being the offspring of Steelke are also looked after by Stantler who accompany the group.
cobblemon.species.steelke.name: Steelke
cobblemon.species.vauxee.name: Vauxee
cobblemon.species.vauxee.desc: Cute and lazy Pokemon, who are very unaware of the power they posses. They often flurry around and scoot up sand, looking for treasure and such. Vauxee are very adventurous and love having fun.
cobblemon.species.vauxelle.name: Vauxelle
cobblemon.species.vauxelle.desc: Vauxelle are associated with both the sun and the moon and appear to be strongest when the luminaries are at the highest point in the sky. Because Vauxelle only need to sleep when neither the moon or sun is shining, they are usually full of energy, much like their pre-evolution counterpart.
cobblemon.species.vacute.name: Vacute
cobblemon.species.vacule.name: Vacule
cobblemon.species.veefere.name: Veefere
cobblemon.species.chaust.name: Chaust
cobblemon.species.charmir.name: Charmir
cobblemon.species.sambranaust.name: Sambranaust
cobblemon.species.sambranaust.desc: Sambranaust's intimidating appearance may put off trainers from raising it, but don't be fooled. It merely wants to have a good time and relax with those who take good care of it.
cobblemon.species.cloflower.name: Cloflower
cobblemon.species.cloflower.desc: These gentle Pokemon can often be seen digging for roots underneath the soil of forests and even jungles. They are not aware of their psychic powers but that doesn't stop them from trying.
cobblemon.species.petafleur.name: Petafleur
cobblemon.species.petafleur.desc: Upon evolution, Petafleur are confident in its new awakened power and trusts itself more than it did as a Cloflower. Petafleur has attacks that most Pokemon of the same type wouldn't and this gives it a great advantage in battle.
cobblemon.species.florown.name: Florown
cobblemon.species.florown.desc: Florown is for those trainers who like weird, but powerful Pokemon. Florown is in the same league as Mr. Mime, but are considered a lot stronger. Florown are fully in control of its psychic abilities and are often shown off in touring circuses.
cobblemon.species.earwick.name: Earwick
cobblemon.species.earmor.name: Earmor
cobblemon.species.veneedle.name: Veneedle
cobblemon.species.poisapine.name: Poisapine
cobblemon.species.doree.name: Doree
cobblemon.species.doree.desc: Much like Diglett, Doree is a earth-moving Pokemon. People have made exhibits where you can visit tunnels, which Doree famalies have made, and find rare Pokmon underground, but not for capture.
cobblemon.species.dawreel.name: Dawreel
cobblemon.species.dawreel.desc: These Pokemon are known for their steel maces, which can be devastating. They are quite the offensive Pokemon, however they lack in special moves. But what they lack in special they make up for in resistance and Dawreel are one of the toughest Pokemon out there.
cobblemon.species.minrok.name: Minrok
cobblemon.species.minrok.desc: Minrok are mossy Pokemon traits of Grass-types but are Poison / Rock types. They absorb light and are also fond of damp areas where they multiply very quickly and easily. They like to speed demonically through open fields, exhausting gases while doing it.
cobblemon.species.minryde.name: Minryde
cobblemon.species.birred.name: Birred
cobblemon.species.birred.desc: Birred like to collect things, it differs per Birred what they're after but every single Birred has an obsession which can be quite annoying for passing trainers, because it's impossible to tell what object they have to keep pocketed.
cobblemon.species.birryde.name: Birryde
cobblemon.species.birryde.desc: Birryde match the speeds of fighter jet planes and these Pokemon are often used by such people to practice with. They are extremely loyal and people compare this to a Pidgeot. Alas, they still have a nack for 'picking up' loose objects.
cobblemon.species.tweetrille.name: Tweetrille
cobblemon.species.woodtryle.name: Woodtryle
cobblemon.species.biduane.name: Biduane
cobblemon.species.biduane.desc: Bidaune are referenced in a legend which states they were once small flying Pokemon like Pidgey and Spearow who wanted to be free and fly wherever they went, supposedly leaving their bodies to do so.
cobblemon.species.bidengel.name: Bidengel
cobblemon.species.bidengel.desc: Angelic in appearance, Bidengel are shy and caring Pokemon. The size of their disk on top of their halo represents the wisdom of the Bidengel, usually increasing with age. Bidengel don't often come down from the clouds and it is said that because they don't breathe, they can fly all the way to space.
cobblemon.species.bidread.name: Bidread
cobblemon.species.bidread.desc: Bidread were once thought to be messengers of a bad omen, using the orb they carry for fortune telling. A young man would train a Bidaune before his wedding, and if it evolved in to a Bidengel he would be blessed in marriage, but cursed if it evolved in to a Bidread. Such myths have long since died out, however.
cobblemon.species.childer.name: Childer
cobblemon.species.childer.desc: Sweet, chirpy Pokemon that are seen only at winter in the cold snow where they nestle together in straw nests high up in trees. Small enough to perch on your hand, Childer are great pets and love nothing better than sitting by a fire in the winter cold.
cobblemon.species.norewin.name: Norewin
cobblemon.species.norewin.desc: Norewin are hardy Ice-types because of its high defenses. Norewin are also only seen in the harsh winters or in cold areas in the mountains. They have dragon-like features, but retain the some bird-like features from Childer. To protect themselves, they can freeze themselves in an impenetrable amount of ice.
cobblemon.species.lauves.name: Lauves
cobblemon.species.lauvered.name: Lauvered
cobblemon.species.lauvader.name: Lauvader
cobblemon.species.raunny.name: Raunny
cobblemon.species.raunny.desc: Most definitely the fastest family of Rock Pokemon known so far. These Pokemon combine their agility with their brute force to knock down opponents in a flash. Raunny are found mostly in mountains where they feed on vegetation, although are also sometimes known to eat pebbles.
cobblemon.species.raudren.name: Raudren
cobblemon.species.raudren.desc: An extremely aggressive Pokemon that lives among the highest mountains and inside the lowest valleys of the world. Not the friendliest of Pokemon, Raudren are known to shatter buildings with their hard head.
cobblemon.species.unmol.name: Unmol
cobblemon.species.minole.name: Minole
cobblemon.species.grannole.name: Grannole
cobblemon.species.proseed.name: Proseed
cobblemon.species.proseed.desc: Proseed are known to let themselves get carried away by light breezes, both out of fear for their lives and trying to find a proper space to grow and develop.
cobblemon.species.tulipro.name: Tulipro
cobblemon.species.tulipro.desc: Proseed has blossomed into Tulipro, now becoming much more carefree instead of worrisome. If attacked, it will likely take a few seconds for it to even register the pain.
cobblemon.species.felefox.name: Felefox
cobblemon.species.valvette.name: Valvette
cobblemon.species.rewt.name: Rewt
cobblemon.species.salrander.name: Salrander
cobblemon.species.tumbeaver.name: Tumbeaver
cobblemon.species.tumbeaver.desc: Tumbeaver roll around all day, it is in fact, one of the few things they do, if a Tumbeaver doesn't get stopped by an occasional tree or rock it can become a very devestating ball that wrecks everything in it's path.
cobblemon.species.kremcee.name: Kremcee
cobblemon.species.kremcee.desc: This Pokemon is friendly compared to most other Dark types. Whenever they meet new people or Pokemon they always bow and hands with arm-like ears. They look pretty slow because of that C-shaped rock on their head, but deceptively run pretty fast.
cobblemon.species.haleet.name: Haleet
cobblemon.species.haleet.desc: Haleet are protected by a strange shield, the origins of the shield are unconfirmed, as is much about this Pokemon. What is known, is that they can be quite aggressive, although that is partly due to the style of training they do with their Trainers.
cobblemon.species.chulee.name: Chulee
cobblemon.species.chanalee.name: Chanalee
cobblemon.species.chislee.name: Chislee
cobblemon.species.kintee.name: Kintee
cobblemon.species.kinett.name: Kinett
cobblemon.species.kinettee.name: Kinettee
cobblemon.species.fai.name: Fai
cobblemon.species.pafrei.name: Pafrei
cobblemon.species.freil.name: Freil
cobblemon.species.faipan.name: Faipan
cobblemon.species.pangel.name: Pangel
cobblemon.species.gurangle.name: Gurangle
cobblemon.species.liotee.name: Liotee
cobblemon.species.leeverge.name: Leeverge
cobblemon.species.irise.name: Irise
cobblemon.species.irise.desc: These Pokemon are deaf but are excellent lip readers. Irise and their Trainers have a true bond because of the level of trust both must have in the heat of battle.
cobblemon.species.yeraze.name: Yeraze
cobblemon.species.yeraze.desc: Yeraze are still deaf but they use their other senses to battle. Their sight is extremely impeccable, with sight that is better than humans. They can also sense vibrations occasionally digging their claws into the ground; this is also allows them to ground Electric attacks.
cobblemon.species.sharmor.name: Sharmor
cobblemon.species.sharmaul.name: Sharmaul
cobblemon.species.sevris.name: Sevris
cobblemon.species.cradvris.name: Cradvris
cobblemon.species.floatate.name: Floatate
cobblemon.species.fleetade.name: Fleetade
cobblemon.species.valiade.name: Valiade
cobblemon.species.causit.name: Causit
cobblemon.species.causit.desc: Not the most mobile of Pokemon, Causit is just a nuisance both on water andon land. Its not the most useful Pokemon either, but when it evolves, this changes.
cobblemon.species.cassidite.name: Cassidite
cobblemon.species.cassidite.desc: The family of Cassidite is the only bird-like Pokemon capable of battling underwater. Although it is a good battler on land, it prefers the water as its streamlined appearance gives it a good advantage against Pokemon such as Mantine.
cobblemon.species.cascassidine.name: Cascassidine
cobblemon.species.cascassidine.desc: A feared underwater being that feeds by plucking Flying-types from the surface, drowning them before feeding on them. They are fearsome battlers and not to be taken lightly. Their plumage is water-resistant to increase speed in water, also working to repel Water-type attacks during battle.
cobblemon.species.glauvee.name: Glauvee
cobblemon.species.glaufang.name: Glaufang
cobblemon.species.glaure.name: Glaure
cobblemon.species.criwely.name: Criwely
cobblemon.species.crauwly.name: Crauwly
cobblemon.species.craud.name: Craud
cobblemon.species.preano.name: Preano
cobblemon.species.prarendo.name: Prarendo
cobblemon.species.paradeano.name: Paradeano
cobblemon.species.paradeano.desc: Paradeano's bulbs are full of pure energy, capable of powering cities when given proper care. When angered, they're known to burst in chaotic displays of electrical bolts.
cobblemon.species.flawsy.name: Flawsy
cobblemon.species.flawepsi.name: Flawepsi
cobblemon.species.psiantor.name: Psiantor
cobblemon.species.dratt.name: Dratt
cobblemon.species.drowler.name: Drowler
cobblemon.species.foratt.name: Foratt
cobblemon.species.breame.name: Breame
cobblemon.species.breame.desc: An artificial Pokemon only capable of producing beam-based attacks. Breame are fond of mirrors and will fire them gleefully from it’s snout.
cobblemon.species.awespark.name: Awespark
cobblemon.species.awesurge.name: Awesurge
cobblemon.species.awesurge.desc: These speedy yet large Pokemon never set foot on the ground. They are seen competing with other’s of it’s kind, appearing as light trails, as they race and battle for dominance.
cobblemon.species.kwauwk.name: Kwauwk
cobblemon.species.kwauwk.desc: These Pokemon are well-known for their odd assortment of attack types. Kwauwk is said to shift type entirely when they lose focus, but this has been unproven.
cobblemon.species.quwauzrel.name: Quwauzrel
cobblemon.species.quwauzrel.desc: Even more bizarre than Kwauwk, this Pokemon is found rarely in the wild, racing across the land emitting unsettling cries. It’s said to wildly change type when startled.
cobblemon.species.enlune.name: Enlune
cobblemon.species.enlune.desc: Enlune is a clawed Pokemon that enjoys fireworks and anything related to light. They have a fascination with mirrors and whenever one is near, they are seen gazing into it.
cobblemon.species.petri.name: Petri
