cobblemon.species.thorstle.desc: Thorstle live in fields that don't get tended to well. Their bright pink flower is extremely spiky, and releases toxins when touched that give a sharp stinging pain.
cobblemon.species.thistance.name: Thistance
cobblemon.species.nettic.name: Nettic
cobblemon.species.nettic.desc: There leaves are covered in tiny hairs that cause an irritant sting when touched. During Spring in Central Orbis, a week is dedicated to them to celebrate the seeds they produce, which are a favorite food for many Bug types.
cobblemon.species.stinttle.name: Stinttle
cobblemon.species.stinttle.desc: Stinttle thrive in soils that are highly acidic. This is why they live so close to urban areas due to the phosphate-rich waste that gets expelled into grasslands. They contain tiny needles that are incredibly irritant to touch, causing large rashes that can take months to heal.
cobblemon.species.stimanic.name: Stimanic
cobblemon.species.stimanic.desc: A sting from a Stimanic can be life threatening due to intense toxins that paralyze the body. They have powerful electric charges that have been known to disrupt nearby outlets. It is common for Stimanic to cause cities to lose power if too many are close, they stand close to power lines and feed on electricity to make themselves stronger.
cobblemon.species.traffimite.name: Traffimite
cobblemon.species.traffitron.name: Traffitron
cobblemon.species.traffitron.desc: A Pokemon developed by PokePal Inc. This Pokemon is designed to ensure there is an organised flow of traffic throughout the city. They are capable of shooting powerful lasers to those who do not obey traffic laws.
cobblemon.species.skenteur.name: Skenteur
cobblemon.species.skenteur.desc: Skenteur are known for their sweet aromas that are used in the finest perfumes across the world. However like their cousins Stunky, they are able to create putrid smelling gas that they fire at their opponents when threatened.
cobblemon.species.parfumou.name: Parfumou
cobblemon.species.parfumou.desc: Parfumou's scent is considered the most beautiful in the world. Perfumers have tried to replicate its scent in perfume but have never been successful. Despite the scent being delectable, it is highly poisonous in large quantities.
cobblemon.species.searsage.name: Searsage
cobblemon.species.frankfurnt.name: Frankfurnt
cobblemon.species.frankfurnt.desc: Frankfurnt's ears are covered in fur that have a similar consistency and odour to smoke. They are often used by firefighters as a mean to locate people trapped in flaming buildings.
cobblemon.species.vermob.name: Vermob
cobblemon.species.vermob.desc: Vermob are a common sight in alleyways where they work together in groups to steal food to give to their leaders.
cobblemon.species.veradmin.name: Veradmin
cobblemon.species.vermicapone.name: Vermicapone
cobblemon.species.vermicapone.desc: Evo Poison FangSTAB Poison - Scary Face Normal - BiteSTAB Dark - Swords Dance Normal 4 Quick Attack Normal 10 Hyper Fang Normal 15 Beat UpSTAB Dark 19 CrunchSTAB Dark 23 Parting Shot Dark 28 Super Fang Normal 31 Torment Dark 34 Sucker PunchSTAB Dark 38 Foul PlaySTAB Dark 40 Toxic Poison 43 ComeuppanceSTAB Dark 48 Double-Edge Normal
cobblemon.species.monsewer.name: Monsewer
cobblemon.species.monsewer.desc: Monsewer live in the sludge and muck of the cities sewers where they absorb anything they can to grow in size. Sewer canals are commonly blocked up by Monsewer hiding in large pipes and tunnels.
cobblemon.species.miremaid.name: Miremaid
cobblemon.species.miremaid.desc: Miremaid lives in dark aquatic environments such as old reservoirs and sewage systems. They are known to drag people and Pokemon into its watery lair and keep them as part of its collection.
cobblemon.species.rubblock.name: Rubblock
cobblemon.species.rubblock.desc: Rubblock are born from the rubble and debris of fallen buildings and structures. The iron pipes on their heads pick up signals from other Rubblock. When enough Rubblock band together they will evolve.
cobblemon.species.debruin.name: Debruin
cobblemon.species.bourubble.name: Bourubble
cobblemon.species.bourubble.desc: Evo Hammer Arm Fighting - Sand Attack Ground - Tackle Normal 5 Sharpen Normal 8 Rock ThrowSTAB Rock 11 Metal Claw Steel 16 Metal Sound Steel 19 Sandstorm Rock 22 Rock SlideSTAB Rock 28 Autotomize Steel 31 Block Normal 34 Body Slam Normal 38 Metal Burst Steel 41 Wide Guard Rock 48 Heavy Slam Steel 53 Double-Edge Normal 60 Rock WreckerSTAB Rock
cobblemon.species.uninail.name: Uninail
cobblemon.species.desertusk.name: Desertusk
cobblemon.species.burrorm.name: Burrorm
cobblemon.species.burryrm.name: Burryrm
cobblemon.species.baybee.name: Baybee
cobblemon.species.baybee.desc: Baybee live in large urbanised areas where the older generation will build up structures for them to reside in until they are ready to evolve. When predators are near they bury underground leaving only their tails exposed.
cobblemon.species.drillbee.name: Drillbee
cobblemon.species.drillbee.desc: Drillbee are often used by construction workers to pass materials up to developing buildings, their hard heads resist falling debris. In the wild, they work to build structures for their queen. Drillbee is the most common evolution of Baybee.
cobblemon.species.diggbee.name: Diggbee
cobblemon.species.diggbee.desc: Baybee that remain in their honey armour for too long evolve into Diggbee. They are used in construction sites as a reliable means to dig up dirt. Their huge claws allow them to breakthrough even bedrock.
cobblemon.species.honarchee.name: Honarchee
cobblemon.species.honarchee.desc: Honarchee control whole colonies ordering younglings to create lavish structures from surrounding items. It produces a beautiful tasting royal jelly that is said to contain healing elements.
cobblemon.species.tarexite.name: Tarexite
cobblemon.species.tarexite.desc: Long ago, Tarexite were the apex predators of prehistoric Rikoto. Records show that they were able to hunt even in midst of a volcano eruption.
cobblemon.species.weyabitt.name: Weyabitt
cobblemon.species.weyatonne.name: Weyatonne
cobblemon.species.pomdan.name: Pomdan
cobblemon.species.pufflepom.name: Pufflepom
cobblemon.species.pufflepom.desc: Cheerleaders will use Pufflepom in dance routines due to their eye for co-ordination and moves. Pufflepoms on different teams are incredibly competitive to one another.
cobblemon.species.battrol.name: Battrol
cobblemon.species.battrolor.name: Battrolor
cobblemon.species.battrolor.desc: Battrolor are used by the Orbopolis Police Force as a means of both transport and to detect criminal activity. They are able to fly high above the clouds and detect prey with ease. When in pursuit they are able to travel at extreme speeds and leaving lightning strikes where they travel.
cobblemon.species.kankrab.name: Kankrab
cobblemon.species.wrekrab.name: Wrekrab
cobblemon.species.wrekrab.desc: Wrekrab reside in huge scrapyards where they consume the thrown away metal. They carry huge vehicles on their backs, the bigger the vehicle the bigger the Wrekrab's rank in its colony.
cobblemon.species.sootot.name: Sootot
cobblemon.species.sootot.desc: Chimchik spend their young lives nesting in chimneys to stay warm. They absorb the smoke exuded which gives them their dark plumage.
cobblemon.species.sweepmu.name: Sweepmu
cobblemon.species.sweepmu.desc: Sweepmu live on buildings with chimneys where they spend their days burrowing their heads. They absorb the soot and ash into their plumage which makes them incredibly dense. Despite having wings, it is unable to fly and rather relies on jumping to reach rooftops.
cobblemon.species.palmbrella.name: Palmbrella
cobblemon.species.palmbrella.desc: Popular among tourists, Palmbrella lounge on beaches taking joy in granting shade to people and Pokemon alike. Their leaves are incredibly thick and keep out both the suns rays and rain.
cobblemon.species.feistsea.name: Feistsea
cobblemon.species.letharleo.name: Letharleo
cobblemon.species.letharleo.desc: Letharleo spend 90% of their day asleep. They only wake up to eat and battle and will fall asleep instantly afterwards. Its a common sight for ferries and boats to be delayed due to sunbathing Letharleo on the pier.
cobblemon.species.chickaring.name: Chickaring
cobblemon.species.chickaring.desc: Chickaring live along the coast in huge nests in palm trees around the Orbis region where they bask in the sun. They do not catch their own food but rather rely on Seadeek gathering fish for them. Their necks puff up similar to a rubber ring to help them stay afloat in the ocean.
cobblemon.species.seadeek.name: Seadeek
cobblemon.species.seadeek.desc: They are often known to be annoying to tourists as they eat beach comers' food and steal their possessions. They have a loud screeching cry that they bellow across the shores. They always obey the orders of a Cappatross, and will bring all the food they acquire to their leader before eating it themselves.
cobblemon.species.cappatross.name: Cappatross
cobblemon.species.cappatross.desc: Cappatross lead groups of Seadeek and Chickabeach during migrations and long distance flights. They are extremely territorial and will not allow other Pokemon to be near the rest of its group. There will only ever be one Cappatross per flock; when another Seadeek evolves, the two Cappatross will fight it out, the winner either retaining or taking control of the flock.
cobblemon.species.blufable.name: Blufable
cobblemon.species.conchle.name: Conchle
cobblemon.species.turtlantis.name: Turtlantis
cobblemon.species.turtlantis.desc: Once a common sight in the oceans surrounding Orbopolis; Turtlantis have dwindled in numbers due to the presence of plastic bags in the ocean. They are unable to differentiate between their main prey and Plastic bags due to human interference.
cobblemon.species.ittibitti.name: Ittibitti
cobblemon.species.nemish.name: Nemish
cobblemon.species.imprioni.name: Imprioni
cobblemon.species.slugcus.name: Slugcus
cobblemon.species.finsail.name: Finsail
cobblemon.species.finsail.desc: Finsail are used by trainers across Orbopolis as means of transportation across the ocean. While not being the smoothest and most reliable ride, Finsail are capable of reaching great speeds that makes them popular choice among fisherman who desire to chase their catches. Their long noses are incredibly sturdy and able to break rocks that may block its path.
cobblemon.species.jellybag.name: Jellybag
cobblemon.species.jellybag.desc: Jellybag are unique in the way they dispose of every item they see, no matter what it is.
cobblemon.species.trasphin.name: Trasphin
cobblemon.species.trasphin.desc: Years of ocean pollution have caused Trasphin to absorb toxins and oil into their bodies to adapt. They are full of sludge that they expel out of their bottle like noses.
cobblemon.species.whaste.name: Whaste
cobblemon.species.whaste.desc: Whaste lifelessly drift along with the oceans currents collecting trash on their backs and have been given the nickname 'cleaners of the sea' because of this. Bird Pokemon like Seadeek often seek rest on their backs when they have to travel long distances. Depending on the items found on their backs can alter their abilities and moves.
cobblemon.species.memoroot.name: Memoroot
cobblemon.species.spectralyra.name: Spectralyra
cobblemon.species.spectralyra.desc: As the wind passes through its delicate string-like vines, an ethereal melody is emitted that is believed to soothe restless spirits. Urban legends say that the music it plays can be heard in the afterlife.
cobblemon.species.budgeaf.name: Budgeaf
cobblemon.species.budgeaf.desc: One of the starter Pokemon from Orbis, Budgeaf are excellent Pokemon for first time trainers due to their overly friendly and protective personalities. Its leaf-like tail gives off a sweet aroma that people try to replicate in dishes. Budgeaf are very nimble, despite their small size they are more than capable of flying through strong winds with ease.
cobblemon.species.gryphoyal.name: Gryphoyal
cobblemon.species.gryphoyal.desc: Gryphoyal are known for their incredible leaf-like plumage that give off a mouthwatering aroma when rustled. It is capable of moving at extreme speeds on both land and in the sky and will hunt Pokemon just about anywhere. Gryphoyal are mentioned often in Ancient Orbis records, indicating that they were the main source of travel for many people due to their size and outgoing temperament.
cobblemon.species.zodiaking.name: Zodiaking
cobblemon.species.aburago.name: Aburago
cobblemon.species.aburago.desc: Aburago travel streets at night in search for the flames of lamps and candles to consume. People often light candles in their homes which are rudely put out by a passing Aburago.
cobblemon.species.terraor.name: Terraor
cobblemon.species.terraor.desc: Believed to be formed from the built up fears of people, Terraor appear at the scariest parts of scary stories, feeding on the listeners screams.
cobblemon.species.shadovizor.name: Shadovizor
cobblemon.species.shadovizor.desc: Born to life from malevolent shadows, Shadovizor can only move freely in the dark. During the day, it travels along walls and floors, disguising itself as a persons shadow.
cobblemon.species.whaloon.name: Whaloon
cobblemon.species.orcloud.name: Orcloud
cobblemon.species.deye.name: Deye
cobblemon.species.deye.desc: Deye hurl themselves like dice to predict future events. Rolling both eyes is said to be bad luck.
cobblemon.species.pyroulette.name: Pyroulette
cobblemon.species.pyroulette.desc: Pyroulette are exclusively owned by family owners of the Metroville Casino and have been passed down for generations. They possess a bizarre and mysterious energy.
cobblemon.species.aerling.name: Aerling
cobblemon.species.cyclowyrm.name: Cyclowyrm
cobblemon.species.xephyron.name: Xephyron
cobblemon.species.coralegion.name: Coralegion
cobblemon.species.moosong.name: Moosong
cobblemon.species.horncerto.name: Horncerto
cobblemon.species.horncerto.desc: Horncerto's horns once evolving become hollow and tough. Originally thought to be brass, researchers quickly realised they are made out of hardened keratin. The noise produced from them once caused many tales of ghost trains.
cobblemon.species.pinjure.name: Pinjure
cobblemon.species.mediquil.name: Mediquil
cobblemon.species.mediquil.desc: Mediquil are the nurses of Ottora's forests. Many children have reported that upon being hurt, a healing quil from a Mediquil would clear up their wounds by counteracting bacteria.
cobblemon.species.stachick.name: Stachick
cobblemon.species.shockite.name: Shockite
cobblemon.species.falconduct.name: Falconduct
cobblemon.species.falconduct.desc: Falconduct commands the skies with jet-like precision, its sleek body cutting through storms like a blade of thunder. Its wings generate static currents that bathe the ground in ions. Some believe Falconduct's form inspired the shape of early military aircraft.
cobblemon.species.floodle.name: Floodle
cobblemon.species.woofoam.name: Woofoam
cobblemon.species.civilarva.name: Civilarva
cobblemon.species.pupail.name: Pupail
cobblemon.species.dynamoth.name: Dynamoth
cobblemon.species.glittiny.name: Glittiny
cobblemon.species.lunarva.name: Lunarva
cobblemon.species.fulluna.name: Fulluna
cobblemon.species.silfrish.name: Silfrish
cobblemon.species.jueshika.name: Jueshika
cobblemon.species.jueshika.desc: Evolves into Juekizumi by using Maple Syrup on 5 times
cobblemon.species.juekizumi.name: Juekizumi
cobblemon.species.aqquack.name: Aqquack
cobblemon.species.mergangster.name: Mergangster
cobblemon.species.coynel.name: Coynel
cobblemon.species.popstarch.name: Popstarch
cobblemon.species.cabbrain.name: Cabbrain
cobblemon.species.cerebage.name: Cerebage
cobblemon.species.finook.name: Finook
cobblemon.species.reelfin.name: Reelfin
cobblemon.species.aubat.name: Aubat
cobblemon.species.silvarn.name: Silvarn

cobblemon.species.salfurrr.name: Salfurrr

cobblemon.species.poltrait.name: Poltrait
cobblemon.species.ghoullery.name: Ghoullery
cobblemon.species.pidunce.name: Pidunce
cobblemon.species.destructice.name: Destructice
cobblemon.species.disix.name: Disix
cobblemon.species.diielve.name: Diielve
cobblemon.species.giiem.name: Giiem
cobblemon.species.vulpilfer.name: Vulpilfer
cobblemon.species.howltlaw.name: Howltlaw
cobblemon.species.miensei.name: Miensei
cobblemon.species.ottoranhonedge.name: OttoranHonedge
cobblemon.species.ottorandoublade.name: OttoranDoublade
cobblemon.species.aegistump.name: Aegistump
cobblemon.species.chainslash.name: Chainslash
cobblemon.species.vesitanchespin.name: VesitanChespin
cobblemon.species.vesitanchespin.desc: Es ist sehr schläfrig. Wenn es träumt, kann es für kurze Zeit in die Zukunft schauen.
cobblemon.species.vesitanquilladin.name: VesitanQuilladin
cobblemon.species.vesitanquilladin.desc: Die Krone auf seinem Kopf schützt es vor Ablenkungen, sodass es in Ruhe zur jeder Zeit meditieren kann. Das Auge auf dem Bauch dient zur Abschreckung.
cobblemon.species.vesitanchesnaught.name: VesitanChesnaught
cobblemon.species.vesitanchesnaught.desc: Meditation hat diesem Pokémon erlaubt in seinen Träumen durch Zeit und Raum zu reisen. Man sagt es hat schon alles gesehen.
cobblemon.species.vesitanfennekin.name: VesitanFennekin
cobblemon.species.vesitanfennekin.desc: Anstelle eines Snacks kaut es unterwegs auf einem Knochen herum. Knochensammeln ist seine größte Leidenschaft.
cobblemon.species.vesitanbraixen.name: VesitanBraixen
cobblemon.species.vesitanbraixen.desc: In seinem Schweif steckt ein Knochen, den es bei Bedarf zum Kampf einsetzt, um mehr Knochen zu sammeln.
cobblemon.species.vesitandelphox.name: VesitanDelphox
cobblemon.species.vesitandelphox.desc: Stolz präsentiert dieses Pokémon die Knochen seiner Gegner, die es als Schweif hinterher zieht.
cobblemon.species.vesitanfroakie.name: VesitanFroakie
cobblemon.species.vesitanfroakie.desc: Wenn sich dieses Pokémon bedroht fühlt, sondert es ein Gift ab, was schmerzt wie tausend Grad heiße Flammen.
cobblemon.species.vesitanfrogadier.name: VesitanFrogadier
cobblemon.species.vesitanfrogadier.desc: Es ist unglaublich agil und schnell. Bei seiner Jagd auf Gegner spuckt es kleine Feuerbälle auf sie, für einen gerösteten Snack.
cobblemon.species.vesitangreninja.name: VesitanGreninja
cobblemon.species.vesitangreninja.desc: Kaum hat man es erspäht, verschwindet es auch schon wieder. Alles was man sieht ist das Lichtbild seiner Flamme, die an Sternschnuppen erinnert.
cobblemon.species.vesitanscatterbug.name: VesitanScatterbug
cobblemon.species.vesitanscatterbug.desc: Es reguliert seine Körpertemperatur mit dem Puder, das seinen Körper bedeckt, und kommt deswegen in jedem Klima und jeder Region zurecht.
cobblemon.species.vesitanspewpa.name: VesitanSpewpa
cobblemon.species.vesitanspewpa.desc: Es lebt versteckt im schattigen Dickicht. Wird es von einem Feind angegriffen, stellt es sein Fell zur Abschreckung zu scharfen Spitzen auf.
cobblemon.species.vesitanvivillon.name: VesitanVivillon
cobblemon.species.vesitanvivillon.desc: Vivillon kommen weltweit mit den unterschiedlichsten Flügelmusterungen vor. In Vesita entwickelte es heilende Kräfte.
cobblemon.species.vesitanflabebe.name: VesitanFlabebe
cobblemon.species.vesitanflabebe.desc: Hat es eine Blume gefunden, die ihm gefällt, lebt es sein Leben lang in Symbiose mit ihr. Es lässt sich unbekümmert vom Wind treiben.
cobblemon.species.vesitanfloette.name: VesitanFloette
cobblemon.species.vesitanfloette.desc: Es fliegt auf Wiesen umher und kümmert sich um welkende Blumen. Es setzt deren geheime Kräfte frei und nutzt diese zum Kämpfen.
cobblemon.species.vesitanflorges.name: VesitanFlorges
cobblemon.species.vesitanflorges.desc: Wunderschöne Blumengärten sind sein Revier. Sollte sich jemand ungewollt nähern, setzt es ein tödliches Giftgas frei.
cobblemon.species.vesitanskiddo.name: VesitanSkiddo
cobblemon.species.vesitanskiddo.desc: Man sagt, es sei eines der ersten Pokémon, die mit Menschen zusammengelebt haben. Es ist sehr ruhig und friedfertig.
cobblemon.species.vesitangogoat.name: VesitanGogoat
cobblemon.species.vesitangogoat.desc: Durch ihr sehr robustes Fell können sie ganze Gebirgszüge unbeschadet herunterrollen. Der Aufstieg dauert allerdings ewig.
cobblemon.species.vesitanspritzee.name: VesitanSpritzee
cobblemon.species.vesitanspritzee.desc: Der von ihm verströmte Duft verzückt jeden, der ihn riecht. Es benutzt ihn um seine Gegner kurzzeitig zu kontrollieren.
cobblemon.species.vesitanaromatisse.name: VesitanAromatisse
cobblemon.species.vesitanaromatisse.desc: Wie Pilzsporen breitet sich der vor ihm versprühte Duft im Körper des Gegners aus. Wenige Sekunden später werden sie zu willenlosen Sklaven.
cobblemon.species.vesitanswirlix.name: VesitanSwirlix
cobblemon.species.vesitanswirlix.desc: Es stößt weiße Fäden aus, die so süß und klebrig wie Zuckerwatte sind, sich jedoch in Sekunden entzünden lassen.
cobblemon.species.vesitanslurpuff.name: VesitanSlurpuff
cobblemon.species.vesitanslurpuff.desc: Die Flamme auf seinem Kopf kann bis zu 685°C heiß werden. Es hilft deshalb oft in Konditoreien aus.
cobblemon.species.vesitaninkay.name: VesitanInkay
cobblemon.species.vesitaninkay.desc: Mit den blinkenden Punkten auf seinem Körper raubt es Gegnern den Kampfeswillen. Es nutzt diese Gelegenheit, um sich zu verstecken.
cobblemon.species.vesitanmalamar.name: VesitanMalamar
cobblemon.species.vesitanmalamar.desc: Mit seinen hypnotischen Kräften lockt es Gegner an, hält sie mit den Tentakeln an seinem Kopf fest und zersetzt sie dann mit Verdauungssekret.
cobblemon.species.vesitanbinacle.name: VesitanBinacle
cobblemon.species.vesitanbinacle.desc: Bithora bewohnen jeweils zu zweit einen Felsen. Entzweien sie sich im Streit, sucht sich eines der beiden einen neuen Felsen als Unterkunft.
cobblemon.species.vesitanbarbaracle.name: VesitanBarbaracle
cobblemon.species.vesitanbarbaracle.desc: Arme und Beine verfügen über eigene Gehirne, was ihnen relative Bewegungsfreiheit gewährt. Sie ordnen sich jedoch zumeist den Befehlen des Kopfes unter.
cobblemon.species.vesitanskrelp.name: VesitanSkrelp
cobblemon.species.vesitanskrelp.desc: Als verfaulter Seetang getarnt, lauert es auf Beute und bespritzt alles und jeden, der sich ahnungslos nähert, mit flüssigem Gift, bevor es ihm den Rest gibt.
cobblemon.species.vesitandragalge.name: VesitanDragalge
cobblemon.species.vesitandragalge.desc: Es heißt, dass die Besatzung von Schiffen, die sich in Tandraks Hoheitsgebiet begeben, nicht mehr lebend zurückkehrt.
cobblemon.species.vesitanclauncher.name: VesitanClauncher
cobblemon.species.vesitanclauncher.desc: Durch körpereigene metallartige Absonderungen feuert es wie eine Pistole kleine Kügelchen ab, die aus kurzer Distanz selbst Felsen zerschmettern.
cobblemon.species.vesitanclawitzer.name: VesitanClawitzer
cobblemon.species.vesitanclawitzer.desc: Aus seinen gewaltigen Scheren feuert es riesige Stahlkugeln ab, die ganze Klippen zum Einsturz bringen können.
cobblemon.species.vesitanhelioptile.name: VesitanHelioptile
cobblemon.species.vesitanhelioptile.desc: Die Zellen der Hautlappen, die sich beidseitig an seinem Kopf befinden, erzeugen Strom, wenn sie von Sonnenstrahlen beschienen werden.
cobblemon.species.vesitanheliolisk.name: VesitanHeliolisk
cobblemon.species.vesitanheliolisk.desc: Die Strommenge, die ein Elezard mit ausgebreiteten Hautlappen durch Umwandlung von Sonnenstrahlen erzeugt, genügt zur Versorgung eines Wolkenkratzers.
cobblemon.species.vesitanhawlucha.name: VesitanHawlucha
cobblemon.species.vesitanhawlucha.desc: Ungeachtet seines kleinen Wuchses, erweist es sich, dank seiner Kampftechnik, gegenüber größeren Gegnern wie Machomei oder Hariyama als ebenbürtig.
cobblemon.species.vesitandedenne.name: VesitanDedenne
cobblemon.species.vesitandedenne.desc: Mit seinem Schwanz zapft es Lebenskraft von seinen Opfern ab, um Energie zu tanken, die es über seine Schnurrhaare wieder entlädt.
cobblemon.species.vesitangoomy.name: VesitanGoomy
cobblemon.species.vesitangoomy.desc: Sein Körper ist von einer schleimigen Schicht umhüllt, an der gegnerische Tritte und Schläge abgleiten, ohne Schaden anzurichten.
cobblemon.species.vesitansliggoo.name: VesitanSliggoo
cobblemon.species.vesitansliggoo.desc: Es verjagt Gegner durch Absonderung eines alles zersetzenden Schleims. Die zurückgebildeten Augäpfel des Pokémon gewähren ihm keine Sicht.
cobblemon.species.vesitangoodra.name: VesitanGoodra
cobblemon.species.vesitangoodra.desc: Es greift den Gegner mit ausfahrbaren Fühlern an. Aufgrund seiner Blindheit benutzt es diese ebenfalls zur Orientierung und Naruhngssuche.
cobblemon.species.vesitanbergmite.name: VesitanBergmite
cobblemon.species.vesitanbergmite.desc: Es wehrt gegnerische Angriffe mit seinem in Eis gehüllten Körper ab. Bruchstellen bessert es mit aus kalter Luft gewonnenem neuen Eis aus.
cobblemon.species.vesitanavalugg.name: VesitanAvalugg
cobblemon.species.vesitanavalugg.desc: Mit den zahlreichen Arktip auf seinem Rücken sieht es aus wie ein Flugzeugträger aus Eis.
cobblemon.species.vesitannoibat.name: VesitanNoibat
cobblemon.species.vesitannoibat.desc: Selbst ein gestandener Ringer geht bei den 200 000 Hz hohen Ultraschallwellen dieses Pokémon unweigerlich in die Knie.
cobblemon.species.vesitannoivern.name: VesitanNoivern
cobblemon.species.vesitannoivern.desc: Es fliegt in finsterer, mondloser Nacht umher und macht Jagd auf achtlose Beute. Ist bei Dunkelheit jedem Gegner überlegen.
cobblemon.species.herovor.name: Herovor
cobblemon.species.herovor.desc: Herovor mostly lives in the forest it was born in, which it is very protective of. As they grow, leaves sprout on their shells.
cobblemon.species.forestone.name: Forestone
cobblemon.species.forestone.desc: Forestone supports smaller Pokémon and helps grow wildlife in its habitat by spreading seeds that grow on its leaves.
cobblemon.species.mountree.name: Mountree
cobblemon.species.mountree.desc: Mountree guards its forest against any danger, willing to risk its life to help those in need. Its shell is as hard as granite.
cobblemon.species.purrlit.name: Purrlit
cobblemon.species.purrlit.desc: Purrlit are very playful Pokémon and they're easily distracted by the smallest things. One can tell how happy a Purrlit is by the warmth of his snout.
cobblemon.species.purryo.name: Purryo
cobblemon.species.purryo.desc: Purryo is a rapscallion among Pokémon, loving to cause mischief with other Purryo. Perhaps this is why it usually fears to evolve into the well-behaved Flearoe.
cobblemon.species.flearoe.name: Flearoe
cobblemon.species.flearoe.desc: Flearoe attacks by exhaling hot breath that singes its opponents. Its fur produces heat on its own and is sometimes used to produce winter clothes.
cobblemon.species.salatad.name: Salatad
cobblemon.species.salatad.desc: Salatad are born in small bodies of water and live there until they evolve. Their powerful tails make them excellent swimmers for escaping predators.
cobblemon.species.salanip.name: Salanip
cobblemon.species.salanip.desc: More adapted to land than its previous evolution, Salanip has developed sharper claws. Its poison sacs allow it to stun prey.
cobblemon.species.salaslam.name: Salaslam
cobblemon.species.salaslam.desc: This Pokémon can slug prey with its powerful arms and tail. Salaslam can excrete toxins through its mouth and skin.
cobblemon.species.hamstar.name: Hamstar
cobblemon.species.hamstar.desc: This Pokémon is a favored pet because of its soft fur and gentle nature. It has been said that touching the star on the back of a Hamstar will bring you good luck.
cobblemon.species.snuffuzz.name: Snuffuzz
cobblemon.species.snuffuzz.desc: Snuffuzz are known for their extremely soft fur. Bird Pokémon often collect their shed winter coats each spring for their nests.
cobblemon.species.budcherp.name: Budcherp
cobblemon.species.budcherp.desc: Budcherp are capable of limited human speech through mimicry, often speaking phrases to warn or alert people of potential nearby threats.
cobblemon.species.budsoar.name: Budsoar
cobblemon.species.budsoar.desc: Budsoar are watchful protectors of the forests, directing lost travelers to safety with their glowing feathers and warning them of any danger.
cobblemon.species.elecritter.name: Elecritter
cobblemon.species.elecritter.desc: Elecritter is a very agile Pokémon. They store static electricity in their fur as they run, which is released when irritated or frightened.
cobblemon.species.weashock.name: Weashock
cobblemon.species.weashock.desc: Weashock are more capable of controlling their electricity. They have sharp minds and use electricity to stimulate themselves for faster reflexes.
cobblemon.species.stickit.name: Stickit
cobblemon.species.stickit.desc: Stickit will burrow themselves underground near the roots of trees to sleep. Their tough backs assist in defending against predators.
cobblemon.species.stickut.name: Stickut
cobblemon.species.stickut.desc: Only one Stickut inhabits each tree in the forest. If another Stickut appears, they'll fight to toss their opponent off. The victor stays while the loser seeks a new tree.
cobblemon.species.cheepip.name: Cheepip
cobblemon.species.cheepip.desc: Cheepip travel in large flocks. Sometimes there are such large amounts of them together that, when resting, they make can make entire rock faces look covered in grass.
cobblemon.species.aeroma.name: Aeroma
cobblemon.species.aeroma.desc: Although big, Aeroma is known to be gentle and caring companions. Their voices have therapeutic power, and their songs brighten even the dullest gardens.
cobblemon.species.lavenseed.name: Lavenseed
cobblemon.species.lavenseed.desc: Lavenseed spends most of their day basking in sunlight for necessary nutrients. They are attracted to kind people, though large crowds may scare them away.
cobblemon.species.lavenbelle.name: Lavenbelle
cobblemon.species.lavenbelle.desc: Lavenbelle emanate an aroma from their skin. Because of this, their fallen petals are often used in perfumes and aromatherapy.
cobblemon.species.lavenrina.name: Lavenrina
cobblemon.species.lavenrina.desc: Lavenrina are graceful and agile. They give off a soothing aroma as they dance ballet, being famous for their many ballet shows around Rikoto.
cobblemon.species.moonky.name: Moonky
cobblemon.species.moonky.desc: Moonky can be difficult to train due to their rambunctious nature. They're said to have come from the moon ages ago.
cobblemon.species.lunape.name: Lunape
cobblemon.species.lunape.desc: Lunape are mischievous ones, often using their psychic powers to play tricks on others. Their antics especially worsens on the full moon.
cobblemon.species.tadart.name: Tadart
cobblemon.species.tadart.desc: Being small and fragile, Tadart uses its leaf to camouflage into the forest environment and keep itself afloat in the water to avoid predators.
cobblemon.species.dartoad.name: Dartoad
cobblemon.species.dartoad.desc: Dartoad make use of their leaf-like tail both for shielding itself from drying out on sunny days and as a water dish on rainy days.
cobblemon.species.doveheart.name: Doveheart
cobblemon.species.doveheart.desc: It's said the very presence of a single Doveheart can calm even the tensest of situations. If both a male and a female appear, mortal enemies can become lifelong allies.
cobblemon.species.spidox.name: Spidox
cobblemon.species.spidox.desc: A single bite from Spidox can cause nausea and drowsiness for several hours. They will often attempt to web whatever they bite, regardless of size.
cobblemon.species.widox.name: Widox
cobblemon.species.widox.desc: Despite the stigma and fear surrounding them, Widox venom was a key research material in creating the first Antidotes and Full Heals.
cobblemon.species.glowig.name: Glowig
cobblemon.species.glowig.desc: Glowig live in dark forests, with a main diet of leaves. Their glow, while essential for their sight in the dark, makes them easy picking for Flying-type Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.glocoon.name: Glocoon
cobblemon.species.glocoon.desc: Glocoon covers their glowing spots with leaves to avoid detection. When they are spotted by predators, they blind them with a sudden flash of light.
cobblemon.species.glowing.name: Glowing
cobblemon.species.glowing.desc: Glowing can generate light so strong that it can illuminate the forest as if no trees are blocking the sun. Travelers rely on them to find their way out of the forest.
cobblemon.species.stotox.name: Stotox
cobblemon.species.stotox.desc: Hikers and tourists sometimes come back after a mountainous walk feeling dizzy and faint. This is due to them stepping on a Stotox's poisonous spike.
cobblemon.species.bouldox.name: Bouldox
cobblemon.species.bouldox.desc: Bouldox's spikes are coated in a powerful poison that affects the nervous system. A single touch of these spikes can paralyze a person for hours.
cobblemon.species.crystox.name: Crystox
cobblemon.species.crystox.desc: Despite their appearance, Crystox are entirely organic Pokémon. Their crystals are actually crystallized poison, and their toxicity is not weakened in this state.
cobblemon.species.jumple.name: Jumple
cobblemon.species.jumple.desc: Some Jumple can jump a hundred times higher than themselves. However, they are easily blown away by the wind and end up miles away from the forests where they live.
cobblemon.species.casspring.name: Casspring
cobblemon.species.casspring.desc: Casspring's legs act like springs, rendering them capable of jumping very high. It is often for people to be startled when they land from the sky out of nowhere.
cobblemon.species.flowby.name: Flowby
cobblemon.species.flowby.desc: Although small and light, Flowby can use its control over the wind to create strong breezes that are capable of lifting an adult off their feet.
cobblemon.species.nimblow.name: Nimblow
cobblemon.species.nimblow.desc: Because Nimblow's bodies mostly consist of water vapor, they shrink during droughts and grow during rainy seasons.
cobblemon.species.cirribus.name: Cirribus
cobblemon.species.cirribus.desc: Cirribus live very far up in the atmosphere. On rare occasions, masses of Cirribus would join together to form massive storm clouds capable of great devastation.
cobblemon.species.pixwee.name: Pixwee
cobblemon.species.pixwee.desc: It's said that seeing Pixwee while lost in the woods grants you luck to find your way out. This myth persists as Pixwee continues to make their home near human settlements.
cobblemon.species.pixilily.name: Pixilily
cobblemon.species.pixilily.desc: A tale in Rikoto is that if you catch a Pixilily, they'll grant you a wish. This is derived from records of grateful Pixilily who gather berries and objects for their trainers.
cobblemon.species.ugling.name: Ugling
cobblemon.species.ugling.desc: Due to their undeveloped wings, Ugling are unable to fly. On the other hand, they're very skilled swimmers, able to dive for over 10 minutes for food.
cobblemon.species.swellegant.name: Swellegant
cobblemon.species.swellegant.desc: Even though they are one of the most beautiful Pokémon in Rikoto, Swellegant are extremely vain. They spend most of their time staring at their reflections in ponds.
cobblemon.species.angling.name: Angling
cobblemon.species.angling.desc: Angling are especially small among Water-type Pokémon. By using their cute eyes as a defense mechanism, they convince predators to hunt for other Pokémon instead.
cobblemon.species.angelish.name: Angelish
cobblemon.species.angelish.desc: Known as the 'Jewel of the Open Sea', Angelish love to swim in the ocean. They fall sick and become dull-colored when kept in an aquarium or other enclosed areas.
cobblemon.species.angelight.name: Angelight
cobblemon.species.angelight.desc: Angelight are considered one of the most beautiful Pokémon in the oceans of Rikoto, and yet they do not actively look down on other Pokémon for not being as beautiful.
cobblemon.species.rubbunny.name: Rubbunny
cobblemon.species.rubbunny.desc: Rubbunny are capable of extreme feats of agility, ricocheting between foes with incredible force. Myths say that they can jump to the moon and bounce back.
cobblemon.species.aquad.name: Aquad
cobblemon.species.aquad.desc: Aquad often swim against river currents to train their muscles. They swish their strong tails to help themselves keep steady.
cobblemon.species.smaqua.name: Smaqua
cobblemon.species.smaqua.desc: Smaqua train by standing on rocks in the center of whitewater rapids, avoiding and smashing any obstacles that may wash down the river.
cobblemon.species.vennap.name: Vennap
cobblemon.species.vennap.desc: Vennap excretes a sweet, honey-like scent to attract prey. As they get close enough, Vennap spits sticky goo onto the prey and traps them, allowing for no escape.
cobblemon.species.monstrap.name: Monstrap
cobblemon.species.monstrap.desc: Monstrap is an extremely cunning predator. Scientists have discovered that their existence pre-dates even some extinct, fossilized Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.lophug.name: Lophug
cobblemon.species.lophug.desc: Lophug's ears give off a unique chemical when wrapped around a person or another Pokémon, relieving pain and causing wounds to heal faster.
cobblemon.species.beopup.name: Beopup
cobblemon.species.beopup.desc: Beopup hunt in packs, in every pack there's an Alpha. To be Alpha they must know a certain move, if another Beopup learns that move, it can compete for the role of Alpha.
cobblemon.species.werehide.name: Werehide
cobblemon.species.werehide.desc: A vicious and rarely tamed Pokémon, in ancient times Werehide were thought to be cursed humans that became Pokémon every full moon.
cobblemon.species.aractula.name: Aractula
cobblemon.species.aractula.desc: Aractula have built up resistance towards Spidox venom from their rivalry. Not even a dose strong enough to take out human adults would have any effect on them.
cobblemon.species.terrotula.name: Terrotula
cobblemon.species.terrotula.desc: The gentle giants of Bug-types, Terrotula is often misunderstood for its fearsome appearance. Yet, despite their pleasant nature, they are merciless in battle.
cobblemon.species.geckone.name: Geckone
cobblemon.species.geckone.desc: Geckone can tap into the minds of people and Pokémon as a defense mechanism, overlaying their visions with illusions.
cobblemon.species.toron.name: Toron
cobblemon.species.toron.desc: Toron's hide is said to be as tough as steel. It can crack rocks by charging into them without so much as scratching their body.
cobblemon.species.oriture.name: Oriture
cobblemon.species.oriture.desc: Oriture can detect vibrations in the ground with ease. When two Oriture are hunting the same prey, they would stomp on the ground to disrupt the other's tracking.
cobblemon.species.natoron.name: Natoron
cobblemon.species.natoron.desc: Natoron creates earthquakes to scare away any Pokémon intruding on its territory. Trainers are advised to approach them with caution.
cobblemon.species.zuppy.name: Zuppy
cobblemon.species.zuppy.desc: Zuppy are playful Pokémon by nature. They favor running around each other at high speeds, often creating sparks by accident.
cobblemon.species.rushot.name: Rushot
cobblemon.species.rushot.desc: A Pokémon said to able to move as fast as a lightning strike, Rushot are attracted to the sound of thunder and follow it relentlessly.
cobblemon.species.flawk.name: Flawk
cobblemon.species.flawk.desc: Flawk cannot glide even with a running start due to its weak wings. The most it can do is run on the ground, utilizing flames to speed itself up.
cobblemon.species.legenix.name: Legenix
cobblemon.species.legenix.desc: Legenix are said to be immortal. Once every 100 years, they will burst into flame and be reborn as a Flawk egg.
cobblemon.species.snazap.name: Snazap
cobblemon.species.snazap.desc: Snazap possesses two types of venom with different effects in its fangs, allowing it to choose which one to utilize in different situations.
cobblemon.species.cobolta.name: Cobolta
cobblemon.species.cobolta.desc: Cobolta can change the patterns on its body by directing the electrical current in its body. This is mostly for intimidation, though it sees use during mating seasons as well.
cobblemon.species.bushoo.name: Bushoo
cobblemon.species.bushoo.desc: If a Bushoo gets startled, it can easily crouch down and appear as if it were a small bush. It can be difficult for garden owners to find their own Bushoo.
cobblemon.species.bushup.name: Bushup
cobblemon.species.bushup.desc: When Bushup gather in large groups, they may appear as a giant bush. If a couple of them fall asleep on a path, they may turn a commonly visited forest into a giant maze.
cobblemon.species.bushairy.name: Bushairy
cobblemon.species.bushairy.desc: The hedge on Bushairy's back can be trimmed, allowing trainers to create different shapes out of it. There are contests on which Bushairy has the finest trimmed hedge.
cobblemon.species.platyplat.name: Platyplat
cobblemon.species.platyplat.desc: Platyplat spend most of their time lazing around, whether onshore or in the rivers. They leisurely swish their tail to drift across bodies of water.
cobblemon.species.platyplash.name: Platyplash
cobblemon.species.platyplash.desc: A Pokémon with a strange appearance and behavior, most people don't believe Platyplash exists until they encounter one face to face.
cobblemon.species.terraz.name: Terraz
cobblemon.species.terraz.desc: Terraz, while able to fly at a high speed, quickly becomes fatigued and will find a place to land. An injured Terraz can barely even flap its wings.
cobblemon.species.terravolt.name: Terravolt
cobblemon.species.terravolt.desc: Terravolt leads flocks of Terraz, making sure they can keep up. Yet, at the same time, Terravolt themselves cannot keep flying for a long time either.
cobblemon.species.dinomite.name: Dinomite
cobblemon.species.dinomite.desc: Dinomite wraps its arms with discarded bandages and sometimes Wraphro wraps. It may occasionally venture into Goldune Desert for replacement wraps.
cobblemon.species.dinopion.name: Dinopion
cobblemon.species.dinopion.desc: Dinopion are fierce fighters capable of launching volleys of claw strikes and punches exceeding 100,000 PSI. They use stalagmites in caves as punching bags.
cobblemon.species.formling.name: Formling
cobblemon.species.formling.desc: A master shapeshifter, Formling are said to be able to take the permanent form of other Pokémon at will. Due to this, they are theorized to have spread to other regions.
cobblemon.species.raizid.name: Raizid
cobblemon.species.raizid.desc: Raizid draws its power from the Earth's electromagnetic field. They recharge themselves of energy by stabbing their tail into the ground.
cobblemon.species.raizodon.name: Raizodon
cobblemon.species.raizodon.desc: Raizodon is almost always building up energy when not moving. The high voltage keeps its body running even when it's out of food.
cobblemon.species.dracubat.name: Dracubat
cobblemon.species.dracubat.desc: Dracubat's night vision is second to none, making them very powerful Pokémon at night. It leeches blood from other Pokémon to recover its own health.
cobblemon.species.countula.name: Countula
cobblemon.species.countula.desc: Countula are known as 'Terrors of the Night'. Hiding in the shadows, they are capable of draining life from other Pokémon without their victims even noticing.
cobblemon.species.golkid.name: Golkid
cobblemon.species.golkid.desc: Golkid are ancient Pokémon created as helpers. Throughout centuries, it has always assisted people in building constructions that were too big for human hands.
cobblemon.species.golemo.name: Golemo
cobblemon.species.golemo.desc: A Golemo in deep sleep cannot be easily moved. Some cities employ Bulker specifically to clear out blockades of sleeping Golemo.
cobblemon.species.golossus.name: Golossus
cobblemon.species.golossus.desc: Created by ancient rulers to protect their tombs, Golossus can sense disturbances to their master's well-being and will not stop until the threat is gone.
cobblemon.species.buzzeed.name: Buzzeed
cobblemon.species.buzzeed.desc: Buzzeed is often seen as food by other Pokémon, only for them to deliver a powerful shock as they approach. They absorb both energy from the sun and the ground.
cobblemon.species.ecobuzz.name: Ecobuzz
cobblemon.species.ecobuzz.desc: Care must be taken so that one does not touch Ecobuzz by accident, as high voltage flows through their leaves continuously.
cobblemon.species.signileaf.name: Signileaf
cobblemon.species.signileaf.desc: Signileaf was once considered a pest due to its odd effects on radio waves, but since the invention of the Pokégear, they've been crucial in maintaining a region-wide network.
cobblemon.species.pupool.name: Pupool
cobblemon.species.pupool.desc: Pupool has a tendency to gnaw on everything. Trainers have to take care to clean up their drool from their furniture.
cobblemon.species.pooldog.name: Pooldog
cobblemon.species.pooldog.desc: A popular household Pokémon due to their loyalty and gentle disposition. Their drool always hangs from their jowls, if removed, it will reform immediately.
cobblemon.species.peafan.name: Peafan
cobblemon.species.peafan.desc: Peafan actively chases others away from their territory by showing their tail, but they are easily scared away by larger predators.
cobblemon.species.psyflock.name: Psyflock
cobblemon.species.psyflock.desc: In battle, Psyflock use their colorful tail to hypnotize their opponent, once it has caught them off guard, they are defeated with powerful Psychic attacks.
cobblemon.species.phoxy.name: Phoxy
cobblemon.species.phoxy.desc: Phoxy are remarkably skittish, fleeing from even other docile Pokémon. If pursued, they use their petite size to escape through the forest.
cobblemon.species.phoxiven.name: Phoxiven
cobblemon.species.phoxiven.desc: People say that if you see a Phoxiven, you're very lucky. However, if you manage to capture one, you'll be blessed with good fortune for the rest of your life.
cobblemon.species.paracaw.name: Paracaw
cobblemon.species.paracaw.desc: Paracaw often fly in flocks and seldom separate from their group. They work together under the direction of Paraful and Parabow in gathering supplies.
cobblemon.species.paraful.name: Paraful
cobblemon.species.paraful.desc: Known for their haughtiness, Paraful would disobey their trainers ever so often, but in truly tough battles they willingly listen to orders.
cobblemon.species.parabow.name: Parabow
cobblemon.species.parabow.desc: History's most famous sailors and infamous pirates are often depicted alongside Parabow, due to their incredible natural navigation skills at sea.
cobblemon.species.hummzing.name: Hummzing
cobblemon.species.hummzing.desc: Hummzing are one of the tiniest Pokémon in the world. This works to their advantage, as they can zoom around predators with them unable to catch up.
cobblemon.species.hummzap.name: Hummzap
cobblemon.species.hummzap.desc: Whenever Hummzap flaps its wings rapidly, it causes a loud, buzzing noise. Many facilities employ Cosmet to keep them away from interfering with signals.
cobblemon.species.spony.name: Spony
cobblemon.species.spony.desc: Spony stampeding through a field would not leave a trail of damaged plants; Rather, flowers bloom along their paths.
cobblemon.species.horshush.name: Horshush
cobblemon.species.horshush.desc: In the past, Horshush was the primary form of transportation in the Rikoto region. Since then, farmers raise them for their ability to rejuvenate tired soil.
cobblemon.species.gworm.name: Gworm
cobblemon.species.gworm.desc: Gworm are beloved by farmers for their ability to plow the fields for them. However, they may get careless and dig into underground aquifers, ruining the farmlands.
cobblemon.species.wormune.name: Wormune
cobblemon.species.wormune.desc: Wormune spend most of their lives underground, and for the rare occasions where they are above ground, they coat themselves in the dirt as armor.
cobblemon.species.wormole.name: Wormole
cobblemon.species.wormole.desc: Wormole can create massive tunnels, even through mountainsides. Many caverns connecting routes and towns in Rikoto are thanks to these Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.scorlit.name: Scorlit
cobblemon.species.scorlit.desc: Scorlit lobs colorful fireballs at their prey when hunting; the shape of fireworks in Rikoto is thus shaped after them.
cobblemon.species.scorpinova.name: Scorpinova
cobblemon.species.scorpinova.desc: Scorpinova live under dunes in large, sandy deserts. The sting of its tail both envenoms and burns its prey's flesh. Their antivenom needs to be chilled to take effect.
cobblemon.species.sandster.name: Sandster
cobblemon.species.sandster.desc: Hiding in dunes, Sandster often trips Pokémon and people alike by creating small bumps of sand, then attacking them when they're down.
cobblemon.species.monstune.name: Monstune
cobblemon.species.monstune.desc: Monstune create pits of quicksand to trap Pokémon and people. There are often signs warning of their habitats, but sometimes those sink into their pitfalls as well.
cobblemon.species.wraphro.name: Wraphro
cobblemon.species.wraphro.desc: Wraphro can be found roaming around tombs. It is not known whether they are simply Pokémon who wrapped themselves in cloths or reanimated wraps of ancient corpses.
cobblemon.species.pharobe.name: Pharobe
cobblemon.species.pharobe.desc: Pharobe were once the servants to Ancient Rikotoan desert kings and queens, now they are regarded as the kings of the pyramids.
cobblemon.species.roobeo.name: Roobeo
cobblemon.species.roobeo.desc: Few rocks remain standing in areas where Roobeo live. Some of them may wander outside deserts simply to look for targets to practice punching against.
cobblemon.species.roobeop.name: Roobeop
cobblemon.species.roobeop.desc: Kickboxing masters among Fighting-type Pokémon, Roobeop wander Rikoto searching for an appropriate Roobeo to train as their apprentice.
cobblemon.species.dodont.name: Dodont
cobblemon.species.dodont.desc: Dodont were believed to be extinct until they were discovered in the Rikoto region again. They are incredibly ignorant in comparison to other Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.rexite.name: Rexite
cobblemon.species.rexite.desc: While hunting, the flame on Rexite’s tail burns more intensely, flickering like a heartbeat. This causes a huge boost in its capabilities.
cobblemon.species.stegron.name: Stegron
cobblemon.species.stegron.desc: Stegron's plates conduct electricity well. They store excess energy from meals and sunbathing in their plates and release it when they are threatened.
cobblemon.species.stegasteel.name: Stegasteel
cobblemon.species.stegasteel.desc: The plates on Stegasteel fossils, still preserving their charges, have been used as batteries on mountain areas where power supply isn't easy to come by.
cobblemon.species.atomotro.name: Atomotro
cobblemon.species.atomotro.desc: When the energy storage in Atomotro reaches its limits, it would release a powerful beam of radiation into space, creating electromagnetic disturbances around it.
cobblemon.species.atomotrix.name: Atomotrix
cobblemon.species.atomotrix.desc: Atomotrix's multiple bodies can operate at a parallel speed. It can analyze incredibly complex situations in a second.
cobblemon.species.skrabble.name: Skrabble
cobblemon.species.skrabble.desc: Skrabble scavenges gemstones of various colors and shapes from caves. The larger and more polished a gemstone is, the more respect it holds among peers.
cobblemon.species.jeweltal.name: Jeweltal
cobblemon.species.jeweltal.desc: Ancient Rikotoan Desert Pharaohs would train Jeweltal to sit atop their crown. This both displayed their nobility and protected them from would-be assassins.
cobblemon.species.weakid.name: Weakid
cobblemon.species.weakid.desc: While frail physically, Weakid have a heightened sense of danger, and often make their escape before any predator even notices them.
cobblemon.species.bulker.name: Bulker
cobblemon.species.bulker.desc: Hulking powerhouses among Pokémon, Bulker are capable of shrugging off most physical attacks and retaliating tenfold. However, they are quite dimwitted and easily tricked.
cobblemon.species.dynaball.name: Dynaball
cobblemon.species.dynaball.desc: When a Dynaball's emotion rises, it explodes all of a sudden. It's rare for trainers to possess one without getting covered in dust at least once.
cobblemon.species.explonade.name: Explonade
cobblemon.species.explonade.desc: Explonade detonates itself whenever it feels itself is in danger. Some cities employ trainers to clear out Explonade swarms for safe travels.
cobblemon.species.fawnite.name: Fawnite
cobblemon.species.fawnite.desc: Fawnite favors crashing through any and all obstacles, leaving broken pieces of trees and even rocks behind. Cities are often on the lookout for a herd of them.
cobblemon.species.chardeer.name: Chardeer
cobblemon.species.chardeer.desc: Chardeer creates blazing trails through woodlands and forests when escaping predators. Once the fire is extinguished, these paths often become new hiking trails.
cobblemon.species.elkindle.name: Elkindle
cobblemon.species.elkindle.desc: The speed that Elkindle runs at leaves everything behind it in an inferno. A Elkindle horde is considered on the scale of natural disasters.
cobblemon.species.shrubsea.name: Shrubsea
cobblemon.species.shrubsea.desc: Shrubsea lives on reefs close to the shore, sticking themselves to rocks and dancing to the sea's current. Their habitats in Rikoto have become famous tourist spots.
cobblemon.species.kahula.name: Kahula
cobblemon.species.kahula.desc: Kahula continues dancing on the reefs they washed up onto as Shrubsea. Competitions exist where people attempt to imitate their hula dances.
cobblemon.species.weedsea.name: Weedsea
cobblemon.species.weedsea.desc: Weedsea resides among the seaweed crowds to hide from the hunters. There are even seemingly algae colonies where there is nothing but Weedsea.
cobblemon.species.kelpula.name: Kelpula
cobblemon.species.kelpula.desc: Kelpula colonies are everywhere on the seabed. Some fish Pokémon often attempt to eat their kelp-like appendages, which Kelpula will protect at any cost.
cobblemon.species.eclipo.name: Eclipo
cobblemon.species.eclipo.desc: Eclipo are born from asteroids that enter the atmosphere during an eclipse. Legends tell of their close relationship with Solaran and Lunaro.
cobblemon.species.eclipser.name: Eclipser
cobblemon.species.eclipser.desc: Eclipser use solar and lunar energy to power their attacks. They can spectacularly control light and darkness.
cobblemon.species.feva.name: Feva
cobblemon.species.feva.desc: Feva can make any human or Pokémon fall ill, simply from contact alone. Specialized gloves are sold in stores to be able to take care of Feva and its evolutions.
cobblemon.species.fevira.name: Fevira
cobblemon.species.fevira.desc: Fevira can cause hypnotic trances from the poison it spreads through dancing. Trainers are required to make sure they do not release poison in public space.
cobblemon.species.fevesta.name: Fevesta
cobblemon.species.fevesta.desc: When a Fevesta dances, it creates a poisonous cloud that envelops a large area and inflict all that approaches it with fever; This dance is known as the 'Deadly Pirouette'.
cobblemon.species.moostone.name: Moostone
cobblemon.species.moostone.desc: Moostone trots around rocky mountains, headbutting each other both for fun and to hone their resilience. Rocks caught between two would simply crumble into dust.
cobblemon.species.moostrike.name: Moostrike
cobblemon.species.moostrike.desc: Moostrike are fierce and aggressive Pokémon, despite their appearance and usual portrayal. Males are known to fight to near-death over territory and mates.
cobblemon.species.kidlit.name: Kidlit
cobblemon.species.kidlit.desc: Thriving in mountainous terrains, Kidlit can easily jump across creaks and gaps between rocky cliffs, leading to their crucial position in search and rescue.
cobblemon.species.billaze.name: Billaze
cobblemon.species.billaze.desc: Billaze are master climbers among Pokémon, known for being able to scale sheer volcanic mountainsides, even during an eruption.
cobblemon.species.airimp.name: Airimp
cobblemon.species.airimp.desc: Inside the metal casing of Irimp is nothing but hot air. They can expel the air to attack, but to keep the air heated they scour the land for more fuel.
cobblemon.species.blimpoon.name: Blimpoon
cobblemon.species.blimpoon.desc: People use Blimpoon to transport items and packages to regions far from Rikoto. They are essential to worldwide trade, as Rikoto is rather isolated from other regions.
cobblemon.species.cuburn.name: Cuburn
cobblemon.species.cuburn.desc: While having an adorable appearance, Cuburn's temper flares up easily; They may even cause a wildfire when engaging in an especially heated battle.
cobblemon.species.grizzler.name: Grizzler
cobblemon.species.grizzler.desc: Grizzler looks after its fellow Cuburns, but when they are challenged, they would abandon all caution and throw themselves fully into the fight.
cobblemon.species.magrizzly.name: Magrizzly
cobblemon.species.magrizzly.desc: Magrizzly's flames and spirit are known to heat up when fighting other Magrizzly. The same extends to Polarpow, even though they are of different colors.
cobblemon.species.barball.name: Barball
cobblemon.species.barball.desc: Barball sheds their worn-out spikes for new, sharper ones every once a while. The shed spikes are still incredibly venomous and have been used as arrowheads in the past.
cobblemon.species.barbviral.name: Barbviral
cobblemon.species.barbviral.desc: Barbviral can shoot out the spikes on it as if they're missiles. To grow the spikes back, it consumes large amounts of minerals and poisonous plants.
cobblemon.species.fyant.name: Fyant
cobblemon.species.fyant.desc: A bite from a Fyant can cause a burning pain that can last for hours. They are usually found around volcano vents where they build their underground nests.
cobblemon.species.blitzy.name: Blitzy
cobblemon.species.blitzy.desc: Blitzy sparkle in the night sky, often being mistaken for stars. People sometimes have them create light shows for celebrations.
cobblemon.species.blitziglow.name: Blitziglow
cobblemon.species.blitziglow.desc: Blitziglow can cause bright explosions when it's enraged or excited. It is debated whether theirs or Scorlit's fireworks are more beautiful.
cobblemon.species.blitziboom.name: Blitziboom
cobblemon.species.blitziboom.desc: Battles between Blitziboom illuminates the whole night sky. Even if it is raining, a Blitziboom at full power would simply blow away the rainclouds with ease.
cobblemon.species.hottop.name: Hottop
cobblemon.species.hottop.desc: Hottop can disguise themselves as rocks when they feel threatened, though the smoke escaping from their chutes makes the disguise rather ineffective.
cobblemon.species.fizire.name: Fizire
cobblemon.species.fizire.desc: Fizire can create smog clouds from the two chutes on its back. The fields where they have left their particles become fertile land, excellent for agriculture.
cobblemon.species.volcadon.name: Volcadon
cobblemon.species.volcadon.desc: Though capable of immense devastation, Volcadon are said to deposit their excess lava on the coasts, enlarging the landmass of Rikoto.
cobblemon.species.napkid.name: Napkid
cobblemon.species.napkid.desc: Napkid's body is incredibly soft and silky. They favor hiding among blankets and scare people who did not notice their presence.
cobblemon.species.phansheet.name: Phansheet
cobblemon.species.phansheet.desc: Phansheet wraps itself around Pokémon and human alike, sapping their life energy in the meantime. This does little more than putting the targets to sleep, thankfully.
cobblemon.species.psytric.name: Psytric
cobblemon.species.psytric.desc: Psytric is an artificially created Pokémon, but no one has come forward claiming to be its creator yet. Rumors say that it was created by aliens.
cobblemon.species.tortarock.name: Tortarock
cobblemon.species.tortarock.desc: Tortarock's shell cracks if it is exposed to heat for too long; As such, they often dip their body in water to keep their shell healthy.
cobblemon.species.bouldoise.name: Bouldoise
cobblemon.species.bouldoise.desc: Bouldoise's shells are said to be near impenetrable. There have been records of Legenix dropping them from miles above the earth, only to land and walk away unscathed.
cobblemon.species.porfin.name: Porfin
cobblemon.species.porfin.desc: Porfin are a docile species of Pokémon. They have a close relationship with humans; some may even allow children to play amongst them.
cobblemon.species.doflap.name: Doflap
cobblemon.species.doflap.desc: Doflap can swim at an amazing speed and yet with great maneuverability. They would create water rings for themselves to swim through for fun.
cobblemon.species.shrimpet.name: Shrimpet
cobblemon.species.shrimpet.desc: Shrimpet cannot properly defend itself from predators, so it must utilize the environment to protect itself. Living near underwater volcanoes have made them heat-resistant.
cobblemon.species.shrimpoon.name: Shrimpoon
cobblemon.species.shrimpoon.desc: Shrimpoon thrives in water even with temperatures at well beyond the boiling point. They stun their prey with superheated bubbles launched from their pincers.
cobblemon.species.sharko.name: Sharko
cobblemon.species.sharko.desc: Sharko start swimming once they're born from eggs. Even when they have to stay in one place, they would swim in a circle endlessly.
cobblemon.species.markrush.name: Markrush
cobblemon.species.markrush.desc: Markrush are constantly swimming at high speeds through the ocean's depths, even while sleeping. This behavior keeps their gills oxygenated.
cobblemon.species.kinip.name: Kinip
cobblemon.species.kinip.desc: Kinip shifts themselves so that attackers bite on their venomous spikes. Even with all of its spikes ripped out, Kinip can grow them back in a few hours.
cobblemon.species.guppish.name: Guppish
cobblemon.species.guppish.desc: Years of evolution have made Guppish able to evolve into several formes. There are still ancient Guppish out in the sea that have yet to evolve.
cobblemon.species.eqwater.name: Eqwater
cobblemon.species.eqwater.desc: Eqwater's skin is stained green from the algae it uses for protection and nutrients from photosynthesis. It prefers tropical waters in which algae is plentiful.
cobblemon.species.gillyde.name: Gillyde
cobblemon.species.gillyde.desc: Gillyde glide quickly and carefully just above the water. Swarms of them would skip across the sea between seasons to regions with the appropriate climate.
cobblemon.species.seagic.name: Seagic
cobblemon.species.seagic.desc: Seagic create mirages as a form of entertainment for their fellow Pokémon, though from time to time some unfortunate people would fall to the illusion.
cobblemon.species.orcail.name: Orcail
cobblemon.species.orcail.desc: Orcail is well-adapted to cold waters. It has an extra layer of fat to keep warm and to crush ice drifts that their prey may inhabit on.
cobblemon.species.jellitot.name: Jellitot
cobblemon.species.jellitot.desc: Jellitot♂, with their soft and light body, simply go along with the currents of the ocean. They sometimes wash up onto the shores of many beaches around Rikoto.
cobblemon.species.jellitic.name: Jellitic
cobblemon.species.jellitic.desc: Jellitic shields themselves from attackers with ice shields formed instantaneously. However, they discard these every time, not having the strength to move them.
cobblemon.species.jelliking.name: Jelliking
cobblemon.species.jelliking.desc: Jelliking's body draws in water from around it, draining the heat from it to create ice. As an Ice-type, their body temperature is notably high.
cobblemon.species.jellinip.name: Jellinip
cobblemon.species.jellinip.desc: Using their many tentacles, Jellinip entangles their foes, then submerge them in toxic clouds. The cloud of poison decomposes in a few minutes, though.
cobblemon.species.jelliqueen.name: Jelliqueen
cobblemon.species.jelliqueen.desc: Jelliqueen do not allow any intruders to approach their offsprings. If a stray Jellitot or Jellinip drifts near, Jelliqueen would take it under its care.
cobblemon.species.parasea.name: Parasea
cobblemon.species.parasea.desc: Parasea kindly allows other smaller Pokémon to perch on its back when crossing the ocean. Few attack it due to its gentle nature and strong fins.
cobblemon.species.paradiso.name: Paradiso
cobblemon.species.paradiso.desc: There are stories of shipwreck survivors mistaking Paradiso for an island, only to wake up on the shores as the island they were on has disappeared.
cobblemon.species.surfide.name: Surfide
cobblemon.species.surfide.desc: Surfide go long lengths to decorate their surfboards made out of planks. The more intricate one's board is decorated into, the more respect it holds among fellow Surfide.
cobblemon.species.tidude.name: Tidude
cobblemon.species.tidude.desc: Because Tidude are almost always surfing, they have achieved amazing balancing skills. They compete to see who can surf on the largest waves.
cobblemon.species.crablue.name: Crablue
cobblemon.species.crablue.desc: Crablue hone their pincers against rocks near the shores. If one finds a rock with many u-shaped gouges on it, this means that a Crablue colony is nearby.
cobblemon.species.rockster.name: Rockster
cobblemon.species.rockster.desc: Rockster's claws possess multiple layers of rock shells, allowing them to break through even steel slabs with a single punch. Few aquaria are willing to host them.
cobblemon.species.toxidon.name: Toxidon
cobblemon.species.toxidon.desc: When startled, Toxidon roll up into a ball shape, using the spikes on its back to defend itself from attackers. Contrary to popular belief, however, they cannot roll well.
cobblemon.species.snapike.name: Snapike
cobblemon.species.snapike.desc: Snapike are highly intelligent Pokémon who would pick out spikes from its back to make traps. They carefully collect used spikes after battles.
cobblemon.species.holloweed.name: Holloweed
cobblemon.species.holloweed.desc: Holloweed's main diet is pumpkins, with them being able to hide among pumpkin plants and gorge on them without being noticed.
cobblemon.species.hollowkin.name: Hollowkin
cobblemon.species.hollowkin.desc: Even in the murky darkness of the swamp, Hollowkin can hunt thanks to their soul-piercing glowing eyes and their keen sense of detecting vibrations.
cobblemon.species.rottoween.name: Rottoween
cobblemon.species.rottoween.desc: Every october, swarms of Rottoween would appear from the swamps to hunt. This led to a tradition where people put jack-o-lanterns around their house to keep them away.
cobblemon.species.swampheap.name: Swampheap
cobblemon.species.swampheap.desc: In a dark environment such as swamps, Swampheap can fully blend themselves into the area, dragging unaware preys into their jaws.
cobblemon.species.purpole.name: Purpole
cobblemon.species.purpole.desc: Purpole secretes venomous slime on its body regularly. While contact with it will not cause lethal harm, it is still enough to cause severe pain.
cobblemon.species.frogoo.name: Frogoo
cobblemon.species.frogoo.desc: Frogoo do not mind living in murky and polluted water, the toxic flowing through their body counteracting any possible harm the water can cause to them.
cobblemon.species.toxitoad.name: Toxitoad
cobblemon.species.toxitoad.desc: Toxitoad are extremely venomous to the touch. Able to cause severe hallucinations, people used to utilize their toxins in warfares.
cobblemon.species.aqlarva.name: Aqlarva
cobblemon.species.aqlarva.desc: Aqlarva keeps a bubble of water around it when it is out of water. In dry areas, trainers need to provide it with additional water supply.
cobblemon.species.mosliquo.name: Mosliquo
cobblemon.species.mosliquo.desc: Mosliquo sips clean water from swamps and rivers using their long mouthparts. Some Mosliquo also consumes fruits; they ferment inside its abdomen and become fine wine.
cobblemon.species.slibloo.name: Slibloo
cobblemon.species.slibloo.desc: Slibloo are said to be a collective being of fungus gathered together. Even if it is struck apart, it can reform with much ease.
cobblemon.species.fungerm.name: Fungerm
cobblemon.species.fungerm.desc: The excess spores that solidify into colonies on its body are known to be extracted by witch doctors for dubious elixirs. These spores also serve as a defense for Fungerm.
cobblemon.species.kapplash.name: Kapplash
cobblemon.species.kapplash.desc: Once thought to be malicious river demons, Kapplash are in fact benevolent Pokémon who bring along clean water. Many people offer them cucumbers as praises.
cobblemon.species.trollow.name: Trollow
cobblemon.species.trollow.desc: Trollow often sneak into people's residences and move objects around, then hide in a corner to watch homeowners express their confusion about the state of their home.
cobblemon.species.trollurk.name: Trollurk
cobblemon.species.trollurk.desc: Trollurk carries out pranks just like their pre-evolutions, but when they are caught in the act they become enraged and attack everything in the vicinity.
cobblemon.species.trollger.name: Trollger
cobblemon.species.trollger.desc: Known as the ‘Enforcers of Nature’, they have a terrible temper and little patience for those who would dare harm the environment.
cobblemon.species.skeledeep.name: Skeledeep
cobblemon.species.skeledeep.desc: Skeledeep are mainly found in deep water, occasionally surfacing. As such, the few times they have been spotted people have been mistaking them as human skeletons.
cobblemon.species.scrow.name: Scrow
cobblemon.species.scrow.desc: Legends say that Scrow are abandoned scarecrows inhabited by lost souls. They have found their new purpose in protecting crops from bird Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.gaslit.name: Gaslit
cobblemon.species.gaslit.desc: Gaslit are said to be the spirits of those who perished in fires. Their burning body can shine so bright that it can blind foes.
cobblemon.species.dozand.name: Dozand
cobblemon.species.dozand.desc: While Dozand look and act as if they are awake, they are actually in permanent sleep. They can navigate in the real world while only seeing their dreams.
cobblemon.species.skreech.name: Skreech
cobblemon.species.skreech.desc: Skreech's cry is so loud that it can shatter windows. They will often cry until they get what they want.
cobblemon.species.banshreek.name: Banshreek
cobblemon.species.banshreek.desc: Banshreek are seen as heralds of the passing. It is customary for families to shut their windows close at the sight of one.
cobblemon.species.banscream.name: Banscream
cobblemon.species.banscream.desc: Banscream's cry can get so piercingly loud, it can shatter rocks. They say seeing one up close can drive a person insane.
cobblemon.species.finflix.name: Finflix
cobblemon.species.finflix.desc: Finflix are a recently discovered species once thought to have been a hoax. Investigations have shown that they were much more commonly found in the past.
cobblemon.species.finndra.name: Finndra
cobblemon.species.finndra.desc: A sighting report of Finndra in their local waters is enough to attract tourists and Pokémon trainers alike to a city, even if those are but hoaxes.
cobblemon.species.hydrogon.name: Hydrogon
cobblemon.species.hydrogon.desc: A famous legend in Rikoto tells of a fisherman being carried by a dragon to an underwater palace - such dragon is said to have been Hydrogon.
cobblemon.species.merkid.name: Merkid
cobblemon.species.merkid.desc: They were once believed to be myths until their discovery in Rainbow Reef. Moving in schools, they would hypnotize people with their voices and make them leave them be.
cobblemon.species.mermarine.name: Mermarine
cobblemon.species.mermarine.desc: Mermarine's voice can capture the mind of even the most focused sailor. In the past, ships have to plan their route to avoid Mermarine habitats.
cobblemon.species.mersidon.name: Mersidon
cobblemon.species.mersidon.desc: Mersidon's tridents on their tails act as a lightning rod, directing thunderbolts from the sky to either strike down their foes or power their own attacks.
cobblemon.species.corrine.name: Corrine
cobblemon.species.corrine.desc: The coral flower on Corrine's head is a valuable decoration for the riches. While they do shed naturally, growing a new one takes a hundred years upwards.
cobblemon.species.coralush.name: Coralush
cobblemon.species.coralush.desc: Due to their weak fins, Coralush can only hop around on the seabed. As they age, some of them become strong enough to swim semi-consistently.
cobblemon.species.coraltle.name: Coraltle
cobblemon.species.coraltle.desc: In order to float on the water, the Coraltle's shell has sacrificed some of its robustness for the sake of its lightness. This allows them to maneuver with ease among the coral reefs.
cobblemon.species.gravole.name: Gravole
cobblemon.species.gravole.desc: Gravole often disguise themselves as tombstones in graveyards. They rest in the day and roam about at night, bringing confusion among grave keepers in the past.
cobblemon.species.specstone.name: Specstone
cobblemon.species.specstone.desc: Specstone don't have a definite body. If a part of their body is missing, they set out and take stones from graveyards to repair it.
cobblemon.species.snoozee.name: Snoozee
cobblemon.species.snoozee.desc: Snoozee are capable of entering people's dreams. Sometimes, they may accidentally wander into one, only to be forced out as the dreamer wakes.
cobblemon.species.ghoullow.name: Ghoullow
cobblemon.species.ghoullow.desc: Ghoullow can see the dreams of others and manipulate them as they see fit. Those that have wrong them would suffer from nightmares, and vice versa.
cobblemon.species.baawool.name: Baawool
cobblemon.species.baawool.desc: Baawool are famous for their soft wool which is used for all kinds of clothing. Baawool farms still thrive today due to the lack of artificial materials that can replace wool.
cobblemon.species.baabush.name: Baabush
cobblemon.species.baabush.desc: The soft, bushy wool of Baabush regrow instantly under sunlight if sheared. It has a pleasant aroma which is used in perfumes.
cobblemon.species.baablaze.name: Baablaze
cobblemon.species.baablaze.desc: The coat of Baablaze is revered by many who live in cold climates to be the best; not just for retaining heat, but even generating warmth on its own.
cobblemon.species.baabble.name: Baabble
cobblemon.species.baabble.desc: Baabble's wool can soak up the water of a volume much larger than its size, and yet remain dry to the touch. Towels produced from Baabble's wool are a customer favorite.
cobblemon.species.baabreeze.name: Baabreeze
cobblemon.species.baabreeze.desc: Baabreeze's wool feels as light as air. It's often used for blankets and pillows to provide a soft texture as if a piece of cloud to the sleeping.
cobblemon.species.baablock.name: Baablock
cobblemon.species.baablock.desc: Baablock's wool cannot be sheared with mundane tools at all, as they are as hard as a rock; They are valuable in building walls and other strong structures.
cobblemon.species.baablizz.name: Baablizz
cobblemon.species.baablizz.desc: Baablizz's wool can cool down a heated piece of metal without being ignited. It is considered a cheap substitute for air conditioners in arid areas.
cobblemon.species.parafox.name: Parafox
cobblemon.species.parafox.desc: The presence of Parafox is unusually weak, even for a Ghost-type. Sometimes, it may flicker in and out of reality for a split second.
cobblemon.species.pupetal.name: Pupetal
cobblemon.species.pupetal.desc: Pupetal often frolic in flower fields, attracting other younger Pokémon to join in. Anyone who approaches will be engulfed by the cheery mood.
cobblemon.species.pupyro.name: Pupyro
cobblemon.species.pupyro.desc: Pupyro rampage through the fields, picking fights with anything they see. There are tales of the unfortunate left with severe burns after encountering one.
cobblemon.species.puplash.name: Puplash
cobblemon.species.puplash.desc: Puplash weeps at the merest provocation, crying for long enough that a large puddle would form around it. Its tears have been said to be incredibly bitter.
cobblemon.species.felove.name: Felove
cobblemon.species.felove.desc: Felove roam the lands, resolving conflicts and feuds as they go. The largest war in the history of Rikoto ended with a horde of Felove strolling across the battlefield.
cobblemon.species.yayak.name: Yayak
cobblemon.species.yayak.desc: Yayak avoids any humans that approach them, hiding back into their herd. A Yayak separated from their herd becomes agitated at all times.
cobblemon.species.yakkle.name: Yakkle
cobblemon.species.yakkle.desc: Yakkle can walk in the fast currents of the rivers, its hooves rooting in the riverbed and allowing it to anchor. They carry young Yayak on their backs as they cross rivers.
cobblemon.species.leonite.name: Leonite
cobblemon.species.leonite.desc: Leonite are kings of the Safari Zone, lying atop rock outcroppings across the sanctuary. Their manes and claws are as hard as diamonds, enough to slice through rocks.
cobblemon.species.flapinko.name: Flapinko
cobblemon.species.flapinko.desc: Flapinko are glamorous Pokémon who like to show off and put on an act whenever the opportunity arises. Their pink feathers are often used on performers' outfits.
cobblemon.species.rollie.name: Rollie
cobblemon.species.rollie.desc: Rollie love to roll around in the mud and throw mud balls at unsuspecting Pokémon passing by. Their trunks allow them to spray out water like a hose.
cobblemon.species.elestomp.name: Elestomp
cobblemon.species.elestomp.desc: With a stout body, Elestomp are Pokémon with few predators. Their long trunks can hold a large volume of water which can then be used as projectiles.
cobblemon.species.girafire.name: Girafire
cobblemon.species.girafire.desc: Girafire's long neck allows it to reach the leaves of tall trees in the sanctuary. The healthier the Pokémon is, the more fierce its mane burns.
cobblemon.species.giraflame.name: Giraflame
cobblemon.species.giraflame.desc: Giraflame's neck is constantly burning. While they don't display discomfort in this, the flames can turn trees into ash in mere seconds.
cobblemon.species.bullson.name: Bullson
cobblemon.species.bullson.desc: Riding on a Bullson is a famous sport in the Rikoto region. The stronger the Bullson, the more difficult it is to sit on its back.
cobblemon.species.zebrite.name: Zebrite
cobblemon.species.zebrite.desc: Known for their keen psychic senses, Zebrite telepathically communicates with other members of their herd to work as a single entity.
cobblemon.species.hippond.name: Hippond
cobblemon.species.hippond.desc: Hippond wrestle with each other in mud pools, their color providing a natural camouflage from larger predators that hunt them.
cobblemon.species.hippotone.name: Hippotone
cobblemon.species.hippotone.desc: Hippotone possess jaws strong enough to crush rocks without trouble. However, they are terrible at detecting predators, making them easy preys despite their strength.
cobblemon.species.cheetric.name: Cheetric
cobblemon.species.cheetric.desc: Cheetric is one of the fastest Pokémon in the world. They have been recorded to break the sonic barrier when pursuing their prey.
cobblemon.species.cosmet.name: Cosmet
cobblemon.species.cosmet.desc: Cosmet may sometimes land on the ground from a lack of energy. They would wait for thunder to strike down on them, then take off into the sky once more.
cobblemon.species.meterock.name: Meterock
cobblemon.species.meterock.desc: Meterock zoom across the stratosphere, having little care for what they crash into. Rocket launches have to be carefully planned around their flying routes.
cobblemon.species.syrill.name: Syrill
cobblemon.species.syrill.desc: Syrill create air currents deep in caves, giving the illusion of an exit nearby. Lost hikers follow these winds only to end up even more lost in the caverns.
