cobblemon.species.cycrill.name: Cycrill
cobblemon.species.cycrill.desc: Cycrill take residence in caves near the sea. They would create strong winds that push Pokémon and boats alike from the shore.
cobblemon.species.syphoon.name: Syphoon
cobblemon.species.syphoon.desc: Syphoon can whip up hurricanes capable of great destruction when incited. The roaring winds they create can level large cities.
cobblemon.species.hypnopuff.name: Hypnopuff
cobblemon.species.hypnopuff.desc: Hypnopuff is known for the hypnotic gas they emit for self-defense; They are essential in treating insomnia in the ages long past.
cobblemon.species.hypnosmog.name: Hypnosmog
cobblemon.species.hypnosmog.desc: Hypnosmog can freely control the movement of the smog cloud around it. No armor can hope to shield one from their hypnotic smoke.
cobblemon.species.nawale.name: Nawale
cobblemon.species.nawale.desc: Nawale charge horn first into anything that intrudes their territory. Many a Nawale has broken their horns from ramming into larger ships.
cobblemon.species.whaley.name: Whaley
cobblemon.species.whaley.desc: Whaley's blubbery skin protects it from the cold, deep ocean. Without a lung large enough to hold their breath for long, however, they can only dive underseas for under an hour.
cobblemon.species.humbreech.name: Humbreech
cobblemon.species.humbreech.desc: The barnacles on Humbreech's body act as a layer of natural armor that protect them from damage. They shed old barnacles for new ones every year.
cobblemon.species.squidart.name: Squidart
cobblemon.species.squidart.desc: Squidart propel themselves by shooting ink from behind at high pressure, as well as blinding their predators at the same time. Their ink does not disappear until after a day.
cobblemon.species.lisquid.name: Lisquid
cobblemon.species.lisquid.desc: Considered to be one of the ocean’s most dangerous predators, Lisquid are both intelligent and ruthless, using their ink and limbs to attack prey.
cobblemon.species.hamawl.name: Hamawl
cobblemon.species.hamawl.desc: Hamawl smash rocks on the seabed open to find prey living within. Their eyelids are coated in steel to protect them from impact when it is hammering rocks.
cobblemon.species.silvicious.name: Silvicious
cobblemon.species.silvicious.desc: Silvicious often spend time by their lonesome when swimming. When one encounters another Silvicious, they compete in fights of brute strength.
cobblemon.species.groilla.name: Groilla
cobblemon.species.groilla.desc: Groilla are very shy Pokémon. They'd rather throw hard fruit at their enemies from the trees than confront them directly.
cobblemon.species.groillum.name: Groillum
cobblemon.species.groillum.desc: Groillum wrestle with each other as a past time. They can do stunt attacks like body slamming from the treetops, or hanging the others upside down under a branch.
cobblemon.species.kongrilla.name: Kongrilla
cobblemon.species.kongrilla.desc: Kongrilla are incredibly territorial Pokémon. They often fight against clans of other Kongrilla just to ensure their territories weren't intruded on.
cobblemon.species.woodbeak.name: Woodbeak
cobblemon.species.woodbeak.desc: Woodbeak peck trees to feast on bugs lurking within. The sounds this produces are also a way of long-range communication for them.
cobblemon.species.woodawn.name: Woodawn
cobblemon.species.woodawn.desc: Woodawn’s flower gives off a lovely scent. The flower’s color and type differ from region to region, with Rikoto claiming the most beautiful.
cobblemon.species.wingon.name: Wingon
cobblemon.species.wingon.desc: Wingon used to be covered in fur one million years ago. As they evolve, they shed their fur to lower their air resistance when they are flying.
cobblemon.species.aerogon.name: Aerogon
cobblemon.species.aerogon.desc: Aerogon's wingspan is one of the widest in Rikoto. They can spread and retract their wings at will to control their flight speed.
cobblemon.species.tikitik.name: Tikitik
cobblemon.species.tikitik.desc: A traditional ritual among Tikitik is to set up a bonfire, then dance around it as a group. It is yet unknown what purpose the ritual serves.
cobblemon.species.tikitoko.name: Tikitoko
cobblemon.species.tikitoko.desc: Tikitoko construct their own masks from the trees of the jungle. Excavated masks built by ancient Tikitoko are noted to hold DNAs from Pokémon of the past.
cobblemon.species.cryodro.name: Cryodro
cobblemon.species.cryodro.desc: Cryodro is adorned with scales of clear crystals on its back. When sunlight shines down, the scales refract the light into many different colors.
cobblemon.species.cryodrago.name: Cryodrago
cobblemon.species.cryodrago.desc: The areas in which the Cryodra resides are covered with beautiful crystals. It is said that there is a hidden crystal valley where many Cryodras gather.
cobblemon.species.brachio.name: Brachio
cobblemon.species.brachio.desc: Brachio are delicate Pokémon that can only survive in the appropriate climate. Organizations have been set up to protect Brachio from extinction.
cobblemon.species.brachiodon.name: Brachiodon
cobblemon.species.brachiodon.desc: Brachiodon were near extinction until they adapted by growing a pelt of leaves, which camouflages them and protects them from predators.
cobblemon.species.bugray.name: Bugray
cobblemon.species.bugray.desc: Bugray swarm humans who wander into the jungles, leaving bites that would remain itchy even after days. Repels specifically made to counter them are commodities in the tropics.
cobblemon.species.dracofly.name: Dracofly
cobblemon.species.dracofly.desc: Dracofly are coveted by bug fanatics as extremely difficult to find, let alone catch. Any trainer who catches one is considered a master of bugs by their peers.
cobblemon.species.tapire.name: Tapire
cobblemon.species.tapire.desc: The spots on Tapire's back are where they store their energy. When engaged in a fierce battle, smoke would come out from the spots.
cobblemon.species.tapiblaze.name: Tapiblaze
cobblemon.species.tapiblaze.desc: Tapiblaze produces a unique smoke that would put all that approaches into slumber. Every now and then, one may find a sleeping Tapiblaze, hypnotized by their own smoke.
cobblemon.species.sluggah.name: Sluggah
cobblemon.species.sluggah.desc: Moss grows on the surface of Sluggah's gooey skin, protecting them from heavy rainfall. They spit out slime puddles to rid excess water in their body.
cobblemon.species.mossnail.name: Mossnail
cobblemon.species.mossnail.desc: Mossnail take pebbles from the ground and combine them together with moss, forming its shell. The shell can grow or shrink depending on their needs.
cobblemon.species.lazloth.name: Lazloth
cobblemon.species.lazloth.desc: Lazloth barely moves from their spot throughout the day. Their long arms allow them to catch fruits and small prey that are unaware of their presence.
cobblemon.species.mystablet.name: Mystablet
cobblemon.species.mystablet.desc: Mystablet was used in ancient times to foretell the future. The color on Mystablet is a sign of upcoming events, ranging from miracles to disasters.
cobblemon.species.bunnic.name: Bunnic
cobblemon.species.bunnic.desc: Bunnic is one of the most popular Pokémon for young trainers due to its adorable appearance, especially its fluffy fur which it grew to adapt to the extreme climates of the tundra.
cobblemon.species.arctichare.name: Arctichare
cobblemon.species.arctichare.desc: The fur on Arctichare insulates heat, protecting Arctichare from the unbearably harsh climate. They use their strong ears to throw snowballs at passers-by for fun.
cobblemon.species.moofork.name: Moofork
cobblemon.species.moofork.desc: Moofork's groups live in seclusion. As they keep to themselves on snowy mountains, only hikers would see them in more than a glimpse.
cobblemon.species.avaldeer.name: Avaldeer
cobblemon.species.avaldeer.desc: Avaldeer guides hikers through snowstorms using its bright red nose. For this, it is highly revered in mountain towns.
cobblemon.species.molice.name: Molice
cobblemon.species.molice.desc: Molice carve through ice sheets for fun, though sometimes they can accidentally dig through houses in snow-covered villages.
cobblemon.species.huskpup.name: Huskpup
cobblemon.species.huskpup.desc: Huskpup lick each other to clean their fur, and because of this, they are used to having snow in their mouth. Snow cones are a favorite snack for them.
cobblemon.species.huskold.name: Huskold
cobblemon.species.huskold.desc: A layer of ice forms on the bite marks left by Huskold, leading to the term frostbite. The ancient people of Rikoto called it the Arctic Beast.
cobblemon.species.crysilla.name: Crysilla
cobblemon.species.crysilla.desc: Crysilla only live in areas where temperature low enough for humans to get frostbite. The ice shards on their body melt into puddles every summer.
cobblemon.species.cryscoon.name: Cryscoon
cobblemon.species.cryscoon.desc: Cryscoon's body was once believed to be composed entirely of ice crystals. Any light that is directed at the Pokémon would be reflected cleanly.
cobblemon.species.crystiwing.name: Crystiwing
cobblemon.species.crystiwing.desc: Crystiwing's wings, though fragile, are extraordinarily sharp, to the point where it can cleave a glacier into half. Such is why no bird Pokémon dare to prey on it.
cobblemon.species.snowlow.name: Snowlow
cobblemon.species.snowlow.desc: Snowlow roll around in the snow to make themselves larger, but sometimes a few of them would roll up too much snow that they couldn't support their own weight.
cobblemon.species.snowrong.name: Snowrong
cobblemon.species.snowrong.desc: Snowrong are possessed snowmen that form during winter. When summer comes, their bodies melt, and the soul within searches for another body.
cobblemon.species.aurorai.name: Aurorai
cobblemon.species.aurorai.desc: Aurorai gathers under auroras, absorbing the light that shines down on them from the natural phenomenon. They leave behind colorful trails when dashing.
cobblemon.species.colcub.name: Colcub
cobblemon.species.colcub.desc: Colcub are taught to swim at a very young age. They feed mainly on fishes, though occasionally they would opt for Yache Berries.
cobblemon.species.subearo.name: Subearo
cobblemon.species.subearo.desc: Subearo's claws are permanently coated in cold air, leaving frost marks on whatever they slash at. Some trainers employ them to create intricate ice sculptures.
cobblemon.species.polarpow.name: Polarpow
cobblemon.species.polarpow.desc: Despite living in completely different climates, Polarpow exhibit extreme aggression when fighting Magrizzly. This phenomenon is still being studied.
cobblemon.species.rinolar.name: Rinolar
cobblemon.species.rinolar.desc: Rinolar were alive and abundant in the ages long past, but since then they have only ever been found frozen in giant glaciers or inside ice caves.
cobblemon.species.rinotic.name: Rinotic
cobblemon.species.rinotic.desc: One of the mightiest Pokémon in the frozen tundra, Rinotic are said to have persevered since the ice age. Its hide is so thick, not even drills can penetrate it.
cobblemon.species.noseal.name: Noseal
cobblemon.species.noseal.desc: Noseal's rubbery nose is used by them as a sense organ; They would rub their nose against everything they come into contact with to get a feel on what they are.
cobblemon.species.isealcle.name: Isealcle
cobblemon.species.isealcle.desc: Isealcle dig their tusks into frozen lakes to open holes, from which it can jump into the water below and hunt for food even on the coldest days.
cobblemon.species.sealberg.name: Sealberg
cobblemon.species.sealberg.desc: Sealberg's tusks were popular accessories on the market. Due to the difficulty of extracting them safely, which led to several incidents, trade in Sealberg tusks is now prohibited. tusk trades are now banned.
cobblemon.species.apein.name: Apein
cobblemon.species.apein.desc: As human development encroaches on the rainforests, sightings of Apein have become rarer and rarer. They have taken to hiding among treetops nowadays.
cobblemon.species.sascrush.name: Sascrush
cobblemon.species.sascrush.desc: Due to their keen senses, Sascrush were elusive to cameras until recently. Their large footprints in the mountains used to inspire folk-tales of giants.
cobblemon.species.battic.name: Battic
cobblemon.species.battic.desc: Battic are most active during blizzards when most of the prey they hunt is lost in snowstorms. They use ultrasounds so that they are not bothered by snow that obscures their vision.
cobblemon.species.blizzibat.name: Blizzibat
cobblemon.species.blizzibat.desc: Blizzibat can create powerful blizzards by flapping their wings quickly. Even up close, their bites can cause their foes to be struck down with fever.
cobblemon.species.carbonix.name: Carbonix
cobblemon.species.carbonix.desc: Carbonix can produce two types of liquid that can either rapidly freeze or scorch anything in contact with it. They are used in cooking before electricity became common.
cobblemon.species.carbonitro.name: Carbonitro
cobblemon.species.carbonitro.desc: Carbonitro have complete control over their body temperature, allowing them to become freezing cold or scorching hot at will.
cobblemon.species.iggle.name: Iggle
cobblemon.species.iggle.desc: Iggle's shell is composed of highly compressed snow. Having been packed together so tightly, not even fire is enough to break it.
cobblemon.species.iglow.name: Iglow
cobblemon.species.iglow.desc: Iglow move as slow as the glacier, even with the legs they developed from their pre-evolution. They would stand in one place and pull in food with freezing wind.
cobblemon.species.gigloo.name: Gigloo
cobblemon.species.gigloo.desc: Gigloo can shoot powerful blasts of ice balls from the igloo on its back. Being completely covered in thick ice, their body can uncaringly break through rough terrains.
cobblemon.species.puffle.name: Puffle
cobblemon.species.puffle.desc: Having fragile beaks, Puffle opts to freeze the fruits they feed on before eating them so they do not break their beak.
cobblemon.species.puffpeak.name: Puffpeak
cobblemon.species.puffpeak.desc: Puffpeak use their glowing beak for communication between flocks. There are theories that their beaks are colored after auroras.
cobblemon.species.pinglett.name: Pinglett
cobblemon.species.pinglett.desc: Pinglett is unable to balance themselves well when walking, preferring to stay beside their parents for safety and comfort.
cobblemon.species.pinglade.name: Pinglade
cobblemon.species.pinglade.desc: Pinglade's wings are powerful enough to slice through blocks of ice. Female ones go out searching for food while the male ones look after babies Pinglett.
cobblemon.species.tweetot.name: Tweetot
cobblemon.species.tweetot.desc: Tweetot's high-pitched songs are considered relaxing and calming. Heralding the rise of the sun with their melody, those who hear it's singing would be filled with joy for the day.
cobblemon.species.melotweet.name: Melotweet
cobblemon.species.melotweet.desc: Melotweet can compose songs so beautiful, anyone who listens to them for too long would become entranced and lose their sense of time passing.
cobblemon.species.eelect.name: Eelect
cobblemon.species.eelect.desc: Eelect are patient hunters, waiting in the crevices of their lair and scouting for the best target. They use their tails to zap and subdue their prey.
cobblemon.species.chamelec.name: Chamelec
cobblemon.species.chamelec.desc: Chamelec hides through displaying patterns similar to the environment on their body. When it attacks, the pattern on its body changes.
cobblemon.species.chamelectro.name: Chamelectro
cobblemon.species.chamelectro.desc: Chamelectro's tongue can stun even a human adult; However, the static on their tongue makes it always visible, making it easy to spot an attacking Chamelectro.
cobblemon.species.palmo.name: Palmo
cobblemon.species.palmo.desc: Palmo is encased in a hard shell, making its leaves the only approachable target on its body. Much weaker Pokémon take shelter under it for safety.
cobblemon.species.cocorocko.name: Cocorocko
cobblemon.species.cocorocko.desc: The coconuts grown from Cocorocko are as hard as rocks, making them effective as thrown weapons. Recently, people have taken them up for bowling as well.
cobblemon.species.sealug.name: Sealug
cobblemon.species.sealug.desc: Sticky slime covers Sealug's whole body. It sheds the coat of slime on it every once a while to remove the dirt on itself.
cobblemon.species.nembroslug.name: Nembroslug
cobblemon.species.nembroslug.desc: The green spots on Nembroslug's body marks where it stores gooey slime. They can entangle foes simply by bumping into them.
cobblemon.species.droot.name: Droot
cobblemon.species.droot.desc: Droot emits a fruity fragrance, luring other small animals to their grasp. However, the same fragrance also invites their own predators to attack.
cobblemon.species.dragoon.name: Dragoon
cobblemon.species.dragoon.desc: Dragoon's skin is resilient to the point where it can even resist a boulder dropping onto it. For the lucky farmers who can find one, they can be effective in repelling birds.
cobblemon.species.frugon.name: Frugon
cobblemon.species.frugon.desc: Said to be guardians of farmlands and orchards, Frugon's very presence causes fruit-bearing plants to grow at an astonishing rate.
cobblemon.species.serpyro.name: Serpyro
cobblemon.species.serpyro.desc: Serpyro prefer living in the hottest parts of the volcanoes, especially where its dark and an abundance of active vents. As such, sightings of Serpyro are incredibly rare.
cobblemon.species.slitheat.name: Slitheat
cobblemon.species.slitheat.desc: Slitheat can create powerful fire tornadoes by whipping their tail around. They protect their territory by creating walls of fire on the boundary.
cobblemon.species.pinkmee.name: Pinkmee
cobblemon.species.pinkmee.desc: Pinkmee are extremely popular in Pokémon pageants, it is said they keep their lustrous pink shine by eating nothing but a certain species of plankton.
cobblemon.species.valure.name: Valure
cobblemon.species.valure.desc: Statues and fountain features of this Pokémon are commonly seen around Rikoto as both an admiration of their beauty and their strength.
cobblemon.species.beautifin.name: Beautifin
cobblemon.species.beautifin.desc: Beautifin's scales are used to produce expensive pieces of jewelry and accessories. Even with the ban on poaching them, the species can barely be found in the open sea nowadays.
cobblemon.species.strikon.name: Strikon
cobblemon.species.strikon.desc: When thunderclouds gather densely on the tops of mountains, it is believed that many Strikon eggs are nested. People chase these storms in the hopes of obtaining one.
cobblemon.species.strikloud.name: Strikloud
cobblemon.species.strikloud.desc: Strikloud and Nimblow often come into odds with each other. Whenever two of the species battle in the sky, a terrible thunderstorm is created.
cobblemon.species.strikyon.name: Strikyon
cobblemon.species.strikyon.desc: Strikyon mindlessly strike down anything that approaches it with lightning bolts. Aviation Departments have hired trainers for repelling Strikyon from common airline routes.
cobblemon.species.fayely.name: Fayely
cobblemon.species.fayely.desc: Fayely will only bond with kind-hearted people. They can become physically ill should their trainer commit evil deeds, but will still never leave their side.
cobblemon.species.fayegon.name: Fayegon
cobblemon.species.fayegon.desc: Fayegon emanates an aura of goodwill and kindness. Being near one can cause even the most cold-hearted person to show empathy.
cobblemon.species.fayedra.name: Fayedra
cobblemon.species.fayedra.desc: Highly revered in Rikoto for their selflessness and kind-hearted nature, Fayedra will not hesitate to sacrifice itself to save a life, even that of a stranger.
cobblemon.species.terradon.name: Terradon
cobblemon.species.terradon.desc: Embodying the element of Earth, Terradon is said to regulate the continents' movement, such that no catastrophic earthquakes happen.
cobblemon.species.tigacore.name: Tigacore
cobblemon.species.tigacore.desc: Embodying the element of Fire, Tigacore is said to keep the lava in the mantle of the planet flowing, such that it will not freeze over.
cobblemon.species.searine.name: Searine
cobblemon.species.searine.desc: Embodying the element of Water, Searine is said to control the flow of water in lakes, rivers and the seas, such that marine life can flourish.
cobblemon.species.tornadowl.name: Tornadowl
cobblemon.species.tornadowl.desc: Embodying the element of Air, Tornadowl is said to direct air currents through the lands, such that fresh air is available to all living things.
cobblemon.species.aethera.name: Aethera
cobblemon.species.aethera.desc: Embodying the element of Aether, Aethera is said to hold the spark that can create life and can allow species to communicate with each other.
cobblemon.species.solaran.name: Solaran
cobblemon.species.solaran.desc: Said to being born to counteract the shadow of a solar eclipse, legends speak of Solaran overseeing the order between humans and Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.lunaro.name: Lunaro
cobblemon.species.lunaro.desc: Said to being born to counteract the light of lunar eclipse, legends speak of Lunaro encouraging individuality between humans and Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.cellance.name: Cellance
cobblemon.species.cellance.desc: Cellance was born out of the clash between Solaran and Lunaro, who controls the power of the duo to bring balance to society. It is part of the folklore of the region.
cobblemon.species.healthia.name: Healthia
cobblemon.species.healthia.desc: Its presence soothes flora and fauna. Healthia emits a fragrance that heals people of their illness, no matter how severe.
cobblemon.species.pollusion.name: Pollusion
cobblemon.species.pollusion.desc: A resentful spirit whose presence causes life to wither, Pollusion returns the harm done to the world and itself to polluters with tenfold severity.
cobblemon.species.gemmany.name: Gemmany
cobblemon.species.gemmany.desc: Gemmany collects any gems it sees. However, tales have it that it would still generously give out jewels to those who asked.
cobblemon.species.elefern.name: Elefern
cobblemon.species.elefern.desc: Elefern is a very compassionate species of Pokemon that frequently tends to lost or scared Pokemon. It will trumpet its trunk and call the rest of its heard if its enraged.
cobblemon.species.foliphant.name: Foliphant
cobblemon.species.foliphant.desc: Since they must pay great attention to their matriarchal Forestusk, they rarely leave the heard. Foliphant is known for being extremely gentle, and it will use the leaves from its tail to feed injured Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.forestusk.name: Forestusk
cobblemon.species.forestusk.desc: Forestusk are incredibly powerful, yet they prefer to utilise their power to aid others. Smaller forest Pokemon live in their grassy hide, forming a symbiotic relationship.
cobblemon.species.kinfowl.name: Kinfowl
cobblemon.species.kinfowl.desc: Mountain summits are typically home to Kinfowl. It may spew embers that are above 2000 degrees if startled. For its characteristics, its feathers are used in apparel due to them exuding their own warmth.
cobblemon.species.pyravis.name: Pyravis
cobblemon.species.pyravis.desc: Pyravis are oblivious, egotistical Pokemon. When confronted with a powerful opponent, they will pay heed; otherwise, they will disregard every instruction.
cobblemon.species.pavonix.name: Pavonix
cobblemon.species.pavonix.desc: Pavonix are exceedingly vain and are frequently kept by wealthy households. They are known to spend hours cleaning each feather, but will only stop when confronted with a formidable opponent. According to legend, this Pokemon was created from the ashes of the legendary Ho-oh.
cobblemon.species.cubble.name: Cubble
cobblemon.species.cubble.desc: It has a strong territorial instinct and will face up to larger and stronger opponents without hesitation. Cubble will be incredibly loving to its trainer and like playing if it is adopted as a kitten.
cobblemon.species.sabroar.name: Sabroar
cobblemon.species.sabroar.desc: Sabroar will go to any length to defend its trainer, even if it means fighting dirty. Its enormous paws may severely injure an opponent, making it a strong Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.striger.name: Striger
cobblemon.species.striger.desc: Striger has a wild side. It finishes opponents by biting them with their enormous fangs after launching violent slashes. Its untamed nature can only be tamed by the most powerful of trainers.
cobblemon.species.chipmunch.name: Chipmunch
cobblemon.species.chipmunch.desc: Found in and around Otopo's metropolitan regions. Chipmunch will scavenge food whenever it can, which frequently ends in it falling asleep and waking up in an unfamiliar place.
cobblemon.species.munchilla.name: Munchilla
cobblemon.species.munchilla.desc: When its stomach is full, it finds it difficult to fight. If it is unable to find food, it will go on a rampage until it has eaten. Its snores or the rumblings of its hungry gut may be mistaken for its cries.
cobblemon.species.hunbear.name: Hunbear
cobblemon.species.hunbear.desc: It's always hungry, therefore it'll strive to collect as much honey as it can. It is frequently seen napping in a Furrbee husk with its sticky paws.
cobblemon.species.grizlusk.name: Grizlusk
cobblemon.species.grizlusk.desc: Grizlusk are highly friendly creatures who frequently look after bug Pokémon. Its arms' husks have hardened and can deliver powerful strikes.
cobblemon.species.gnawzzle.name: Gnawzzle
cobblemon.species.maniscourge.name: Maniscourge
cobblemon.species.whirliseed.name: Whirliseed
cobblemon.species.whirliseed.desc: Whirliseed float down from the highest trees and drift around the countryside till they settle. They bury themselves once they've landed in order to evolve.
cobblemon.species.burlygig.name: Burlygig
cobblemon.species.burlygig.desc: When it evolves, it keeps its enormous leaves, which help it defend itself against flying Pokémon. It can move about, however it attempts to move as little as possible owing to the energy necessary to evolve.
cobblemon.species.sycanopy.name: Sycanopy
cobblemon.species.sycanopy.desc: Sycanopy live for a very long period and see the numerous changes in Otopo. Many Bug and Normal-type Pokémon may be found in its canopy.
cobblemon.species.rosepillar.name: Rosepillar
cobblemon.species.rosepillar.desc: Rosepillars are found in the undergrowth of forests and utilise their red feelers to detect danger. When opponents are detected, they retract, making Rosepillar a smaller prey for predators.
cobblemon.species.pupenta.name: Pupenta
cobblemon.species.pupenta.desc: It positions itself as near to the sun as possible in order to acquire adequate energy for development. Constantly staring at the sun has left it blind, but it has enhanced its other senses.
cobblemon.species.cerisefly.name: Cerisefly
cobblemon.species.cerisefly.desc: Its wings light up in a pattern that confuses adversaries. When it is startled, its antennae quiver, causing a mental pulse that confuses enemies.
cobblemon.species.snuggrub.name: Snuggrub
cobblemon.species.snuggrub.desc: Snuggrub live at the base of mountains and volcanoes. They headbutt assaulting opponents with their pointy horn.
cobblemon.species.furncoon.name: Furncoon
cobblemon.species.furncoon.desc: Hikers use Furncoon to keep warm in frigid climes. It attaches itself to branches with spikes, ready for evolution.
cobblemon.species.eruptle.name: Eruptle
cobblemon.species.eruptle.desc: Eruptle lifts its front arms over its head to create a menacing appearance due to its tiny stature. The secreted oil collected in its claws ignites the flame from its proboscis.
cobblemon.species.miniral.name: Miniral
cobblemon.species.miniral.desc: Miniral are rock type Pokemon that may be found in fields and mountains. They are thought to be ordinary pebbles until they start walking! People frequently mistake them for pebbles whilst they rest and step or trip over them.
cobblemon.species.boliath.name: Boliath
cobblemon.species.boliath.desc: It scales mountain ridges in search of smaller boulders to consume. It will add it to its body if it is a very rough-looking stone.
cobblemon.species.watter.name: Watter
cobblemon.species.watter.desc: Watter are extremely agile and can deflect even the most precise blows. It has the ability to reach the ocean's lowest depths.
cobblemon.species.marinott.name: Marinott
cobblemon.species.marinott.desc: Marinott travels with Otopian Sailors. They are skilled fisherfolk that can easily catch hundreds of fish every day. It's not uncommon to see it around fishing ports. It has a reputation for rescuing humans and hauling prey.
cobblemon.species.pilomoss.name: Pilomoss
cobblemon.species.pilomoss.desc: Pilomoss may be found in the woodland areas of Otopo. It basks in the sun as much as possible, turning its coat green in the process. They are thought to be linked to Slakoth, however Pilomoss are considerably more active.
cobblemon.species.arbomoss.name: Arbomoss
cobblemon.species.arbomoss.desc: Arbomoss travels at a glacial pace, causing moss to grow on its back. This moss has medicinal and poisonous properties, making it a helpful Pokemon for herbalists.
cobblemon.species.buzzling.name: Buzzling
cobblemon.species.buzzling.desc: Often found in forests, Buzzling is often found on the top of leaves, nibbling through them. Whilst its cute, it can secrete a sticky fluid which slows its opponent down.
cobblemon.species.furrbee.name: Furrbee
cobblemon.species.furrbee.desc: According to several Pokefans, Furrbee make the greatest pollen of all Pokémon. Pollen from Furrbee is utilised in both human and Pokémon dishes.
cobblemon.species.clonector.name: Clonector
cobblemon.species.clonector.desc: Clonector resembles a variety of bee and wasp Pokemon, however it is unable to sting its opponent. Its colours deter predators, allowing it to forage for food freely.
cobblemon.species.antillery.name: Antillery
cobblemon.species.antillery.desc: To find nourishment, Antillery must break through rocks. It can suck up shattered chunks of rock and fire them at great speeds from its snout if it feels threatened.
cobblemon.species.reavair.name: Reavair
cobblemon.species.reavair.desc: It flutters around, emitting ultrasonic waves in quest of its prey - bug type Pokemon. These ultrasonic waves are great at highlighting the glint of metal.
cobblemon.species.maraudair.name: Maraudair
cobblemon.species.maraudair.desc: Historically, pirates owned Maraudair. They have an uncanny ability to detect even the tiniest gleam of riches from hundreds of kilometres away. Their treasures are strewn around their dens.
cobblemon.species.beoleaf.name: Beoleaf
cobblemon.species.beoleaf.desc: The sound of its bark may be heard for kilometres. Despite its playful character, Beoleaf can be quite temperamental, and even the tiniest of things can set them off.
cobblemon.species.werevine.name: Werevine
cobblemon.species.werevine.desc: It sharpens its claws on Sycanopy's bark. Their claws are so keen that they've been known to effortlessly slice through metal.
cobblemon.species.nocthorne.name: Nocthorne
cobblemon.species.nocthorne.desc: Nocthorne are secretive Pokemon that can only be discovered in the furthest reaches of the wilderness. Nocthorne, the leaders of Beoleaf packs, are expelled after assaulting one of their own. The spiky thorns function as a deterrent to pursuing Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.woodwoo.name: Woodwoo
cobblemon.species.woodwoo.desc: Woodwoo are forest defenders who live beneath lush canopies. They fly down to the forest floor in search of little insect Pokemon to consume.
cobblemon.species.forowl.name: Forowl
cobblemon.species.forowl.desc: Forowl is an expert at catching prey in the dark. This Pokémon's success is due to its exceptional vision, which helps it to see in low light, and its delicate, supple wings, which fly silently.
cobblemon.species.gullstal.name: Gullstal
cobblemon.species.gullstal.desc: Gullstal is a popular choice among sailors and fisherman. Its diminutive size allows it to get into places that other Pokémon can't. It frequently quarrels with Wingull.
cobblemon.species.coasteron.name: Coasteron
cobblemon.species.coasteron.desc: Seafarers utilise Coasteron as a signalling device. They may create a piercing toot to alert their trainer to danger.
cobblemon.species.zappinch.name: Zappinch
cobblemon.species.zappinch.desc: Zappinch was originally assumed to be a Normal-type Pokémon until it was found that its claws can absorb electricity. Zappinch nest in pylons and can be found in cosmopolitan places.
cobblemon.species.parrocity.name: Parrocity
cobblemon.species.parrocity.desc: Every time it flaps its wings, electricity is created. The receptacle becomes electrically charged if it is caught in the gust of its wings.
cobblemon.species.arveeny.name: Arveeny
cobblemon.species.arveeny.desc: Lemmini are extremely small, making them difficult to capture. It has been said that Lemmini accidently fall of cliffs.
cobblemon.species.lemighty.name: Lemighty
cobblemon.species.lemighty.desc: Lemighty, despite its little stature, possesses incredible physical strength. A Lemighty will guard a herd of Arveeny to the death.
cobblemon.species.migravion.name: Migravion
cobblemon.species.migravion.desc: Legends say Migravion never truly stops flying. If one is seen circling an area, it is believed to be guiding lost Pokémon toward safety. Its feathers take on hues that match the landscapes of its nesting grounds.
cobblemon.species.quink.name: Quink
cobblemon.species.tadacid.name: Tadacid
cobblemon.species.tadacid.desc: Tadacid, despite its adorable appearance, is exceedingly deadly, and merely brushing across its oily skin can make you sick. When training, trainers must wear protective gloves.
cobblemon.species.rancroak.name: Rancroak
cobblemon.species.rancroak.desc: Due to the acidic qualities of its saliva, it feels a continual burning sensation on its tongue. A single lick from a Pokemon may render you paralysed for life.
cobblemon.species.gamutrid.name: Gamutrid
cobblemon.species.gamutrid.desc: Gamutrid is exceedingly deadly, and the poison pouring from its pores causes the plants surrounding it to wilt and die. Strange concoctions flood the pouches on its cheeks, causing various diseases.
cobblemon.species.duhmbey.name: Duhmbey
cobblemon.species.duhmbey.desc: Despite its weakness and helplessness, this Pokemon contributes to keeping Otopo's waterways clean and fresh. It spends several years attempting to reach the depths of the body of water in which it dwells.
cobblemon.species.vishuslayk.name: Vishuslayk
cobblemon.species.vishuslayk.desc: Vishuslayk, one of the most ferocious Pokemon, has a territorial feud with Gyarados. By whirling swiftly in water, Vishuslayk may electrically charge their body. It will fire sparks from its tentacles if it feels threatened.
cobblemon.species.timicharge.name: Timicharge
cobblemon.species.timicharge.desc: A shy Pokemon who spends much of its time with its mother. It is known to charge full force when threatened!
cobblemon.species.ramparent.name: Ramparent
cobblemon.species.ramparent.desc: A Ramparent is powerful enough to tow heavy automobiles. When threatened, its horn has hardened to a rock-hard condition, and it will charge with full might.
cobblemon.species.tatei.name: Tatei
cobblemon.species.tatei.desc: Tatei are well-liked by criminal gangs. They exploit their adorable looks to fool their foes.
cobblemon.species.kyopir.name: Kyopir
cobblemon.species.kyopir.desc: Crime syndicates utilise Kyopir to construct blockades and hinder police involvement. It is quite obstinate and will only fight if they are given something in return.
cobblemon.species.piroyata.name: Piroyata
cobblemon.species.piroyata.desc: Unless you can defeat it in battle, it's best to avoid eye contact with this Pokémon. Despite its huge and massive bulk, Piroyata has a swift fighting skill.
cobblemon.species.fluffalo.name: Fluffalo
cobblemon.species.buffofluff.name: Buffofluff
cobblemon.species.platypud.name: Platypud
cobblemon.species.platypud.desc: The toxin it secretes from its paws can be utilised medicinally if diluted. When you touch this Pokemon, you will feel a tingling feeling.
cobblemon.species.platypulse.name: Platypulse
cobblemon.species.platypulse.desc: It submerges its tail in water and emits electrical pulses that confuse its target, allowing it to utilise its barbed bill to inject poison.
cobblemon.species.surisand.name: Surisand
cobblemon.species.surisand.desc: Surisand operate in big groups to defend themselves. A Surisand you encounter will most likely serve as the group's sentry, warning other Surisand to flee.
cobblemon.species.surislash.name: Surislash
cobblemon.species.surislash.desc: Surislash will fight to the death to protect its area. Its swift movements and razor-sharp claws can cause serious damage in a short period of time.
cobblemon.species.tabuki.name: Tabuki
cobblemon.species.tabuki.desc: Tabuki are nefarious creatures who lurk in the shadows of the city. Their long tails can be used to attack other city-dwelling Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.peaby.name: Peaby
cobblemon.species.peaby.desc: Peabys do not emerge from their sheath until they are ready. The sun's rays drive this Pokémon to expand to enormous proportions, and the larger they grow, the closer they get to evolving.
cobblemon.species.papea.name: Papea
cobblemon.species.papea.desc: Papea takes great pleasure in their Peaby. While this Pokémon appears to be sleeping, it is really absorbing sunlight. When the Peaby is ready to develop on its own arable soil, it releases the pods from its arms, which regenerate.
cobblemon.species.maizeby.name: Maizeby
cobblemon.species.maizeby.desc: Full of energy and curiosity, Maizeby are known for their playful nature. They are often found in fields, using their tiny leaves to playfully sway in the wind as they learn to grow stronger with every passing day. It's unknown which face is its true face.
cobblemon.species.halseaon.name: Halseaon
cobblemon.species.halseaon.desc: In Otopo's Pokemon Centers, Halseaon may be found working. It is noted for being exceedingly caring, putting others before itself.
cobblemon.species.ventilio.name: Ventilio
cobblemon.species.ventilio.desc: It is exceedingly quick, and only the most skilled anglers can see it. Because of its blade-like fins, it can readily avoid most traps.
cobblemon.species.katanicut.name: Katanicut
cobblemon.species.katanicut.desc: Its fins are so powerful that they can sever metal. Katanicut flies past opponents with its fins outstretched, delivering a deadly blow.
cobblemon.species.fibraark.name: Fibraark
cobblemon.species.fibraark.desc: Once a year, it sheds its tail fur. The exquisite silk scarf is greatly desired by fashionistas.
cobblemon.species.snarligatr.name: Snarligatr
cobblemon.species.snarligatr.desc: Its leathery skin helps it blend in with murky surroundings. Only the sparkle of its eyes may be seen at night.
cobblemon.species.ferocidile.name: Ferocidile
cobblemon.species.ferocidile.desc: It can shatter a tree in half with its mouth. It will not release its prey once clasped.
cobblemon.species.gorbler.name: Gorbler
cobblemon.species.gorbler.desc: As it burrows underground, it forms a network of tunnels. Durtworm's eyesight is severely impaired as a result of living in such a dark environment, but its sense of smell is enhanced. It can detect food from a distance of 100 metres.
cobblemon.species.gaiaminth.name: Gaiaminth
cobblemon.species.gaiaminth.desc: Gaiaminths are a type of deep-soil creature that may grow to enormous sizes. It regularly absorbs nutrient-rich soil after crushing it using its drill-like mandible.
cobblemon.species.huskuttle.name: Huskuttle
cobblemon.species.huskuttle.desc: They are spotted excavating tunnels in the sand, waiting for opponents to pass by, then springing from the sand and attacking in the hopes of rapidly defeating its opponent.
cobblemon.species.decareca.name: Decareca
cobblemon.species.decareca.desc: It stores almost a tonne of sand in its claws, which it may fire out at rapid speeds if it is assaulted.
cobblemon.species.akakeru.name: Akakeru
cobblemon.species.akakeru.desc: It is frequently seen rigorously exercising; it will not stop until it reaches evolution. It will choose a certain training regimen until evolution happens.
cobblemon.species.keruguru.name: Keruguru
cobblemon.species.keruguru.desc: Even concrete is pulverised as Keruguru twists its arm whilst throwing a punch. After three minutes of combat, the Pokemon takes a break. It is frequently encountered sparring with Hitmonlee when transported to other regions.
cobblemon.species.kerukeru.name: Kerukeru
cobblemon.species.kerukeru.desc: Kerukeru kicks its opponent with its legs at breakneck speed using its great sense of balance to stay upright. It is frequently encountered sparring with Hitmonlee when transported to other regions.
cobblemon.species.seevil.name: Seevil
cobblemon.species.mimicnid.name: Mimicnid
cobblemon.species.mimicnid.desc: Because of their likeness to Ledyba, Mimicnid are highly sought for by Bug Catchers. When opponents are caught in its web, it can exactly duplicate their moves.
cobblemon.species.tasmaniac.name: Tasmaniac
cobblemon.species.tasmaniac.desc: Its fierce and territorial nature makes it a formidable opponent, but a loyal companion to those it considers part of its pack.
cobblemon.species.toxipine.name: Toxipine
cobblemon.species.toxipine.desc: It glides around the woodland floor, gathering up berries as it goes. Despite its little size, its toxin is quite lethal.
cobblemon.species.venetreme.name: Venetreme
cobblemon.species.venetreme.desc: Venetreme's spines develop quite quickly. These may be plucked from its body and used against opponents. They quickly regrow.
cobblemon.species.ozzapi.name: Ozzapi
cobblemon.species.ozzapi.desc: Ozzapi are found in Otopo's rugged, savannah-esque areas. They are extremely fast Pokemon, so can be hard to study. When spooked, it will send a quick jolt at its assailant using its ossicones.
cobblemon.species.oscillacone.name: Oscillacone
cobblemon.species.oscillacone.desc: Its ossicones serve as an electrical conduit. When it eats from trees, it struggles to keep the electricity contained, which might cause other pokemon to get shocked. In Otopo's savannah regions, Zapraffe is utilised as a riding Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.volswine.name: Volswine
cobblemon.species.volswine.desc: It has a peak speed of 75 mph (120 km/h), but once it starts moving, it will not stop until it collides with something. It runs at such a high speed that sparks shoot from its trotters.
cobblemon.species.blitzhogg.name: Blitzhogg
cobblemon.species.blitzhogg.desc: The top of its head has fur that works as a conductor. When it runs, this energy goes through its tusks, supercharging its speed. It is, however, difficult to halt once it has begun to run.
cobblemon.species.scarug.name: Scarug
cobblemon.species.scarug.desc: They are discovered in such enormous numbers that the floor appears to be moving. They will quickly disperse if exposed to light.
cobblemon.species.crypcoon.name: Crypcoon
cobblemon.species.crypcoon.desc: Crypcoon has strengthened its shell by consuming all the riches locked away with it when buried among the Kings. It's too heavy to move, so it'll only react when it evolves.
cobblemon.species.sarcofomoth.name: Sarcofomoth
cobblemon.species.sarcofomoth.desc: Because it has been present since ancient times, the spores it produces are far more powerful than those released by other Bug Pokemon. You should never look it in the eyes directly.
cobblemon.species.gubeluto.name: Gubeluto
cobblemon.species.cubrosus.name: Cubrosus
cobblemon.species.cubrosus.desc: It hides in the darkest of places, calmly waiting for its victim. In the night, the golden stripes on its fur shimmer, hypnotising any victim who looks its way.
cobblemon.species.feranther.name: Feranther
cobblemon.species.feranther.desc: Poachers are attracted to their black hide because of its malignant qualities. They are masters of stealth, hunting alone and bringing even the most powerful opponent to the ground.
cobblemon.species.orialisk.name: Orialisk
cobblemon.species.orialisk.desc: The first sighting of an Orialisk was in a distant Pokémon Tower. A departing spirit inhabits the memorial, causing it to have a mind of its own.
cobblemon.species.tripulcre.name: Tripulcre
cobblemon.species.tripulcre.desc: By consuming lost souls, Oralith evolved into Tripulcre. The sheer power it absorbs, lifts Tripulcre off the ground. It has inanimate Oralith spinning around it because its ghostly powers are so strong.
cobblemon.species.flittervolt.name: Flittervolt
cobblemon.species.flittervolt.desc: A Pokémon with a body that resembles cottony clouds. They look for food when the weather is stormy, when most Pokémon would hide.
cobblemon.species.bakkabolt.name: Bakkabolt
cobblemon.species.bakkabolt.desc: It glides freely over the sky during stormy days, blending in with the clouds. When enraged, it employs its piercing shriek to confuse attackers.
cobblemon.species.dragite.name: Dragite
cobblemon.species.dragite.desc: It hatches from the toughest of eggs, devouring the shell to build its rough carapace. Dragite is still growing and struggles to keep upright. It still lacks arms.
cobblemon.species.crushaur.name: Crushaur
cobblemon.species.crushaur.desc: Dragite evolves into Crushaur after eating all the pebbles surrounding its collar. Crushaur's jaw strength is incredible, allowing it to crack open even the toughest mineral deposits. Unfortunately, once they begin eating, they will not stop until they are completely satisfied, resulting in a hefty frame.
cobblemon.species.tiamond.name: Tiamond
cobblemon.species.tiamond.desc: Its head jewel is the toughest horn of all known of Pokemon, and it cannot be broken. By compressing the carbon it consumes in its stomach, it can produce a large number of diamonds in a short amount of time which it gifts its trainer.
cobblemon.species.folfaun.name: Folfaun
cobblemon.species.folfaun.desc: A peaceful Pokemon that like to live in the woods. It used to be plentiful in ancient times, but it was killed for its pelt, making it exceedingly difficult to locate now.
cobblemon.species.elklore.name: Elklore
cobblemon.species.elklore.desc: An old Pokemon that is seldom seen these days. It can be located in the forest's darkest recesses. The Pokemon leaves a distinctive floral scent trailing behind it, which comes from the vegetation growing from its horns, which changes seasonally. The leader of the herd has the most spectacular horns.
cobblemon.species.canifang.name: Canifang
cobblemon.species.canifang.desc: Within its pack, Canifang exhibits remarkable camaraderie, supporting its companions through teamwork and strategic coordination. It is said that Canifang embodies the untamed spirit of the wilderness, and has a reputation as a relentless hunter.
cobblemon.species.scuffulent.name: Scuffulent
cobblemon.species.scuffulent.desc: Scuffulents are easily enraged since they are frequently stomped on. It will seize its attacker by the feet, drag him underground, and pound him to death.
cobblemon.species.fracactus.name: Fracactus
cobblemon.species.fracactus.desc: Due to desertification, its plant skin has solidified, becoming a rock-like carapace. Its speed has slowed to a crawl, yet it still uses its mass to lend weight to its assaults.
cobblemon.species.salasander.name: Salasander
cobblemon.species.salasander.desc: Salasander scurries across the desert floor, looking for scraps left behind by other Pokemon. It's lightning fast and can get out of practically any circumstance if it's endangered.
cobblemon.species.alpalpa.name: Alpalpa
cobblemon.species.alpalpa.desc: Light on their feet, Alpalpa are found on the tundra plains of Otopo. Their fur, whilst not adapted for colder climates, does absorb water which freezes and glistens in the winter sun.
cobblemon.species.pacalaya.name: Pacalaya
cobblemon.species.pacalaya.desc: Due to their brilliance, they are a popular favourite among Pokemon coordinators. Water particles that gather in their fur have frozen into sharp cold needles, their fur is sharp to the touch
cobblemon.species.molooze.name: Molooze
cobblemon.species.molooze.desc: Its shell is getting brittle due to the high acid content in the fluid it releases. Because the fluid it discharges dilutes in the water it lives in, it is presently not powerful enough to damage other Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.escargoo.name: Escargoo
cobblemon.species.escargoo.desc: The fluid leaking from Escargoo's shell is extremely dangerous. Under the toxicity of its secretions, even its shell is beginning to fracture.
cobblemon.species.tundrimp.name: Tundrimp
cobblemon.species.tundrimp.desc: It has a smart but ferocious demeanour. It waits until the parents have left their nests before sneaking in and stealing their eggs.
cobblemon.species.gigice.name: Gigice
cobblemon.species.gigice.desc: It charges forward and bashes its foes like a warrior, unconcerned about whatever damage it may sustain. This Pokémon is easily enraged, and it has no qualms about utilising its enormous power to achieve its goals. It has a rivalry with Froskijo.
cobblemon.species.froskijo.name: Froskijo
cobblemon.species.froskijo.desc: It creates a swirling blizzard using its psychic prowess, opting for brains not brawn. Adversaries caught in the vortex are frozen solid. It has a rivalry with Gigice.
cobblemon.species.wintweet.name: Wintweet
cobblemon.species.wintweet.desc: Wintweet have little hold on snowy ground, so they seldom leave the caverns where they live.
cobblemon.species.frosbeak.name: Frosbeak
cobblemon.species.glaceor.name: Glaceor
cobblemon.species.glaceor.desc: Glaceor was discovered at the impact site of an asteroid. It was originally thought to be inanimate, but after burning up as it hurtled through the sky, it took on a life of its own.
cobblemon.species.iceteroid.name: Iceteroid
cobblemon.species.iceteroid.desc: Multiple Glaceor collide together to form Iceteroid. Iceteroid possesses extremely difficult-to-pierce armour, making it a dangerous opponent in battle.
cobblemon.species.pangoloo.name: Pangoloo
cobblemon.species.pangoloo.desc: Pangoloos live in the coldest parts of the world. Rangers in Otopo guard them to prevent poachers from collecting their frozen shell for Nevermeltice.
cobblemon.species.snoat.name: Snoat
cobblemon.species.snoat.desc: Snoat has a slender physique. It can squeeze through tight areas and flee when attacked. Snoat is assumed to be a localised variety of Furret in other areas.
cobblemon.species.sleasel.name: Sleasel
cobblemon.species.sleasel.desc: Snoats which struggle and steal food evolve into Sleasel. They dwell in extremely cold places, and use their extremely long body to curled up to stay warm.
cobblemon.species.glacermine.name: Glacermine
cobblemon.species.glacermine.desc: It employs its tail in a variety of ways. It utilises it as a scarf to stay warm in chilly places, but it may also be used to entangle opponents.
cobblemon.species.toyrosaur.name: Toyrosaur
cobblemon.species.toyrosaur.desc: Substitution Dolls were once inanimate Toyrosaurs. They drank the love and joy they felt and gained consciousness once they were no longer employed for warfare and instead owned as cuddly toys.
cobblemon.species.stegotoy.name: Stegotoy
cobblemon.species.stegotoy.desc: Stegotoy are compassionate creatures who want to nurture others rather than fight. It will constantly defend the Pokémon under its care.
cobblemon.species.jellestrial.name: Jellestrial
cobblemon.species.jellestrial.desc: Jellestrial are alien Pokemon that were discovered in a meteorite found in Hoenn. It seeks safety since its jelly-like body is exceedingly vulnerable. When Jellestrial encounters steel-type Pokemon, they get ecstatic.
cobblemon.species.medusien.name: Medusien
cobblemon.species.medusien.desc: Due of the ship-like carapace it resides in, Medusien are exceedingly well protected. Due to its thick armour, it relies on its psychic powers to keep afloat.
cobblemon.species.tantan.name: Tantan
cobblemon.species.natugnaro.name: Natugnaro
cobblemon.species.ankarmor.name: Ankarmor
cobblemon.species.ankarmor.desc: Ankarmor were discovered in an old fossil and are thought to have existed thousands of years ago. Their carapace is extremely strong and can resist tremendous pressure.
cobblemon.species.kilosor.name: Kilosor
cobblemon.species.kilosor.desc: After hundreds of encounters, Ankarmor evolves into Kilosor, as a result of being subjected to harsh assaults. It utilises its mace-tipped tail to defend itself as well as strike its foes.
cobblemon.species.therospine.name: Therospine
cobblemon.species.therospine.desc: The DNA of this creature was discovered in an old fossil. They are aggressive and will seek out as many opponents as possible in order to continually improve their strength and fighting skill.
cobblemon.species.theroroar.name: Theroroar
cobblemon.species.theroroar.desc: With a rapid swipe of its razor-sharp claws, it can annihilate its foes. It is so violent that it would defy its trainers and fight until the opponent is defeated.
cobblemon.species.rapraider.name: Rapraider
cobblemon.species.flammtern.name: Flammtern
cobblemon.species.yokorch.name: Yokorch
cobblemon.species.yokorch.desc: It is thought that the spirits of children who go missing at festivals led them to come to life when they were once just a simple paper lantern.
cobblemon.species.stubby.name: Stubby
cobblemon.species.stuckorn.name: Stuckorn
cobblemon.species.rocstrich.name: Rocstrich
cobblemon.species.venoraze.name: Venoraze
cobblemon.species.toxerno.name: Toxerno
cobblemon.species.aridamel.name: Aridamel
cobblemon.species.aridamel.desc: It prefers dry environments. Aridamel releases mud from the port on its hump to control its temperature because of the harsh sun.
cobblemon.species.deserdary.name: Deserdary
cobblemon.species.diploracus.name: Diploracus
cobblemon.species.floradocus.name: Floradocus
cobblemon.species.floradocus.desc: Due to the utopian jungle climate, Floradocus can still be found rather than resurrected by fossils. Its skin has calcified as a result of its rapid growth, forming a bark-like covering on which bird Pokemon may build their nest.
cobblemon.species.kakapow.name: Kakapow
cobblemon.species.beetler.name: Beetler
cobblemon.species.caratarge.name: Caratarge
cobblemon.species.pavapace.name: Pavapace
cobblemon.species.geonigma.name: Geonigma
cobblemon.species.geonigma.desc: Geonigma comes from an experiment where Ditto was subjected to the harshest of environments. Its body instead morphed into a black silhouette, allowing it to merge seamlessly into its environment whilst taking on its properties.
cobblemon.species.smokwi.name: Smokwi
cobblemon.species.smokwi.desc: Found in grassy areas surrounding volcanoes, Smokwi hunt and forrage for small bug-type Pokemon. It's long beak is sharp enough to pierce even the most dessicated earth.
cobblemon.species.iguava.name: Iguava
cobblemon.species.modovoldo.name: Modovoldo
cobblemon.species.jackajolt.name: Jackajolt
cobblemon.species.jackajolt.desc: It is readily stimulated, prompting it to rush off at high rates. When it is startled, it discharges a burst of electrical energy.
cobblemon.species.panburn.name: Panburn
cobblemon.species.panblaze.name: Panblaze
cobblemon.species.flamhopper.name: Flamhopper
cobblemon.species.hornbully.name: Hornbully
cobblemon.species.mantini.name: Mantini
cobblemon.species.thanatis.name: Thanatis
cobblemon.species.unode.name: Unode
cobblemon.species.dioduo.name: Dioduo
cobblemon.species.quadrarity.name: Quadrarity
cobblemon.species.quadrarity.desc: The consequence of four Dioduo combining is Quadrarity. Due to the quick spinning of the electric, it blasts out in all directions.
cobblemon.species.cisburn.name: Cisburn
cobblemon.species.foaltasm.name: Foaltasm
cobblemon.species.stallighast.name: Stallighast
cobblemon.species.robutler.name: Robutler
cobblemon.species.robutler.desc: They were designed to assist trainers with everyday duties and housework who have hectic schedules. When it is angry, it finds it difficult to conceal its feelings and will change its countenance.
cobblemon.species.waitroid.name: Waitroid
cobblemon.species.waitroid.desc: After several years with its trainer, Robutler evolves into Waitroid. Waitroid is capable of combat as well as chores, and can quickly overwhelm other Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.pinacier.name: Pinacier
cobblemon.species.narcicle.name: Narcicle
cobblemon.species.narcicle.desc: It has the ability to swim at amazing speeds across water. Its long horn, which develops continually during its life, may puncture opponents.
cobblemon.species.gulpit.name: Gulpit
cobblemon.species.sparrawk.name: Sparrawk
cobblemon.species.falswain.name: Falswain
cobblemon.species.naviator.name: Naviator
cobblemon.species.naviator.desc: Their vision is unrivalled; soaring high in the sky helps them to easily identify prey and swoop down with pinpoint accuracy. They are known to roam around the Pokemon world and to have nests in the faraway territory of Okeno.
cobblemon.species.callimeeko.name: Callimeeko
cobblemon.species.callimeeko.desc: Callimeeko are extremely elusive and have only been seen a few times. It is an expert at blending into the shadows, with just its eyes revealing its whereabouts.
cobblemon.species.quokkute.name: Quokkute
cobblemon.species.quokkute.desc: Quokkute are the most affectionate of all Pokemon, and once they form a relationship with a trainer, they would never abandon them.
cobblemon.species.coralpus.name: Coralpus
cobblemon.species.coralpus.desc: Coralpus is a sea creature that can be discovered stranded on the beach. They can remove kelp from their moustache and use it to make bandages for injured Pokemon, and their kelp is prized by hunters for its medical powers.
cobblemon.species.paratorte.name: Paratorte
cobblemon.species.paratorte.desc: Paratorte is a mythical monster that may be spotted soaring over Otopo. When a Paratorte withdraws its wings in mid-flight and bombards the earth below, catastrophic head injuries have occurred.
cobblemon.species.vegebun.name: Vegebun
cobblemon.species.vegebun.desc: Vegebun are extremely joyous Pokémon. It is said that if a Vegebun makes a nest in a farm, it will have a bountiful harvest.
cobblemon.species.skundertaker.name: Skundertaker
cobblemon.species.skundertaker.desc: Skundertaker seems completely unfazed by its own odour. It loves to sneak up on unsuspecting trainers, unleashing a stink so bad that some claim they saw their souls leave their bodies—if only for a moment!
cobblemon.species.grinyan.name: Grinyan
cobblemon.species.grinyan.desc: Those who witness its naughty smile are said to be cursed. It still has its original trainer's Pokéball, which it will only give up if it has complete faith in someone.
cobblemon.species.talpastar.name: Talpastar
cobblemon.species.cassoworry.name: Cassoworry
cobblemon.species.flysh.name: Flysh
cobblemon.species.skoi.name: Skoi
cobblemon.species.skoi.desc: Skoi can travel at breakneck speeds despite its massive bulk. Skoi is utilised as a mode of transportation by certain trainers in Otopo.
cobblemon.species.magnymph.name: Magnymph
cobblemon.species.polaragon.name: Polaragon
cobblemon.species.psylet.name: Psylet
cobblemon.species.psylet.desc: Their gaze is hypnotic. Psylet is claimed to have the ability to manipulate even the most strong-willed individuals into committing heinous acts.
cobblemon.species.sansque.name: Sansque
cobblemon.species.granuken.name: Granuken
cobblemon.species.lamentra.name: Lamentra
cobblemon.species.bittergeist.name: Bittergeist
cobblemon.species.cherisoul.name: Cherisoul
cobblemon.species.tarseek.name: Tarseek
cobblemon.species.buddaki.name: Buddaki
cobblemon.species.jestar.name: Jestar
cobblemon.species.lunbun.name: Lunbun
cobblemon.species.lichyrm.name: Lichyrm
cobblemon.species.hornbeet.name: Hornbeet
cobblemon.species.tengushi.name: Tengushi
cobblemon.species.adjie.name: Adjie
cobblemon.species.majee.name: Majee
cobblemon.species.latarajee.name: Latarajee
cobblemon.species.goraseed.name: Goraseed
cobblemon.species.mandroxica.name: Mandroxica
cobblemon.species.rocurrent.name: Rocurrent
cobblemon.species.cryzlect.name: Cryzlect
cobblemon.species.cryzlect.desc: The crystals interwoven within its rocky structure conduct electricity allowing this rock type to float. It emits a tuneful crisp chime when a crystal is hit.
cobblemon.species.electrec.name: Electrec
cobblemon.species.electrec.desc: Preferring to live in burrows, it uses its electric energy to communicate with others and sense danger. It’s often found near storms, drawn to areas with strong electrical activity.
cobblemon.species.perfomask.name: Perfomask
cobblemon.species.perlusc.name: Perlusc
cobblemon.species.perlusc.desc: Perlusc live in shallow seas in the tropical regions of Otopo. Incredibly shy, it does its best to camouflage into its surroundings. People harvest the pearls it makes and gift them to those they love.
cobblemon.species.nacrelusc.name: Nacrelusc
cobblemon.species.poisnip.name: Poisnip
cobblemon.species.scyrmpion.name: Scyrmpion
cobblemon.species.anemular.name: Anemular
cobblemon.species.submurchible.name: Submurchible
cobblemon.species.timekreepa.name: Timekreepa
cobblemon.species.compawtriot.name: Compawtriot
cobblemon.species.tamanome.name: Tamanome
cobblemon.species.tamanome.desc: This Pokemon has a unique genetic structure, in which it can evolve based on the favouritism of certain parameters. Its form will change depending on how it has been treated.
cobblemon.species.tamakomu.name: Tamakomu
cobblemon.species.honokomu.name: Honokomu
cobblemon.species.honokomu.desc: Honokomu embodies magma's ferocity. It fires huge bursts of fire that completely consume everything they come into contact with.
cobblemon.species.tatakomu.name: Tatakomu
cobblemon.species.mizukomu.name: Mizukomu
cobblemon.species.majokomu.name: Majokomu
cobblemon.species.damakomu.name: Damakomu
cobblemon.species.sokukomu.name: Sokukomu
cobblemon.species.leafdra.name: Leafdra
cobblemon.species.terradra.name: Terradra
cobblemon.species.flamdra.name: Flamdra
cobblemon.species.flamdra.desc: Thought to be a dragon born in the pits of a Volcano. Flamdra are attuned to trainers who have an affinity for the grass type.
cobblemon.species.vulcadra.name: Vulcadra
cobblemon.species.vulcadra.desc: It raises its young in the depths of a dormant volcano. It can easily incinerate its prey.
cobblemon.species.oceadra.name: Oceadra
cobblemon.species.oceadra.desc: Living in the deepest parts of the ocean, Oceadra enjoy a peaceful existance. They are believed to be a sign of longevity, so you're extremely lucky if you ever see one.
cobblemon.species.peladra.name: Peladra
cobblemon.species.peladra.desc: Peladra are extremely elusive. The pearl it sits on not only provides it with additional longevity but is greatly sought after by poachers.
cobblemon.species.vivizard.name: Vivizard
cobblemon.species.vivizard.desc: Long thought to be a myth, this Pokémon's existence was only recently confirmed by a mountaineer who caught one.
cobblemon.species.prizmazor.name: Prizmazor
cobblemon.species.prizmazor.desc: Prizmazor's carapace has bleached due to the immense power that it contains. One blast from a Prizmazor's Hyper Beam is enough to tear through a mountain.
cobblemon.species.faberon.name: Faberon
cobblemon.species.faberon.desc: An egg which contains Faberon, is said to be hatched under a mountain of discarded Dragon Scales. It is incredibly delicate, and shy towards trainers and Pokémon alike. It hides under the casing of its shell at all times.
cobblemon.species.dragerg.name: Dragerg
cobblemon.species.dragerg.desc: A mystical Pokémon that exudes a mystical energy. Described in legend, its skin gives off the most entrancing spectrum of colour. If shed, this skin can be used to make clothes impervious to damage.
cobblemon.species.harpiveran.name: Harpiveran
cobblemon.species.harpiveran.desc: The emissary of alignment; Harpiveran takes those who challenge balance to either Orderion or Anarchaic. It is not known who its true master is.
cobblemon.species.orderion.name: Orderion
cobblemon.species.anarchaic.name: Anarchaic
cobblemon.species.anarchaic.desc: Said to appear in the midst of chaos; Anarchaic was sealed away centuries ago due to its terrifying power. It is said to take the souls of those who live a dishonest life.
cobblemon.species.esoterra.name: Esoterra
cobblemon.species.esoterra.desc: Esoterra can link itself to the planet and draw energy from its surroundings by drilling itself into the floor. This energy can be used as an attacking mechanism, firing lasers from the jewel on its head.
cobblemon.species.axolovl.name: Axolovl
cobblemon.species.axolovl.desc: Axolovl are extremely rare, and you are said to be extremely blessed if you ever encounter one. Axolovl are overflowing with love and meeting one is said to cause dreams of love to come true.
cobblemon.species.eleplant.name: Eleplant
cobblemon.species.herbederm.name: Herbederm
cobblemon.species.mammahonia.name: Mammahonia
cobblemon.species.bollokin.name: Bollokin
cobblemon.species.flamabull.name: Flamabull
cobblemon.species.audhroch.name: Audhroch
cobblemon.species.newtiny.name: Newtiny
cobblemon.species.salamarsh.name: Salamarsh
cobblemon.species.caudatidal.name: Caudatidal
cobblemon.species.coocun.name: Coocun
cobblemon.species.cocadeux.name: Cocadeux
cobblemon.species.cocatrois.name: Cocatrois
cobblemon.species.pilfur.name: Pilfur
cobblemon.species.pikpossum.name: Pikpossum
cobblemon.species.nimf.name: Nimf
cobblemon.species.trusshy.name: Trusshy
cobblemon.species.dayfly.name: Dayfly
cobblemon.species.duskito.name: Duskito
cobblemon.species.kupal.name: Kupal
cobblemon.species.cheervona.name: Cheervona
cobblemon.species.taracub.name: Taracub
cobblemon.species.dentdeleo.name: Dentdeleo
cobblemon.species.dandylion.name: Dandylion
cobblemon.species.cervidear.name: Cervidear
cobblemon.species.pedenki.name: Pedenki
cobblemon.species.rasclove.name: Rasclove
cobblemon.species.inkling.name: Inkling
cobblemon.species.inkap.name: Inkap
cobblemon.species.inklassy.name: Inklassy
cobblemon.species.sorrowmin.name: Sorrowmin
cobblemon.species.ermourne.name: Ermourne
cobblemon.species.weepsel.name: Weepsel
cobblemon.species.magixy.name: Magixy
cobblemon.species.magimancy.name: Magimancy
cobblemon.species.critatter.name: Critatter
cobblemon.species.critippet.name: Critippet
cobblemon.species.critabard.name: Critabard
cobblemon.species.spectung.name: Spectung
cobblemon.species.hauntung.name: Hauntung
cobblemon.species.phantung.name: Phantung
cobblemon.species.maluce.name: Maluce
cobblemon.species.nitemori.name: Nitemori
cobblemon.species.llima.name: Llima
cobblemon.species.rocpaca.name: Rocpaca
cobblemon.species.jewellama.name: Jewellama
cobblemon.species.crovus.name: Crovus
cobblemon.species.cawpin.name: Cawpin
cobblemon.species.flambe.name: Flambe
cobblemon.species.fricasheep.name: Fricasheep
cobblemon.species.searies.name: Searies
cobblemon.species.lullamb.name: Lullamb
cobblemon.species.shleepy.name: Shleepy
cobblemon.species.mismol.name: Mismol
cobblemon.species.hokumol.name: Hokumol
cobblemon.species.boovine.name: Boovine
cobblemon.species.tumblwee.name: Tumblwee
cobblemon.species.jumblweed.name: Jumblweed
cobblemon.species.troublweed.name: Troublweed
cobblemon.species.poisoma.name: Poisoma
cobblemon.species.coronatox.name: Coronatox
cobblemon.species.spuro.name: Spuro
cobblemon.species.spurtail.name: Spurtail
cobblemon.species.walabrume.name: Walabrume
cobblemon.species.kangarain.name: Kangarain
cobblemon.species.stormaroo.name: Stormaroo
cobblemon.species.cadavish.name: Cadavish
cobblemon.species.carcashark.name: Carcashark
cobblemon.species.shoales.name: Shoales
cobblemon.species.palaices.name: Palaices
cobblemon.species.dolfun.name: Dolfun
cobblemon.species.tropiaqua.name: Tropiaqua
cobblemon.species.peruna.name: Peruna
cobblemon.species.catopact.name: Catopact
cobblemon.species.spectreflek.name: Spectreflek
cobblemon.species.polterglas.name: Polterglas
cobblemon.species.oozion.name: Oozion
cobblemon.species.gloopzion.name: Gloopzion
cobblemon.species.leazid.name: Leazid
cobblemon.species.leazid.desc: Leazid are curious and energetic Pokémon that uses its strong pincers to grab onto branches and leaves, helping it balance in the trees.
cobblemon.species.triceive.name: Triceive
cobblemon.species.triceive.desc: Triceive uses its vine-like pincers to strike opponents swiftly. Its venomous touch becomes stronger as it matures, helping it defend against larger threats.
cobblemon.species.hydrathorn.name: Hydrathorn
cobblemon.species.hydrathorn.desc: Hydrathorn's body is covered in thick thorn-like growths, which it uses to launch fierce strikes. It is a dangerous predator in the wild, using its vine-like arms to both attack and ensnare its prey.
cobblemon.species.bullit.name: Bullit
cobblemon.species.bombull.name: Bombull
cobblemon.species.brassear.name: Brassear
cobblemon.species.brassear.desc: Brassear's horns are extremely strong, capable of piercing massive boulders and lifting them with ease. When angry, their horns will light up and sizzle.
cobblemon.species.hippony.name: Hippony
cobblemon.species.hippony.desc: Hippony are loved by young kids because of their playful attitude. They can create colorful bubbles, used to put on shows or to distract opponents in battle.
cobblemon.species.gallocamp.name: Gallocamp
cobblemon.species.gallocamp.desc: Gallocamp are very playful and energetic. They have the ability to run on water, often putting on shows to entertain wild Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.aquastrian.name: Aquastrian
cobblemon.species.aquastrian.desc: Aquastrian are great swimmers, able to pass through large whirlpools with ease. Touching their horn is said to give you good luck.
cobblemon.species.quillit.name: Quillit
cobblemon.species.quillit.desc: Quillit are shy and timid. When they get startled, they will curl up into a ball and harden their quills to ward off predators.
cobblemon.species.quillistic.name: Quillistic
cobblemon.species.quillistic.desc: Upon evolution, Quillistic have grown their confidence. Their quills are sharp and poisonous and can be shot in any direction they choose.
cobblemon.species.kestling.name: Kestling
cobblemon.species.kestric.name: Kestric
cobblemon.species.kestric.desc: Kestric are incredibly swift, causing small electrical currents to form behind them as they fly.
cobblemon.species.falconik.name: Falconik
cobblemon.species.falconik.desc: Falconik love to fly through thunder storms where they can absorb electricity. In battle, they use their tail like a conductor to direct electric attacks.
cobblemon.species.cricky.name: Cricky
cobblemon.species.cricky.desc: Cricky can jump very high and far, causing them to often get carried by the wind. Their legs are extremely quick, able to kick an average of 10 times per second.
cobblemon.species.crickick.name: Crickick
cobblemon.species.crickick.desc: Ability: Lead Foot - Boosts the power of 'kicking' moves
cobblemon.species.pestor.name: Pestor
cobblemon.species.pestor.desc: Pestor are known for their pranks and traps. Quite often they'll play dead so when trainers go to help, they can ambush them and steal from their bags.
cobblemon.species.punkosom.name: Punkosom
cobblemon.species.cupilla.name: Cupilla
cobblemon.species.silkute.name: Silkute
cobblemon.species.flutterfly.name: Flutterfly
cobblemon.species.squibble.name: Squibble
cobblemon.species.squibble.desc: Squibble never stay still and are always on the look out for berries to store in trees. When startled, they will bite onto their attacker with their strong front teeth.
cobblemon.species.searell.name: Searell
cobblemon.species.searell.desc: Searell can ignite the seeds it keeps in it's cheeks to use for attacks. With their tail being very fluffy and warm, smaller Pokémon love to curl up in them on cold nights.
cobblemon.species.theossiansunflora.name: TheossianSunflora
cobblemon.species.theossiansunflora.desc: The strong sunlight of Theos allows Theosian Sunflora to convert their excess energy into powerful solar attacks.
cobblemon.species.theossianspinarak.name: TheossianSpinarak
cobblemon.species.theossianspinarak.desc: Theosian Spinarak hide out in fields camouflaged as pumpkins. At night, they raid farmer's crops and eat all they can find.
cobblemon.species.theossianariados.name: TheossianAriados
cobblemon.species.theossianariados.desc: Theosian Ariados have a powerful bite, causing immense pain for several days if bit. Their abdomen resembles a pumpkin allowing them to blend in with the crops when hunting.
cobblemon.species.hopple.name: Hopple
cobblemon.species.hopple.desc: Hopple are very up-beat. Pre-schools often have them as class pets because they love to play with children.
cobblemon.species.hoppuff.name: Hoppuff
cobblemon.species.hoppuff.desc: Hoppuff can jump quiet high due to their springy legs. Don't be fooled by their cute appearance; Hoppuff can pack quite a punch with their ears.
cobblemon.species.bunursery.name: Bunursery
cobblemon.species.bunursery.desc: Bunursery are very caring and calm Pokémon. Daycares often work along side them as they're very good with young Pokémon and taking care of Pokémon Eggs.
cobblemon.species.theossianraichu.name: TheossianRaichu
cobblemon.species.theossianraichu.desc: As electricity builds up inside its body, it becomes more aggressive. One theory is that the electricity buildup is actually causing stress.
cobblemon.species.yolkoo.name: Yolkoo
cobblemon.species.cherishen.name: Cherishen
cobblemon.species.roostuff.name: Roostuff
cobblemon.species.sqworm.name: Sqworm
cobblemon.species.sqworm.desc: Gardener's love Sqworm for their ability to turn the soil, keeping it fresh and moist. The length of a Sqworm depends on the quality of soil they've been eating.
cobblemon.species.tunnoworm.name: Tunnoworm
cobblemon.species.theossianmareep.name: TheossianMareep
cobblemon.species.theossianmareep.desc: Theosian Mareep have very soft and springy wool. Clothing designers love using their wool in their clothes as they provide a fresh flowery scent while also being immune to static buildup.
cobblemon.species.theossianflaaffy.name: TheossianFlaaffy
cobblemon.species.theossianflaaffy.desc: Flaaffy's wool expands in bright sunshine, becoming lighter and fluffier. They love to roll around in fields of flowers.
cobblemon.species.theossianampharos.name: TheossianAmpharos
cobblemon.species.theossianampharos.desc: They draw in solar energy through the flower on their tail. They use this solar energy to unleash powerful Grass-type attacks.
cobblemon.species.ostoe.name: Ostoe
cobblemon.species.ostoe.desc: Ostoe are quiet clumsy and often fall over due to their large feet. Despite this, they are capable of running a mile in only a few minutes.
cobblemon.species.ostretch.name: Ostretch
cobblemon.species.ostretch.desc: Ostretch are extremely fast for their size. They can run over a hundred miles per hour and not tire.
cobblemon.species.fawnix.name: Fawnix
cobblemon.species.fawnix.desc: It's said that Fawnix can create plant-life in the most barren of areas. They're quiet uncommon to come across in the wild so not many trainers have been able to capture them.
cobblemon.species.foresteer.name: Foresteer
cobblemon.species.foresteer.desc: Foresteer were thought to be a myth until a group of them were caught on film. The leaves on their horns change color depending on their enviroment.
cobblemon.species.theossianhoppip.name: TheossianHoppip
cobblemon.species.theossianhoppip.desc: Theosian Hoppip dig themselves into the ground to absorb nutriants from the soil. They're able to grow wheat from the seeds that fall off their head.
cobblemon.species.theossianskiploom.name: TheossianSkiploom
cobblemon.species.theossianskiploom.desc: Theosian Skiploom have hallow bodies filled with straw. They can often be seen jumping through the fields of farms.
cobblemon.species.theossianjumpluff.name: TheossianJumpluff
cobblemon.species.theossianjumpluff.desc: Jumpluff spend their time watching over fields by standing on their wood like tail. They do this to keep away bird Pokémon from feeding on the harvest.
cobblemon.species.moofy.name: Moofy
cobblemon.species.moofy.desc: Moofy are very curious and will gather in groups roadside to stare at the people going by. They often use their heads to break down their pens if they run out of grass to graze upon.
cobblemon.species.theossiantauros.name: TheossianTauros
cobblemon.species.theossiantauros.desc: Theosian Tauros have very strong skulls, using them to charge opponents. At the end of their 3 tails are iron balls which they use as a flail if attacked from behind.
cobblemon.species.theossianmiltank.name: TheossianMiltank
cobblemon.species.theossiangrowlithe.des: Theosian Growlithe are commonly used on farmers due to their herding abilities. They love to play in wet mud, often covering themselves completely head to toe in dirt.
cobblemon.species.theossianarcanine.name: TheossianArcanine
cobblemon.species.theossianarcanine.desc: People often use Theosian Arcanine to traverse the regions deserts. They have large paws which allow them to gain traction when running on sand.
cobblemon.species.stoatic.name: Stoatic
cobblemon.species.stoatic.desc: Stoatic construct massive tunnel systems beneath the ground where they store berries. Their cheek pouches can glow in the dark, allowing them to see while traversing said systems.
cobblemon.species.seedlee.name: Seedlee
cobblemon.species.seedlee.desc: Seedlee are easily scared, and will often disguise themselves as plant sprouts when sensing anyone nearby. They can release a potent scent from their petals if predators get too close.
cobblemon.species.petalite.name: Petalite
cobblemon.species.petalite.desc: Petalite have very efficient photosynthesis which allow them to take in a larger amount of sunlight than other grass Pokémon. The brighter their petals, the more energy they have absorbed.
cobblemon.species.mofly.name: Mofly
cobblemon.species.humoth.name: Humoth
cobblemon.species.carefeely.name: Carefeely
cobblemon.species.theossianwooper.name: TheossianWooper
cobblemon.species.theossianwooper.desc: Theosian Wooper can sense changes in the air with their antenna. If they sense something a storm coming, they'll let out a cry to warn other Pokémon in the area.
cobblemon.species.theossianquagsire.name: TheossianQuagsire
cobblemon.species.theossianquagsire.desc: Theosian Quagsire are very lax in nature as they do not need to hunt to eat. They sit on river-bottoms absorbing nutrients from the water.
cobblemon.species.quackle.name: Quackle
cobblemon.species.quackle.desc: Quackle are care-free Pokemon that spend their time lazily floating in ponds and lakes.
cobblemon.species.paraduck.name: Paraduck
cobblemon.species.paraduck.desc: Paraduck love the rain but dislike getting wet. They use large fallen leaves as umbrellas, sitting outside during storms.
cobblemon.species.psychick.name: Psychick
cobblemon.species.psychick.desc: Psychick's mind is 2 seconds into the future while it's body is in the present. This often causes it to act out before anything happens, giving it a head start to get away.
cobblemon.species.psyfan.name: Psyfan
cobblemon.species.psyfan.desc: In the wild, Psyfan are constantly looking ahead in time before any battle. They will run away if they see a loss in their future.
cobblemon.species.magoo.name: Magoo
