cobblemon.species.magoo.desc: Magoo's saliva can eat through almost anything, allowing them to get into all sorts of places. They like cramped, dark spots where they can gather energy in order to evolve while avoiding predators.
cobblemon.species.bugritty.name: Bugritty
cobblemon.species.bugritty.desc: Upon evolution Bugritty gains a hard shell somewhat resembling a Pokèball. This allows them to sneak into the bags of trainers undetected and eat all that’s inside.
cobblemon.species.wizzip.name: Wizzip
cobblemon.species.wizzip.desc: Wizzip don't stop moving and sporatically buzz around until they find something to eat. Their saliva is acidic enough to melt through metal, making them a nuisance in cities.
cobblemon.species.skeetle.name: Skeetle
cobblemon.species.skeetle.desc: Skeetle train their muscles by rolling around a large rock all day. As it gets easier to push, they increase the size of their rock, the alpha of the colony having the largest.
cobblemon.species.atlasect.name: Atlasect
cobblemon.species.atlasect.desc: Similar to Skeetle, Atlasect are constantly increasing the weight and size of their rock. The larger the rock, the better the chance of them attracting a mate.
cobblemon.species.beetile.name: Beetile
cobblemon.species.beetile.desc: Beetile use their horn to chip away at trees, getting to the sap inside. When they're close to evolving, they will stick to the side of an object and not let go until they evolve.
cobblemon.species.theossianheracross.des: The iron-rich sap found in the tress of Theos allows for Theosian Heracross to develop a much stronger shell than their regional counterparts.
cobblemon.species.theossianvenonat.name: TheossianVenonat
cobblemon.species.theossianvenonat.desc: Theosian Venonats are unable to control the brainwaves they emit sometimes causing hallucinations. It takes a trainer with great perserverance to make one evolve.
cobblemon.species.theossianvenomoth.name: TheossianVenomoth
cobblemon.species.theossianvenomoth.desc: Theosian Venomoth now have greater control over the brainwaves they emit, ensuring not to disrupt their trainer.
cobblemon.species.trunklit.name: Trunklit
cobblemon.species.trunklit.desc: Trunklit release puffs of smoke from their nose to create shapes. Humans in the ancient times would use the soot leftover to create artwork and tell stories.
cobblemon.species.smogophant.name: Smogophant
cobblemon.species.smogophant.desc: Smogophant constantly release foul smelling smoke from the pores on their backs. The thicker the smoke the younger and healthier the Smogophant.
cobblemon.species.theossianshinx.name: TheossianShinx
cobblemon.species.theossianshinx.desc: It's said that Theosian Shinx can see into multiple universes, allowing to see different outcomes of events. When frightened, they will attack using flashes of light to distract their foes.
cobblemon.species.theossianluxio.name: TheossianLuxio
cobblemon.species.theossianluxio.desc: Their incredibly strong psychic powers have given Theosian Luxio a god complex, as they believe to be on the same level as some Legendary Pokemon.
cobblemon.species.theossianluxray.name: TheossianLuxray
cobblemon.species.theossianluxray.desc: Evolution has humbled Theosian Luxray as their powers now help them to understand their place in the universe.
cobblemon.species.grizzle.name: Grizzle
cobblemon.species.grizzle.desc: Grizzle are quite grumpy. They can be found stomping through the woods destroying small trees and rocks.
cobblemon.species.grumbear.name: Grumbear
cobblemon.species.grumbear.desc: The only time Grumbear are at peace is when they're hibernating. If awoken too early, they will go into a frenzy attacking everything they see.
cobblemon.species.cheekmunk.name: Cheekmunk
cobblemon.species.chippunch.name: Chippunch
cobblemon.species.chippunch.desc: Chippunch always store berries in their cheeks to give them an energy boost during battle. Their tail is incredibly strong often acting as a third fist.
cobblemon.species.nibblit.name: Nibblit
cobblemon.species.nibblit.desc: Nibblit are constantly looking for something to chew, forcing Trainers to carry sticks with them in order to avoid Nibblit destroying their belongings.
cobblemon.species.lumbash.name: Lumbash
cobblemon.species.lumbash.desc: Their constant chewing has strenthened their teeth, allowing them to bite through large trees with ease. They carry around said trees to use as a weapon.
cobblemon.species.moleer.name: Moleer
cobblemon.species.moleer.desc: Moleer have very poor eye sight and rely on their sense of smell to know their surroundings. Their tough claws allow them to break through rock with ease.
cobblemon.species.tremole.name: Tremole
cobblemon.species.tremole.desc: Tremole arms act as drills allowing it to dig large tunnels underground with ease. They constantly get into territory disputes with Burroworm, often caving in each others tunnels.
cobblemon.species.crystone.name: Crystone
cobblemon.species.crystone.desc: In ancient times, it was seen as a sign of wealth to have a Crystone at your side. Their gemstone horn's are often sought out by poachers.
cobblemon.species.crysaur.name: Crysaur
cobblemon.species.crysaur.desc: Crysaur love to consume precious stones. Tales tell of Crysaur often eating the entire treasure vaults of Kings back in ancient times.
cobblemon.species.dinomond.name: Dinomond
cobblemon.species.dinomond.desc: Though sought-after by poachers for the gemstones pretruding from it's body, Dinomond have more than enough strength to defend themselves.
cobblemon.species.hoonoes.name: Hoonoes
cobblemon.species.hoonoes.desc: Hoonoes like to hide in the shadows making loud noises to scare people passing by. It's said they can fortell when someone will die.
cobblemon.species.younoes.name: Younoes
cobblemon.species.younoes.desc: Younoes can pass through walls allowing them to sneak into homes and scare the people living there, though they have never been recorded harming anybody.
cobblemon.species.eyenoes.name: Eyenoes
cobblemon.species.eyenoes.desc: Eyenoes have incredible vision, allowing them to partially see through walls. They are also able to sense the passing of those around and will shriek whenever someones time is up.
cobblemon.species.zippit.name: Zippit
cobblemon.species.zippit.desc: Zippit like to sleep on powerlines at night absorbing electricity. People often wake to find they have no power in their house due to Zippit causing overnight blackouts.
cobblemon.species.ampire.name: Ampire
cobblemon.species.ampire.desc: Ampire are not welcome in major cities as they will hang from Transmission Towers at night often causing damage and large power outages.
cobblemon.species.theossianoddish.name: TheossianOddish
cobblemon.species.theossianoddish.desc: The leaves that fall off Theosian Oddish's head were used to make potions in ancient times because they were said to have magical abilities.
cobblemon.species.theossiangloom.name: TheossianGloom
cobblemon.species.theossiangloom.desc: Citizens of Theos often use the leaves from Theosian Gloom in herbal teas as they are believed to contain healing properties.
cobblemon.species.theossianvileplume.des: Just like their pre-evolution, Theosian Vileplumes leaves are used to create a strong herbal tea. However, consuming too much can cause hallucinations.
cobblemon.species.theossianbellossom.des: When a Theosian Gloom consumes too much of their own herbal medicine, their psychic powers drastically increase and upon exposure to a Shiny Stone, they evolve into Theosian Bellossom.
cobblemon.species.venotrap.name: Venotrap
cobblemon.species.venotrap.desc: Snaptrap hang from trees to disguise themselves as hanging plants. When it's prey passes by, it quickly snaps them up and tangles them in it's vines.
cobblemon.species.faupent.name: Faupent
cobblemon.species.faupent.desc: Faupent sit on the jungle floor imitaing a snake to scare away larger predators while waiting for bird Pokemon to fly overhead. When one does, they quickly shoot up and snatch them out of the sky.
cobblemon.species.theossiancroagunk.name: TheossianCroagunk
cobblemon.species.theossiancroagunk.desc: Theosian Coragunk live in boggy, muddy water, where they can hide their bright colors. Their skin is covered in a wet, slimy substance that can make you sick if you touch it.
cobblemon.species.theossiantoxicroak.des: While beautiful to look at, Trainers are urged to limit contact with their Theosian Toxicroak as the poison they excreet can cause terrible sickness.
cobblemon.species.shroolie.name: Shroolie
cobblemon.species.shroolie.desc: The spores that Shroolie carelessly release from their bubbles can cause different effects, depending on how the Shroolie is feeling at the time.
cobblemon.species.pixcess.name: Pixcess
cobblemon.species.pixcess.desc: Upon evolution, Pixcess are able to greater control their spores allowing them to be used to greater effect in battle.
cobblemon.species.elegantus.name: Elegantus
cobblemon.species.elegantus.desc: Elegantus constantly release pheromones attracting many Shroolie. These shroolie will mindlessly follow the commands of their leader.
cobblemon.species.slicoth.name: Slicoth
cobblemon.species.slicoth.desc: Slowth are extremely slow Pokémon, but what they lack in speed they make up for in attack. Their claws are super sharp, capable of slicing down a tree with ease.
cobblemon.species.mosstire.name: Mosstire
cobblemon.species.mosstire.desc: Mossloth conserves energy, appearing sluggish in battle to deceive opponents. When underestimated, it surprises with a powerful, rapid strike fueled by its stored energy.
cobblemon.species.mantice.name: Mantice
cobblemon.species.mantice.desc: Mantice have very swift and fluid movements. They gracefully dance around their prey before unleashing the fatal blow.
cobblemon.species.mantislash.name: Mantislash
cobblemon.species.mantislash.desc: Mantislash overcome stronger opponents through the use of their speed and technical striking, targeting their weak points.
cobblemon.species.theossianbellsprout.de: Theosian Bellsprout are much more vicious than other Bellsprout. Due to their darker nature, people try and avoid them as they're quick to lash out against anything that get close.
cobblemon.species.howligoon.name: Howligoon
cobblemon.species.howligoon.desc: Howligoon constantly fight for leadership, with the loudest howler being the Alpha of the tribe. When they're in a bad mood they will bang on their chest and go on a rampage.
cobblemon.species.boomian.name: Boomian
cobblemon.species.boomian.desc: Upon evolution, Boomian immediately challenge the Alpha of their tribe. If they win, they leave their tribe and live in solidarity deeming them as too weak to be around.
cobblemon.species.theossianyanma.name: TheossianYanma
cobblemon.species.theossianyanma.desc: Theosian Yanma are quiet rare to find in the wild. It's said only experienced trainers can handle them.
cobblemon.species.theossianyanmega.name: TheossianYanmega
cobblemon.species.theossianyanmega.desc: The beat of its wings is so powerful that it accidentally dislodges full-grown trees when it takes off in flight.
cobblemon.species.theossianflabebe.name: TheossianFlabebe
cobblemon.species.theossianflabebe.desc: The light Theosian Flabébé produce from their flower grows brighter the more in-tune they are with their ghostly powers.
cobblemon.species.theossianfloette.name: TheossianFloette
cobblemon.species.theossianfloette.desc: Legend has it, Theosian Floette help lost souls find their way to the afterlife using their lanturn-like flower.
cobblemon.species.theossianflorges.name: TheossianFlorges
cobblemon.species.theossianflorges.desc: Theosian Florges are very malicious, feeding on the souls of fellow Pokémon while they rest.
cobblemon.species.peckit.name: Peckit
cobblemon.species.peckit.desc: Peckit cannot fly but can jump quite high. Their beak is quite strong, using it to peck through the hard ground to find hiding Sqworm.
cobblemon.species.luvzonica.name: Luvzonica
cobblemon.species.flossway.name: Flossway
cobblemon.species.flossway.desc: Flossway are kind and gentle Pokémon. Whenever you smell a sweet scent in the air, it's likely that a Flossway is nearby.
cobblemon.species.dracopuff.name: Dracopuff
cobblemon.species.dracopuff.desc: Despite their size, Dracopuff are extremely light and fluffy. Shop owners around Theos often have one by their side, providing a happy enviroment for their customers.
cobblemon.species.scalyx.name: Scalyx
cobblemon.species.scalyx.desc: Scalyx are very aggressive and mean Pokémon. People prefer to stay away from them as they're known to bite leaving a deep wound.
cobblemon.species.psyguana.name: Psyguana
cobblemon.species.psyguana.desc: Their horn is said to be the source of their psychic power. Be wary of Psyguana as know they're known to be very aggressive if they feel at all threatened.
cobblemon.species.theossiancottonee.name: TheossianCottonee
cobblemon.species.theossiancottonee.desc: They spend their days drifting along with the wind. The cotton that falls from their body is used to make all sorts of clothing.
cobblemon.species.theossianwhimsicott.de: Theosian Whimsicott are carried by the wind often picking up dirt and debris, eventually they become too heavy to carry.
cobblemon.species.theossianpetilil.name: TheossianPetilil
cobblemon.species.theossianpetilil.desc: Adapting to the nutrient-poor soil of Theos Mountains, Petilil evolved to burrow in and absorb sunlight from the snow's reflective surface.
cobblemon.species.theossianlilligant.des: Theosian Lilligant are known to perform intricate dances during the coldest of nights, using their frosty petals to create enchanting patterns in the air.
cobblemon.species.gulling.name: Gulling
cobblemon.species.gulling.desc: With limited flying prowess, Gullings linger along steep cliffs, skillfully catching updrafts to glide through the air.
cobblemon.species.parrate.name: Parrate
cobblemon.species.parrate.desc: A single Parrate often leads a crew of a dozen Gulling. They patrol beaches and boardwalks snatching anything shiny they can find.
cobblemon.species.theossiandwebble.name: TheossianDwebble
cobblemon.species.theossiandwebble.desc: The coastal habitat of Theos allowed for Dwebble to adapt to a more aquatic lifestyle, where it thrives by utilizing a seashell as its protective home.
cobblemon.species.theossiancrustle.name: TheossianCrustle
cobblemon.species.theossiancrustle.desc: Theosian Crustle live underwater and are rarely seen on land. They bury themselves into the side of the ocean shelf for protection.
cobblemon.species.blobish.name: Blobish
cobblemon.species.blobish.desc: Not much is known about Blobish as they're not often seen in the wild. Their appearance often turns people away from catching them.
cobblemon.species.decoyster.name: Decoyster
cobblemon.species.decoyster.desc: They lure in prey with the pearl on their tongue. Once close, they emerge from the sand and trap their target using their shells.
cobblemon.species.theossianmienfoo.name: TheossianMienfoo
cobblemon.species.theossianmienshao.name: TheossianMienshao
cobblemon.species.brambli.name: Brambli
cobblemon.species.brambli.desc: Brambli are natural foragers and hide their findings in their bush like tail. They can be very mischievous around humans!
cobblemon.species.sapli.name: Sapli
cobblemon.species.sapli.desc: Sapli survive the winter by stealing from other Pokemon's food stores. They are generally not well liked by other Pokemon for this reason.
cobblemon.species.coatimber.name: Coatimber
cobblemon.species.coatimber.desc: Coatimber were used for many years by master criminals in heists of important artifacts from museums and private collections. These Pokemon were slowly used less and less as law enforcement better understood how this Pokemon would help to commit crimes. They have since been adopted by Pokemon rehabilitation groups and have been found to be very excellent and caring companions and excellent battlers.
cobblemon.species.salamagma.name: Salamagma
cobblemon.species.salamagma.desc: Salamagma have hot spots on their bodies that can become extremely hot. Many people used these hot spots for cooking before stoves were invented.
cobblemon.species.salamolten.name: Salamolten
cobblemon.species.salamolten.desc: Salamolten can melt anything their skin touches. Some of the spots on it's body can reach temperatures as high as 1000 degrees.
cobblemon.species.amphibroil.name: Amphibroil
cobblemon.species.amphibroil.desc: Amphibroil have molten lava covering their backs that their body constantly produce. When they move quickly they will spill a massive amounts of very hot lava, which can be dangerous!
cobblemon.species.octiny.name: Octiny
cobblemon.species.octiny.desc: Octiny's yellow tentacles will give a person a static shock if touched. They seem to enjoy shocking other small Pokemon as a prank.
cobblemon.species.octricity.name: Octricity
cobblemon.species.octricity.desc: Octricity can make the rings on its head flash brightly, and it uses this to disorient predators. If that does not work it can wrap its tentacle around and opponent and deliver a hearty shock.
cobblemon.species.plasmapod.name: Plasmapod
cobblemon.species.plasmapod.desc: Plasmapod can generate large amounts of electricity in the organ in the back of its head. It can expel this electricity out of its sucker and frequently electrifies the water in an entire area to paralyze it's prey.
cobblemon.species.squirrey.name: Squirrey
cobblemon.species.raspberrel.name: Raspberrel
cobblemon.species.adoved.name: Adoved
cobblemon.species.admibird.name: Admibird
cobblemon.species.extravagale.name: Extravagale
cobblemon.species.silkapillar.name: Silkapillar
cobblemon.species.silkapillar.desc: Fabripillar have the ability to create a soft fabric like material from its body, which it uses to keep warm in the cold.
cobblemon.species.mothread.name: Mothread
cobblemon.species.mothread.desc: It is said that Mothread are extremely soft, so much so that laying your head on their back can almost instantly put someone to sleep, especially if they are stressed or tired.
cobblemon.species.strawbabe.name: Strawbabe
cobblemon.species.fragalia.name: Fragalia
cobblemon.species.fraquility.name: Fraquility
cobblemon.species.martwig.name: Martwig
cobblemon.species.martwig.desc: During the winter, Martwig bury themselves in the ground except for their tail, which they leave above ground to gain energy from photosynthesis during their long slumber. It is said that when the Martwig begin to come up from out of the ground winter is over.
cobblemon.species.martimber.name: Martimber
cobblemon.species.martimber.desc: Their pine needle like fur protects them from the cold and can also be used to attack its foes. They are also said to have very strong noses!
cobblemon.species.glidair.name: Glidair
cobblemon.species.pepshroom.name: Pepshroom
cobblemon.species.chimary.name: Chimary
cobblemon.species.chimary.desc: Chimary are born with bells connected to their neck. Muscles in their neck allow them to control when the bell rings, and this ability is usually used to create mating rings or to warn other pokemon of incoming danger!
cobblemon.species.canaring.name: Canaring
cobblemon.species.canaring.desc: Canaring spend most of their time sitting on their bells, as flying for long periods of time is difficult. Many ancient towns would have one Canaring in them that could be used as an alarm of incoming danger, such a wildfire or incoming attack.
cobblemon.species.pitoxin.name: Pitoxin
cobblemon.species.pitoxin.desc: Pitoxin's feathers have the ability to secrete poison, which Pitoxin gets from eating poisonous big-type Pokemon. It's red feather's are especially toxic, able to knock out a large Pokemon in a matter of seconds.
cobblemon.species.satymp.name: Satymp
cobblemon.species.bapherno.name: Bapherno
cobblemon.species.apheeble.name: Apheeble
cobblemon.species.aphur.name: Aphur
cobblemon.species.calvolt.name: Calvolt
cobblemon.species.wildebolt.name: Wildebolt
cobblemon.species.voltebeast.name: Voltebeast
cobblemon.species.rabineer.name: Rabineer
cobblemon.species.rabineer.desc: Rabinner seem to have an innate sense for fixing mechanisms and machinery, and are thus used as helpers in working on machines. They also seem to make rudimentary machine in the wild, independent of humans!
cobblemon.species.clofae.name: Clofae
cobblemon.species.clofae.desc: Clofae are rare pokemon. They tend to live isolated in fields cover in clovers, and tend to live under or around four leaf clovers. It is said having one near you will bring you endless goodluck, but if one is angry with you it will curse you with bad luck for forever.
cobblemon.species.firant.name: Firant
cobblemon.species.dynamant.name: Dynamant
cobblemon.species.vermoist.name: Vermoist
cobblemon.species.drizzlingua.name: Drizzlingua
cobblemon.species.drizzlingua.desc: Drizzlingua can produce massive amounts of water through its tail. It uses this water to dampen and weaken dynamant colonies, which are its main food source. They are also frequently used by humans for fire fighting.
cobblemon.species.spriterra.name: Spriterra
cobblemon.species.faearth.name: Faearth
cobblemon.species.trainymph.name: Trainymph
cobblemon.species.trainymph.desc: Trainymph or small but strong, able to take out very large opponents with their strength and swiftness. They are also capable of jumping many times their own height straight into the air.
cobblemon.species.locusteka.name: Locusteka
cobblemon.species.locusteka.desc: Locusteka are extremely skilled fighters, and many humans train under Locusteka to better improve their fighting abilities. It is said that if one gets exceptionally hungry it can go into a ravenous rage and become ten times stronger.
cobblemon.species.chiqua.name: Chiqua
cobblemon.species.turphoon.name: Turphoon
cobblemon.species.typhitty.name: Typhitty
cobblemon.species.typhitty.desc: Typhitty can live in many rivers and ponds, and are good for whatever water they live in because their gills naturally filter and purify water
cobblemon.species.typheline.name: Typheline
cobblemon.species.typheline.desc: Typheline spend a majority of their life sleeping in shallow water. They gain energy by burying themselves in the mud of shallow water and have their whiskers photosynthesize energy for them.
cobblemon.species.swampole.name: Swampole
cobblemon.species.poliwamp.name: Poliwamp
cobblemon.species.swamphibian.name: Swamphibian
cobblemon.species.childew.name: Childew
cobblemon.species.salimist.name: Salimist
cobblemon.species.needlish.name: Needlish
cobblemon.species.ivish.name: IVish
cobblemon.species.heartbill.name: Heartbill
cobblemon.species.rubster.name: Rubster
cobblemon.species.immortoise.name: Immortoise
cobblemon.species.immortoise.desc: Some say that Immortoise can can physically live forever if no physical harm came to them. Their hairs are coveted as supposed cures for wrinkles.
cobblemon.species.ruffurchin.name: Ruffurchin
cobblemon.species.hatox.name: Hatox
cobblemon.species.shellice.name: Shellice
cobblemon.species.reefool.name: Reefool
cobblemon.species.lakalf.name: Lakalf
cobblemon.species.lakalf.desc: Lakalfs have large amounts of body fat that allow it take stay warm in the cold waters of the lakes it lives in.
cobblemon.species.bullake.name: Bullake
cobblemon.species.bullake.desc: Bullakes large body makes it hard to keep swimming for long periods of time, so it frequently rests at the bottom of lakes, and moss and underwater plants grow on its skin while it rests. It uses its large horns to attack ony predators attempting to eat its children.
cobblemon.species.pesketch.name: Pesketch
cobblemon.species.pesketch.desc: Pesketch have a thin and pale body that is perfect for disguising themselves on the white sand of their natural habitats. Some believe Pesketch came into existence when a child dropped their drawing of a fish into the ocean.
cobblemon.species.nurshark.name: Nurshark
cobblemon.species.sharkure.name: Sharkure
cobblemon.species.shrimpno.name: Shrimpno
cobblemon.species.shrimpno.desc: Shrimpno have a diet of only a strange colorful plant that grows on ocean floors. This plant is poisonous to most other Pokemon and humans. It's diet appears to have given Shrimpno colorful tail fins, which it uses to disorient predators.
cobblemon.species.shrimpadelic.name: Shrimpadelic
cobblemon.species.shrimpadelic.desc: Shrimpedelic flash the bright colors all over its body to confuse and hypnotize its prey. Shrimpedelic are rather distracted Pokemon, and some believe this is because they are seeing into higher dimensions due to their heightened psychic abilities.
cobblemon.species.garbezoa.name: Garbezoa
cobblemon.species.jetsowar.name: Jetsowar
cobblemon.species.spectacea.name: Spectacea
cobblemon.species.helux.name: Helux
cobblemon.species.helectric.name: Helectric
cobblemon.species.tentacult.name: Tentacult
cobblemon.species.cultamari.name: Cultamari
cobblemon.species.eggozoa.name: Eggozoa
cobblemon.species.hydravenge.name: Hydravenge
cobblemon.species.booblue.name: Booblue
cobblemon.species.booblue.desc: Booblue's beak is as hard as steel and it uses its hard beak to break through ice in its natural habitat.
cobblemon.species.submarooby.name: Submarooby
cobblemon.species.submarooby.desc: Submarooby has adapted to be able to spend long periods of time under ce sheets to hunt its prey. Its wings and beak are as hard as steel and are used to break through layers of ice and also to fight!
cobblemon.species.whalobe.name: Whalobe
cobblemon.species.cerebeluga.name: Cerebeluga
cobblemon.species.flyminate.name: Flyminate
cobblemon.species.fearit.name: Fearit
cobblemon.species.haunthin.name: Haunthin
cobblemon.species.bisoil.name: Bisoil
cobblemon.species.bisoil.desc: Bisoil are extremely slow pokemon that spend all of their time either grazing or sleeping. They are also extremely strong with exceptionally hard kicks!
cobblemon.species.buffalearth.name: Buffalearth
cobblemon.species.buffalearth.desc: These gigantic pokemon are extremely territorial of the mountain environments they inhabit, and attempt to scare off any humans who attempt to enter their land.
cobblemon.species.gecksquire.name: Gecksquire
cobblemon.species.knightile.name: Knightile
cobblemon.species.geckombat.name: Geckombat
cobblemon.species.pyrogorgia.name: Pyrogorgia
cobblemon.species.snowbowll.name: Snowbowll
cobblemon.species.snowbowll.desc: Snowball use their white coat and round body to disguise themselves in the shown. Children frequently mistake them for pre-made snowballs and throw them at other children.
cobblemon.species.overcowl.name: Overcowl
cobblemon.species.overcowl.desc: Overcowl's feathers work very well at keeping the Pokemon warm during the winter. Their feathers are sought after for creating luxury winter coats.
cobblemon.species.puncholla.name: Puncholla
cobblemon.species.puncholla.desc: Puncholla are extremely territorial and will fight any Pokemon that attempt to enter their territory. When they punch an opponent their fists frequently get stuck on the opponent and disconnect from their arms. Luckily, Puncholla can regenerate their fists very quickly.
cobblemon.species.caimolt.name: Caimolt
cobblemon.species.reptigon.name: Reptigon
cobblemon.species.spectragon.name: Spectragon
cobblemon.species.farenhead.name: Farenhead
cobblemon.species.pyranium.name: Pyranium
cobblemon.species.seworm.name: Seworm
cobblemon.species.velvorm.name: Velvorm
cobblemon.species.fungramp.name: Fungramp
cobblemon.species.foscal.name: Foscal
cobblemon.species.fossasin.name: Fossasin
cobblemon.species.dodie.name: Dodie
cobblemon.species.dodoc.name: Dodoc
cobblemon.species.serpebble.name: Serpebble
cobblemon.species.serpentite.name: Serpentite
cobblemon.species.rolyboly.name: Rolyboly
cobblemon.species.rolyboly.desc: Rolyboly have adapted to looking like pokeballs, as they enjoy feeding on trash that humans throw away. They disguise themselves as broken pokeballs in trash, and are very displeased with trainers that pick them up.
cobblemon.species.endearasite.name: Endearasite
cobblemon.species.erosite.name: Erosite
cobblemon.species.erosite.desc: Erosite will attach to a host and this host will fall deeply in love with the first thing they see. It feeds off of the affection the host gives to its beloved.
cobblemon.species.venusite.name: Venusite
cobblemon.species.venusite.desc: Venusite raise Erosite on its abdomen. Once they are old enough to live on their own, it flings them from its tail onto a host.
cobblemon.species.impelt.name: Impelt
cobblemon.species.impelt.desc: Impelt used to be imported to different regions and sold to children as the perfect pet Pokemon, which they were. They are very independent and do not have to have a lot of care but are incredibly cuddly and kind with children.
cobblemon.species.puzzlock.name: Puzzlock
cobblemon.species.chubaby.name: Chubaby
cobblemon.species.chubuffet.name: Chubuffet
cobblemon.species.carnicabra.name: Carnicabra
cobblemon.species.sentennial.name: Sentennial
cobblemon.species.sentennial.desc: Sentennial is an ancient colossus made from gold and marble. It was said to have been made to protect an ancient city but it was too destructive and was broken into 100 pieces that were scattered across the land.
cobblemon.species.frungus.name: Frungus
cobblemon.species.frungus.desc: Frungus puts off a scent that drives predators away. It's slimy skin is also an irritant to those who touch it.
cobblemon.species.mushribbit.name: Mushribbit
cobblemon.species.mushribbit.desc: Mushribbit's tongue is very sticky. It can adhere to anything and can pull prey in weighing up to 600 lbs. At the end of its tongue is a paralyzing posion.
cobblemon.species.toadrule.name: Toadrule
cobblemon.species.toadrule.desc: Toadrules have been measured to have leapt 300 ft in the air, capable of defense in more ways than their weaker poison. Their four arms also operate independently from one another.
cobblemon.species.oinklit.name: Oinklit
cobblemon.species.hamferno.name: Hamferno
cobblemon.species.infernoink.name: Infernoink
cobblemon.species.bufflow.name: Bufflow
cobblemon.species.bufflow.desc: Bufflow can be found wading at the edges of rivers and lakes. Their fur holds lots of water, to keep it's dry skin moist.
cobblemon.species.brinalo.name: Brinalo
cobblemon.species.bisonami.name: Bisonami
cobblemon.species.trilbin.name: Trilbin
cobblemon.species.trilbin.desc: Trilbin are a common sight in Tokas. In the early mornings their songs can be heard, waking up people with gentle tunes.
cobblemon.species.bintone.name: Bintone
cobblemon.species.beatrob.name: Beatrob
cobblemon.species.erliber.name: Erliber
cobblemon.species.erliber.desc: Both mouths of erliber nourish the bird in a symbiotic relationship developed when a baby erliber falls from its nest.
cobblemon.species.getzawyrm.name: Getzawyrm
cobblemon.species.getzawyrm.desc: As the symbiotic relationship reaches full potential, getzawyrms take on their dragon form, its minds fully merged and ferocious.
cobblemon.species.nutub.name: Nutub
cobblemon.species.bubinuter.name: Bubinuter
cobblemon.species.mortoise.name: Mortoise
cobblemon.species.mortoise.desc: The skull shape on its head serves as a warning to those aware if its presence. Explosions result for those who are not.
cobblemon.species.clunkey.name: Clunkey
cobblemon.species.clunkey.desc: In the forests, it's said that clunkey have been spotted on the rarest of occasions. Those who've found one have great luck for a year.
cobblemon.species.arachute.name: Arachute
cobblemon.species.parachnid.name: Parachnid
cobblemon.species.crustancient.name: Crustancient
cobblemon.species.nozlox.name: Nozlox
cobblemon.species.hydrox.name: Hydrox
cobblemon.species.dewmite.name: Dewmite
cobblemon.species.fountic.name: Fountic
cobblemon.species.obstick.name: Obstick
cobblemon.species.stalkturnal.name: Stalkturnal
cobblemon.species.walok.name: Walok
cobblemon.species.binduga.name: Binduga
cobblemon.species.gliduki.name: Gliduki
cobblemon.species.tukaleap.name: Tukaleap
cobblemon.species.cattack.name: Cattack
cobblemon.species.tokassianmagby.name: TokassianMagby
cobblemon.species.tokassianmagmar.name: TokassianMagmar
cobblemon.species.koroka.name: Koroka
cobblemon.species.goroka.name: Goroka
cobblemon.species.snoboon.name: Snoboon
cobblemon.species.boonball.name: Boonball
cobblemon.species.abomboon.name: Abomboon
cobblemon.species.gexom.name: Gexom
cobblemon.species.gectidact.name: Gectidact
cobblemon.species.finpin.name: Finpin
cobblemon.species.merpin.name: Merpin
cobblemon.species.mermace.name: Mermace
cobblemon.species.corozard.name: Corozard
cobblemon.species.biolazard.name: Biolazard
cobblemon.species.gravelo.name: Gravelo
cobblemon.species.minerapt.name: Minerapt
cobblemon.species.outcroptor.name: Outcroptor
cobblemon.species.grebur.name: Grebur
cobblemon.species.grebloo.name: Grebloo
cobblemon.species.parazyme.name: Parazyme
cobblemon.species.cytocite.name: Cytocite
cobblemon.species.snifflet.name: Snifflet
cobblemon.species.fridgehog.name: Fridgehog
cobblemon.species.iciquill.name: Iciquill
cobblemon.species.gestup.name: Gestup
cobblemon.species.phantoll.name: Phantoll
cobblemon.species.springeist.name: Springeist
cobblemon.species.amphibrain.name: Amphibrain
cobblemon.species.croatex.name: Croatex
cobblemon.species.jawminate.name: Jawminate
cobblemon.species.imposibeast.name: Imposibeast
cobblemon.species.knuclaw.name: Knuclaw
cobblemon.species.huntitan.name: Huntitan
cobblemon.species.wiskurry.name: Wiskurry
cobblemon.species.wrinklaw.name: Wrinklaw
cobblemon.species.turfowl.name: Turfowl
cobblemon.species.turgato.name: Turgato
cobblemon.species.turojet.name: Turojet
cobblemon.species.buptic.name: Buptic
cobblemon.species.croptic.name: Croptic
cobblemon.species.eleslink.name: Eleslink
cobblemon.species.eleconda.name: Eleconda
cobblemon.species.puffgi.name: Puffgi
cobblemon.species.mushboom.name: Mushboom
cobblemon.species.mushboom.desc: Mushboom almost makes you wish for a Nuclear Winter. Its body can reach 100,000,000° Celsius. Its smoke-like cap can cause different hazardous weathers.
cobblemon.species.outepede.name: Outepede
cobblemon.species.grosscean.name: Grosscean
cobblemon.species.aylien.name: Aylien
cobblemon.species.sharcoe.name: Sharcoe
cobblemon.species.bullvanize.name: Bullvanize
cobblemon.species.craycrane.name: Craycrane
cobblemon.species.papiral.name: Papiral
cobblemon.species.gluttiny.name: Gluttiny
cobblemon.species.stakube.name: Stakube
cobblemon.species.cereblow.name: Cereblow
cobblemon.species.flekskeeto.name: Flekskeeto
cobblemon.species.garlick.name: Garlick
cobblemon.species.ghoulic.name: Ghoulic
cobblemon.species.oniion.name: Oniion
cobblemon.species.screechean.name: Screechean
cobblemon.species.sulgast.name: Sulgast
cobblemon.species.goonanas.name: Goonanas
cobblemon.species.worminder.name: Worminder
cobblemon.species.chainitie.name: Chainitie
cobblemon.species.barbaris.name: Barbaris
cobblemon.species.galaxey.name: Galaxey
cobblemon.species.sculptean.name: Sculptean
cobblemon.species.cerebranch.name: Cerebranch
cobblemon.species.inclemight.name: Inclemight
cobblemon.species.spritten.name: Spritten
cobblemon.species.spritten.desc: Spritten are playful and energetic 'Mons, and can be a handful for new trainers. They used to be hunted extensively, being prized as rare pets.
cobblemon.species.predageist.name: Predageist
cobblemon.species.predageist.desc: A dark force revived a poor Spritten caught in a trap, and now this 'Mon seeks out those that would do harm to others relentlessly.
cobblemon.species.phanther.name: Phanther
cobblemon.species.phanther.desc: All that is left of Phanther's mortal self is its pelt, which it carries with it. Despite its ruthless battle style, it is a loyal to its trainer and loves to sleep in moonbeams.
cobblemon.species.ambystar.name: Ambystar
cobblemon.species.ambystar.desc: Ambystar are bumbling 'Mons that love to investigate anything and everything. They are quick to make friends, and are recommended as an essential first 'Mon to train.
cobblemon.species.amphibula.name: Amphibula
cobblemon.species.amphibula.desc: A rather relaxed 'Mon that prefers to gaze up at the stars. It prefers to lay about than to battle, especially if it considers the opponents its friends.
cobblemon.species.galaxalotl.name: Galaxalotl
cobblemon.species.galaxalotl.desc: A curious 'Mon that loves to hug all those it comes across, even stronger foes. They are stronger on clear, moonlit nights, and use a mysterious power to bounce around in the air.
cobblemon.species.psyalii.name: Psyalii
cobblemon.species.psyalii.desc: Slow to warm up to its trainer, this 'Mon is very skittish and shy. It prefers to confuse foes from a distance, and will cry if approached too suddenly.
cobblemon.species.dusynap.name: Dusynap
cobblemon.species.dusynap.desc: A quiet 'Mon that observes from a distance, analyzing its foes. It will not engage with a foe it deems beyond its skill to dispatch, and will ignore commands to do so otherwise, deeming them foolish.
cobblemon.species.injelligent.name: Injelligent
cobblemon.species.injelligent.desc: Cold and calculating, this 'Mon will not hesitate to bring down a foe by any means necessary. It often times itself to see just how fast it can dispatch its opponents, and often treats battling like solving a puzzle.
cobblemon.species.squiruff.name: Squiruff
cobblemon.species.squiruff.desc: Squiruff are entirely scatterbrained 'Mons-- Often picking up things and losing them within the same moment. Often, Squiruff fight among themselves.
cobblemon.species.scuffrel.name: Scuffrel
cobblemon.species.scuffrel.desc: Scuffrel get into frequent battles with neighboring 'Mons for both territory and to test their abilities. Bird 'Mons of all kinds are their mortal enemies, and they will attack them on sight.
cobblemon.species.peap.name: Peap
cobblemon.species.peap.desc: Peap attempt to use the eye-like markings on their inner wings to scare off predators. Other than that, they truly have no other forms of defense.
cobblemon.species.peafuddle.name: Peafuddle
cobblemon.species.peafuddle.desc: Peafuddle are erratic creatures, often making chirping sounds to simply chase away the silence. They also like to startle other 'Mons by squawking loudly.
cobblemon.species.peadazzled.name: Peadazzled
cobblemon.species.peadazzled.desc: The more confusing and striking the eye-markings on Peadazzled's body are, the more favorably they are treated among their peers.
cobblemon.species.peaknighted.name: Peaknighted
cobblemon.species.peaknighted.desc: Peaknighted do not give up, even when defeated in battle. They are quick to use their psychic abilities to confuse foes, then finish them off with powerful pecks.
cobblemon.species.ahrimini.name: Ahrimini
cobblemon.species.ahrimini.desc: Ahrimini often paralyze their prey with a striking glare before swooping in to attack them with its small, sharp claws.
cobblemon.species.prikkle.name: Prikkle
cobblemon.species.prikkle.desc: Quick to anger, these 'Mons will barrage their foes with sharp quills charged with electricity.
cobblemon.species.pinzineedl.name: Pinzineedl
cobblemon.species.pinzineedl.desc: Eternally grumpy, this 'Mon often sleeps curled up into a ball, its charged quills menacing those that would dare bother it.
cobblemon.species.lizleaf.name: Lizleaf
cobblemon.species.lizleaf.desc: This 'Mon enjoys hanging from trees by its tail. Unfortunately, it is often attacked by other 'Mons mistaking it for a berry!
cobblemon.species.thistliz.name: Thistliz
cobblemon.species.thistliz.desc: This 'Mon enjoys escaping its foes by grabbing its feet and rolling away like a leafy wheel.
cobblemon.species.brambazard.name: Brambazard
cobblemon.species.brambazard.desc: This mon has full control of the thorny vines that hang from its head, and often uses them to both attack and intimidate enemies.
cobblemon.species.hayboo.name: Hayboo
cobblemon.species.hayboo.desc: These 'Mons like to hide in dry grass, and often get scooped up into hay barrels. They are prolific in farm areas, and are looked on favorably as they pick weeds to weave into hats.
cobblemon.species.effighast.name: Effighast
cobblemon.species.effighast.desc: These 'Mons are a staple of every farmer's team in Urzavos, as they protect their fields from other 'Mons that seek to eat their crops or harass their livestock.
cobblemon.species.skeinter.name: Skeinter
cobblemon.species.skeinter.desc: Forgotten scraps of yarn are thought to turn into these 'Mons. They steal and eat cloth and yarn to grow larger.
cobblemon.species.aracknit.name: Aracknit
cobblemon.species.aracknit.desc: Some consider these 'Mons nuisances, others use these 'Mons to collect fabric and yarn to use in their projects. Depending on the temperament of the 'Mon, they either share their hoard freely or jealously guard it.
cobblemon.species.rodoll.name: Rodoll
cobblemon.species.rodoll.desc: Brought to life by a well-loved pincusion, these 'Mons love to bounce around and leave fluff all over the place.
cobblemon.species.verplushie.name: Verplushie
cobblemon.species.verplushie.desc: Having grown large enough, this 'Mon takes its previous evolutions into its fluff to keep them warm and safe when their fabric has worn down. Every pattern is unique!
cobblemon.species.brrbear.name: Brrbear
cobblemon.species.brrbear.desc: Young Brrbear have an abundance of fluff to the point where they must roll around. As they grow older they lose their fur, which is highly prized coat stuffing.
cobblemon.species.brrzolt.name: Brrzolt
cobblemon.species.brrzolt.desc: This 'Mon's claws have adapted to be savagely serrated so it can cut through the thick fur and fat of its prey.
cobblemon.species.plumbee.name: Plumbee
cobblemon.species.plumbee.desc: These soft-bodied 'Mons are a prized treat among its predators. They often stay hidden under logs and in bushes as harsh sunlight can hurt them.
cobblemon.species.pupoke.name: Pupoke
cobblemon.species.pupoke.desc: Gathering nearby briars to form a cocoon, these 'Mons bide their time until evolution. They have been known to roll into foes to inflict wounds on them.
cobblemon.species.briarasp.name: Briarasp
cobblemon.species.briarasp.desc: Despite rumors that they are naturally aggressive, these 'Mons do not attack unless provoked. They enjoy sweet berries and have been known to help cultivate wild Pecha berry trees.
cobblemon.species.elemuttal.name: Elemuttal
cobblemon.species.elemuttal.desc: There are a few different variations of this 'Mon with distinct patches of colored fur on their back. Scientists have often wondered if they share a common Ancestor with Eevee.
cobblemon.species.yellow_elemuttal.name: Elemuttal
cobblemon.species.yellow_elemuttal.desc1: There are a few different variations of this 'Mon with distinct patches of colored fur on their back. Scientists have often wondered if they share a common Ancestor with Eevee.
cobblemon.species.blue_elemuttal.name: Elemuttal
cobblemon.species.blue_elemuttal.desc1: There are a few different variations of this 'Mon with distinct patches of colored fur on their back. Scientists have often wondered if they share a common Ancestor with Eevee.
cobblemon.species.caniflame.name: Caniflame
cobblemon.species.caniflame.desc: These 'Mons are prized for their keen senses and devoted loyalty. They are often used as guard dogs, as they are great with children of all ages.
cobblemon.species.thounder.name: Thounder
cobblemon.species.thounder.desc: These 'Mons are suited for rugged terrain, as they have a hardy nature to survive in it. They use their blinding speed to chase prey and take it down.
cobblemon.species.permafruff.name: Permafruff
cobblemon.species.permafruff.desc: Mountaineers of Urzavos often keep these 'Mons on their team. They can sense avalanches, and should the worst happen, are strong enough to drag their trainers to safety, no matter how far that may be.
cobblemon.species.snatchirp.name: Snatchirp
cobblemon.species.snatchirp.desc: These 'Mons are known to be bold enough to steal items right off of people, in broad daylight! They are obsessed with treasure, and often pick fight with other birds for their items.
cobblemon.species.corvosene.name: Corvosene
cobblemon.species.corvosene.desc: Having learned from their past mistakes, these 'Mons are master thieves, often working in small groups to steal items from homes and shops.
cobblemon.species.constellapin.name: Constellapin
cobblemon.species.constellapin.desc: Curious 'Mons that enjoy chasing games. They are often out at night during full moons, in which their ears glow and the starry pattern on their tails seem to swirl with color.
cobblemon.species.ichorot.name: Ichorot
cobblemon.species.ichorot.desc: Ichorot love to hang around in spooky forests and graveyards, gobbling up whatever debris is left behind. The ooze around the bottom of their mouths is foul, and not recommended for contact with skin.
cobblemon.species.statikub.name: Statikub
cobblemon.species.statikub.desc: Just touching the space around this 'Mon will cause small static shocks! In particularly dry places, they are seen as a fire hazard.
cobblemon.species.urzap.name: Urzap
cobblemon.species.urzap.desc: Their fur seems to always be standing on end from how much static is stored in it. When they encounter a problem they cannot solve, they will heat their claws up and destroy said problem.
cobblemon.species.batteary.name: Batteary
cobblemon.species.batteary.desc: Despite how excitable these 'Mons are, they have finally understood their full power, and try to reserve their strength for battles. As a result, they nap and eat often, giving them an abundance of energy.
cobblemon.species.bawlmire.name: Bawlmire
cobblemon.species.bawlmire.desc: The pitiful whimpers these 'Mons make while laying in the mud first led many to believe they were haunted piles of earth.
cobblemon.species.miserooze.name: Miserooze
cobblemon.species.miserooze.desc: These 'Mons wander around, looking for friends. However, their sad demeanor seems to bring the air down around them, and most avoid them. In response, they weep, and lose their forms.
cobblemon.species.depressoil.name: Depressoil
cobblemon.species.depressoil.desc: Having grown bitter, these 'Mons often scare travelers by coming out of the muddied waters and making guttural noises at them. A tamed 'Mon is rather pleasant.
cobblemon.species.hilaribat.name: Hilaribat
cobblemon.species.hilaribat.desc: They love to fly around during any large gathering-- Be it carnivals, festivals or parties-- And make people laugh or smile. You can always hear them coming by the soft jingling of their bells.
cobblemon.species.histerijeist.name: Histerijeist
cobblemon.species.histerijeist.desc: These 'Mons have learned to make amusing noises to make people laugh, and seem to be a favorite among the traveling carnivals that roam Urzavos.
cobblemon.species.parasuck.name: Parasuck
cobblemon.species.parasuck.desc: These pests will stick onto 'Mons and drain them of their life force. Once they drink enough, they evolve.
cobblemon.species.hemorobbin.name: Hemorobbin
cobblemon.species.hemorobbin.desc: Though these 'Mons have a spiked, boney carapace, they still have an exposed spot on their back. The carapace can expand along with the ichor sack.
cobblemon.species.sedimollusk.name: Sedimollusk
cobblemon.species.sedimollusk.desc: A snail that carries around a strong rock upon its back to protect its soft body.
cobblemon.species.gastropow.name: Gastropow
cobblemon.species.gastropow.desc: A Mon who carries the stones it could not pummel to pieces on its back. It is on a constant journey to train.
cobblemon.species.mosshroud.name: Mosshroud
cobblemon.species.mosshroud.desc: These 'Mons lie motionless in the dark depths of caves, hoping for prey to step on them. Their bite is strong enough to break through most common metals and metal alloys.
cobblemon.species.murkreep.name: Murkreep
cobblemon.species.bateeny.name: Bateeny
cobblemon.species.bathemoth.name: Bathemoth
cobblemon.species.brachiboing.name: Brachiboing
cobblemon.species.soaropod.name: Soaropod
cobblemon.species.soaropod.desc: Intact Spine Fossil Evo Name: Soar + sauropod Speedy Support, 520 BST, moves unorganized
cobblemon.species.souropod.name: Souropod
cobblemon.species.souropod.desc: Cry made by: skurleton Name: Sour + Sauropod
cobblemon.species.apatoplek.name: Apatoplek
cobblemon.species.apatoplek.desc: Cry made by: skurleton Name: apatosaur + apoplectic Name Credit: Banzaimarten It is actually based off a Bajadasaurus. But apatosaur's name's easier to work with.
cobblemon.species.whirlifern.name: Whirlifern
cobblemon.species.ferneurosis.name: Ferneurosis
cobblemon.species.luminlite.name: Luminlite
cobblemon.species.luminlite.desc: Luminlite cling to the walls of cave and wait for things to pass by it before stunning them with a beam of light. In the depths of caves, they flicker their lights in specific patterns to communicate with one another.
cobblemon.species.luminlux.name: Luminlux
cobblemon.species.luminlux.desc: A towering colony of Luminlite become Luminlux - It has not yet harmonized all of its disparate parts, and thus skitters around erratically. Its many faces will flicker on and off randomly, disturbing those around it.
cobblemon.species.lumineye.name: Lumineye
cobblemon.species.lumineye.desc: When enough Luminlite and Luminlux gather, they form Lumineye - A giant colony that thinks as one entity. Their harsh beam of light stuns any unfortunate enough to be caught in it. It can see through walls and solid stone for miles.
cobblemon.species.prickity.name: Prickity
cobblemon.species.prickity.desc: Name Help: kaijumon Name Meaning: Prick/prickly + kit, baby rabbit
cobblemon.species.ruffhaws.name: Ruffhaws
cobblemon.species.ruffhaws.desc: Name Help: kaijumon Name Meaning: Rough/roughhouse + misspelling of tough, ‘tuff’ + paws Stat Help: kassofchaos
